3.description: I've been to this salon twice.  Both times I had a fill in and they did a pretty good job, say a 7 on a scale of 1-10. But, they ruined my eyebrows!  I have a very nice natural arch.  I tweeze my own eyebrows and all I need them to do is clean up the fine hairs above and below.  They created a new arch that looked awful. It took two months for me to let them grow back.  II always have the owner or his wife do my nails, but in my experience Nice Nail II is the best nail salon in the area, although it's in Franklin Park.

1.description: NO STARS! Don't ever go here! I just left and the nail tech named Mai (pronounced My) RUINED my eyebrows and tried to pencil them in the cover up the fact that she put a hole in one of them. They refunded my money without any problems though. Not to mention my cuticles are sliced up and bleeding from the botched manicure she did. This disgusting place needs to be shut down. I'll be contacting the city and the better business bureau immediately.

2.description: If you don't mind getting an infection, this place is perfect. I asked the nail tech to utilize sterile equipment for my manicure and she appeared bewildered. I waited as she fumbled around looking for sterile supplies to use. She then returns empty handed. To further insult both my intelligence and patronage she grabs the same non sterile equipment she attempted to use initially. Don't go here. I highly doubt that any of the technicians even have a license.

0.description: I went here for the first time about a week and a half ago for a manicure and for my eyebrows.They did well on my eyebrows. ($8)However it was the worst manicure I have gotten. I have my nails shaped a specific way and when I asked her to replace the nail that have allen off she did... but the shape was completely different. There was black spots in my nails from the polish. She didn't allow my nails to dry before telling me to follow her to get my nails done! She just applied the polish! Also the paint job was bad it's all lumpy. Not to mention the one nail she replaced fell off not even a week later.

4.description: I have been going to this place for a little over a year.  Only because I couldn't find a better place.   You never see the same nail tech twice, so forget about finding a regular tech. .  It doesn't even matter how often you go.  Once I got a gel fill in, and  I kid you not the tech did the job in less than 15 mins.  It's always a  50/50 chance if your nails are done right.  Management is just rude.  The guy cares more about the techs than the customers.  The tech's make so much money they do not care if you are happy or not.  Forget about any creativity.  They're only good for basic polish.  I got a new full set last week and now I have to take them off.  They were done so badly.  Its a wrap for me, I'm done.  I am not going back! Save your money and time.  Find somewhere else to go.

0.description: Have you ever been to a beauty supply store and they make you feel like they just saw you on a line up on CSI Investigations well this place doesn't do that at all; they make you feel like they want your business and you are a valued customer.I always feel comfortable and the owner as well as the staff is very friendly.  They have a very wide selection of wigs.As far as price goes they are about comparable to many other beauty supply places.  I have been here a few times and each time I have had a good experience.  My daughter went crazy buying so many different barrettes and balls for my granddaughter hair that I thought she was trying too start her own store....lolIt's a nice size store  and it's well lit...If you buy wigs you know that is important!I will be back!Enjoy!!!

This place is OK. Came here to get my daughter shoes this week for school.  You would think their prices would be lower with a nike outlet across the street.  Which is where we normally go.  However, after she didn't find what she wanted at Nike, she did find what she wanted here.  This foot locker is pretty small, so they don't have much of a selection in my opinion.

3.description: I just ordered a pizza puff that was not tasty. I find it difficult to serve a bad pizza puff considering they're prepared elsewhere but it didn't seem to have any cheese in it. My Gyro-Cheeseburger was extremely soggy. The Italian Beef was flavorless and the meat was dry. The cheese steak fries had something that didn't taste or look like sour cream but aside from that glob of white substance in the middle of my fries they were mediocre.  I WILL NOT BE BACK!

1.description: I have been eating at Big Mikes since they opened! I live right across the street so I no longer have to travel for good food. The chicken salads are one of my favorites but the Greek Gyro is my absolute favorite OMG!! My mom likes the fried chicken wings & my daughter loves their pizza puffs! I like that Big Mikes serve a variety of food. Mexican, American, Soul.. The gyro & steak fries are the bomb too!! So are the tacos! Mike can we get some Jerk Tacos pleaseeeeee?! Lol Good place to eat!!

0.description: I got an Italian beef I must say it was juicy delicious and meat was tender hands down best beef in chicago as well as gyros if you want fast food this the joint to stop in its conveniently located of of the Dan Ryan so you be in and  out !!

2.description: Great food, I would definitely order here again! Kids loved their personal pizzas and the gyros are excellent!!!

5.description: I got a gyro sandwich with some cheese fries. It was a GIANT gyro for like 5$. I was pleasantly surprised by how clean it was inside and the staff was super sweet. My boyfriend got some chicken and I snagged a bite - it was also really good. I'd definitely come back.

6.description: I had Big Mikes for the first time a few days ago. The food was fresh, delivered hot and absolutely amazing. My gyro was cooked and dressed perfectly, the fries arrived still steaming and crisp, and my friend loved the gyro cheeseburger. I love the fact that BMG is a pork free establishment! Its a good way to go and quite honestly better for their customers. This is an awesome place on the south side and I will be visiting again.

7.description: My first visit to Big Mikes changed my outlook on burgers. First of all, my partner brought me here on a date and being dressed up for a fine dining experience I refused to go in. Once I got in there, looked at the menu, and heard it was a no pork establishment...I got real comfortable. That day I got and will always get the gyro burger with turkey bacon. This burger was so juicy and flavorful I considered that date to be the best date ever. Since then, I've had the fish, chicken, and plain burgers and it was all good however nothing beats the gyro burger.

8.description: Gas station food

9.description: "Big Mike's big gyro sandwich" was delicious instructions were followed.Italian beef was delicious instructions were followed.Pizza puffs were terrible did not have much filling instructions were not followed. I asked to please fry hard and add lemon pepper neither was done.The cheesecake did not taste good it was warm and it looked like it was handled like a football it was all out of shape and just not good.The chili did not have much beef in it the beef that was in it was grainy and it was really greasy not good either.And finally chicken nuggets, chicken nuggets were average only thing that saved them was the sauce, sweet baby Ray's sauce you would be better off buying frozen chicken nuggets cooking them and getting your own Sweet baby Ray's it will probably be cheaper.The delivery guy was quick food was packaged well and the delivery guy was very courteous overall experience I would go back for a Gyro or an Italian beef but that's pretty much about it. And big Mike's would not be my first choice although the gyro was very good the pizza puff experience was quite disappointing.

10.description: Serving the best burgers, made fresh, and steaming hot. Friendly service, simple decor. All I can say is this place has reasonable prices. Best all around in the Chicago area. The gyro burger is a must to try! This is a place to try if your on the go and in this area for a quick visit. Their also open late at night! Bonus!

4.description: Big Mike's has the best food! The food is hot, cooked to order and full of flavor. Definitely will be going back!!! Yum!

3.description: Compared to the reviews below. .. this walgreens actually has great customer service and the staff greet you with a warm welcome. .... don't believe the comments below. ... if the service was bad at one point. .. it has significantly improved..... I love this location....

1.description: My favorite walgreens! Love it! My family has shopped her for years and has never had any issues. The staff is friendly and helpful.

2.description: Stan is the man at walgreens Always helpful every time I go thereGreatness is for him need more managers like him

5.description: Are utilized their photography services I was very impressed

6.description: GETTO.... Worst service and selection on the planet... Should be shut down!!!!

0.description: This is my neighborhood Walgreens. I feel like Norm from Cheers when I walk in here.  They're always nice.

4.description: This Walgreens puts the G in Ghetto!!! Only went here because I was visiting family in the area. The entire staff needs to be retrained in customer service starting with the management!!!!!

56.description: The food is fairly good here. I have visited several times, but the quant. differs each visit. The prices are sort of high for the area and quant.of food. The cashier is sometimes very friendly and couteous and other times she is snippy and rude. They really need some quality control from top to bottom. I may find another establishment since I like to be respected when I spend $20 for takeout!!

29.description: Let me set things straight: this is not the spot to go to for excellent customer service. The employees aren't rude, but it's not like they are going above and beyond for you. They make sure your order is correct and that's that. As far as the food. Listen, get the jerk tips and/or the hot links. Wait your ass the allotted amount of time to get your food. These reviews on here with people complaining about the service and wait time are BOGUS. This is a good ass hood food joint, so the service won't be horrible, just not overachieving, and the wait time is worth it so chill the fuck out and wait for your food. The rosemary on these hot links...!?!? GAD DAYUM!!! (Although I-57 has the hot link game on lock!) The donut spot next door though!? *faints*

42.description: I'm sorry this location is not working out and the new owners are not addressing the operational and customer service issues. Friday night and no slabs or turkey ready for purchase . Really!! Either get it together or close the joint

23.description: I heard nothing but great reviews about the original place. It was even featured on a national cable food show on TLC. That said I went there late night once. Rib tips was all fat and sauce was burnt. Say the same for all BBQ joints on Cottage Grove. Shame have to travel to 115th for decent BBQ. I-57 or Best BBQ. Both are miles ahead.

47.description: The absolute worst barbeque I have ever had. I tried to like it..tried to eat it but burnt meat and nasty sauce equals whole thing in the trash. I wish I could give them zero stars.

8.description: My wife said it all in her review. I'm very picky about BBQ being that I'm from Kansas City, but I have to say I was impressed by Uncle Johns. I told my wife he has a customer for the duration of my time in Chicago.  I hope it wasn't a one time deal. The lady behind the glass told me it was worth the wait, and it sure is..... I'll be back uncle John,your new nephew!!!!! Lolololol

31.description: When my relatives come to Chicago, this is the first and last stop...turkey tips.  The sauce is spectacular.  Seasoned will, hot or mild.  I've only had the tips and I'm a true fan.

34.description: I went here close to (10 minutes before) closing time at 12 midnight late Wednesday, June 4thI ordered what I thought was 1 half chicken and a 7up soda.  The chicken mealcame with fries & coleslaw & bread ... however when I opened the bag afterI had exited the place & was in my car to eat, I only noticed 3 pieces of chicken: breast & wing attached & just aleg or drumstick. Though I do not care much for thighs, it was missing the thigh.I went back to inform them that I did not get 4 pieces as should be with a halfchicken slate & the door was locked because it had closed.  So I took themeal I had not eaten at that point & myreceipt to the bakery in front or next door that seemed to be open late if not24 hours.  The cashier there was puzzled and could not help me thoughshe did start to give me the phone number for Uncle John's but then I realizedI had the  receipt in my hand w/ the phone number on it.I went back to my car to call Uncle John's several times as it was only about12:02 AM Thursday, June 5th & I thought someone would answer the phones asthey were closing. I called may be 3 times & no one answered & therewas no voicemail to accept any messages.I thought there was nothing more I could do so I acquiesced & proceededto just eat the meal since I could not save it until the morning to dispute & I hada major project to work on Thursday and no time to go back anyway.About another 10 minutes after that, I saw one of the cooks or the personwho took my money approaching her vehicle.  So I asked her whyI was not given a half chicken with 4 pieces as I only got 3 pieces asthe thigh was missing.  She argued with me saying I was wrong and thatthe chicken is cut in half and yadda yadda... She could not understandfor herself how the chicken could have been cut so in half that it wouldnot have the thigh piece as maybe the chicken could have beendefective?  She was very insulting toa customer who paid and said to some other male there that I had too muchdrama or something to that effect.  I asked her before that could I talk to her management and she saidshe was the manager ... So I asked if I could talk to someone elseover her later in the morning. So she said to call back or something butshe still disagreed with me even after I showed her the bones and therewas none that pointed that I got a thigh. She said or pointed to the breastbone & said that was the thigh. I said the wing would be attached to thebreast & the thigh should have been attached to the leg & I showed herthe leg and there was no thigh part.  She still did not believe me and wasvery rude.Advice:So do not go here if it is closing time as if they make a mistake on yourorder , you won't have any recourse to dispute or show they cheated you.Also take a picture if you can of the food so you can dispute better.I was tired already and it was going to be a long day later on in themorning so I just wanted to eat something and relax for a momentI did not take a picture when I could have .Or better yet, check you meal before you leave the place &canshow them outside those dingy thick bullet proof glass thingsthat you got the wrong order or somethingJust because the manager or cashier here said I, the customer, was wrongI think this place is not sensitive to the customer.If you do purchase, use a credit card or something so you can disputethe charge.  Unfortunately for me I paid cash.Well I won't go here again especially if they cheat the customers.I have been here a few times before (maybe a total of 3, 4 times)and I have ordered this meal before and never had an issue untilWednesday night/ Thursday morning. I grew up in Chatham &used to go to this place when it was Leon's and had a restaurantwith seating (dining tables, chairs) and it was fun back in the 1980sI even brought some of my IIT college dorm-room classmates to the placeback in 1988.And this day I was treated like some insignificant black maledespite I earned a Masters degree...  I guess there is injustice all around &this place just shows that.Other than that, the place is kind of dirty and for a while it had abroken door.Also those thick bullet-proof glass windows seem a bit dingy and because of that it may mean the place or area isunsafe anyway if they need all that and especially if needs thosethick bullet-proof glass & does not have those new"No Gun" symbols on the entrance door as I feel much safer in the White suburbsanyway & I am better treated when I have a complaint aboutnot getting adequate service. There in the White suburbs, if I sayI did not get service, they take care of it and give you no lip or backtalk.Here at this place, I guess this lady thought I was some typical blackmale, however, I earned engineering degrees and earn substantialmoney than to be so disrespected like a a typical or common black malein the city.I will be sure to send the management team a copy or a letter of my experience.

16.description: I will NEVER, NEVER, NEVER eat there AGAIN.  A couple of hours after eating them I got extremely sick.  Yes, it was food poisoning.  I was sick for almost two days.  I have never been that sick from food before in my life.  I tried Uncle Johns because as usual Lems BQ was packed and I didn't feel like the wait.  I've gotten mixed reviews from my friends regarding Uncle Johns.  Some have told me when they were on 69th street the food was really good but have gone down a lot.  Others have told me they just didn't like their BQ so I thought I'd just try it for myself.  The ribs were burnt and I wasn't crazy about the hot links however, I ate them.  The only time that building will see me again is to get some Dat Donuts....  Horrible food and horrible service.  Shame on Uncle Johns for selling bad and freezer burned meat!!!!!!!!!!!!

13.description: What can I say garbage garbage garbage never ever go there. They should be ashamed to call this bull !##/ bar b que

11.description: What a wasted trip!  I put off coming here for just long enough to miss the old location.  I'm not used to ordering food through bullet-proof glass in a tight corridor with no place to sit down.  I am used to quality BBQ and this ain't it.I'll count this as the first and hopefully last time I ever get a carryout box with enough grease to float french fries in!  Stop.  Nope, there was literally a pool of oil in the bottom of the box which made the french fries useless for anything other than propping up the meat and making the box feel heavier.Worse, the meat had an acrid taste to it as though the firewood was ripped off a failed Chicago porch.  I can do without being able to eat the fries I paid for, but when  a BBQ joint can't even serve a tasty rib tip, I quit!

39.description: You never really know what you have until its gone. If you enjoy re-issued movies like 'Total Recall' with Colin Farrel instead of Arnold, 'Psycho' with Vince Vaughn instead of Anthony Perkins, 'Planet of the Apes' with Marky Mark instead of Charlton Heston, and/or 'Clash of the Titans' without Laurence Olivier, and with, well, no one... then you might enjoy the new Uncle John's bbq. Don't get me wrong - in the abstract, I might give this place 4 stars had I never visited their old location. Unfortunately, I have. The new location makes gives me new respect for what the old location achieved despite its own limitations - just like the 2011 remake of 'Conan the Barbarian' gave me new respect for the original, despite the original being what film critic Vincent Canby described as 'a long, incoherent, ineptly staged adventure-fantasy'. [RIP Vince.]My main issues include:1) Prices have increased - and there is no longer a Monday/Tuesday special. While I imagine the new place may have slightly higher rent, it's farther for anyone who doesn't live on the far south side and the traffic much worse on local roads since there is no easy access off the highway. So it's more expensive in cash and your time.2) Despite increased prices, the food quality is less consistent. You'd think with the larger kitchen, that shouldn't be the case. You'd also think with higher prices that shouldn't be the case. You'd be wrong on both counts. Never had an issue at the old spot even during the Monday / Tuesday specials.3) The 'sauce on the side' charge. I'm beginning to think that they drench the ribs / fries in sauce to mask ribs/fries that have been done long enough to begin to dry out. By requesting the ribs without sauce, they are forced to give you the fresher ribs, so they want to discourage that by adding a charge. Here's the thing - bbq sauce costs about as much as ketchup. Would anyone accept paying extra for ketchup just to be able to avoid a hot dog or fries that are past their prime? I guess the new Uncle John's management hopes so.That being said I still like the ribs. I just didn't like them nearly as much as I feel I should given the increased cost and inconvenience. Places on the north side that I used to consider 'incoherent and ineptly staged' are now as (or almost as) good given distance and cost.

37.description: i miss the old uncle Johns.no way will i ever come back here again.tips were too tough to chew. hot links changed. hot sauce on the side had NO heat.wasted trip and wasted money.

0.description: I ordered the small rib/link combo. I'm originally from Chicago but I've migrated to Atlanta I had been craving ribs and links for months. I was a bit leery of trying this place because the last time I was there(after Leon's finally closed) the food was horrible. These links were nostalgic. My grandfather was always a hot links man...he would definitely love the spice of these....Needless to say I inhaled it all...now chewing...just a lot of smacking. The mixed hot and mild sauce is divine. Brought my husband an order of hot links back to Atlanta and this is what's left.

38.description: The hot links here are FUCKING ETHEREAL.  The wings taste exactly like McDonald's chicken nuggets, which is wonderful thing.  The ribs and tips aren't worth writing home about.  And at the new location you can stop by Dat Donut for dessert.

51.description: I've been searching with no luck for a good BBQ spot in Chicago and I just decided to go here on a whim one day. I must say it is reaaally good! Their prices are super reasonable and I love the links. I usually get the rib tips and links and I have been satisfied 100% of the time. Every time I go in there someone is complaining about the wait, but I have never experienced an excessive wait time. My food is usually ready within 5-10 minutes. The customer service is fine as well...I haven't experienced nor witnessed any rude behavior (and I have been at least 10 times). My only gripe is the fries getting soaked with bbq sauce but I never bothered to ask for the fries on the side so I guess I can't complain too much.

27.description: This place doesn't deserve any stars!This place is HORRIBLE!My boyfriend and I went there today and ordered a slab of ribs and chicken.  Both the ribs and chicken were over cooked (almost burned) and the sauce was garbage!  I'm a Kansas City native and take my BBQ serious!Don't waste your time or money on this place!

32.description: I've been to this location several time in the last 3 months and have been very pleased with the taste. I decided to try Uncle J's on 47th for a family gathering on the 4th of July. BIG MISTAKE. I ordered a lot of food over the phone and was promised it would be ready but when I arrived it was not. The owner of Uncle Js argued with me and did not have food to even begin to prepare my order. I immediately drove to Uncle Johns on 83rd. When I got to 83rd I was met with a smile and with compassion when I told her my story and that I have 10 family members waiting. She simple said "give me 15 minutes" in around 30 minutes I walked out with tons of food and I was very happy! Uncle Johns on 83rd was glad to accept my 120.00 and I was more than delighted to give it to them. UNCLE JOHN'S ON 83RD AND COTTAGE SAVED THE DAY! God Bless you all...

54.description: I watched the Hungry Hound on ABC Channel 7 on Friday, February 15, 2013. The hubby and I decided to treck into the city to purchase food on Saturday, February 16, 2013.  I would say that the food was just okay.  I am not a rib person and I ordered the rib tips, hot links, and chicken for my daughter. My husband says that the chicken wings could of been better.I agree with Ahminah, the customer service is horrible. It is the same at Dat Donuts which is located next door. The woman that waited on me today was a Hispanic looking woman (didn't get her name).  She was rude.  When I asked for sauce on the side, she kept repeating that it is extra.  I politely told her that I have money.  I spent almost $50 there.  I don't know if the customer service that was rendered was because the place is located in the hood.  I had lived in the area about 22 years ago and it is definitely the hood.  Message to the owner:  You need to train your workers on good customer service.  I was offended when the woman kept repeating "the sauce is extra" three times like I can't read the signs that were posted ( I have to Masters degrees and work at a college).  She was very rude, ghetto, and uncouth.

48.description: I like this joint.  It's close to work and if you go early - 11:30, there isn't much wait time on a weekday.  My favorite are the hot links.  The mild sauce has just the right heat.  Haven't tried the stronger stuff.  I think it's worth it to spend the extra coin on getting the sauce on the side, (additional charge for packaging) otherwise the fries that come with it are too soggy.  Extra star added for the convenience of "Dat Donut" next door for dessert.

44.description: I just called to place an order. The staff said they weren't accepting any orders at this time. I asked why,  she responded that the lobby was full and the weren't taking orders. Wouldn't it make more sense to take the call in and give me an appropriate time to come in. Versus deterring me from coming in at all. I guess they missed my order.

24.description: Split a Jumbo Rib Tip with mild bbq sauce & fries with my hubby. It was decent but the sauce was delicious. Would come back again.

7.description: Let me set things straight: this is not the spot to go to for excellent customer service. The employees aren't rude, but it's not like they are going above and beyond for you. They make sure your order is correct and that's that. As far as the food. Listen, get the jerk tips and/or the hot links. Wait your ass the allotted amount of time to get your food. These reviews on here with people complaining about the service and wait time are BOGUS. This is a good ass hood food joint, so the service won't be horrible, just not overachieving, and the wait time is worth it so chill the fuck out and wait for your food. The rosemary on these hot links...!?!? GAD DAYUM!!! (Although I-57 has the hot link game on lock!) The donut spot next door though!? *faints*

49.description: Bad customer service....Ordered a chicken leg and tip combo. I asked the cashier if fries came with it. She responded yes.  Low and behold when I arrived home and began eating I realized there were no fries under the meat. I called to inform them thinking I'd get fries at a later time.  Nope! The woman on the phone told me to bring my order back up to the restaurant in order to receive fries. When I informed her that we had already started eating and we can get them later,  "No ma'am that's not how it works. " was her response. I was really disappointed with her response to their mistake.The food was just OK. Nothing special. Not worth the $9.78 paid... especially since my fries were M.I.A.

40.description: Links are of the chain and Ribs and Rip Tips Woohoo! As good as it gets!

53.description: I've been l o n g i n g for some good, no, GREAT barBque for a long while now.  I ended up at Uncle John's B.B.Q. after zooming north on Cottage Grove and noticing a Dat Donuts sign.  Someone I use to work w/told me about Dat Donuts years ago, and being the donut conneiseur that I is, I Uturned and headed back to check out Dat (see yelp review).  After purchasing a Dat, I moseyed on out the door and noticed a serious crowd of AA folk at Unc John's (in the same bldg. w/DAT)....JACKPOT, I thought, it must be good for that many folks to be jammed up in there for some que.Anywho, I'm going to keep this brief, I did not like the Unc's tip/link ($13+), and the sauce (mild on my food & I had the nerve to order a side of hot, just to check it out), UGH~it sucked and 3/4 of it, went in the gar-BAGE.My cousin tells a story of babysitting me as a lil' girl...and I would not stop cryin' because I wanted some ribtips and they had to go out and buy me some ribtips.  Fast forward to 2013, I"m still on that ribtips tip and I won't stop until I find 'em, as my all time favorite que place, has closed and my tips/links life hasn't been the same since :(

30.description: I wish there was a way to add ainus star. I tried once & was completely disappointed. Someone told me that it had gotten better & I tried it again only to be let down again.

46.description: A bbq catastrophe. I made my monthly pilgrimage to Uncle John's yesterday. Lo and behold, the place was deserted and a sign indicated that they had moved to 83rd and Cottage Grove. Ok, I've come this far, I'll go a little farther. I walked into some kind of nightmare dystopian version of Uncle John's after the apocalypse. Clean, shiny counters - I felt like I was at a BBQ bank. Still, big deal right? It's the food that counts. And that's the problems. This is not Uncle John's. The sauce tastes like a can of tomato paste tripped over a bottle of hot sauce. Two stars for the links. The links are pretty much the same - just smokeless and with that horrible marinara sauce all over it.

1.description: My husband and I were attempting to try another barbeque place which was across the street, and smelled the aromas of barbeque as we approached...only to find that the other place had closed. We asked a guy who was getting into his car, and he said it was Uncle John's, across the street...and we would love it.My husband turned into their lot and we went to check it out. This was after 11 at night, and they were packed!! We ordered a large 1/2 rib tips, 1/2 hot links meal to share, which came with fries, bread, and cole slaw, and your choice of sauce. As we checked out the menu, hubby asked questions and talked to a few people, who all said it was really good. They told us it would be about 15-20 minutes because they were busy, but that was ok. There is no seating here so we took our order home, and even after the almost hour drive, the food was still delicious. There was no fat on the rib meat at all, and we could taste the genuine smoky flavor. The hot links were spicy and cooked to perfection. Their sauce is delicious, too! I kept dipping my fries in it. For south side barbeque we like Lem's, but my husband thinks this may be his new favorite. We will definitely try again, but for a first visit, they deserve the 5 stars!!

55.description: They will NEVER have to worry about me! Ok so I heard about how great the BBQ was from the 69th Street location. I truly just stumbled upon this location while visiting my favorite sweets shop Dat's Donuts. I went in and asked for a menu to take back to my family so that we could decide what we wanted and the cashier acted as though I was asking for platinum drinking goblets. I returned later to pick up my order from Dat's and decided to look up local area BBQ joints when I found out that this Uncle John's was the same one that was featured on ABC 7's Hungry Hound segment a few years back. So I called to place an order and the woman that answered was either going through "the change", just finished eating a bag of nails, or was just plain old mean. She had the biggest attitude as I was asking about certain menu items. I explained to her very nicely that I would be a first time customer and just wanted to know which combos they offered considering they did not have any menus. She adjusted her attitude VERY slightly to answer my simple question, so I placed my order. When I got out to pick up my order I just so happen to run into two young ladies that were talking about what a bad attitude the women working at Uncle John's had. When asked about their encounter they just stated that they are definitely not customer friendly and luckily the food is better than the service. Just like most of us here on Yelp I work very hard for every dollar I earn so I will not be patronizing any business that does not appreciate and respect the customer. Maybe they need to be reminded which side the rib tips are sauced on.

9.description: I ordered the large tip and link combo. I definitely got my money's worth for the quality and quantity compared to some of the other locals bbq joints in the area. I can't believe I'm just now trying this place after living so close for almost two years. I'll definitely be back.

26.description: I've only had the rib tips here and they were pretty good. The sauce is a little sweeter than I like but they rib tips were tender. I would eat here again.

25.description: I stopped in the other day for a jumbo tip and3 link. This turned out to be a half of a large and three links. I was quite upset as the order was to be divided by several people. I have gotten a jumbo order before so I I thought I knew what to expect. They should rename the order just tips and three links.

12.description: I have been going here almost weekly which is costly because the turkey tips are $11 for the one size order. Every thing was excellent until 2 weeks ago I guess they got a new cook now the tips got tougher and sometimes burnt and the portion got smaller. I won't be going back for a while maybe experience will help with the new cook:(

21.description: This place is awful.  Overpriced nasty sauce that's dry?? crazy, how does the sauce dry up? but it does.69th was much better.  Do yourself a favor and don't come here.

17.description: This place is awful.  Overpriced nasty sauce that's dry?? crazy, how does the sauce dry up? but it does.69th was much better.  Do yourself a favor and don't come here.

10.description: Rumors of Uncle John's precipitous decline have been greatly exaggerated.  The ribs and tips are still meaty and delicious, and the mild and hot sauces are still "elbo lickin' good". What's missing from the 69th street days is consistency: my friends and I agreed that in our large order of tips, some pieces were smoked to tingly perfection and some just weren't smoked. You could actually see the difference in the pieces of meat. Everything tasted good, but if Uncle John's want to approach its greatness of yore, they need to take the care necessary to make sure that every piece of meat is done just right.

5.description: My perspective may be that of a Chicago barbecue novice, but I went to the original Uncle John's and this version once each, and this one works if judged on its own merits rather than in comparison to the legendary original. The ribs and rib tips have a primal appeal to a carnivore. As Seth P. notes, there is inconsistency in the smokiness. This isn't a dealbreaker. The hot sauce is spectacular. It isn't the hottest thing you've ever tasted but it works on multiple levels. The fries are pretty good but you may not give them much attention amid all the meat.There's no seating.

3.description: Love the tip/link combo!! They probably have some the best chicken I have tasted in a while.  But the customer service give me a headache and they don't take order over the phone.  WHYYYY!!!!!!!! But overall really quick and good food if you in the area and looking for some bbq on the fly

35.description: The B. B. Q. was excellent as always and the service was fast; it is worth the trip and the money.

19.description: I I had a taste for bbq so I went to Uncle Joe's on 83rd n Cottage Grove. I ordered 6 wings w/mild sauce and a small Cole slaw. It was horrible!!. The chicken was black on the inside which meant it was old. I will never go back there again!!!. How can they serve old food like that!! It's horrible!!!!!

28.description: This is my second time here because i wanted to make sure that the first time i was there maybe things got better. Hell to the Nah!! This place is a fukin joke. I got the medium tip instead of the half slab i used to get at the old uncle john's.  As i stated in my last review the meat is chewy and stringy, basically it was inedible this time. I wound up suckin on the bones just to get some meat flavor cause i couldn't chew the damn meat.  The only thing i could chew was the fat on the bones, and who wants to do that. It seems they changed the sauce cause it tasted like any ole bbq joint sauce. They did put regular fries instead of waffle fries back into the menu, but so fukin what. I'm done with this place. I'll go down the street to Lem's if i want some regular ass ribs.  Booooooooo! Uncle johns bbq. U've been warned, chew at ur own risk.  Plus i'm getting the sneaky suspicion that this place has nothing to do with the original Uncle John's. Bootleg ass name stealers.

45.description: Usually when I try a new rib joint in the hood, I always order a large tip with mild sauce on the side. Thats the one time test every rib shack gets that'll determine if I'll b a regular. They charge extra for sauce on the side so I couldnt do it this time.This use to be a BBQ joint of another name before it was Uncle Johns and it pretty much taste the same as the place before. The meat was ok. It was a mixture of tender, fatty, amd tough pieces of tips. More tender pieces than anything else and it was real stringy. The sauce tasted like Boston bake beans sauce and was real good on the fries that were sitting at the bottom of the plastic container. It wasn't mild sauce though, it was BBQ sauce. I may return, but I doubt I become a regular. It does taste a lot better than Captain Curts up the street and the service was very fast. I'd of given them 3 stars instead of 1 if it wasnt for the fact that they messed up the order of the guy in front of me. The customer, after getting the wrong order, brought the food back from his car and told them it wasnt his. Instead of taking it and throwing it in the trash, they gave it to the customer whose food it was suppose to be, even though the other guy had opened it, instead of just making him a fresh new one. Thats very UNSANITARY.  How'd they know the other guy didnt dig in it? Also they lose a star because all the employees look like cook county prison inmates.

33.description: I truly wish I had read the reviews before I wasted my time and money going to this place. I ordered a Jumbo hotlink with no bread because I have celiac disease and  I am allergic to wheat.  My friend  ordered a large combo rib tip and hotlink.  I dropped her off in Hyde park and went home to Matteson il. OMG when I opened my food the first thing I saw was  3 pieces of bread on top of the hot links so it was contaminated with wheat. The hotlinks were all burnt black. How horrible to serve such food. I threw everything in the garbage and called my friend she said all of her food was burnt black she could not eat it and she had thrown it in the garbage.  If you drive by this place keep going don't waste your time or money horrible horrible burnt black food not fit for a dog to eat. BTW the customer service wasn't great either. Run by this place. Stay away I will never ever go back there. Terrible.

43.description: Avoid this place if you ever ate at the original spot as it will ruin your fond memories of the greatest rib tips ever. This location has mushy rib tips and a price increase with an inferior product doesn't make sense. The links are ok but not worth the drive or your money. They even managed to make the sauces bland and some how dry. The tips seem to have been cooked in the oven or boiled and no longer have the smokey flavor they once possessed, you get more smoke flavor from a bk whopper then these rib tips. Before you would be walking outside and you could smell the smoke from the wood burning inside from the original location. Now it seems like the aquarium smoker is used as a prop. I hope one day uncle johns comes back to its original glory...

2.description: This is the worst place to go and buy barbecue I've been there many of times and each time I've went  there no matter what time of the day or night I go I always end up with garbage,, I get the ribs tips every time. ,and each time I've gotten more fat then tips ,  if they are not fatty they are burn so bad until  you can't eat them , I've tried to give them the benefit of the doubt ,,, this is why I kept trying them I figure it might just be the cook of the day but no this restaurant I would give this place not 1 star rating don't waste your money people ,,, please don't !!!!

18.description: Best hotlinks. Great value for the money. Good barbecue for low prices. Fits everyone's budget.

41.description: What a wasted trip!  I put off coming here for just long enough to miss the old location.  I'm not used to ordering food through bullet-proof glass in a tight corridor with no place to sit down.  I am used to quality BBQ and this ain't it.I'll count this as the first and hopefully last time I ever get a carryout box with enough grease to float french fries in!  Stop.  Nope, there was literally a pool of oil in the bottom of the box which made the french fries useless for anything other than propping up the meat and making the box feel heavier.Worse, the meat had an acrid taste to it as though the firewood was ripped off a failed Chicago porch.  I can do without being able to eat the fries I paid for, but when  a BBQ joint can't even serve a tasty rib tip, I quit!

52.description: I won't go back the presentation was bad & so was the food!!! The sauce was to thick! I wouldn't recommend this place at ALL!!!!!!! Didn't want 2 give this place any stars

50.description: I thought  was going to get some really good BBQ and is was just OK.  The service was good but the BBQ was not what I expected. I will not be going back.

4.description: My first time trying this place and I can say the servings were a big portion, the sauce wasn't really to good. If probably never eat here again

6.description: They're pretty good service was good food was good. I miss the old uncle John's on 69th....I have really  good news.....The original owners have opened up a new restaurant on 47th it's called Uncle J's, and it reminds me of the good old Uncle John's!!!!! Even have good deals on Tuesday and Wednesday before 6pm....

22.description: i was skeptical about eating here because it replaced what i consider to be a legendary chicago bbq spot which is leons...but to my surprise its better...they offer jerk ribs and all the other traditional bbq menu items...they get you in and out very fast and the portions are large..the prices arent bad at all for the quantity..my only complaint is that if u order just ribs u cant add a single link u have to order a whole link meal..besides that this is def one of my fav bbq spots on the southside

15.description: Called to place an order for pick up and was RUDLEY told that we are not a catering business, youMust come in to place your order and than the nasty lady said, and besides we are not bushy anyway and just hung up the phone.. No customer service at all and they wonder why we don't want to support... I didn't need all of that attitude, a simply no you have to come in and place your order would have worked just fine.. SMH

57.description: Horrible Service. Great bbq! All depends who's at the window.

20.description: I purchase a slab of ribs and order of six wings the ribs were over cooked and very dry and the meat was tough and the chicken was old and you can tell by the very very dark bones and they cover it up with sauce that  is not good either . The 69th place food was much better and fresh they cared about the food they served to the customers and that can make you or break because serving good fresh food is the very important to customers spending their hard earned money and don't received what they paid for That means to  me they have lost a very very angry customer  don't go there it is not worth it.

36.description: Don't bother! Not nearly as good at the one on 69th but that owner's daughter took over and opened up a spot at 502 E. 47th Street (2 Doors East of Vincennes) called Uncle J's BBQ and it is delicious, it's taste just like Uncle John's on 69th! and the menu is identical. Please go there instead! Don't dare waist your time going on 83rd!!!

14.description: This place sucks nothing but burnt tip bones I'm not sure where the meat is but it was just nasty and i really wanted to like them because it's so close to home but the portions and taste is horrible

3.description: This place is awesome for body oils, incense, and African soaps. The service is awesome. The fragrances are popular and inexpensive. I am a customer of fourteen years. This is a great place to purchase scented oils for a love one or friend for any occasion.

1.description: These brothers keep me with a memorable fragrance!!!!Too many to name but ready to experience more.

2.description: I've bought oils and incense from them since the 90s. High quality. Friendly staff. Cocoa mango or Jamaican Fruit!

0.description: I've been a customer for approximately 16 years...good stuff! I currently live in INDIANA and will make time to get quality oils because I know it's worth it. They've got a customer for life.

1.description: I truly wish I can rate a -5. Walmart.com is absolutely ajoke. I made the mistake of going online to do a same day pick up order. Firstproblem online it never stated AFTER I placed my order that I can pick the itemup today it stated that it will be available at the end of the week? Not somuch a big deal I was willing to wait. Midweek I receive a text stating that Ican retrieve my items, then a following text stating my items were canceled???I know try to keep up with me lol. I immediately head to the store because theitems were a gift for someone that needed to have it by the end of the week. Iarrive to the 83rd and Stewart location first mistake! I stood there for about5min before anyone said hello. I explain to the gentelman that I am confused onwhat's going on with my order.. he takes my name walks away and come back. Nowmy order was a total of $109.00 this young man brings out 2 items when Iordered about 7 or 8. I ask him is this all you having out of my entire order?he says yes this is all they can locate in the store, imagine my confusion. Itell him I thought that was the reason Walmart asks you to choose a location sothey can ensure the items are here? he reply and says that is"walmart.com" not walmart ( as he stands in front of a walmart.comsign). I truly did not want to argue I ask him if he can cancel my complete order.he says yes. I personally grab a cart and go through the ales and find everyitem I ordered online to begin with...... Imagine how upset I am I go to theregister and re purchase all items for $146.00, I left the store with other badcustomer service at the register and at the door checking my receipt.. I getonline to walmart.com the next day just to double check everything wascanceled, I go to my cart and see that there is still 3 items shipping to thestore huh?????? I log on and chat with a representative whom I gave the abovestory to who felt really bad. His words to me were "WE FAILED YOU" heensured me that he will escalate my refund. I let things go for a few days goback online the orders are still in my cart ( at this point I am on fire)because I still have a total of $246.00 holding on my debit card in Walmartcharges... I get back on the chat and explain myself again she tells me thatnothing has been escalated smh and that I have 2 options 1. I can go back tothe store to cancel the items or 2. wait 7 days if the items are not picked upthey are automatically canceled?????? I instantly asked her for the number tocorporate which she claims she does not have. She states if I call walmart.comthey will transfer me. I call walmart.com and asked to speak to corporate theytransferred me and I was on hold for about 30 min. I grab my house phone andcall walmart.com and speak to a supervisor named " Samantha", I explainedto her my detailed situation and she calls "Theresa" at 83rd andstewart location on 3 way and they both decide the only way still that they cancancel the items that should have already be canceled is for me to go all theway back to the store?? I literally just disconnected the phone call becausethis is more time wasted. I go to the location to cancel my items again anotherunnecessary mistake. Their were 2 gentleman at the counter whom tried to tellme they couldn't cancel them from here (I had to remind them that I was givenno choice) after switching registers and gaining the help of another lady thecanceled the rest of my order. No no that's not it lol. Today Is Feb, 1st so asI had some free time I go back onto walmart.com to make sure everything iscanceled again. Imagine my surprise when everything says canceled but I stillsee a balance of 19.78??? I have to call walmart.com again because this isunclear I speak to a pleasant gentleman by the name of "Victor" whomtried his hardest to help but really couldn't figure it out either and againstates he will escalate my matter to refund me this difference now ( if youhave read my entire review you will know why I am not confident this willhappen). This has been going on for about a week now and I am still missingmoney from this order, I am calling out walmart corporate to make it right withme which I know may not happen because apparently service is not a priority atthis company. Honestly this experience makes me want to NEVER shop at walmartagain. I hope this helps at least one person... walmart if you get a chance to read this look up my order and contactme. Carmen.l.adcock@gmail.com.

9.description: THIS IS BY FAR THE WORST LOCATION I HAVE EVER BEEN TO!Never have I been so utterly disrespected and disregarded by so many associates in one location at one time. I visited a Walmart location a few days ago and used a self checkout kiosk. I mistakenly asked for cash back from the kiosk (which does not dispense cash) and left the store without realizing I never received my change.  I called in to customer service, and was advised over the phone by one customer service associate (Ronidqua) to bring in my receipt to receive the cash back from my transaction. I came into the store, and waited 45-minutes in line to get assistance. Once at the customer service counter, I explained my situation, to which the associate, Candice, takes my receipt and tells me to have a seat because my issue will take a while.  After 20-minutes of waiting, I follow up with Candice to make sure someone is handling my issue.  She says that she just followed up with someone about my issue and walks off to handle returned items. After ANOTHER 45-minutes of waiting patiently, I ask to speak to a manager (Rolando). After explaining my issue to him, he tells me that I should first contact my banking institution to handle this matter and if they can't do anything, then to come back to the store.  I ask him if it would be possible to at least get my original receipt back, to which he responds no member of his staff would have taken a receipt and given it to a member of security to rectify an issue.  He then proceeds to tell me that if my financial institution is unable to resolve the issue, then I should come back and they can re-print me a copy of my receipt.  He made ZERO attempt to recover my original receipt or even acknowledge the fact that one of his associates DID execute such an act.  After multiple requests to get my original receipt returned to me, I asked if he could get the associate that took my receipt from me. He responded that she had left for the evening.  The level of complete and utter lack of adequate customer service at this location is very disturbing. There have been several instances with similar outcomes where I leave highly frustrated at the lack of care associates take in fulfilling even their basic responsibilities. There is obviously a lack of training present, both in basic customer service and in problem solving. Instances like these make it increasingly daunting to patron these locations because of the EXPECTATION of poor customer service and lack of care by almost ALL employed associates.  This type of quality is not indicative of the Walmart mission or vision and needs to be addressed immediately.  No one should ever be subjected to the blatant disregard for people or their time that I experienced.This was the final straw for me spending my money with a company that could clearly care less about quality customer satisfaction or even basic customer service.  I will no longer shop here and fully intend to spread the word about the poor service I received today.

23.description: If I could, I would give this location 0 stars. The shelves are often bare because all the inventory sits on palettes in the aisles. The employees seem uninterested and are just plain rude. The absolute worst Wal-mart I have ever visited. You could not pay me to return to that location. Execs in Bentonville need to visit this location to see how horribly this store represents their brand.

5.description: Most of the employees spend more time talking to one another than assisting the customers. The bathrooms are always a mess and don't ask for help because the employee is going to send you in whatever direction comes to mind in order to get you out of their face. The one employee that was great was Robert in customer service. Even at 7:00am he is smiling, he could teach the other employees about customer service. The return carts are overflowing and sitting in the front of the store and it looks a complete mess.On black Friday, it was unorganized and the lines were backed up. This is normal however because there are more people standing around than checking out customers. Even the front end managers stand around. I was a front end supervisor and when the lines were out of control I jumped in to help bring the lines down. Not at here...they watch and complain! The after Christmas sell was absent. I went to purchase a TV and was looking for a 32 inch. I wanted a 32 inch Samsung. I saw a 32 inch at Walmart but it was high. I went to Target, got a 40 inch Samsung Television for a cheaper price than the Walmart 32 inch television. Walmart was once the store I loved to come to, however these days it is getting worse. The women's clothing department looks like an Elderly person is the buyer. Nothing that makes a mature woman want to wear it because it is no style but a bunch of colors. You can find elastic waist pants all day. Other than that nothing jumps out.In addition, get some pizza's in there that are not pepperoni and sausage. Some people like to have a quality brand pizza that is beef or turkey. They purchase a few cheap brand beef pizza's and everyone doesn't eat pork. Again, the buyer isn't supplying the need of all customers.

25.description: Really? This is why we needed Walmart in Chicago so bad?I might be biased because I don't like Walmart so much to begin with; I much prefer Target. But due to a friend's bridal registry, then a large gift ordered by out-of-town relatives, I have needed to go to this one twice. Well, of course the registry kiosk wasn't functional, why would it be? So the first trip was a wasted one. At least we did get what we came for the second time. But both times, we encountered employees who could not answer any question, no matter how simple (such as where certain departments were located within the store; people who work within ten feet of the registry kiosk and are in fact facing it don't know where it is or if they have one)), could not speak proper English despite it being their first language (sorry, Ebonics does not count as a language), and were much more interested in loudly describing their sex and drinking lives to each other than in doing anything like work. Please. There is no reason to find yourself in this store.

12.description: Walmart, that absolute genius business model. Crappy store cleanliness as usual, genius level supply chain logistics (second only to Amazon.com), savings directly passed down to customers.

21.description: Went to this Walmart to pick up a few things (Never EVER try to spend more that 30-45 min in this place) and sure enough, I was almost jumped by a a mother and daughter duo who became upset when I told them they butted me in line.  I actually said "excuse me ma'am, I was in line."  Why oh why did they proceed to curse me clean the hell OUT in front of the 2 small children they had with them.  The Walmart staff turned the other cheek while the security never came to my rescue.  They ended up getting out of line but the whole experience was ghetto and embarrassing.  I swear this will be my last Walmart experience in the hood.  I will spend the extra coins at Target for the safer experience.

16.description: I was actually glad when this Walmart opened because of the dearth of businesses in so many south side neighborhoods.  Even though Walmart is a "big box" retailer with some not so attractive attributes I was looking forward to something that would be better than nothing.  Social consciousness, eco-friendly gobbledy gook, and feelgood slogans aside, what good is a business that won't open in my neighborhood?  Alas, this Walmart manages to be sub-par even with my generally low expectations of a "big box" retailer.  I've found pricing to be pretty good on most items.  I commonly find OTC pharmacy items are much less than competitors.   General merchandise is poorly stocked and yet the aisles are perpetually cluttered with boxes.  Things are messy, dirty, and misplaced.  The employees are a mixed bag.  I've had a few efficient and polite ones and some that are rude and unhelpful.  Some days you can get in and out, other days the lines are so long and slow moving that I've dropped the merchandise on the nearest shelf and walked out.  The thing that finally turned me off was going in one night to find a jewelry organizer.  After looking around for a few minutes in jewelry I couldn't find it so I approach the jewelry counter to ask if it might be located elsewhere.  Before I can open my mouth some armed security guard tells me very rudely to step back.  I eventually figured out that the sales girl was counting money to close the register but nothing in my dress or demeanor would indicate that I was there to steal.  Trying to ask where I might be able to find help got another rude brushoff.  I draw the line at being treated rudely and disrespectfully when I'm there to give a business my money.  This Walmart can hire armed guards to mean-mug customers but they can't hire anyone capable of answering a question?  No thanks! I think I've been back one time since that incident to get something very minor.  I have to be in pretty dire straits to deal with this place.  I'm sure they'll do fine without my money but I'd rather drive farther and be able to shop in peace.

17.description: In terms of this particular Walmart, the actual building and what it provides is very fantastic. They have a wide variety of products and services that meet every need and/or want that you may have. What makes such a spectacular place exclusively terrible is the lack of customer service. The lackluster employees even go as far as to horseplay and call each expletives in front of groups of customers. I have even witnessed them even refusing to help customers because they themselves are ridiculously lazy. Upon having an experience where I was looking for an item and I had an employee tell me to "Google it so I can see what it look like" [end quote], I found myself too apalled to even want to return to this location. If you value your time and money, I implore you to go elsewhere.

10.description: Is this really a "Supercenter"? I have been here about 3 times.  Typical Walmart- it meets my shopping needs.   I really do not have a complaint about this store. I even shopped here on Thanksgiving.  It was PACKED, but, I was in and out in no time. Its good to have a Walmart in the city of Chicago.

11.description: I think that Walmart really has gotten better over the last couple of months from what I have seen. Everything seems to be fully stocked now and orderly. So hopefully they will keep it up.

27.description: Worst customer service ever! Seriously, employees are RUDE and doesn't do anything. Walmart needs to hire good people. I would not come to this walmart ever again.

0.description: The staff here is super unprofessional ! Just ghetto . They have no regard for the customers experience.

20.description: Its really sad to say that this is one of the few Wal-Mart's on the south side of Chicago. This Wal-Mart is normally accustomed to long lines, ignorant customers, and un helpful staff. Needless to say unless your going to go very far south or north this can be one of your only options. Try not to go on the weekend or at night and you may be able to find what you want and not stay in line for 35 minutes. .

19.description: Its really sad to say that this is one of the few Wal-Mart's on the south side of Chicago. This Wal-Mart is normally accustomed to long lines, ignorant customers, and un helpful staff. Needless to say unless your going to go very far south or north this can be one of your only options. Try not to go on the weekend or at night and you may be able to find what you want and not stay in line for 35 minutes. .

2.description: Today was a great day for me at this WalmartI was looking for a great deal for a Christmas gift for my sonShelly in the electronic Department was greatNot only did I get service with a smile she was very knowledgeable of her items in her department. Shelly even took the time out to do my prices checks and made me feel good about my gift for my 12 year old . The price  I got for my Samsung Galaxy 3 with insurance 260.00And a case. I'm a happy mom Overall the store was very neat and cleanWhat a great day

18.description: Went to this Walmart to pick up a few things (Never EVER try to spend more that 30-45 min in this place) and sure enough, I was almost jumped by a a mother and daughter duo who became upset when I told them they butted me in line.  I actually said "excuse me ma'am, I was in line."  Why oh why did they proceed to curse me clean the hell OUT in front of the 2 small children they had with them.  The Walmart staff turned the other cheek while the security never came to my rescue.  They ended up getting out of line but the whole experience was ghetto and embarrassing.  I swear this will be my last Walmart experience in the hood.  I will spend the extra coins at Target for the safer experience.

13.description: You can't possibly be serious about the way this store is managed , they should clean house starting with the manager and the unproductive , incompetent staff

4.description: After years of the only chicago Walmart being on the other side of town, I gotta say I'm glad this was built.   However, it did the exist whe. I actually lived in Chatham. Now the service is another story.  It's mediocre at best, and there's a lot of random nonsense going on in the parking lot.  This store is kinda messy compared to other Walmarts.  And it's not a South side thing either.   The other Walmart in Pullman is waaayyyy cleaner and nicer than this one.  However, it's further from my house and inconvenient to go to typically.  Walmart neighborhood market is closest to me, but they obviously don't have as much stuff as the full store.

24.description: why are there always palettes in the isles & hardly ever stock on the "MF' shelves? Why do the employees think its fine to hold conversations with coworkers & personal visitors while ringing customers up, this broad literally stopped ringning & bagging groceries to have a flirtatious convo w/ a dude that wasnt even mildly attractive :/.. why does this wlmart have the worst produce, but the walmart near my gig , not too far from union station has much better quality of fruit & everything is always  STOCKED ON THE DAMNED SHELVES!.ridiculous

6.description: I think it's great to have a Walmart in the Chatham community. I used to live there and I'm glad to come back and see that the community is growing. I often order things online, and I have to go to the Online Pickup area to pick up my products. The man that usually gets my online order is very nice and professional. There was a time that I received an email from Walmart stating that my order (a lamp) was ready for pick - up, and when I got there, it wasn't even available at the store. The man handled it very well, by walking me to the isle of the lamps and tried to see if I wanted to get anything else. Overall, I always have a great experience there, and I have had encounters with very polite and professional employees.

22.description: they really need to hire more people @ this store lines are to long!

15.description: this location seemed kinda busy last nite. there was merchandise everywhere & some in the wrong sections. i never understood why people just put their stuff wherever they are & cant even put it back where they got it from. its really not that hard 2 do people! got a few things in here & left.

7.description: I don't know what the hell Wal Mart was thinking when they decided to employ hoodrats to work as cashiers. I was checking out after getting groceries and I had placed two pairs of earrings I was giving to someone as a gift and they never got rung up and the cashier said "Oh they fell between the belt"......I just walked out because I was fed up with the slow movement of the line I was in since the lady in front of me was paying for two full carts of food-I guess to feed those grown a** fools in her house. The cashier was also glancing at text messages on her phone which was unacceptable she should be trying to get customers checked out instead of worrying about who the hell texted her. I am going to lodge a complaint with the store manager because it makes no sense to see throngs of workers who are unhelpful when customers are looking for something they just point it out instead of walking with the customer to where the item is. They made a mistake hiring clowns to work at this location and it seems like hoodrats are only there to collect a paycheck and not doing their jobs. Wal Mart needs to clean house of these kind of workers and put people in who are serious about their jobs. Also workers need to refrain from conversing with each other while checking customers out so they can properly handle transactions. They spend too much time discussing things that are not appropriate for the work place such as how they get turned up and laid on the weekends. Half the workers are new to the workforce so they're going to understand how the real world works when they're unemployed for gross misconduct on the job.

8.description: I am not a fan of Wal-Mart in general because of their practices. Because of this, I have cut down my spending from about 90% to 20-30% in the last few years. This particular store has huge issues and can be a big disappointment with overall customer relations. You never know if you will get the services you need. For example, I ordered a same day photo book in 2013 as a gift. NEVER RECEIVED IT. Went to the store several times and there was always a different excuse.  Today I was there (only because I was a passenger with someone else who decided to stop in). Came across the clearance aisles and saw 1/4 of a wall stocked with Cherrios under huge "Clearance" signs. YES!! Well, they didn't have prices on them so I asked a co-manager, Patrick, for the price. He checks with another employee then informs me that they aren't on sale. Excuse me?! Then why are they on the wall marked clearance. Long story short, he argues that they are changing the wall (although NOT ACTIVELY) and that's it. Even threatened to have my mom thrown out the store if she took a picture. Most places will acknowledge the mistake, and give you a discount. But not Patrick, he was steadfast in making sure Wal-Mart didn't lose a dollar. This just confirms my lack of desire to shop there. Oh, and let's talk about how they have the generic white bags with red thank you on it. Talk about bad management! Does corporate know you are not using Wal-Mart brand bags? Wonder what they will think about that. I will say, however, that my cashier, Wakenda was very pleasant as well as the young man in electronics that assisted us with the IPods. Only reason I'm not complaining about being forced to give them one star.

3.description: Lazy ghetto employees which lack customer service skills!! the employees take their time, ring up friends before the next customer in line and don't even try to disguise it!!! The store is dirty and employees don't even move carts out of the aisle so customers can walk through.  Go somewhere else, i can't even suggest another walmart because you'll get the same thing....just go to target

14.description: Like any other Walmart around the country, "It is, what it is." Don't expect it to look like Whole Foods in the Supermarket section and don't expect it to be clean and organized like Target.  Its Walmart, get in and get out.  Just expect to wait in line because of all the 30 registers only 5-6 are open to cash you out.P.S. Its not the holidays yet and the employees looked warn out. Give these Folks a raise and benefits already!

1.description: Nice spot as there are not many options in the neighborhood.  Service is prompt the store clean and the staff is professional. Nice spot for a sit down and a boost of caffeine.

0.description: This is my favorite dunkin..the staff is great and friendly..always helpful..good quick fast service..The food is fresh and they always remember how i like my coffee every time..they have it ready when i get to the register..

3.description: Staff is polite enough.  Free parking.  Accepts take out orders via phone.  No credit cards.  The turkey Philly is my go to.

1.description: The ppl that work here at this place is RUDE as hell!!! Won't be spending my damn money here no more!!!

2.description: I order the Turkey Burger with fries on the side. They have a decent selection of Trurkey products, such Turkey Tips, Turkey Hot Dogs etc. My wife and I had short wait. The Turkey Burger was great will return other items on the menue. There is parking next to the Restaurant and this Restaurant is carry-out only.

9.description: This place is good no doubt! The Turkey Links are fantastic!!! Everything is always very fresh!!! Service could be better!

10.description: Love the chicken on wheat pita!! Everything is always fresh and fast.

4.description: The food is usually good if you order what is available on the menu.   Everything on the menu is not available for order. Menu needs to be updated. Ordering system is flawed. No communication between order takers and cooks. They didn't realize that ingredients were gone. Front cashier is very unfriendly.

6.description: Great Turkey burgers, fast and fresh! Just call them for a pickup and you can pick your meal up within 5 mins! Never had a bad experience. Friendly service. Overall id come back and recommend to many others.

11.description: The best sauce that I've tasted on turkey!  My husband and I frequent this place about once a month. We are never dissatisfied. We typically order the tacos and the turkey tips. They are a wonderful substitute for pork. The service is always friendly although I phone ahead to skip the wait. The few times that I did not call ahead we waited between 10 & 15mins for our order.  This restaurant is one of my staples. My only hope is that they offer the use of a credit/debit option, instead the owner has one of those cheesy/unsafe/expensive ATM machines to draw cash from your debit/credit card (the owner collects fees from each transaction).

5.description: If your looking for a great turkey burger this is NOT the place to go!!!!!! How the hell can the name of your establishment be Turkey Burger Grill and the the actual turkey burger menu item is fucking terrible!!!!! Hands down the worst turkey burger I've ever had in my life!!!! Not to mention the customer service was terrible as well idk what happen with this place it used to be really good. Maybe I need to try something different, the last time I visited this place I had turkey tips I remembered them being delicious but that was about a year ago. You would think the main menu item would be the best, but it was hands down the worst......

7.description: The turkey burgers are Effing Golden!Would have gave it five stars, but the service was lacking.

8.description: The turkey burgers here are better than most places. They have good flavor, texture, and appear to be homemade; not some over processed frozen patty. The turkey sausage pizza is really good but pricy for the small slice you get.

0.description: I have no idea what mad scientist /cook came up with Turkey tips but they're outstanding! I love their selection of burgers,  but their extended menu has become a little cheesy. Too much of the corner spot vibe, and they NEVER have Smoothies!

1.description: They have roaches. I live down the street so I would eat here often. But I went a couple weeks ago and saw a baby Roach . then turned around and saw a big one. So nasty

2.description: So, I decided to come here on my lunch break.  I didn't call ahead an order because I wanted to wait and see what looked good.  Usually, there's a few customers, but little wait time.  Today, there were about 7 people inside (no seats mind you), and random shouts and yelling taking place.  It made me really uncomfortable and it was very hot inside...i had to just leave.  Maybe I'll go back someday when school's back in session.  Otherwise, it's tough how ghetto it gets.

0.description: Well, we were down in this neck of the woods for Chicago Cares. I can't say I'm too familiar...but we saw this place and made a beeline at lunch. Imagine 8 kickballers (in our t-shirts) wandering into this place...we were awe struck by the number of menu items. Literally menus on each and every wall...plastered with items and combos and different ways of prepping. However, not a table in the place. Not sure where people sit!They also sell grillz. Which I'd never seen before. The food was DAMN good and greasy. We sampled fried okra and mushrooms, fried chicken, polish hot dogs, the philly chicken (the biggest sammie I ever saw in my life!), gyros and beefsteak.Seriously, it hit the spot. The guys were friendly, too. I didn't partake in any of the grillz, but I thought it to be an interesting offering at a food shop! I enjoyed the experience.

58.description: I had a date night in downtown Chicago and we randomly chose Plymouth after spotting the rooftop bar while walking along State street.   We had a bit of an adventure trying to find the entrance but finally made our way to the right spot.    We then took the escalator to the top floor and was promptly greeted by a server who took us near the rear of the restaurant.The first thing that caught my eye was the painted mural on the far wall with various local celebrities posing along the bar ranging from Jennifer Hudson to Oprah Winfrey.   I'm gonna assume they weren't all there at the same time but nonetheless it was an impressive photo.Since it was a cold evening, the rooftop itself was sealed up with heat lamps above to keep the patrons warm.    The waitress we had seemed slightly annoyed when my date requested needing more time to decide on a drink but otherwise was competent.I ordered their special of the day which was their $3 fish tacos.   To wash it down I had an Angry Orchard apple cider drink.   The tacos themselves were tasty enough.   My date ordered one of their burgers along with some sweet potato fries.   Those were aplenty since my date showered a lot for me to share.    They were good and not greasy.It was night time but it was still nice being able to see the view of the trains and street traffic from up above.    I would definitely give this place another shot.

56.description: Terrible Food! I don't say that often but ordered artichoke dip - came cold, wth... It's a dip. I thought it was a fluke but all our food came cold.  The pita bread to use instead of  chips?  Hard, like it was toasted yesterday. Yuck!Burger - tasteless, would it kill to add some salt on it? The meat was 1.5 bigger than the bun so you can just bite into it, so I cut in half. Fine. Meat was overcooked on the edge = dry meatChicken wings - overcooked and what a surprise COLD, MAYBE some were warm. Whatever. How can you get a fried thing wrong?!? HoW? Fry and serve not that hard.Mexican egg roll? - again fried but warm/cold and came with DISGUSTING, yes I said it...disgusting guacamole. Did it come from a can? We didn't bother returning food because I just don't bother to do that. Oh the good thing they have drink specials, bad thing, it's water and juice. Thanks for the attempt but hundreds of other places to go.

29.description: I wanted to like this place so so badly, but it was a total trainwreck!Service was super slow upon arriving, it took a long time to get our first drinks.They brought out the completely wrong thing for my order, then it took them twenty minutes to bring out the correct thing.  My husband was already long done eating.  Veggie burgers take about five minutes to cook from frozen, and the place was not that busy at 8:00 on a Sunday - there are no excuses for this.  When it finally did arrive, it had been cooked to death and there was a weird watery, chopped spinach on top that looked like it had just been defrosted.  I squeezed the burger and about 2 tablespoons of water dripped out.  Nothing else on the burger.  What??  And no offer to comp anything? The drinks (moscow mule, mojito) were extremely weak and did not taste right.And for the icing on the cake - my husband, with his iron stomach, felt sick the next morning after eating here.  Never again, Plymouth!  What a waste of a beautiful Sunday night.

42.description: The food here is horrible. We got burgers and fish and chips. Why do they bother asking you how you want your burger cooked when they are super thin and can only be cooked well done? The fish in fish and chips are tiny little nuggets. The back of house was obviously off their game the night we went because they messed up the toppings and blue cheese is not tartar sauce. You don't serve fish and chips with blue cheese. The buns on the burgers were stale and hard. The drinks were slow to come out and not that great. I feel bad for the servers because it was obvious that they were trying and it was just the kitchen and bartenders ruining the night. They talk about their view but the view of the abandoned parking lot is not that breathtaking. I was embarrassed that I suggested this restaurant to the friends I was eating with.  As we were leaving a group asked us if the restaurant was good and we told them no. They were lucky and went somewhere else.
