23.description: I've been here now for both drinks and lunch, for drinking it's not a bad spot, it's a cool rooftop, not super high, but at least you're not waiting a long time in line, not too pricy, standard beer list, as for food, i got the mini sliders once which were fine, and then the chicken chipotle wrap, which was really good and filling, my friend got a wrap and that also looked good, lunch menu is about the same as the bar price wise, its a good deal for the area

47.description: First time here and had some drinks and food on the roof top bar. Service was great and the drinks were really good. Food too. Very friendly staff. Had a great time. even though it was chilly out that night the rooftop has heaters so didn't feel cold at all. definitely going back here

8.description: Worried it would be full of pretentious lawyers, I was nervous to try. To my surprise, the rooftop was full of regular people! Food was great, drinks were better and the service was legit. There was a very pushy server (he wasn't even our server) who almost seemed like he didn't trust our server to do her job. Tried to take my half full glass of wine twice and our condiment caddy once before our food had even been served. Back off, bro...our assigned server was great. We ordered nachos and was surprised by the presentation. Do not order for a meal, but it was perfect had a sharing appetizer. Burgers were next, the wicker basket is long and took up most of our small bistro table. Delicious, though (the burgers not the basket). I would suggest, getting at least Guinness on draft, no other dark microbrew was available.

31.description: I came here Sunday evening, drawn by the lure of a rooftop away from Michigan Ave that maybe, just maybe, might not be too crowded or overpriced. You take an elevator up to the top floor (rooftop might be a little strong, as other reviewers have mentioned, it's 1) not that high up, 2) not open on all sides, and 3) graced with a view of the dirty rooftop next door/the Harold Washington Library El Stop). However, the owls atop the library look pretty badass once it starts to get dark and the lights shine on them, so that was ok. Drinks were good; I enjoyed the French Martini, and the service was fine. We ordered the spinach dip, which was served with a soft pita, and didn't care for it. We didn't find it creamy but more stringy, and had very little flavor, combined with the wilting pita, we didn't take more than one bite each and probably should have requested to have it taken off the bill, not sure why on earth we paid for that, now that I think of it. The 2-star rating says it all: Meh. It wasn't terrible, but there wasn't anything that would make me choose to return, either.

34.description: Plymouth is probably the best place in the south loop for dining outside.  You get to take a small, funky smelling elevator up to the rooftop to enjoy one of the coolest views for free (well you should probably purchase a beverage at least).  You can see the Harold Washington library and just beneath you is a long abandoned enclosed parking ramp leading to a long abandonded roof top parking lot that looks like something John Hughes would have used for a scene in in one of his movies.  So this is not a sexy view but it's a cool view nonetheless.So what to do here?  Drink, eat and drink some more.  This place gets pretty packed with the afterwork crowd.  For lunch, it's mellower and their food is well priced for the loop.  Plus, they have a pretty good variety.  Lots of burger choices, salads and wraps, appetizers...you name it.  Their salads are super big.  The BBQ chicken is a fav.  They also have a nice kebab plate with your choice of chicken or pork, a greek salad and pita for under $10.Their original wood plank floor is very cool.The double ceiling fan is very cool.The misty thing that no one really knows what it does is pretty cool too.  But you can pretend you are on the Maid of the Mist tour in Niagra Falls or London, you choose.If you are a cheap ass Plymoouth has lots of drinks specials and happy hour specials for people like you.

13.description: I came here Sunday evening, drawn by the lure of a rooftop away from Michigan Ave that maybe, just maybe, might not be too crowded or overpriced. You take an elevator up to the top floor (rooftop might be a little strong, as other reviewers have mentioned, it's 1) not that high up, 2) not open on all sides, and 3) graced with a view of the dirty rooftop next door/the Harold Washington Library El Stop). However, the owls atop the library look pretty badass once it starts to get dark and the lights shine on them, so that was ok. Drinks were good; I enjoyed the French Martini, and the service was fine. We ordered the spinach dip, which was served with a soft pita, and didn't care for it. We didn't find it creamy but more stringy, and had very little flavor, combined with the wilting pita, we didn't take more than one bite each and probably should have requested to have it taken off the bill, not sure why on earth we paid for that, now that I think of it. The 2-star rating says it all: Meh. It wasn't terrible, but there wasn't anything that would make me choose to return, either.

11.description: A great place for a fun date night,  or casual dinner and drinks.  Has nice heated,  outdoor seating.  Great eats and drinks any time of the year.

39.description: I'm a big fan of Plymouth Restaurant & Bar especially the rooftop section when it is nice out. I've been to Plymouth Restaurant & Bar on three different occasions.Pros: - Plymouth Restaurant & Bar has both an indoor restaurant and rooftop restaurant. The rooftop bar is great because if it's humid they will sporadically turn on the mister that feels great. - The food is responsibly priced and pretty tasty. I've had the Quesadillas and the nachos which were delicious. They have great guacamole which is a plus for guac lovers like myself.  - The first and third time I went here the wait staff was great and attentive. Even when the restaurant got busy the waitress still made sure to check in on us. She even promptly gave me some napkins and soda water to clean my shirt when something spilled on it.Cons: -  The sitting area is very limited so I'd recommend having at least a backup restaurant choice. - The indoor restaurant closes earlier than the rooftop so they force you to go upstairs. The rooftop restaurant essentially turns into an outdoor night club on the weekend but it gets pretty crowded and loud. If you're looking for a mellow evening I wouldn't recommend the rooftop on weekend evenings. - The second time I came here the hostess was not very professional. Typically when a restaurant gets busy the hostess will give you an estimated wait time but the hostess keep giving us the runaround when we asked for a wait time. She didn't seem to care about us coming or going so we ended up leaving. Aside from the terrible customer service I once got this the best place to go if you're looking for a rooftop experience.

37.description: Awful bartending, burger was burnt. I would send anyone here ever. Most unprofessional staff I've felt with in this city. Save your money and go somewhere else.

0.description: Like Slingblade, I would venture to declare that I've never met a french fried potato I didn't like.  Plymouth's waffle fries are my latest BFFs. My first encounter with waffle fries began eons ago with Chik-Fil-A, and now I would never set foot in one, so that nixes my access to waffle fries.  Until now.  Waffle fries. What a novelty! I already like waffles. Why not just cut potatoes into a waffle-y shape and deep fry? Success, I tell you! While waffle fries will never supplant the traditional french fry "stick" or sliver, if offered on the menu along with spicy curly fries, tator tots, and sweet potato fries, you can bet there will be some brow scrunching and hand wringing over which to order (for me, at least).  You go ahead and order any of the other permutations. I will undoubtedly order the waffle fries.Oh, and Plymouth is a solid lunch venture. Quick, personable service, big portions for the value, decent veggie burger. I believe I mentioned waffle fries...They also have a roof top bar that gets really crowded and something going on regarding martini specials. W a f f l e  f r i e s.

38.description: Rooftop not that big a deal in the end. Mostly because the view from the rooftop isn't that exciting.  Much better than sitting on a sidewalk next to the street though. Buffalo wings had good flavor but I wish they had been a little meatier. Perhaps they were overcooked as there were some tough spots.  Didn't stop us from getting a second order. Combo plater was nice. Southwest egg rolls and sauce were delicious, cheese sticks cooked right with plenty of rich marinara for dipping. Service was great. Didn't have to wait long for more drinks or more food.

51.description: 3.5 StarsThe first warm summer days in Chicago are always the best! My friends and I were trying to think of a place where we could get pretty decent food, sit outside, and could accommodate 6 ppl at the last minute. We headed on over here and received everything we wanted :) The place was packed! We were able to score a table for 2 though to at least place our belongings at. The guys stuck to jack and coke/vodka sprite, while the ladies experimented with the cocktails :) Me being a lover of sweet drinks I went with the patron base Mexican cocktail and it was delicious! Sort of reminded me of a milkshake. I would also recommend the pear cocktail...very refreshing. We shared the appetizer platter:Egg rolls - mehMozzarella sticks - goodMac and cheese bites - good Spinach Dip - excellent Not the best scenery,  but reasonably priced and a great place to mingle with friends on a warm summer night.

27.description: I've gone to the rooftop three times. The food is so-so and it takes a looonng time to get your order (weekdays at noon) but if you work in an air conditioned office it's lovely to be outside in nice weather.It can get really hot in the summer, and they have run some misting pipes along the edge of the terrace to cool you off.

32.description: It was a nice night and we wanted to try something new so we headed over to the Plymouth. It was pretty crowded, but we got seated immediately. They have a large menu with variety and a nice drink menu. I ordered a strawberry long island and my husband got an Angry Orchard. We split 20 buffalo wings with ranch and blue cheese. The drinks were great and the wings were a perfect amount of heat. They also have mild, barbecue and really hot wing options. I wasn't a huge fan of their blue cheese or ranch sauce. They both had a strange aftertaste. The wings were fine without them though. They have several tvs playing different sports  games and the overall ambiance was casual and comfortable. Can't wait to come again and try something new.

54.description: One of The Loop's hidden gems.  A great rooftop bar with very reasonable prices and a fun atmosphere.  For the people criticizing the food, what did you expect?  It's a small, family-owned operation serving mostly bar food, not a five-star restaurant.  The food is just fine, and the other positives (including excellent drink specials)  more than make up for any deficiencies.  It's especially nice in the summer when you can really take advantage of the rooftop.

44.description: Plymouth has a fun rooftop and it's probably a great place to meet a friend for a 'cold' drink.The food is another matter.  You'll find incorrectly cooked burgers with the wrong cheese.  Their "friggin'-hot" baked wings actually rate about a 5 out of 10 on the normal heat scale.  The combo appetizer platter was actually ok.The drinks are a little pricey on a Sunday night, about average for the touristy section of downtown.  The beer was served at approximately 50 degrees and got warmer quick in the night-time Spring breeze,Very nice servers apologized profusely and sincerely - it's almost as if they've had a lot of practice.  Actually, they were very nice, but overwhelmed and understaffed.  After I refused their offer to comp the burger, the waitress comped my Moscow Mule nightcap - that's nice, really.Fix this place.  I really want to like it.

24.description: Great food. Nice view. Excellent service.

7.description: I'm a big fan of Plymouth Restaurant & Bar especially the rooftop section when it is nice out. I've been to Plymouth Restaurant & Bar on three different occasions.Pros: - Plymouth Restaurant & Bar has both an indoor restaurant and rooftop restaurant. The rooftop bar is great because if it's humid they will sporadically turn on the mister that feels great. - The food is responsibly priced and pretty tasty. I've had the Quesadillas and the nachos which were delicious. They have great guacamole which is a plus for guac lovers like myself.  - The first and third time I went here the wait staff was great and attentive. Even when the restaurant got busy the waitress still made sure to check in on us. She even promptly gave me some napkins and soda water to clean my shirt when something spilled on it.Cons: -  The sitting area is very limited so I'd recommend having at least a backup restaurant choice. - The indoor restaurant closes earlier than the rooftop so they force you to go upstairs. The rooftop restaurant essentially turns into an outdoor night club on the weekend but it gets pretty crowded and loud. If you're looking for a mellow evening I wouldn't recommend the rooftop on weekend evenings. - The second time I came here the hostess was not very professional. Typically when a restaurant gets busy the hostess will give you an estimated wait time but the hostess keep giving us the runaround when we asked for a wait time. She didn't seem to care about us coming or going so we ended up leaving. Aside from the terrible customer service I once got this the best place to go if you're looking for a rooftop experience.

49.description: My first time in Chicago was on April 11 on a business trip and I had the opportunity to spend the weekend hanging out, partying and trying new restaurants. Out of every place I went this by far was the best!!. I had their burger and it was extremely good with grade a meat. My buddy got their fish tacos and the sauce they use is delicious. The women who helped us were very kind and the bartender was killing it with the drinks we had.  From simple wiskey and coke,makers please! To long islands.  They did a great job. The view was beautiful. I don't know when I can have opp to go back to Chicago but this is the first place I'm going. Special thanks to a manager there by the name of Debby I beleive. She helped faxing me a receipt so my company can pay for the "company expense".  Haha.  Great place!!

40.description: I've been here on 3 occasions both being with groups of 8 so read this but understand big groups anywhere can be a problematic.  The most recent venture being yesterday. The food is bar food that keeps up with the trends. If you've never tried Mac and cheese bites, I suggest you try theirs because I loved them. The rooftop is beautiful but awful for groups the size of ours. We came in a had to cramp around two round tables. And there was barely any table space left. If you have to do a group check with the restaurant weeks ahead and only if it's a special occasion but if it's an intimate party of two, I'm sure you will have a great time. On all of the occasions the waiter came by multiple times and was very friendly. The downstairs is pretty lovely too with giant windows that open. So there are multiple pros and cons to eating here.

53.description: I went here for happy hour, we were able to sit on the roof. We went in the winter time, they have the roof closed off and heated. It's actually heated very well. They have 1/2 price apps during the week after a certain time, I think it's after 3 or 4. The salsa was a bit spicy and the guacamole was good. I also tried the Mac & cheese bites, those were ok, I expected more spice from those. They don't have a large variety of beer, but they offered a couple craft beers so I was happy.

30.description: I went to the rooftop bar and grill for lunch. My first impression was that the space needs some upgrading. The decor was outdated and the tables are all very close together. There were misters on when we first arrived which was nice and helped to cool us off however, they turned off suddenly after about 10 minutes and remained off the rest of our time there. Great location for a bar and grill but the rooftop isn't exactly a rooftop. It's more of an opening that overlooks another wet and dirty rooftop and the Harold Washington Library.The menu is pretty typical for a bar and grill. Everyone in our party ordered burgers. I opted for a classic cheeseburger and noticed right away how overly seasoned and salty the burger was. My friends had different toppings on theirs and they too, thought the burgers were just okay. Drinks and food are averaged price but also, average quality.

46.description: Great service and great food!!!  first time here and won't be the last!! I would highly recommend for lunch. The service was quick and great customer service

1.description: A few of my friends and I tried to go to this restaurant but we weren't successful. We called ahead about an hour beforehand on a Saturday night and were told there wouldn't be a problem getting a table. We were attracted to the rooftop views they advertised and reasonable prices. When we actually got to the location (mind you, more than 2 hours before closing and less than an hour after calling), the doors were locked. When other diners were exiting, they let us in. We were greeted by an employee telling us they closed early due to slow service on a Saturday night. Although we were never able to try this restaurant, the lack of clarity while trying to attempt do so was off putting.

55.description: This is a great place to come in the summer when you can take advantage of the rooftop bar and the nice weather. It's a great view over the Library and it's kind of a hidden gem since Plymouth Court is tucked away in the loop. There are drink specials that make drinking very affordable. Service is quick and attentive. Come on a weekday right after work to avoid having to wait and you shouldn't have trouble getting a table!

9.description: We had top notch service with a nice view on the rooftop. I really like the ambiance of the bar on the rooftop. It's nice. We only ordered drinks and a appetizer platter. So my review is mainly on the great service , good drinks and the view. I like this place.

26.description: Only had drinks! So I can not rate on food. But I had the Ultimate Margarita and it was AWESOME! My boyfriend likes Irish Mules (a Moscow mile but with whiskey instead of vodka) and though it wasn't in a copper cup he said that it was awesome too. Our server was very nice and personable. Didn't have a name tag so I can't give her a shout out but she had really short dark hair and glasses. We did look at the menu, and everything but three items was $9.99 or under (one was a salad for $10.99, one was wings if you got more than 10, and the slider put options) Anyways, as a quick pit stop for some good drinks, totally worth it.

25.description: Such a good location! If they improved the food, their popularity would skyrocket. Three stars is generous, honestly, because in addition to being sub-par, the food took 45 minutes to arrive. I have fond memories of coming here years ago with my dad and ordering sliders and mozzarella sticks, but either the fare has worsened greatly or my tastes have matured a lot:))) I got a cheeseburger with avocado and sweet potato fries. They gave me waffle fries and swiss instead of sweet potato and pepper jack, and the burger was huge, misshapen, and dry. Good things: it was on a pretzel bun? Which I didn't order but enjoyed? I still have high hopes for this place, so I hope they make the needed changes!

12.description: A bunch of friends and I came here for a happy hour right after work and we had a very enjoyable time.Décor: We went right up to the roof, which is a solid spot. The entire thing is covered so, rain or shine, you can enjoy not matter the weather but the sides/windows are open-air so you don't feel like you're trapped inside. There are a bunch of tables and also a decent amount of room to stand (if you so choose). We had a table in the corner, which was nice as it kept us out of a traffic area. Everything there is relatively clean as well... well, except for a VERY LARGE spider that decided to try and spin a web right above our heads... luckily we took him out without issue.Staff: Our waiter was just ok... He was rather attentive although there were a few mishaps. He wasn't the most speedy and, even delivering drinks, didn't have the most steady of a hand (he ended up spilling a beer down my leg). But, no major harm. And he did give us a round of free shots for taking care of, and not completely freaking out about, the spider.Drinks/Food: We were there for happy hour so we only had drinks. But they were tasty and served nice and cold. After everyone else left, I stayed to give their wings a try. I went with 20 of them, half Buffalo and half "friggin' hot!" I must say that I really enjoyed the buffalo but did not feel the same about the "FH" flavor. The buffalo was classic with a  little bit of heat. The FH was not as flavorful and really not that much hotter than the buffalo. Rather disappointing. However, the wings themselves were very good and are rather good-sized.Value: The drinks prices, for happy hour, are a solid deal and the food is not outrageously priced.I really liked this rooftop and cannot wait to return in the future!

59.description: I can't say enough good things about Plymouth--the food is excellent, the service is fast, and the drink specials are phenomenal.First, the food. All of the appetizers are excellent--but I highly recommend the appetizer platter. Whenever I go with a friend we share this, and for a mere $7/person you get loads of spinach dip, yummy southwest egg rolls, mozzarella sticks, and fried mac n cheese (which is fantastic!). Beyond all this, the waffle fries are excellent. Also, on Fridays they have a $3 fish taco special where you get a huge serving of delicious fish tacos for only $3!! Can't be beat!Next, the drinks. Plymouth has a $5 martini special every night of the week! I especially love the pomegranate martinis on Fridays! The martinis are delicious and everyone I've taken here has been impressed by them. Your best bet is to get the fish taco special & the martini special. Get a few drinks and dinner at a fabulous rooftop bar for less than $15!!If you're in the Loop area and haven't tried Plymouth, it's a must. Great food, drinks, and a beautiful view from the rooftop (even in the winter when they make sure to keep the rooftop heated to a nice cozy temperature!!)

21.description: Went at lunch time, waited 45 minutes for my food !!! And when my salad finally came, the chicken was not done properly !! Never going back

17.description: Four of us arrived at 5:30pm on a Thursday. A sign said the roof was open...we went up in the elevator and were told it was closed for reservations. We went back down and luckily got the last table inside.After 10 minutes we finally got to order drinks and apps. The food came before the drinks.10 mins later we were asked to give up our table for another reservation, so we moved.Once our food finally arrived, my order was wrong (the toppings on my burger were incorrect). It took another 15 minutes before my old burger was taken away and a new one was made correctly. To their credit, both our server, another server, and the manager apologized profusely and comped my food, which I appreciated.We finally got our bill, which our waitress had split incorrectly. We fixed it, but in the end she still charged our friend for an extra beer he never ordered. At this point we were late for an event and just paid and left.Overall, well meaning staff and management, but horrible organization and understaffing. Also, the food was not poorly cooked, but the ingredients were mostly frozen product that had either been fried, grilled, or reheated.I would come back for a beer on the roof, but that's about it.

10.description: I went to school at DePaul and would always see the Plymouth rooftop, so finally I got the chance to try it when my friend and I grabbed drinks after work in the loop.  Although we ordered only 2 bloody mary's, they were pretty good so I would definitely like to come back here to try their food sometime.  Their covered rooftop is pretty sweet.  You get an awesome view of the south chicago loop and Harold Washington Library.  Their rooftop is definitely one of their biggest assets and I think it is the ideal place to go for an after work happy hour with coworkers.

5.description: Rooftop not that big a deal in the end. Mostly because the view from the rooftop isn't that exciting.  Much better than sitting on a sidewalk next to the street though. Buffalo wings had good flavor but I wish they had been a little meatier. Perhaps they were overcooked as there were some tough spots.  Didn't stop us from getting a second order. Combo plater was nice. Southwest egg rolls and sauce were delicious, cheese sticks cooked right with plenty of rich marinara for dipping. Service was great. Didn't have to wait long for more drinks or more food.

3.description: The manager Donna needs to be fired.  Under any circumstances don't book your next event here - ESPECIALLY if you are affiliated with JMLS, Depaul or the CBA (I am a JMLS alum and CBA member).Booked a Democratic Debate watching party for my bar association (re:lawyers) with Donna for 12/19, two weeks in advance.  Was told there were two tvs and would be a great spot for the event, $50 deposit, refundable or applicable to the tab.  Event was booked for 20-30 people.12/19 rolls around, The bar maybe has 10-15 patrons in it.  Am told by the manager on duty she has no idea I reserved the space for a debate watching party and tells me she can't reserve the tvs or turn off taylor swift pandora because it might upset the other patrons.Unbelievable.  No word from the owner or the other manager.  We offer to buy drinks for whoever is uncomfortable with turning off taylor swift pandora for 2 hours but are told we have to leave.  Party of about 20 people at 7pm we headed over to Pazzo's next door for MUCH better service.Its January 5th, I've contacted Donna four times in writing about the deposit refund and haven't received a response.

35.description: The hostess was hostile and stupid. The waitress opened with the words "what do you want?" Mmm. Not to spend money here.

19.description: Went here for happy hour on a Friday night with 4 of my co-workers. Sadly the rooftop was full so we were seated in the dungeon bar on the main floor. I wish I could remember our server's name as he was excellent. He kept the drinks coming, and with $5 martinis, the drinks were flowing. We all sampled different martinis and each of us found them tasty. We also ordered a few appetizers and I have no complaints there. The specials are the main reason why I come here. Not many places in the loop offer drink or food specials (half price selected appetizers) which makes this place a winner.

28.description: Excellent food and service! Our server, Baraha, was absolutely fabulous!!!! She really interacts with her customers and made our dinner a pleasure. She may be one of my favorite servers of all time! The only reason I don't give this restaurant 5 stars is because of the manager (I believer her name was Cindy). She was wonderful with the customers but, unfortunately, thought nothing of speaking very harshly to the staff in full view of everyone. As a manager, I understand the desire for perfect performance, but there is a right and a wrong way to do that and she clearly doesn't understand. Criticism needs to be given constructively and in private, neither of which happened when we were dining. We probably would have stayed longer if it was not for her (we had a group of 18, so that is unfortunate). She was the only downside to our Plymouth experience. Correct her performance and this is a 5 star experience without a doubt!

45.description: We randomly popped into here on Sat for a break from the CAF scavenger hunt.  We were excited that the rooftop was open!We only had one drink each but that drink was awesome.  3 of us had a Kentucky Mule which was perfection.  My other friend wanted to try the Plymouth margarita which was refreshing.  The people working there are super friendly and great!!The only drawback is that because it was chilly out, they had the heaters on high.  I was the only one at the table that was feeling it.  It was melting my face off.  But...I'd rather be too warm on a chilly day than freezing.I can't wait to come back and stay awhile.

33.description: I really wish i could've liked this place more since its very close to where i live and the week day drink specials are great but the over all service is just sad. Ive gone twice. The first time our waiter seemed incredibly glittery like he couldn't pay attention to what our orders were he had to keep coming back to ask what we got and we had to remind him more than once. So we went back a second time trying to give it another chance and it was worse. Shot glasses had lipstick on it and hair in the fries. The manager seemed more interested in just giving us something then listening to our very real health concerns, even though i kept adding I didn't want anything i just wanted the problems addressed. I haven't returned since nor do i plan to.

43.description: Great view on the rooftop bar. Mediocre service that's a bit slow and seems stretched. The view and location is worth putting up with it generally so it gets crowded during happy hour time. Call in advance to reserve a table even on days when you would expect it to be slow otherwise.

2.description: So this looks and sounds like a fun place... invited to an event here and was looking forward to it... I like bright lights and rooftop views cuz that's how I roll yo.Anywho... friend amd I arrived about 7pm to meet the group for a Democratic Debate Watch party.... so while waiting for the elevator, 8-9 familiar and disgruntled faces streamed out, telling us the party was moving to a place by DePaul.Bummer... but as the story goes... seems like this place is shady and run by a bunch of disorganized and untrustworthy people that apparently supplement their non-existent tips by keeping deposits for services unrendered.The group swelled to 35-40 and fit perfectly in the Italian place down the street... and the event was solid, despite the Rooftop Management's BS and lack of accountability.

18.description: 3.5 StarsThe first warm summer days in Chicago are always the best! My friends and I were trying to think of a place where we could get pretty decent food, sit outside, and could accommodate 6 ppl at the last minute. We headed on over here and received everything we wanted :) The place was packed! We were able to score a table for 2 though to at least place our belongings at. The guys stuck to jack and coke/vodka sprite, while the ladies experimented with the cocktails :) Me being a lover of sweet drinks I went with the patron base Mexican cocktail and it was delicious! Sort of reminded me of a milkshake. I would also recommend the pear cocktail...very refreshing. We shared the appetizer platter:Egg rolls - mehMozzarella sticks - goodMac and cheese bites - good Spinach Dip - excellent Not the best scenery,  but reasonably priced and a great place to mingle with friends on a warm summer night.

41.description: I wanted to go here and like this place and look like the cool friend who suggested such a great bar. Sadly, I just looked like an idiot and probably am banned from making reservations for me and my friends from now on. After a professional networking event, three friends and I walked down the street to Plymouth hoping to catch up on work and life over drinks and food. When we got there, the bottom floor was closed and only the rooftop area was open. That's fine. So we go upstairs and the place is a madhouse. The hostess looked annoyed that we had a reservation. When we sat down, no one came to help us for 10 minutes, so we flagged someone down to get menus. Then after 20 min had gone by we got our drink order in. Took another 10 min to get our beers. And the whole time the manager was chatting with a table of older folks right next to us! We knew we would starve to death before we could get an order in. So, as soon as we saw the waiter, we asked for the check and I immediately handed him my credit card to expedite the process. Another ten minutes and we finally got to leave. Never have I wanted to get out of an establishment so badly!Although this seems to be an after work favorite for some, it just didn't cut it for me. I'll continue to go elsewhere.

52.description: Worried it would be full of pretentious lawyers, I was nervous to try. To my surprise, the rooftop was full of regular people! Food was great, drinks were better and the service was legit. There was a very pushy server (he wasn't even our server) who almost seemed like he didn't trust our server to do her job. Tried to take my half full glass of wine twice and our condiment caddy once before our food had even been served. Back off, bro...our assigned server was great. We ordered nachos and was surprised by the presentation. Do not order for a meal, but it was perfect had a sharing appetizer. Burgers were next, the wicker basket is long and took up most of our small bistro table. Delicious, though (the burgers not the basket). I would suggest, getting at least Guinness on draft, no other dark microbrew was available.

50.description: Went here for happy hour on a Friday night with 4 of my co-workers. Sadly the rooftop was full so we were seated in the dungeon bar on the main floor. I wish I could remember our server's name as he was excellent. He kept the drinks coming, and with $5 martinis, the drinks were flowing. We all sampled different martinis and each of us found them tasty. We also ordered a few appetizers and I have no complaints there. The specials are the main reason why I come here. Not many places in the loop offer drink or food specials (half price selected appetizers) which makes this place a winner.

4.description: In a summer Time in place like this You feel special , when weather is warm and sunny , around You have best friend, helping stuff , delicious food .... no complein from 6 person in table ! Evryone was happy full and just little bit tipsy   Big menu gives You  alot of choice . I recomend this location evryone moustly for summer Time with fresh air in patio, view from patio can by little bit better only buildings a cross the street but still nice location ;) for all salad lovers try my choice , you will by feel like you eat hole pig

6.description: Plymouth has a fun rooftop and it's probably a great place to meet a friend for a 'cold' drink.The food is another matter.  You'll find incorrectly cooked burgers with the wrong cheese.  Their "friggin'-hot" baked wings actually rate about a 5 out of 10 on the normal heat scale.  The combo appetizer platter was actually ok.The drinks are a little pricey on a Sunday night, about average for the touristy section of downtown.  The beer was served at approximately 50 degrees and got warmer quick in the night-time Spring breeze,Very nice servers apologized profusely and sincerely - it's almost as if they've had a lot of practice.  Actually, they were very nice, but overwhelmed and understaffed.  After I refused their offer to comp the burger, the waitress comped my Moscow Mule nightcap - that's nice, really.Fix this place.  I really want to like it.

22.description: I gave this place three stars because the outside deck is tucked away and well, it's outside, but otherwise, it's not the best place to go. The margaritas are way too sweet, and I don't think they put much tequila in them. The buffalo wings weren't bad and had a decent amount of meat on them. The service? The servers and hostess seemed pretty stressed out, which is understandable -- the place was packed. But still, if you're there to have a good time and are being good customers, why should you have to feel that?

15.description: I've been here now for both drinks and lunch, for drinking it's not a bad spot, it's a cool rooftop, not super high, but at least you're not waiting a long time in line, not too pricy, standard beer list, as for food, i got the mini sliders once which were fine, and then the chicken chipotle wrap, which was really good and filling, my friend got a wrap and that also looked good, lunch menu is about the same as the bar price wise, its a good deal for the area

57.description: Food was great, service was fast and friendly. Overall decent spot for drinks and bar food. Unfortunately, it's hard to find parking in the area and the nearest parking lot is about 2 blocks away.

20.description: Pretty cool rooftop lounge and restaurant. Nothing fancy. A bit miffed that our $9 martinis were served in tumblers. Entrees were fairly priced and a step above normal bar fare. Average service.

36.description: Came here with Michelle Y looking for a rooftop near the Harrison stop on the red line and found this charming place to have some food & drinks and watch part of the Blackhawks game.  They call it a "rooftop" but there is a roof... the side is just open.  There wasn't much of a view as it overlooks a sidewalk and you're not really up that far.  But all in all, it wasn't too bad.  It's a small place upstairs so keep that in mind if you want to come visit during peak hours.For the Blackhawks game it was completely packed, and it was pretty entertaining because there were a couple attractive guys sitting at the bar that I wanted to talk to and unfortunately two other girls ruined that for us.  :(  It brought some entertainment to our night at least to watch these girls crash and burn with the guys who didn't want to talk to them, they just wanted to watch the game.  The food was decent, I had a burger and fries and it was pretty good.  I didn't like the Moscow Mule though, mine was watery and it just didn't taste right.  I think I'd stick with beer at a place like this.

14.description: It was as meh as can be. Nothing stood out, nothing bad, nothing good.The spicy wings I'd give 3.5 stars for, but the burgers were absolutely tasteless. Other than that, the menu is the usual insipid offering of "crowd pleaser" foods. Like a sports bar, expect chewy and tasteless burger patties. The sprinkler system was very aggressive, pumping out enough water to soak the nearby seats. The tables are jam packed together with merely 2 feet in between, with waiters and guests darting between each other like bumper cars. It's risky business standing in certain spots.

12.description: Years ago I had a couple of colonic procedures done and was not pleased at all.  So I was a little skeptical about going and having it done again only to be disappointed.  I did some research on the best places to go and decided to come here because of all the positive reviews.  I booked my appointment online which is extremely convenient by the way.  I was extremely tensed by the time I got to my appointment.  My colonic was with Edita and she put my mind at ease right away.  She was extremely knowledgeable and nice. The clinic was clean and had an relaxing spa atmosphere. I am very satisfied with the service and glad the to be free of all these toxins.  I strongly encourage anyone who's ready to be healthy and toxic free to visit CIC.  You won't be disappointed

3.description: Just wonderful! Not only do I feel like I walk on clouds after the actual treatment, but the energy of this place is calming and positive too! Both Kimberly and Edita are professional, caring, polite, and friendly.I even brought my mom here when we found out she had skin cancer (she has subsequintly changed her whole approach to nutrition and taking care of herself).I have been here when they were on Michigan Ave, and now on Erie - nothing has changed; still as good as always. The staff doesn't seem to have changed either. Most impressive thing is Edita even remembered my mom after 18+ months!Thank you for a great all-round experience.

1.description: This is a beautiful, peaceful environment for cleansing, which can be embarrassing or uncomfortable.  The staff is outstanding and they put you at ease, and listen to any concerns or requests.  Do not hesitate to book an appointment here!!  You will be happy!

2.description: The staff at Chicago colonics Kimberly & Edita are very kind and patient . Their primary focus is always to make you feel comfortable and ultimately better  . I would highly recommend this location to anyone searching for a colonics center .

9.description: I had a colonic once before many years ago with a family friend who could do the procedure. She was somewhat aggressive, which is not so great when she's controlling a tube going up my butt. But she didn't scare me so much that I didn't see the value on colonics. After reading reviews of all the colonic treatment centers in the city of Chicago or close by, I chose this one. I was received by Kimberley. At first I was very nervous because Kimberley was very "in my face" and excited about meeting me and bringing me into the room. I'm not sure it was her personality or just my own nervousness about sharing this personal experience with her, who i didn't know at all. Once I got myself set up, invited her back in to help with the process, and we began the flow of water into my rectum, I just decided to relax and let it be. Then I felt more comfortable with her, and maybe she relaxed too, seeing I had relaxed. She was very sensitive to how personal and intimate the experience was for me, verbally and in body language. She was supportive and also knew when to leave the room and give me my space. I had waves of nausea coming and going, and once I got the hang of the occasional intensity, I could look over at the tube to my side with all the stuff coming out of my body from the flush. I felt I was actually learning spiritual lessons of sticking through something scary with myself. As the most intense waves of nausea rushed at me, I worked to keep my heart open and be present, rather than squirm and try to resist the unpleasant feelings. And every time I released the water - what a relief! At the end of the treatment I paid (a very fair price by the way) and took the probiotics they offer freely after the treatment. Walking to the train to ride home (it was evening), I immediately noticed my groundedness and centeredness and sense of peace within. i genuinely felt different, with all these toxins having been removed. I felt AMAZING!! This was last night. I am still feeling quite cleansed. Also, i think I released a lot my first time (bile and solids and who knows what else) because I am currently on a week long liver/gallbladder cleansing diet which basically consists of simple, unprocessed foods, without fried food, excess sugar, or animal products. So that probably helps with productivity. Even though I feel like I got a LOT out, I do think there's more lurking in there. I am planning on making another appointment for this coming week or the next week. What a wonderful experience! I can't recommend colonics in general, and CIC in particular, enough! May you release all your toxins, too!

10.description: The place is clean and the technician was fantastic.  Made everything so easy and painless.  It felt like a spa.  I would highly recommend.

4.description: Can't say enough great things about the staff, the overall process, and the surprising ease of the entire process.  The staff make what might seem like a scary process extremely laid back and relaxing.  If you go, I promise you will like it and feel like a new person when you leave!

6.description: I could not say enough nice and wonderful things about this place! I've been coming here for almost a year now and could not imagine trying anywhere else again! The office is small and simple but really how extravagant does it need to be? You can purchase packages or do individual sessions. Edita is the woman I work with and she is a doll! So sweet and great to talk to. She's very helpful with healthy eating tips and habits, juicing and other organic things to help with digestion etc. so if you have any questions don't hesitate to ask! She's very gentle and makes you feel welcomed and not awkward at all. Last time I was there I was so cold (had to walk there form my place in the cold Chicago winter) and she gave me a blanket to wrap my legs in during the session to keep me warm. LOVE IT

15.description: I have nothing but good things to say about CIC. I decided to get my first colonic because I just wasn't feel great. Kimberly made this personal experience/process more comfortable than I could have hoped for. She was knowledgeable, kind, patient, and she actually cared about the way I felt. I would recommend CIC to anyone who is feeling bloated, heavy, or to someone who simply wants to reap the benefits of cleansing their system. To put it simply, I couldn't have picked a better place!!!!

0.description: Great, Friendly Service and TreatmentI visited Chicago Internal Cleansing plenty of times and each time was a smooth and easy process with great and friendly service. I plan to continue going. The ladies are very welcoming and attentive

5.description: My first colonic was a success! My Hydrotherapist was Edita and she was very professional and helped make me feel comfortable throughout the whole process. My cleanse was yesterday and today I took a look at my stomach and noticed I no longer have that small puff (bloated look). I do not feel bloated either. This experience has motivated me to live a healthier life. I can't wait to go back Saturday for my second cleanse. Edita stated the first cleanse normally doesn't release a lot of toxins, it isn't until your second cleanse where you start to see some real release. But for my first session I released a lot of toxins and she said I did very well for my first time.A little about the details, I did a closed system, which basically means the hydrotherapist is in the room with you the entire time. Open system you perform the colonic yourself. Edita talked to me the whole time and she also massaged my stomach to help the flow of water through my colon.There is slight discomfort because you have the feeling of wanting to poo when she fills your colon with water, but this is a good thing because the warm water is flowing through your colon and breaking up all those years of toxins building up in the pockets of your colon. You get to see the stuff come out of you in that machine on the wall. It's kind of gross but it's a lesson to learn what stuff we hold in our bodies and possibly could motivate you to eat healthier foods.After 30 mins I couldn't take it anymore and needed to go to the toilet and handle business if you know what I mean. Edita removed the speculum from my rectum and left the room for me to use the toilet that is in the room. I know this is gross but for those who want to know I am letting you know, when you get on that toilet you are letting out whatever water that was left in your colon including the other crap your colon has. After you are done releasing, you put your undies and pants back on and go speak with the hydrotherapist. She gave me a probiotic and also suggested I eat light for the rest of the day. Something like soup or a light salad. Since my colon has been cleaned I want to NOT eat any rich or heavy foods.I would highly recommend this facility for a comfortable experience and a great feeling afterwards :-)

13.description: Kimberly at Chicago Internal Cleansing was fantastic!! For my first session, I signed up for the "assisted cleanse" and Kimberly was with me from the second I walked into the clinic to the minute I left. She completely calmed my nerves (I was pretty terrified about doing this), and made me feel totally comfortable. After my first session, I spent about 30 minutes on the toilet- I released more waste than I could of ever imagined I would! I went back for my second session yesterday and did the Libbe system. It's a machine that you lay down on and it's less assisted- you basically do everything on your own, but Kimberly explained how to work the machine and came in to check on me throughout the treatment to make sure I was A-Okay. Also, there is a doorbell on the machine that you can ring if anything is wrong and she will come right in and help you. It's definitely a process- I am doing 5 sessions to break up all the gunk in my system that has accumulated over the last 27 years, but I'm happy to report that I can already see a huge difference after only 2 sessions. Another plus- they only use disposable tubes and products and the office is impeccably clean! I highly recommend Chicago Internal Cleansing!!!

11.description: internal cleansing: rinse, repeat, and scary stuff is all down the tubes OK folks! Here goes! Or in this case, "there it goes"... Going to a new colonics place is always, for me, a bit worrisome. Usually the procedure is only mildly uncomfortable during the initial... ...ummmm.... ...shall I just say the "beginning", although I once had one that reminded me to avoid prison at all costs. Not here! Chicago Internal Cleansing, or "C.I.C." is one of the finer medical spas in the city. It is not thankfully, a new-agey place where you hold crystals and chant, and listen to plinky-plinky music while your butt is hosed out. Thankfully there is no "hard sell" of various products or other services. (That's for you, Ruby Room!)Located on the fourth floor of the north end of the Carbide Building that also houses the Hard Rock Hotel    (insert irony here)    the offices are soothing and most importantly, immaculate. CIC offers both the closed and the open system of internal cleansing, along with an oxygen sauna thingy that I am not too familiar with. Frankly, I have not had a colonic using the "open system" because it sounded too scary, but after seeing the actual device and hearing the explanation of how it works, I'd give it a try next time. So, yeah, I try to do this whenever I am in town. Ideally, a series of them. Conveniently, CIC offers a package where you get a discount. Five for $360. Money well spent, and after four I still have one in the well. The equipment is state of the art, and anything that you come in contact with is disposable and "single use" only. Both ladies that work there, Edita and Kimberly, are professional, GENTLE, and both literally radiate good heath. I've seen this healthy glow before in other colon hydrotherapists. You don't need to convince me that removing the toxins that build up in your ass has a lot to do with that look. It may have something to do with your liver super-purifying itself once your colon is completely empty, as opposed to a slower release of the nasties your liver is supposed to get rid off. (I suppose its like flushing your radiator or something.) Disclaimer; The following part of this review may not be suitable for younger audiences. Still here?-OK.!Colonic #1 with Edita. Punctual. The "delicate" part of the procedure was fast and painless. The results were good, but I knew that we were only scratching the surface. Colonic #2 with Edita. Three days later. I know for a fact that I did NOT eat that much in the last few days. Where is this shit coming from? Colonic #3 with Edita. An obvious change in what floats through the glass tube. During the fill and massage, I actually felt something inside me spasm (not painfully, just surprisingly) and the result was pretty impressive. But in my heart, or in my colon perhaps, I knew that there was something else lurking in there. And whatever it was, perhaps the gum I swallowed in grade school, or my sister's Barbie doll's head from 40 years ago, was becoming aware of it's inevitable fate. But it was stubborn. It was evil. The demon refused to leave. Colonic #4 with Kimberly. If there is such a thing as the "break through colonic", this was it. I almost wanted to shout "THE POWER OF CHRIST COMPELS YOU!!!!" as what appeared to be a combination as asphalt and old bicycle tires blasted out of my system.Kim told me that this had been in there for a very, very long time.I have no idea what that was, but I am sure glad it is GONE! Chicago Internal Cleansing. Where the filler is all killer! Carry on.

8.description: Colon cleansing is Great for you and this is a great place to do it. The staff is accommodating and kind, easy to schedule (online) and is informative and intelligent about what they are doing. I have tried a few colonic places but this is my go to.

14.description: I've been getting colonics for years to help deal with IBS, so when I came here, I was not new to the procedure. That said, my first time here was during a pretty painful attack. I could barely walk and was in a great deal of pain. Called the number and was given an appointment for that same day. The whole experience was, well.... more intense than usual. But Kimberly was great through the whole thing. She seems very patient and kind, which is key for something so intimate. That was a month ago. I wish I could say that one session and I was cured, but that's not the way my condition works. I felt great afterward, but eventually, the symptoms reappear. My latest session was with Kimberly again, yesterday. She was still very nice and knowledgeable. She also remembered our last session, which is great, cause I don't feel like just another number. All in all, this place is not as upscale as some others in the city. But it is clean and quiet and feels very cozy. They do not offer a great many services, just hydrotheapy and oxygen sauna (which I mean to try). They also do not try to up sell a bunch of supplements or services that you don't need. The price is comparable to others in the city and parking is just $8 with validation. I would say that this place is worth checking out. I will definitely be back.

7.description: The staff was nice, the 'job' was done + they give you a probiotic pill at the end. Yay. It all went downhill when I told the hydrotherapist that I had previously received a colonic...I DID ALL THE WORK! She even expected me to operate the LIBBE ( LIBBE info: innerhealthandbeauty.net…)And here comes the part where I wish I made up a fake name on Yelp: I almost had an *ahem* accident on Michigan Avenue! Thank God I didn't and for a Starbucks on every corner with key-less entry bathrooms!I believe 'it' happened because the therapist didn't take ownership of the session. My appointment lasted about thirty minutes longer because I was expected to know when AND how to turn the machine off, so I irrigated a bit longer than usual. Since my appointment was near closing time, I was rushed out. Not only was that not cool, it wasn't responsible.Morals of the story: Don't put your colon in the hands of people who are not properly trained. Do your homework and ask questions. I'm walking away knowing that some things need a personal recommendation and not a Yelp review.

12.description: This Dock's location is literally the last of a dying breed.  I believe it's the last location standing.  The Fishwich is a classic, as are the Dock-berry shakes.  One of the few places that has a Nehi fountain machine.  I'm only vouching for the fish & shakes.  The wings, shrimp & fries are sub par.

3.description: I've always been a customer of Dock's for years and I used to walk to the one around the corner from my house, but they've since closed and the same for the location on 87th before you get to Stony Island and 95th and Vincennes. I used to get their box of fish with an Omar on the Nile(for those of you who arent south side natives it's a locally produced juice drink). Their fish is absolutely delicious, but like some posters have stated the attitude of the cashier is sub par. I've seen better customer service skills at other places. I am however giving it four stars for the best fish around, but I give no stars for bad customer service. Again I don't get how African-Americans have such shitty customer service skills they don't know how to talk to customers without having some kind of nasty attitude. The owners of Docks needs to consider moving into a bigger space because it's too small when they have a pretty good crowd going on specific days like Friday and Saturday nights when most people are eating out and don't want to cook. I am going to consider calling my orders in because with the summer being here it can get pretty warm inside when you're waiting for your order to come up. This is one of two places I love to get fish from because it tastes good and is cooked up fresh and not just sitting under a heating lamp where the best flavor leaves the food. Docks has been a staple in the South Side for more than 40 years and is a local owned franchise.

1.description: Back in the day, Dock's was king. There were multiple restaurants all featuring fresh fish fried with its own inimitable, consistent, batter. Fast forward to today ... One Dock's, batter has changed and fish not so fresh - just fried. I had a hankering for fried perch a couple of evenings ago. I was in the vicinity of Dock's and thought they would for sure satisfy my itch. After waiting for nearly 30 minutes, I got my spicy-smelling order of five perch fillets, eager to arrive home. What a disaster. The texture of the fish was nearly pasty with the batter being the only thing holding the fish's form. In fact, I questioned whether it was even fish. It was sort of grayish in color. After inspecting several fillets, I could not find one flake of fish. It was really disgusting. Because I am so rarely in that part of town, I just chalked it up to an experience I will not repeat again. I guess the long lines are for the legendary Fishwich but no one seemed able to tell me what the "Fish" is.Docks' primary clientele is not likely to write or read a Yelp review. However, here's hoping that some folks will see this and Be Informed.

2.description: Went here on our way out of chicago because it had high ratings. We found this place but it was a pretty busy area. People were holding up honk for jesus signs and it was pretty loud and annoying. The restuarant itself was pretty cramped and tiny. It didnt look very clean as well. There were a bunch of people waiting for their food. I would not recommend eating in this restaurant but take your food to some other place.Their fishwich was really good with plenty of fish. Might be better too add some other stuff to your which. I would have given it 4-5 stars IF the place was decent enough to eat in.

9.description: Went to Dock's for the first time, even though I had heard about it while growing up in the Chicagoland area. Ordered the famous Fishwich Wednesday Special for just $3.88 plus tax and I must say it was tastefully flavorful! The wheat bun was soft and fresh and the fish was hot and full of crunch! Tomatoes and leafy lettuce with tarter sauce...and I didn't forget to add the extra tarter sauce and hot sauce to kick it up a notch...Just Perfect! Didn't take long to receive a freshly cooked Fishwich and service was good too! Also, I had order a captain's platter. It was described as being a pan full of food but the picture on the wall didn't make it look like a pan...especially since it was for only $8.89. But to my GREAT surprise it was REALLY a PAN of FOOD (Wings, Shrimps, and Ton of Catfish Nuggets with a pile of Fries)...ALL hot and crispy! So much food, I was forced to share with a co-worker and still had leftovers to take home...WoW! I advise you to try and get their before the lunch rush starts at 11:15am or you will be in a pretty long line in a pretty small waiting area.

10.description: Amazing food!!! The seasoning in the fried shrimp is delicious!! I love the fishwish and the catfish sandwich!!! Perch is also tasty! I'm a foodie, and this is a hot spot to satisfy your need for sea lol just be prepared to wait!

4.description: That's place IS NOT NOT NOT, life original Docks. The chicken was I'm seasoned the fish was not the same the bread was hard it's just a big ghetto mess will never be returning

6.description: I really don't see how this place even exist. It is literally like a hole in the wall people are always standing outside because it is so small. When you walk in the counter person taking the orders cashier they seem to be overworked over stress over the top over and under over and out. I think on Wednesday they have a special and that's what it's hell up in Harlem people everywhere mainly standing outside because the place is just too damn small. The food is definitely not all of that I might go on Wednesdays for the special which I think is a chicken sandwich and it's a very appetizing order once you get it I guess they figured the discounted day good luck. I wonder if the people that run these businesses and/or owners/operators of these businesses read these Yelp reviews. I think if they did they would step up their game or they just don't give a you know what and that's how it seems to be especially in the hood. So if you're willing to roll the dice and take a chance with just OK mediocre service and product as well you can dock your boat at dock or you can float your boat and take a chance and maybe you'll have a good experience it. It's not that I've had a bad experience but it's nothing that whatever while you and make you want to come back it seems like the personnel staff in these places someone doesn't know about human resources and being selective when you hire people for your business. Because those faces all the image and they paint an image to the customers in a very bad experience will definitely not put you in the limelight but more like in the hot seat so smile cashier urine customer service my god at least fake it to you can take it or faked it so you can take it I know it's hard dealing with the public and being on 87th street is not the Gold Coast either. People are always high maintenance of course no one's going to leave you a tip we all know black folks are the worst tippers anyway  so with that good luck

0.description: Can't find many of these places anymore, I think it's only 2 left in Chicago  (if that). This 1 is my go to!!!! Anytime I'm on the southside I hit them up for their infamous "FishWish" sandwich. I'm embarrassed to say, but Idk what kind of fish it is!!!! Ik it's 2 filet (I think white fish) fish on a wheat hotdog bun. Served with lettuce, tomato, & tarter sauce. I EAT MINE PLAIN W/HOTSAUCE!!!! I never have a problem here. Service is always on point from the cashiers and my food is always fresh & cooked to order. Weds they have a Fishwish special for like $3 and change so the place is PACKED!!!!!! I've had the shrimp and wings too, but it wasn't anything special and never ordered them again. FISHWISH ALL DAY!!!!PLEASE TAKE NOTE ITS EXTRA FISHY FUNKY SMELLING AND YOU WILL REAK OF THEIR SMELL. DON'T WAIT INSIDE!!!!!!!

5.description: You will never find such a great deal on such great food. For years my guy, who is a south side Chicago native, would always say how good the food was here, but for years I would always just never try it for no real reason. I love everything about Dock's. The price is unbeatable, the amount of food is overwhelming and most of all, it is worth the wait if there is a long line. Our 7 year old loves to get a fishwich now from there and we all go get our sandwiches with a strawberry pop, and that is a perfect day.

13.description: Fishwich great sandwich and shrimp tease worth the wait...

11.description: This place is in the same strip mall that has the best Harold's chicken in Chicago.  It is anchored by the Food 4 Less grocery store.  I have heard that it is the last Docks on the south side.Pros:  The food is really, really good.  Fresh enough, well seasoned, well prepared.  I love that the dinners come with a dinner roll instead of just a piece of white Wonder bread.  The perch is my favorite.Cons:  Extremely slow service.  Be prepared to wait.  You will wait at least 30 minutes to an hour and 30 minutes, depending on the day you go.  Thursday, Friday, and Saturday nights are the worse for waiting, of course.Tips:  Do not bother to call ahead, they will not drop your food until you get there.  Cash is king, but they do accept credit/debit.  The place is very small, and usually very crowed.  Be prepared to stand.  Be prepared to wait out side of the establishment, or standing in it's doorway.If you want a great friend fish meal, this is where you go.  It will be worth your wait.

8.description: If you're ever on the south side and craving a fish sandwich this is where you go. Period!  Now don't go unless you have like 30 minutes to an hour to kill.  Also don't go if you don't have patience for terrible staff with awful manners.  You gotta have a thick skin, but the benefits are well worth it.  Deep fried white fish on soft bread, tomato, lettuce, and light mayo....mmmmmmmmmmm...........

14.description: The only Dock's left in Chicago; the last of a mighty empire.  Dock's was to fish what Harrold's was to chicken back in the '90s.  Due to changes in ownership, the franchise has  been reduced to this final location.  Its still good and the Famous Fishwich is still a treat.  If you want an authentic taste of the South Side of Chicago, you can still get it at Dock's.  The place looks rough, but I ate there today and my meal was hot, fresh, and tasty.

7.description: Stunningly long wait 55minutes for a fish sandwich and order of shrimp!!! customers spilled out the door and onto the sidewalk. After I inquired the extremely rude cashier snapped you can get yo money back! So much for customer service. This place has always been a mess for many years. They wont have to worry about me again. There are many fish options in the vicinity.

3.description: First off it was empty at dinner time. This should have been my clue not to proceed. However I love soul food, comfort food, etc. So anyways I ordered the meatloaf with mashed potatoes & gravy and the other side Mac n cheese.The waitress was an elderly woman and due to her age I believe that's why she moved sooooo slow!  While I waited for my food, the waitress & a man resembling a Sunday Preacher began a conversation about racism? ANywho my food came I left and went to the CAR to inspect. Behold Grayish looking meat (as if reheated from a freezer)! The Mac n cheese was Kraft cheese mix (I'm almost positive)! The mashed potatoes were stiff with gel like gravy? Yuk! I chopped my $12 as a loss and lost that food in an alley dumpster where it belonged!  Never EVER AGAIN! SMH Shame on you Captain Hard Times!

1.description: I hate giving poor reviews but I must warn people about this soul food restaurant that has apparently fallen into "hard times!" Pun intended...I was so excited when my cousin invited me back home to the south side to eat at a restaurant that held wonderful memories in both my family traditions and formally fantastic soul food. Unfortunately, the food was a major disappointment and just barely edible. I admit soul food is not my favorite genre of cuisine, but having been raised in a traditional Black family I know good soul food when I taste it. This FOOD WAS UNACCEPTABLE , it's a good thing thIs diner isn't located in Los Angeles or New York because the rating would have been a resounding "F" with a mandated closure. Captain Hard Times Diner has not been remodeled or updated in anyway since my last visit around 2003. The heated serving dishes were probably some of the same ones used 12 years ago and most of the food was still cold. More specifically, the food was tasteless, the salad was nondescript and wilted, the stuffing was mushy, catfish was so hard and overlooked that it was unrecognizable as fish and most unforgivable the peach cobbler runny. I am truly surprised the health department has not yet closed their doors, so if by chance a health inspector is reading this PLEASE schedule a visit before someone gets hurt.  And yes, there were loved ones in our dining party who did get sick!

2.description: Soul food, with the usual options. I thought the food was pretty good, and it seemed like the employees genuinely cared if you enjoyed your food. I would stop here for soul food.

5.description: This is the spot for Sunday brunch if you  are looking to seriously do some things, eat large amounts of varied (we're talking multiple meats, pastas, sides, desserts, and sweet tea!) and tasty food, and spot some important folks.It's not cheap (around 30 bucks), so save it for a special occasion and be sure to take your blood pressure medication.  You'll need it.

6.description: Since my BFF lives in the area she knows all the places to get the best food and when she said Captain Hard Times for breakfast I thought she was joking because of the name. The place definitely takes you back in terms of decor. The food was OK but for some reason I would like to go back again. The service was cool nothing to write home about but I definitely will give them another go again!

7.description: I  would often go here on Sundays for the brunch which I always thought was satisfactory. Because I recently moved I had not been to this restaurant in a little over a year.  Well let me tell you that they do not have to worry about me patronizing this restaurant again.  Last week my mother and I went to this restaurant for dinner, ( but it was not for the Sunday brunch, )after ordering from the menu we were served corn muffins and rolls.  The corn muffins were very dry and crumbly as id they had been under a heat lamp for an extraordinary amount of time.  Both my son and I ordered teh baked chicken with dressing.  I also ordered a side of macaroni and cheese.  It took approximately twenty minutes for the entrees to arrive (I didn't mind waiting at all).  When the meals arrived The baked chicken was not very fresh and the gravy was cold, it was so cold that it was beginning to gel.  The mac and cheese was watery and had a sour taste.  The dressing was dry as was the chicken.  My complaint to the server brought no response.  I was not trying to get my meal compensated however the server offered no adjustment or any apology.  The only person that was sympathetic was the busboy.  He stated that he would speak to the cook.  Indeed this restaurant has fallen upon Hard Times (pun intended).  I will not  go back and anyone contemplating on goiong should seriously think twice.

8.description: I was truly impressed with this place.  The fried chicken wings were divine.  The beef short ribs were tender and the turkey and dressing reminds me of Thansgiving.  The waitresses are personable people that were very attentive to the needs of their customers.  It was a laid-back setting and with the exception of some noisy patrons, reminded me of a family dinner.  I will definitely go back and sample other great picks on the menu.  The shrimp bisque soup was very good and filling.  Nothing beats warm biscuits and rolls coming to your table while you wait..

9.description: I love their food. I usually get baked turkey with dressing, candied yams, and mac and cheese and it's delicious. It is also well priced and they are fast with take out. It's a great place to have a dinner party. My grandma loved the great service here when she would hold dinner parties here. I wish I could cook as well as they can. Maybe they'll give me lessons.

0.description: This place feels like it has been here forever and that usually means something about it is really good. I had breakfast and it was standard fare but there was something about it that makes you say, 'oh, yeah. I'll be back.' If you're into inspecting your utensils when you arrive, you might get a little upset and start wondering about the place. On the other hand, if you're hungry, you will feel like you're part of something. The food is good, the people are cool even if you look like you don't belong there.  It's as though you immediately become part of the club and you get it and you're glad. It's a weird intangible feel you get in a place like this and it's all good.

4.description: Went there with deacons and pastor from our church today for dinner. Ate at the buffet. Good food for the soul. Wait staff was excellent. Owner came out and spoke to us. Really nice.

0.description: The shoe selection is like what you see online. The place is not huge but it has enough space. What you see online you see in the store..and that rarely happens in shoe stores!

12.description: Very nice massage therapists. Not spa like but great massages. Far away from where I live, but if I lived in the neighborhood I would frequent it more often. My boyfriend loved one of the songs on the play list when we were there. The ladies were nice enough to e-mail him the song and info afterwards! Very polite, very easy going.

7.description: I have received many massages in many places, but none compare to what I've received at Infinite Touch with Kimm.  Hands down, this is the BEST place for "real" massages. Kimm is very professional and her massages are to die for!  I try not to let a month go by without getting a massage.  I can't rave enough!!!  Excellent!!

20.description: Infinite Touch of Chicago is the greatest massage therapy salon in Chicago bar-none! The owner and operator, Kimm Danzie, has the hands of an angel and the atmosphere of a soothing vacation. My husband purchased a home visit massage for our anniversary as a surprise for me! I was not only amazed and how quickly Infinite Touch of Chicago set up and broke down but there was music and the BEST MASSAGE I'VE EVER RECEIVED IN MY LIFE! From that point forward I've recommended and used Infinite Touch of Chicago for many events and gifts to friends, family and co-workers, including a youth group! I always try to do an half hour but always end up going for a full hour! Plus they do house calls! I'll repeat HOUSE CALLS!! Keep it up Infinite Touch of Chicago!

19.description: Infinite Touch of Chicago is the greatest massage therapy salon in Chicago bar-none! The owner and operator, Kimm Danzie, has the hands of an angel and the atmosphere of a soothing vacation. My husband purchased a home visit massage for our anniversary as a surprise for me! I was not only amazed and how quickly Infinite Touch of Chicago set up and broke down but there was music and the BEST MASSAGE I'VE EVER RECEIVED IN MY LIFE! From that point forward I've recommended and used Infinite Touch of Chicago for many events and gifts to friends, family and co-workers, including a youth group! I always try to do an half hour but always end up going for a full hour! Plus they do house calls! I'll repeat HOUSE CALLS!! Keep it up Infinite Touch of Chicago!

1.description: Been awhile since I've been here. The first time with my mother. The second with my husband. Both for massages. Service was wonderful.

2.description: Look no further south siders (and Everyone else) Kimm is the greatest! I no longer travel far and wide for a mediocre massage when I can stay is my neighborhood for the best.

9.description: I suffer from chronic back pain due to my job. So it was recommended that I start going for massages at least once a month. I learned of Kimm and Infinite Touch from Groupon. The location was not too far from where I live in Hyde Park and I knew that parking would not be too difficult unlike if the location was downtown or on the North side. I really liked the fact that I was able to schedule my appointment online. It was extremely easy and convenient and I immediately received confirmation via email. Two days later, I received a confirmation call from Kimm. If you are looking for a very high end, frou-frou spa experience, then Infinite Touch is not for you. I am from the south side of Chicago, so I was not phased by the location on 79th St. If you're nervous about venturing into the south side (let's be honest, some people are) don't worry, Infinite Touch is located just a few blocks off the the expressway- it is very easy to get to (although you can easily miss it as there is not a sign that says "Infinite Touch" rather just the business logo) and there is ample street parking. I was immediately greeted by the receptionist upon entering. He took my coat and offered me something to drink. Again, it's a no-frills place however it was clean and modestly decorated. The new age music that was playing was a nice, relaxing touch.  By no means am I a massage therapy connoisseur, however I can't imagine a massage being any better than Kimm's. Kimm seemed to instinctively know where my trouble spots were without me even going into much detail other than a few questions answered on the first time client questionnaire. I have experienced less than stellar service from companies once they found out I was patronizing their establishment because of a Groupon deal. However, that was not the case at all with Kimm. I did not feel rushed or short changed in the least bit. Matter of fact, once my massage was over, Kimm went the extra mile by giving me a cupcake and mini bottle of champagne for my birthday which was that day! I highly recommend Kimm based on the actual massage and customer service. I have already scheduled my next massage and I look forward to being a long time client of Infinite Touch!

6.description: Where do I begin. I have received massages before, but the massage I got here from Kimm was by far the best massage ever.  Let me repeat that THE BEST MASSAGE EVER.  Kimm is amazing.  I read all the reviews for all the spa's in Chicago trying to find the best one so I could surprise my girlfriend. I am so glad I chose this one.  If I could give it ten stars I would.From the moment you walk in you are treated like a VIP.  The staff is very professional and friendly.  I lucked out and found a Groupon deal for a one hour couples massage with refreshments.  We were not treated any differently because we had the Groupon discount.The room was set up very romantically.  Two massage tables side by side, soft lights, warm atmosphere, relaxing music and a sweet smell in the air (most likely one of the massage oils).  Once we were settled in they came in to start the massage. I again had Kimm and my girlfriend had Donald.  I received a deep tissue massage.  Kimm worked areas of my shoulders, back and legs in a way that it felt like there were five sets of hands on me.  It was amazing.  After the massage was over there was a table set up with juice, bottles of water and some very fresh moist pastries. Everything tasted great.  We were never rushed or hurried.If you want the best massage ever than this is the place to come.  We plan on always getting a massage here when come to Chicago.

18.description: I purchased a Groupon for a couples massage and I must say I have never been treated better! They didn't treat me any different because I purchased and offer as many places do. The location is not in a great neighborhood, but it's located right off of the expressway. You have to be sure to look for the logo on the window because they do not have a sign. When you walk in you are greeted by a very friendly receptionist who makes sure that you are comfortable and taken care of.
