This is not your usual upscale spa but, remember to never judge a book by it's cover because the massage therapists are great at what they do. My husband enjoyed his massage so much, I heard him snoring a few times. Mine was a little more rough, but still amazing. Once the massage was over we were left alone with a small bottle of pink champagne and a plate of desserts and fruit and were allowed to stay as long as we wanted. The only downfall to this place is that you can hear everything going on outside, the car alarms going off, the ambulances, the people yelling at each other on the street. It is a little difficult to relax, but they try their best. I will be returning soon!

10.description: We recently returned for another groupon goodie and, unsurprisingly, enjoyed another wonderful, relaxing afternoon. I just wanted to update this review to add both Kimm and Will to the list of fantastic therapists available who I would not hesitate to return to. I think my partner actually dozed off for a bit during his massage with Kimm because he was so relaxed and comfortable, and Will worked out all the kinks in my body. It's great to know that I can trust so many people here to all do fantastic work. I have already scheduled my birthday massage with Kimm for next month and plan to return soon after for a hot stone massage. Also, I wanted to mention that my partner and I had booked separate 90min massages per the groupon but Kimm must have recognized our names from our previous appnt, because she very thoughtfully put us together in the same large room so that it was like a couple's massage. I am sure this is not always possible but it was another sweet gesture that did not pass us by. Infinite Touch has definitely become my go-to massage place!

13.description: Best massage I ever had-Infinite Touch has found a new regular! Amazing quality massage for the price! Easy to get to, right off the highway. Plenty of free parking right around the corner, in front of cute houses in Chathem. You walk in off the busy street into serene music. The place is simple and clean. If you want a super posh spa that has the price of decorations build into the cost of your massage- go somewhere else. My boyfriend and I did the couples massage and plan to sign up for another. We both liked the idea of supporting a new, local business and with so many deals it is hard to resist.

16.description: **Disclaimer**- I am NOT an employee or relative, but simply one that enjoys getting good service for money I work hard for and spend!!I have a child that plays sports and constantly complains of aches in her body.  Although I always give her a nice mommy rub down it never seemed to be enough.  I purchased the Groupon deal for her to get a 1 hour massage yesterday.  She treated my daughter no different from any other client. I stayed in the room with my daughter for the first few minutes, but since she is older and Kimm is professional, I left the room 5 minutes into her session so she could enjoy her massage experience. While in the waiting area, I fell asleep to the nice relaxing music.  When my daughter came out, she was wobbled to me as she stated how good she felt. She was provided a bottle of water and after paying the tip (which I provided), told Kimm she would see her soon.  We all laughed! After getting in the car, my child told me she had higher expectations from me.  All day and night she talked about her massage experience and how Kimm was so nice.  My daughter said she wanted to save her money so she could go back. She thanked me all night for her treat. Before going to bed she said, "Mom, the girl that massaged me was really good".  I told her the "girl that massaged her" was the owner! She said she really felt special knowing that and kept trying to show me techniques that were used.  I have created a monster!I am sending my brother for the birthday special they have and can't wait for his feedback.  Although I purchased my deals through Groupon, I would definitely pay full price! I encouraged my sister to buy a 90 minute for her husband and she is also getting one for her son.  I just want everyone to have an Infinite Touch experience! Before leaving, Kimm told me that she offers a class for individuals and groups on how to give your mate a massage.  I will be signing up very soon because the way to a man's heart is not his stomach, it's relieving the aches and pains in his body!!

17.description: First of all, bless Kimm for opening a place for massage on the south side. I'm sick of having to travel up north or to the south suburbs, so this place is great for that reason alone. The deep tissue massages that I got from Kimm and Renee have to be some of the best that I've ever gotten. I can only think of two others that I've gotten that even came close and I've been getting massages on a regular basis from all over for years now. I also love the beautiful music that always plays here and the warm inviting scent that always seems to be on the air. All the staff is very friendly and professional. I'm glad Groupon helped me find them.

15.description: Kim is pleasant, professional, down to earth, and GREAT!!! Atmosphere is nice, calming, and very relaxing. I will definitely be returning and recommending friends!!

0.description: Love it. I've been twice and sent my brother and sister in law. They were both pleased and have since returned or made plans to. I haven't tried anyone there but Kimm, but if they're half as good as her, they'll do fine. I have a muscular skeletal disorder that causes pain and stiffness in my muscles. I have had other massages and left just as achy as when I came in. Not here. She seems to know where the trouble spots are and she works them out. The digs are nothing special, but you aren't coming to sit and drink wine. Give her a try and I think you'll be pleased.

5.description: I scheduled an appointment for a massage for my birthday a month in advance and literally while im on my way to the place, I get a call saying they need to reschedule me and unable to service me today, 30 minutes before my appointment!!! Needless to say I will not be rescheduling with them, I will take my business elsewhere!!!

11.description: God Bless Kimm & her healing hands!  I'm a massage therapist myself and was hurtin bad from an event the day before. Not only did Kimm fit in the time for me but had all the right skills to work out my sore muscles & knots into puddy. I'm also very selective of who massages me but would gladly let Kimm work on me anytime! Thank you!!! :)

8.description: I met Kimm last winter, when I took advantage of a Groupon for a chocolate massage and sugar rub at one of the posh, high-end downtown spas.  It was all good, but Kimm was all magic.  I wrote a yelp back then, that "if you have money and don't pamper yourself weekly with this woman, you're crazy."  Since then, she got wise and opened her own spa, Infinite Touch of Chicago.  I have called on Kimm's services (she actually came to my house two or three times) to literally HEAL me and take me on creative voyages with her restorative powers, but yesterday I visited her new spa for the first time.  Ever the critic (of things that don't matter), I have to admit that the location didn't rival Oak Street (but then again, free parking was a plus).  She has just opened, so I have no idea what her ultimate plans might be, but I commented that "less is more," and here's why:Her massage rooms are light and oh-so-airy, which gives her space to move and the lucky recipient of her services mega chi to breathe.  The rooms have at least ten foot high ceilings, and the separation walls don't go all the way to the ceiling, so the gigantic ceiling fan provides that hint of a tropical breeze to all.  And because of the minimalist decor, the stereo--playing New Age "let your troubles go" music kind of echoes throughout the space.When I schedule massage, I want to let it all go for the time I'm there and leave feeling better than I did when I entered.  Sight and taste disappear, and I become a skin sensitive nerve ending, while I allow the music to fill my ears and Kimm's aromatherapy scented oils to soften my withered skin.  It's all I need.If you are one of those people who seeks an instant replay of the last massage, be sure to tell Kimm what you want.  Otherwise, you might have to decide which experience takes you on your favorite journey.  Never one to fall into a pattern, this masseuse lets your body tell her where to take you. And, unlike those Chicago Mag-Mile prices, Infinite Touch of Chicago is reasonably priced.  I used to think "the experience is what you make it."  After growing used to Kimm's pampering, I know it's what SHE makes it.  And it will be amazing.  I recommend having a journal handy.  For some reason, on occasion, these massages unlock my creative juices and I get some of my most inspirational thoughts.Five stars are not enough. Tip large.Can't tell you about Credit or insurance, but she has an awesome online scheduler, and it works.  You'll get a confirmation email.

3.description: I have become a regular here. Kimm is the owner and a sweetheart.  The prices are affordable but she always have specials just check the website.  She has a special touch with her fingers unlike anyother message therapist I've been to. The atmosphere is soothing and calming music always playing. Don't let the area fool you, trust once you go there you will not regret it and will be back!

14.description: Kim is the BEST massage therapist in Chicago! Treat yourself like a king or queen today!

4.description: I heard about the September birthday special that was being offered by Infinite Touch and decided to purchase a massage for my mother since it's her birthday month. To say that she was pleased is an understatement. My mother called me twice....TWICE! Typically, if she calls twice in one day, something is wrong. Not this time. She wanted to rave about the services and treatment that she received from Kimm.  I am so dang happy to know that my mother was well taken care of. It's in a very convenient location off of the EL, and in a small, charming, space. I'm visiting Chicago in a few weeks and plan to treat myself to the services as well! SUH-WHEET!

3.description: Horrible Service!

1.description: The worst service ever i once worked for this great franchise the manager is terrible she and another employee sat in a white expedition tonight for almost 30 minutes while the lobby was full with customer's 1 person was behind the counter the sevice sucks that's why we don't have successful businessesin our community. ...STEP IT UP DOMINO'S

2.description: This is the worst Dominos to order anything from. I use to order Dominos from North Ave location and never once did I encounter the most worst experience ever. I wont ever give any Dominos business again. Instead of hiring a bunch of unprofessional none giving a care to follow directions individuals who are rude with horrible attitude. Invest in hiring people who actually care about the customer satisfaction and not just a pay check!

9.description: One, two, three strikes...I'm out!  I've only recently started liking Domino's pizza. They have gotten much better. But this location...not so much. This is my 3rd time ordering from this location and the food is ALWAYS very mediocre. I am currently eating the driest, most bland sandwich ever. My husband has a philly sandwich with very little "philly" on it. I will continue to support Domino's, just not this location.

10.description: Ordered  from here doing their Grand Opening; Their service is horrible, no regard for customers personal preferences.They clearly have no idea about crm( customer relationship management. Never will I ever, patronize their business again. Employees are ghetto and poorly educated, with abrasive sales tactics. The Absolute worse!!!

4.description: I wish i could rate zero also. Every time I order online here, they call me within 2minutes to tell me they don't have any drivers. Why have an option for delivery if you never deliver. Or they don't have any pizza. Lol what pizza place runs out of pizza?

6.description: It's the most ghetto place ever. The girls that work there are hella rude. The customer service sucks!  I love the sandwiches. Amazing veggie sandwich. But the employees needs more training they do not know the recipes. Yeah I will have to find a veggie sandwich elsewhere.

11.description: I ordered during their Grand Opening.  The pizza was disappointing.  I called their corporate customer service to file a complaint.  A report was supposedly taken for follow-up.  It has been months yet I never received a call.  Guess I won't order from there again.

5.description: So I placed an order on Sunday after seeing that they didnt close till 12am. They charged my card and the kids were following along on the tracker... so here it is the next day and I am still waiting on my pizza to be delivered. I called and there isnt even a recording stating they are closed or otherwise. I will NEVER order from this place again.

7.description: Their drivers are horrible. If you not going to properly "Deliver" pizza don't advertise it. Secondly,  the customer service is unacceptable.  Plan on not ordering from here again.  I wish I can give 0 stars.

8.description: If I could give ZERO stars, I would, but I can't. I just tried to order from this place.  I ordered online and my confirmation said my pizza would be ready in 75-85 minutes, 2 hours later still no pizza!  I called to find out the status and was told by Hank that they had some "technical difficulties" then he said the driver broke down.  I think the phone must have broken down too because I guess he didn't think maybe he should have called ME, the customer to advise I wasn't getting my pizza.  And on top of it, my card was charged and I was told I would receive a refund in 5 days!  TERRIBLE, TERRIBLE SERVICE!  AVOID THIS PLACE AND stick to the neighborhood pizzeria's.

0.description: It's Domino's the bar for taste is pretty low. It tasted like pizza. But this is what sucks about this store. I am less than a half mile away, and they don't deliver to me. However, my ex is well over a half mile away and they  will deliver to her. What kind of BS is that? They don't know the area, because if they did, they wouldn't deliver to the street on block behind them, which is one of the most dangerous blocks on Chicago's South Side, and that is saying a lot. But these lines are drawn by people who are less familiar with Chicago, than North Koreans are. What a bunch of knuckleheads.

58.description: I recall back when Darryl &Andrea Townsend first opened DAT Donut. I thought for a moment, how can such a cool and savvy business lady open and maintain a DOUGHNUT shop?? Turns out that she was smart and made a darn fantastic doughnut. The fritters are oh my gosh rich, sweet, crunchy, and apply delicious! The doughnuts have a slightly crisp exterior and a beautifully soft interior. The icings and glazes are just a bonus. If you are afraid of the South-east side (Chatham), just bring backup or offer them a Dat Donut...THE DOUGHNUTS ARE WORTH IT!

56.description: I first saw this in a Thrillest article, and once I saw a picture of the huge donut, I knew I just had to go here. My friends and I headed over to the Chatham neighborhood at around 11:30 on a Friday night. Were we concerned? Yes. Were we hoping nothing that we were gonna make it in and out safely? Yes. We got to the corner of 83rd and Cottage Grove just fine. It's a well lit place, and there was a CPD parked in the vicinity of the shop. We all went down the car and headed.I love how they use a revolving window to give you your donuts! The woman handling the sales was really nice, and I wouldn't doubt if she was wondering why, at that time of the night, came in to buy donuts. Although there was the Big Dat, they had several kinds of the regular sized treats.I got the glazed yeast, glazed butter milk, chocolate glazed, toasted coconut, and strawberry. I also got a bow tie, with is pretty much the same thing as a glazed yeast but the dough was shaped into a fancy looking bow.These doughnuts are DELICIOUS. Not sure how long they've been out at that moment, but they were nice and soft, yum.I wouldn't mind going down here again, to be honest!

29.description: Best donuts in the city! Haven't had a bad one yet. Try them all and find your faves.

42.description: Came here late at night after a Sox game and cuffed a dozen for around $8. Well worth it! Next time I gotta try a Big Dat

23.description: No debate about it, Dat Donut is amazing; HUGE donuts that are super cheap. Its like shoveling sugar and fat into your mouth, in the best way? Theyve got a pretty big selection of donuts so you'll be able to find whatever you need. Skip the coffee, its horrible murky brown water. Grab a donut and take it somewhere to enjoy outside but be prepared to fight off all the wildlife drawn to enough sugar to last them the winter.

47.description: The donuts here are eye-rollingly good. As in, when you take a bite, your eyes roll to the back of your head because your taste buds can't handle the heavenly, soft, sweet texture of these glazed donuts. I haven't had the other flavors - I've only had the apple fritter, which, by the way, is also quite good - but I think the main attraction of Dat Donut is the regular glazed donut. Get the Big Dat and share it with your friends. It is dat goodIS IT CHEAP? Yes! God, yes!

8.description: If you want a home made donut with just enough glaze covered over it. Then this is the place to go to. Their coffee is also delicious too. If you are in the area please try them.

31.description: Best doughnuts ever. This place is iconic and after hearing my local friends rave about it, we knew we had to go on our last visit to chicago. The neighborhood is rough, and apparently this place even has bullet-proof glass windows, so we stayed in the car, but these doughnuts are incredible. They are bigger-than-your-face massive and so good.

34.description: Second best doughnut shop in the world.Take it from me - I'm a cop.You pretty much need police protection in the terrible neighborhood, but if you're wiling to risk your neck in order to shove a donut down it, try Dat Donut.

16.description: This place is located in a seedy area on the Southside of the city of Chicago however, these have to be soma of the BESTdonuts I've ever had! These donuts taste fresh and delicious. They have DJ'S beat hands down. Actually these donuts make you realize how processed DJ'S really are....smh. Nonetheless, this place is work the drive and trip from anywhere. Please try one of your donuts warm. (13 seconds in microwave )

13.description: This are the best donuts in town.........YOU must try you will not be disappointed!!!!!!!

11.description: Donuts here are "Ohhh...Sooo...Fresh! And just in case you didn't know...its open 24Hrs! This means you can fresh donuts anytime of the day. Nice tasting cinnamon rolls with lots of cinnamon! Has a little place for seating but mainly people come here for takeout!Been here several times from when I use to work in the area but haven't been here for a while. Good to get a chance to have "Dat Donut" taste back on my palate! Only drawback is finding a place for parking when it is busy.

39.description: I tried the old fashioned, classic glazed donut... 4 of them. All amazing. I do not know their secret but there is something amazing going on here. Their donuts are fluffy with a crusty, thick glaze. They are punchy soft with a great bite. There is nothing to regret here.Go ahead and order as many as you like. And a few more for later.

37.description: This is my second favorite donut shop in Chicago. Although they bake their donuts, they taste 100 times better than Dunkin. But if you catch them at the wrong time, you might get stuck with a stale donut. But when they're fresh, no other donut shop can touch them. The only draw back is the location: watch your back.

0.description: Fresh. Delicious. Amazing. Three words I use to describe this donut shop. This place has all the types of donuts you want with all the freshness you've been missing from your oh-so convenient chain donut shop. My favorites: the glazed and the glazed Big Dat. The Big Dat is big. The equivalent of at least 4 donuts in one convenient, giant, circle of sugar and fat and heaven. The Big Dat is not for the faint of heart. By the time you've finished a solo Big Dat, you'll either feel very proud of yourself or very disappointed in your life choices because you don't feel too good anymore. Or you feel a combination of the two. One thing to note: it's not in the best neighborhood and you do order from behind a bullet-proof glass. But this place is definitely worth it!

38.description: These donuts are the best I have been following this place around for years.I remember when Dat donut it was located in a strip mall on 76th racine .Gotcha, a lot of y'all didn't know that did you?These donuts are Scrumdelliious    ,Finger licking,slap yo mama ,Heavenly,Doughy sweet delite.I only eat these once every 3 months.Which makes me really appreciate these donuts.Everything in moderation people.Krispy kreme bow down the place is the king of donut world.

51.description: Yum, yum, and yum!! The glaze dounut are incredibly soft and flavorful. And the apple fritter OMG sedate me please ! I ordered the giant and ate the whole thing. Worth the trip.

27.description: The big dat glazed and the pineapple donuts give me pure life! So delish! Somehow, they are always fresh, no matter what time I go. Knowing that fact sometimes makes life worth living!

32.description: I finally got a chance to try the donuts and it did not disappoint! The parking lot is pretty small and really hard to find parking depending on when you come. I came with my gf and we ordered a dozen donuts and also got the big donut. Everything was really good, but we could tell the donuts we got were not fresh. That is our fault as we came around 8pm. I definitely will come back and hope to get them when they are fresh!

54.description: Some of the best donuts,  I've ever tasted.  Hands down.  Must be made with love and lard.  All I know is with each bite, I make that mmmmHmm face, eyes closed and let the delicious flavors consume me.

48.description: Best donuts ever!! we always bring out of town guests to experience a taste of the south side!!

44.description: So I got a lotta memories of this place. And they all go the same way: It's 2 am and you're bored. You call up some friends and hop in your tin can and race your way down here cause where else can you get some of the world's best donuts at strange times in strange ways? So you cruise down Cottage Grove and you see the neon sign, you duck in and say hi to the dudes (there'll always be a few, loitering around stuffed with ribs) and get yourself a glazed, a strawberry, maybe a jelly, a Big Dat if you're feeling ambitious.Aw yeah, dat's some good donuts. Almost the best in the city -- after Old Fashioned's on 112th. But past 6pm, when Old Fashion closes shop, Dat is King.

24.description: This place is located in a seedy area on the Southside of the city of Chicago however, these have to be soma of the BESTdonuts I've ever had! These donuts taste fresh and delicious. They have DJ'S beat hands down. Actually these donuts make you realize how processed DJ'S really are....smh. Nonetheless, this place is work the drive and trip from anywhere. Please try one of your donuts warm. (13 seconds in microwave )

7.description: After hitting Calumet Fisheries for dinner last week, I stopped by to grab a Dat with some friends and was happy that this experience was better than the first.  Strangely, I came by last time at 9:30 AM on a Sunday and the donuts weren't that fresh...this time, I came by on a Tuesday at 8 PM and they were exceptionally fresh.  I asked the woman behind the counter when they were made; 6 PM is when a batch came out, so don't be discouraged that you'll get hosed if you show up here during the evening.  These guys seems to turn donuts out at all hours of the day (helpful since they are open 24 hours).The Dat is at least four regular glazed donuts in total; it's so massive that you almost have to get that to tell the story to friends.  But this was worth it and for like $3.50 I could feed myself and another adult pretty easily!

49.description: Not a sweets person but they have this glazed donut that is HUGE. It's really good especially when it's fresh and warm!

40.description: Yummmm. Donuts don't get any better than this!  I love this place.  Perfect for a Monday morning!

53.description: I loooove Dat Donuts. I've been coming here for years. My favorite is the lemon cake doughnut. You have to get there early because they sell out quick! The doughnuts are always fresh & the cashiers always greet u with "good morning" & a smile.

30.description: Fresh - delicious and I wish they had a fat free,sugar free no calorie donuts. It is worth the sacrifice of my cheat day !  I usually get 1/2 a dozen or a dozen so that I can share so that I don't feel like I'am the only one that is eating these delish treats.I am drooling writing this -  you will be hooked from the first bite. Just a extra 15 minutes on the treadmill has not killed anyone. definately a place to try if you are ever in the city!

46.description: It's completely true -- the donuts here are bigger than your head. Better yet, the quality and the prices at Dat Donut make this place worth the stop for more than just the novelty of buying a huge donut.First of all, I was a little confused when I got into the parking lot. The door is inside another door that only has a sign for Uncle John's Ribs. Just trust that you're going the right way, and once you walk in you'll see the sign on the door to the right. Also, yes, the location is a little sketchy, but if you come here during the day it's perfectly fine.Now, the donuts! Their giant "Big Dat" donuts come in glazed or chocolate frosted, and once I saw them lined up in the display case I knew I just had to have one for $4. I also asked for two chocolate donuts, but when I got back on the road and looked in the bag I had two chocolate frosted donuts- totally not the same thing! However, the consensus was that despite being the wrong kind, they were still better than the average donut. The texture was light and airy, similar to Krispy Kremes and definitely not like the cake-like texture at Dunkin Donuts. But Dat Donut topped both of the chains because the glaze wasn't overly sweet, and the donuts were extremely fresh. Also, the height of the donuts was taller than I'm used to, and for just over $2 for two, they're a great value!If you happen to be on the south side (or near the University of Chicago like I was!) stop by and get a giant donut and a couple of regular sized ones. It'll be well worth the $7 or so it'll cost you.

1.description: Donuts are delicious! Customer service always lacks. Meanest workers in the world. How much does it take to look a person in the eye when you're serving them, and then give them a genuine and warm "thank you," at the end of the transaction? Did I say that the donuts were delicious, though? Old Fashion is better...

55.description: Don't let the area scare you off (the dangers of the location is totally overblown), because you will be missing such an awesome establishment. Dat Donut is hidden gem nestled on the corner of 83rd and Cottage Grove. The first thing you will notice when you park is the delicious smell of homemade sweets proliferating the air. They've also recently opened up a John's BBQ right next door, so you will probably get some wafts of BBQ as well.There will probably be a small line when you first get there, but it moves fast so it's a short wait. They've got a bunch of different glazed donuts, along with the huge Dat Donut (glazed or chocolate) and the apple fritters, which imo, is their crème de la crème.The donuts were alright, and honestly, nothing super special. It's definitely fresher and softer than what you will get anywhere else, but a donut is a donut for the most part.The apple fritters, however, is where the foodgasm comes from. The crunchy crispy exterior, with the soft, warm interior, and the subtle flavor of apple that lingers with every bite = absolute heaven.Come here, get the apple fritters and go home, because your day will already have been made at this point. DIS PLACE IS AWESOME!!

9.description: These are really good donuts! They remind me of Krispy Kreme, but I would say even better. I tried the chocolate frosted and strawberry frosted. Both were good. I took a pass on the jumbo-sized options...entirely too many calories!! The area where this place is located is a bit sketchy, so be careful when you go. I was in and out in under four minutes and had someone asking me for money in that short amount of time. Definitely not a place to hang out at, but the donuts are surely worth the visit.

26.description: These are really good donuts! They remind me of Krispy Kreme, but I would say even better. I tried the chocolate frosted and strawberry frosted. Both were good. I took a pass on the jumbo-sized options...entirely too many calories!! The area where this place is located is a bit sketchy, so be careful when you go. I was in and out in under four minutes and had someone asking me for money in that short amount of time. Definitely not a place to hang out at, but the donuts are surely worth the visit.

25.description: An absolute hidden gem, given the not so hot location. I would choose the plain glazed donuts here over any one I've ever had anywhere else, they are so so delicious. I would say without contest Dat Donut is the #1 donut at UChicago; you see student groups selling Dat Donuts all the time and it's incredibly popular on campus. Prices are great too!

12.description: I go here when I need a donut fix in a pinch. Unfortunately, I'm a donut lover and I have my fave spots. Sometimes, the craving for fried dough gets so bad, I retreat to the nearest donut sanctuary and this place seems to serve it's purpose.

59.description: The donuts and apple fritters were really good.  However, if you want a Big Dat(Big Donut) or Apple Fritter be sure to arrive early. Later in the night they run out of these two items and they do NOT restock.

21.description: Dat Donut has fresh good quality donuts in chicago. Better than your neighborhood Dunkin Donuts.

17.description: How am I ever going to lose this baby weight if I keep going here every three days, I really enjoy the strawberry donuts, I can inhale 2 with no problem, my husband get the big dat donut and it usually last about 6 hours in our household. I love this place I have to just pace myself!! Lol

10.description: How could not love a donut place that's open 24 hours!! I've been coming here since I was kid and to me nothing has changed. The pineapple and strawberry donuts are the best. The customer service can be kinda bad . But you will def get over it that's how EXCELLENT the donuts are . You would think they would be happy selling the most delicious donuts ever. If you are in the area or if you are coming out your way it's definitely worth it!!!

5.description: Wow, these donuts are delicious! This location use to be the old Leon's BBQ building from back in the day. I ordered a dozen combination glaze,cake and chocolate donuts for under $11.00. All were fresh and customers were coming in as fast as they brought them out. I would give it 5 stars, but they were not fully stocked with all the available flavors posted. It is best to go earlier in the day for more selections.  This location is open 24 hours,  but I suggest going during day light hours for those who are faint of heart about area. Don't be a wimp, check out this hidden gem of Chicago ;)

3.description: Amazing doughnuts! Not the best neighborhood either, but that didn't bother me from getting good food at reasonable prices!

35.description: This is a neighborhood staple or should we call it a Chicago staple.  When you have people driving from all over the city and suburbs at 2am, they have got to be good.  Great tasting old fashioned donuts. And yes you can buy donuts as big as your head. You can still watch the baker at work, too.

19.description: It's completely true -- the donuts here are bigger than your head. Better yet, the quality and the prices at Dat Donut make this place worth the stop for more than just the novelty of buying a huge donut.First of all, I was a little confused when I got into the parking lot. The door is inside another door that only has a sign for Uncle John's Ribs. Just trust that you're going the right way, and once you walk in you'll see the sign on the door to the right. Also, yes, the location is a little sketchy, but if you come here during the day it's perfectly fine.Now, the donuts! Their giant "Big Dat" donuts come in glazed or chocolate frosted, and once I saw them lined up in the display case I knew I just had to have one for $4. I also asked for two chocolate donuts, but when I got back on the road and looked in the bag I had two chocolate frosted donuts- totally not the same thing! However, the consensus was that despite being the wrong kind, they were still better than the average donut. The texture was light and airy, similar to Krispy Kremes and definitely not like the cake-like texture at Dunkin Donuts. But Dat Donut topped both of the chains because the glaze wasn't overly sweet, and the donuts were extremely fresh. Also, the height of the donuts was taller than I'm used to, and for just over $2 for two, they're a great value!If you happen to be on the south side (or near the University of Chicago like I was!) stop by and get a giant donut and a couple of regular sized ones. It'll be well worth the $7 or so it'll cost you.

28.description: Donuts here are "Ohhh...Sooo...Fresh! And just in case you didn't know...its open 24Hrs! This means you can fresh donuts anytime of the day. Nice tasting cinnamon rolls with lots of cinnamon! Has a little place for seating but mainly people come here for takeout!Been here several times from when I use to work in the area but haven't been here for a while. Good to get a chance to have "Dat Donut" taste back on my palate! Only drawback is finding a place for parking when it is busy.

45.description: Unbelievably delicious, no-frills donut place on the South Side. Literally the most delicious donut I've ever had, and a dozen is around $8. You really can't beat the price and the taste, soo good. People need to relax about the neighborhood, you'll be fine.

33.description: I've only visited this location once and I was immediately turned off by the mass amount of flies that circulated and landed amongst the donuts. I was disgusted to say the least and left quickly after seeing such. I wouldn't dare buy food to eat that has been touched by nasty bugs.

43.description: Ok. I live blocks away from this "establishment." And every now and then I get a taste for old fashioned style donuts ! THIS IS NOT THE PLACE TO GO ! Dude need a sign that lights up to tell ppl when the donuts are ready or something. Because every time I step foot in this place they ALWAYS sell these STALE, DRIED OUT,FLAT,DAY OLD donuts. You would think I'd learn my lesson and not keep patronizing. But Im no hater, let a Black man get his money. Does it have to be this way, at the expense of your reputation? Once I tired telling the owner, I told him I always come thru from time to time and support. One of his employees even said she recognizes me as a regular. He didnt even ackowledge my dissatisfaction. Yet he continues to sell these old a** things. Go somewhere else and save yourself some frustration.

2.description: A South Side Chicago Classic. Super fresh, old school, good ass donuts. Donuts made on premises, 24 hours, watch them. Regular size, spare tire size, inexpensive.South Side, bulletproof glass, door security.Leave a penny, take a penny. Regulars leave many pennies for those short a penny.Check it out, if it's your first time come during the day, park close.

18.description: Thank you thank you thank you thank you unless I go to a donut shop order a jelly doughnut then the trouble starts when I asked what flavor is the jelly inside of the donut. No one seems to know I get all kinds of answers except for the answer of the flavor of the jelly that's inside of the donuts I've got an answers like its a jelly donut my reply I gather that what kind of jelly is in the donut reply fruit jelly wow what flavor fruit and that's when the employee looks at me like I'm an imposition and asshole a burden or just that guy is asking me a question and I don't have the freaking answer. I can understand not knowing the answer but not researching it and finding out what kind it is is not only a lackluster customer service experience it's a part of that person not being trained properly and knowing the products that they are selling. That is the worst just the words to ask a service employee a question about something in their work environment that they should know we don't have the answers. I almost got arrested at a store in New Orleans because they would not know the flavor of the jelly inside the donut and I was labeled as a troublemaker because I was starting trouble trying to find the answer to a typical question far as what flavor do you have in your donut. I work in the food service industry I know that people can die from eating peanuts when they have a peanut allergy it is nothing to play with and I am surprised at the store do not pay more attention and are there employees with the knowledge that they need to be able to answer questions. But however the day that I walked into that that donut there was a nice :-) that greeted me there and we talked donuts because I used to make donuts as well and I asked her what kind of jelly was in the jelly filled donut and she knew the right answer it was strawberry filled and she's a very pleasant person the cashier was thats why I left her a $5 tip. Thank you thank you thank you once again Bruce Bruce

41.description: So, in my last review a year ago, I very specifically said we weren't going back...But then my family from California came to town, and after seeing our pictures with the giant donut they demanded we go.This time we drove instead of public transit. The donuts are still fantastic! We took a whole new set of pictures, which my aunts posted on Facebook and were very happy with how goofy/awesome those pics are. My aunt was surprised they were good, saying that when something is a novelty in size, etc. she expects to eat it because it's a novelty, not because it's actually great. But everyone agrees these are fantastic donuts. The six of us polished off 4 Dat Big Ones and one apple fritter. Well, 3 1/2 Dat Big Ones. And again we were way too full to grab lunch after that, even though we all agreed that rib place next door smelled really good.So I retract my statement that we'll never go again. But driving is way better than the public transit down there, and I'd still be selective about when you go.

52.description: dat donut is right next to uncle john's ribs.. the parking lot was really parked when i went.. i ordered the cinnamon roll and dat big ass donut! it was cheap in pricing and the donut was huge and really good!!! i will definitely go back and try their other donuts..!! mmmmmmm donuts...

50.description: Day's is a south side classic! I've been coming here for years and the donuts are so fresh and flakey! This is the best donut spot in Chicago!

4.description: When you walk in you might be looking why is this place behind bulletproof glass well unfortunately it's in a bad neighborhood in Chicago. But honestly I been coming here for years and never had any problems the service isn't the greatest but the donuts are definitely fresh and taste amazing. You can't go wrong with any donut all of them are good my fav is the strawberry. Make the trip it's open 24/7

6.description: Eat in moderation (if you are strong enough to control yourself) you can devour these donuts once a week! Make sure your gym routine is tight though. These donuts are a definite treat for my family...yum

22.description: Perfect donut shop! They have ice cream, juices, smoothies and more. I love there selection and they have great customer service. There in a nice and convenient location. They are very clean and very popular. Stop in and enjoy some great treats here you're sure to enjoy it !

15.description: Came here late at night after a Sox game and cuffed a dozen for around $8. Well worth it! Next time I gotta try a Big Dat

57.description: Very Good!  I have tried the cake donuts with chocolate frosting, the glazed (several people in front of me ordered a full dozen of  just glazed).  The toasted coconut was wonderful, nutty.  The chocolate cake donut w/icing was insanely good, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  Go there and try and order one.  Impossible!  Prices are quite reasonable, especially by the dozen.  Open 24 hrs!

20.description: I called this establishment on Memorial Day (wasn't sure if they were open for the holiday) and the woman who answered the phone was rude. I said good morning just checking to see if you were open and she answers "I answered the phone, didn't I" and I said I was unsure of the hours due to the holiday maam and she said we're 24 hrs...just rude! I want to support black business but if this is the kind of service that I'm going to get then no thanks.

36.description: If you know me, you know I typically come here every Tuesday and Thursday when my night classes get out. I've only had the carmel, strawberry and glazed. Carmel is by far the best. The donuts here pillow soft and have easily become my new addiction. Glad I discovered this place after having a baby, because if I had discovered it while pregnant, you'd think I was having triplets. The girls are always friendly and the donuts are always fresh. The prices recently went up by like 6 cents a donut, but that's not a deterrent. I only gave 4 stars because sometimes the donuts can be a little crunchy.

14.description: I ordered 3 donuts ... A chocolate cake, a lemon cake and a caramel cake donut... When I opened my bag I had received a glazed and two plain cake donuts. Although disappointed I wanted sugar so I ate them. Not to bad. Thus the 2 stars for the fact that they tasted good just not my flavor. Plain.... Uuughhh

3.description: The Steak Sandwiches are good , I would definitely go back and probably get a Turkey sandwich . The fries were good too and the fries were drenched in sauce like they are supposed to be . The only drawback was the customer service but I was expecting that . If in the area I wouldn't mind getting a Hoagy!

1.description: I have to admit I don't really like hoagies, but I got a menu for this restaurant from a coworker and decided to give it a try. They have a very good selection of sandwiches. I decided to try the New Signature Heaven on a croissant,  boy did I pick the right one. LolSmoked turkey and  turkey ham with all the fixings on a toasted croissant. It was very fresh and super tasty and very reasonably priced . We will definetly be going back.  Who knows, I may give hoagies another try lolGreat customer service too. Thank you Shariyah!!

2.description: Ok, if you're from Chicago you know the hype over Home of the Hoagy and are also familiar with the 2 hour wait. With Steak Sweet there is no line and the food tastes just as delicious! I will definitely be back and will definitely try everything at least once!

9.description: Love it... Steak Hoagy was juicy,and the fries are to die for...Will be back for more....

10.description: I can literally eat there everyday. The pistachio ice cream is to die for!  The customer service can be a little better but the food makes up for that. It's super convenient and it stays open late for my late shifts at work. A quick grab before I turn in. My boyfriend request it every single night. But I never get tired of it. The sweet sauce is really good. They add just enough oil.

4.description: When I moved to the east side of chicago with no car ir broke my heart because I could no longer make those bi-weekly trips to Home of the Hoagy. People often would compare & refer me to Taurus' which although its delicious it just doesn't compare. I tried Steak Sweet Hoagy for the 1st time yesterday and was blown away! Although its not Home of the Hoagy it's as close as the Eastside will ever come. The steak sweet sandwich and fries are wonderful! Not to mention their special Tuesday where u get a sandwich, fries and a pop all for $4. I am smitten! The only issue I had was the long wait

6.description: The steaks are good, I always order extra cheese and sauce. Not exactly the same as home of the hoagy but very close. I tried a hoagy today, it was very average, the bread was store bought Turano bread that you buy at the deli at a jewel. It was not worth it, and a little dry. The fries at either cooked too hard or not cooked enough. Worth it for the steak and fries.

11.description: This place is TERRIBLE! I JUST left! I stopped there since it was in the neighborhood and closer than Taurus for a steak sub. Why did I do that? Let's see the problems- this place is over priced, long wait time, ghetto employees, and food was terrible! I paid 7 bucks for a measly "famous sweet steak" which reaked the smell of Open Pit BBQ sauce :( the taste of the meat was terrible to where I cant describe it. The the green sweet peppers that are normally blended  were sitting on top cold and hard. I wasted 20 minutes waiting with no long lines and 7 bucks because this sandwich was not even edible! The absolute worst! I am so glad my friend didnt have a chance to answer when I was calling to see if they wanted something. Open Pit though? Is that what you calll sweet? I would have taken Sweet Baby Rays, but who put Open Pit on anything but ribs? Ewww.... I should have known it would be a bad experience when they allowed this woman to bring her grown (not arm dog) into the place. Its obvious she is a regular! Smh! Anyway, because my sandwich went straight to the trash, now I will be hungry until I cam get to Taurus for a much cheaper and better tasting steak sandwich

5.description: I really wanted this to be at least half as as good as home of the hoagy... it isnt... the sauce isn't bad.... But... there wasn't  enough on sandwich nor fries. The steak is of poor quality.. I spit out gristle and saw tons of stringy tendons.  Meat had no seasoning, not even a sprinkle of salt, tasted boiled. Lack of cheese. Just bad.Also, customer service, the cashier was switching positions with another worker and was rude. The next cashier seemed annoyed with simple questions, hello it's a new spot (although service was relatively fast 6 min)The biggest  complaint about home of the hoagy is its customer service..If someone is trying to steal their success at least have better service... H.o.H food is worth the less than stellar  service.  Go ahead and make the trip to 111th

7.description: For those who were Home Of The Hoagy fans, the sign boasts the fact that you won't have to wait in long line! Obviously the owners were fans as well. The steak sandwich is spot on! Unlike HOTH, you don't get a choice of peppers but the sauce has the taste of the sweet pepper with a nice amount of heat. They have different sizes so I got the small sandwich. It was bursting at the seams with meat and it WAS a meal. The only knock I have (hence 4 stars) is that the fries didn't seem to be fully cooked and they put too much "sauce" on the fries. I ended up tossing them out. I don't need to eat fries anyway...

8.description: I have been going there since it first opened. The food is always good with generous portions. I am very big on customer service. All the ladies who work there are excellent and exceeds my expectations. I had an unfortunate mishap on the way in there tonight. Yes ladies, the flip flop wearers nightmare, after driving all the way from Hyde Park as I was getting out of the car it happened with no extra shoes to put on and certainly I was not walking barefooted. I called to cancel my order and explained what happened needless to say I thought it was a done deal and wasted trip. All I can say is me and my family are quite full now! Unfortunately I forgot the ladies name but I never forget to thank people, especially those who go above and beyond! I am totally satisfied with the service and food and I always recommend this place.

0.description: The 10" steak sweet is HUGE! Enough for two people... Or for you to eat half now and half later (at least, that's what I did!) The sandwich is filled to the brim with yummy steak and the sweet, tomato based sauce reminds you of Sloppy Joe sauce. A definite winner!Obviously if you're patronizing this neighborhood for food, you're not new and know what to expect.  I actually got pulled over for having a headlight out, on my way to pick up my food. But a missing headlight at 12:30am on 79th and Cottage is definitely my bad, I know better, no reflection on the quality of food at the restaurant whatsoever!

1.description: This isn't really a big location and most items seem to be out of place and no real organization. One register was closing leaving only one register open and I don't know what happened but it was like everyone in the store wanted to check out at the same time.  It took about 10 minutes and a few angry customers before they opened up another register.Even with all of that I would come back because if you are having a party it's nothing like getting the things you need for a dollar.The aluminum  pans are no longer strong and durable.  I found that out the hard way this past weekend as my pan started to fold up as I was placing the hot food in the pan.They also tablecloths, balloons, and some other great party favors so although I wouldn't choose this location as my first choice I wouldn't count it out because of everything being a dollar.Enjoy!!!

2.description: I went to this location last week and was appalled at what I saw. Half the aisles were just littered in merchandise. This was by far the most ghetto Dollar Tree I've been to. I've gone to other locations and didnt see just about every aisle a complete mess. It's like the store has no real means to work on catering to a class of clientele that don't think this is some free for all where they allow their kids to run loose in the store taking things off the shelf and throwing it on the floor. I was busy trying to avoid slipping and tripping over things kids have thrown everywhere. I like Dollar Tree, but this location can do a lot better in terms of not catering to the garbage that stepped out of the projects.

0.description: I really want to like this place and give it 4 stars but I cant. This Dollar Tree is so JUNKY!!! I do not understand how its sooooo junky. I wonder do you guys even expect your employees to clean at closing or throughout the day???? I mean some of the aisles are a legit safety hazard to the public. I would hate for a box to fall on some little kid or better yet me... NO NO NO you don't want that. So lets make more of an effort to work on that. The customer service is not bad for this location but it is not the best but it is not the worse either. The employees need to have a professional demeanor instead of the ghetto mindset that they have. Just because you work in a certain area or neighborhood, doesn't mean you have to live up to the stereotype that's placed there.

This "Shoetique" has it all. Shoes, A small selection of classy clothing, Handbags, Jewelry accessories, and for those who need a little tightening up around the edges, they have Waist Trainers and Butt lifters. Yes that's right! The staff is attentive and helpful. The owner is so sweet. They even are starting a 60 day layaway program. I was overjoyed to come across this gem and overspent the day that I went, however I plan to go back to overspend again! Keep up the good work Lure Chaussures. You gained a loyal customer.

3.description: They have a good selection of products for the hair, skin and nails and a discount card that can save you money off of your next purchase. One thing that I really like about this place is that they don't follow you around when you shop! Yes, I've noticed that most small business owners lose their minds when someone walks in with a large purse or bag. This store treats their customers with respect after all if you have security cameras do you need to pace up and down to rows to watch me too?

1.description: Pretty good selection of hair and the like. I really liked how they had a reward card, although I haven't been back since. Its a weird place to park your car so its better to walk. The employees had a good knowledge of black hair, so when I told them of the style I wanted to achieve, they were able to point me in the right direction. I bought braiding hair but if I ever get a chance, I'd like to check out their wigs.

2.description: I went to this place today and waited, and waited and waited to be serviced. There was only one person to assist and she was busy with another customer. She never acknowledged me. I walked around the store for a little while and got tired of being followed by security. I left and will not be back. Taking my business elsewhere.

5.description: LOVE THIS PLACE. I am a hair stylist and I do Hair Extentions. Now When it come to buying hair you don't want cheap stuff that will tangle and look a mess in a week. I will only do Extentions if you have remy hair.... Now the best remy hair that you can buy in Beauty supplys is Bohyme. It comes in all types of textures and colors. I have a very diverse clientel that ranges from, white, asian, black and mid-eastern.... and yes they all want extentions and this hair comes in all thoses textures!! Beauty one on roosevelt has them all!! The staff is friendly and knows me by name!! Even on days that I am too busy to go with my clients all I have to do is call and tell them what I need and they will have it waiting at the counter for my client!! So if you want  long lasting hair without paying online hair prices beauty one is your store.... And if you want it put in Hair By Danyel is your girl!! I am also located in the south loop 1518 S. Wabash 312-404-0853 or just pick up one of my cards at Beatuy One!!

6.description: Staff is generally neutral or friendly. Wide range of wig/hair, hair styling, hair accessorizing, nail polish/care, and skin moisturizing products. Prices are very affordable.

0.description: After receiving horrible service at 2 other beauty supply places, we stumbled across this one. They have a nice collection of wigs and hair products. The sales staff is very knowledgeable, friendly and go out of their way to find wigs that are suited to you.  A sign says that you can only try on 3 wigs for each wig cap you purchase but they'll waive that if you show you're a serious shopper.  I had only intended to buy 1 wig but came out with 3 plus some hair products!  They have a discount club after your first purchase that will give you 5% off future purchases.  Though I easily found street parking, I'm told that there is a parking lot in the rear of the store.I highly recommend this place!

4.description: This place is excellent. There is a great selection of hair extensions and products. The prices are reasonable, the staff is very friendly! I'm so glad this place is in the South Loop!

3.description: Great location/selection.  Need more cashiers!

1.description: I can always go to this location find my cute stylish jewelry and casual wear. Only disappointment is long lines and wait NO cashiers it's so frustrating.

2.description: I would always recommend a BCF in the suburbs.  They are always pretty unorganized in certain departments, but the city store, especially on the south side, is tough to deal with.Of course they always have great deals though.

0.description: I went to Burlington Coat Factory for the first time this weekend at the recommendation of a close friend, and it was a good recommendation.This store is clean, well laid out, has good fitting rooms, has clothing nicely arranged on the hangers, and is pretty cheap.I was very impressed with this store and will likely be back!

4.description: This was my 1st experience with BCF and I must say I am PLEASED because I got a chance to reacquaint myself with the world of LAYAWAY! I found 2 very cute summer dresses for 30 bucks that are SO Carrie Bradshaw that it made me cringe (in a GOOD way)! The prices are cheap, the selection large and the store clean. Also, honorable mention to the store entertainment. 2 chicks tried to shoplift and were promptly caught! Dumb people getting arrested amuses me!

0.description: I came here again on Thursday to pick up some bulbs for the house and I think this will be the location I'll be coming to because the location on 87th and the Dan Ryan has gotten way too ghetto with the store being constantly messy with stuff all over the floor and being overrun with boxes all over the store with things that should be on shelves not in the middle of store aisles. This location is a lot cleaner and less congested and you can at least get cold food items as well, but it would be nice if Dollar tree got breakfast food items made of turkey since they sell too many items that contain pork and not everyone eats pork products. Either way it's better in terms of cleanliness and having items in stock.

1.description: Went here on a Sunday  for Lunch with 3 other people. There was no other people in the dining room. The staff was super friendly and kind. Our water was delivered to the table very quickly, as well as our coffees.The food took  FOREVER. We purchased 2 turkey chop dinners, 1 smothered chicken dinner and 1 burger. The turkey chops were dry and tasteless. The greens were tough and flavorless, the macaroni and cheese was gummy and flavorless and the dressing and sweet potatoes were  basic and not something I would purchase from a restaurant. The burger was decent and the coffee was great. Our bill was $48 dollars for 4 people. OVERPRICED and bland soul food. Don't waste your money or time. Tips for the owners of this restaurant: add garlic, real onions, smoked turkey, butter. Experiment and please taste your food before you send it out. You don't want to be basic, you want to be exceptional.

0.description: Yassa is temporairly relocated to Luversia's. The food was absolutely delicious. Was Ble to meet the owners also. My fiance got the beef, chicken and seafood soup. I got the chicken kabobs. Spicy and amazing. I want some more Nem eggrolls.

12.description: got there when they opened cuz I know this place can get crowded.  was welcomed by the entire staff when walking in.  5 pairs of shoes for $150 including tax.......YUP, I'm happy!  and I avoided the typical big crowd that usually is here.

3.description: I come here because they have a wide variety of Nike's and air Jordan shoes for me and my family. They keep the store organized and stocked with plenty of shoes that you can't really find anywhere else.

1.description: Customer Service is terrible....no professionalism! You will sit on the phone being passed around from person to person waiting on a simple yes or no answer of whether a sneaker was in stock at their location. I could have driven to the location to find out for myself by the time they gave me the answer over the phone. Ridiculous...Good customer service does not exist anymore!

2.description: I have been in this store more then I can count on my hand. Friday November 21st I went in with my baby sister to make an exchange. I wont bore you with all the problems on why I was nervous making the exchange, But a young lady at the counter by the name of "Angela" greeted us with a smile welcomed us, also Angela asked us How can she help? and truly meant it from the time we walked through the door to us just seamlessly looking for clothes this young lady made sure we were attended to. I felt like we had her undivided attention even when she got a bit busy. I have received great service from this store but this one really stuck out to me. I am a Front Office manager at a downtown Hotel so service is everything to me. I believe this store is located in a place where bad service is expected but I want to let you all know this location is an exception.KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK!I noticed.

9.description: I went to this is location Friday March /13/15 12:51pm it is very unpleasant. There were plenty of problems. 1. It's a pretty big sized store & they only have 1 bathroom which someone has to unlock the door for you, when it's unlock there's another door which has a line extended to the employees work room. 2nd while in line the manager was having a vulgar argument with a customer. She was using explicit language &told her well take her a** back to her downtown location she speaks highly of then. It was very unprofessional and embarrassing that a manager can't conduct herself better than that. 3rd when I made a purchase the associate was on the phone not paying attention.I swiped my credit card she asked for id I didn't have it however my signature was on the back of the card. Whenever you have a Signature on the back certified stores don't ask for identification however they did. The employee called the manager who was next to her to cancel the transaction however since I swiped she couldn't cancel. The manager yelled at her in front of everyone customers and employees. The staff is unprofessional they never offer help. Terrible establishment managers and customer service l wouldn't travel to this store again. Very disappointing I hope a district manager would talk to the manager and staff how to conduct a business and the manager set a good example for her employees.

10.description: The selection of shoes are decent, you will be able to find "something" however the check out line is ridiculous.  You will be in line for a minute to check-out, the line moves but it is what it is, I guess.  The employees are half-way friendly but most are young adults just there to work with nothing extra.

4.description: Grabbing a pair of shoes for my 5 year old niece in which the prices are pretty reasonable. Outlet store prices with some higher ones also but only for newer shoes in men sizes. Not bad though, I would recommend.

6.description: Where do I start........As fan of Nike like many others are there is a lack of professionalism and level of honesty at this nike factory location. When a rare Retro jordan V grape is stocked at the store I clearly showed interest in purchasing and asked the male associate if the had any size 10.5 left and right away said NO as I asked what sizes where available instead of answering my question he asked me what sizes am I looking for and as I mentioned 2 other sizes he said they are sold and all they had was 12 so I said ok thanks. What drew me to write a review is when 20minutes later two acquaintances of the associate walked up and was immediately handed 2 10.5. Clearly this place just does business with friends and family and this wasn't the first time this has happened. Nike if your reading this something has to change.All in all don't waste your time with this store unless you know the employees.

15.description: The worst location ever. The lines are always long and the service is beyond ghetto. I was there Saturday 4-13-2013 at 1:50 pm - after standing in line, I get to register and get the worst cashier in the world LaKisha Harris op# 145613. RUDE RUDE RUDE RUDE. Asked her to place gift card in trash to avoid litter. She refused. told me this ain't my store. The managers Debbie Sanchez and Roberto Castellanos are both dumb as rocks.

0.description: I'm not usually in the area to stop through here, but I had been searching for new workout shoes for a while and hadn't lucked out yet. I really wanted a pair of Nikes too, so I hoped the Factory Store would be a winner. I took my time and literally walked down every single aisle of men's and women's shoes (since I wear both). I tried on pair after pair in the men's section but didn't find anything that worked. I did however find a pair of 2013 Hyperdunks in my size on super sale! I like the fit of the 2013s better than the 2014s and wasn't pressed enough to wait and see what the 2015s look like. They were on clearance at a cheap price already plus I got another 20% off! Moving on to the women's section, I really hoped I could find my workout shoes because those were my immediate need. Again, I tried on shoe after shoe and in what seemed like the last row I finally found them. There were also on sale... not clearance... but still, half the price I had expected to pay. For my basketball and workout shoes combined, I paid less than I expected for just one pair. I didn't come here looking for this exact shoe in this exact color... I would assume it would be much harder to shop here if that were the case, but if you're looking for a deal on great pair of Nikes I'd definitely check it out. The Factory Store has a wide selection.I can't speak about the customer service too much. Although I was there for a long time, I was only approached maybe twice to see if I needed help... which I didn't. I was perfectly fine with that level of assistance and there were a ton of folks around ready to help I'm sure if I needed them.

5.description: Its an outlet so I kept my expectations low and my standards high.  Its Nike so that standards were there, especially when they explained that the soles on the vintage looking suede hightops were supposed to be yellowed.  I needed a pair of trainers specifically a 5.0 and I found them,  and while I am not so crazy about the color they will do the job for a gym membership that I just got.  4 stars only because after being in there for 40 mins I was asked did I need help.  Not a big deal.  Line was long but they move it fast.  I would not go during Christmas. Hectic I'm sure.

13.description: I love this store...it's in a decent location, friendly people, gr8 selection...and CHEAP! Yes; some of the products are slightly older..but this is an outlet store. They are genuine Nikki products. What more can you ask for? They even have sales on discounted items. I go as often as I can afford. GR8 bargins!

11.description: 2 tills empty on a busy Saturday.  No excuse for the length if time to check out!  On a brighter side they do have a nice selection

8.description: The prices are great for older season models. Air Max 95s from more than two years ago are in abundance on the shelves. Sweatshirts that were once $200 are marked down to $49.99. Great deals on great quality products! and to top it all off; PROCEEDS FROM THE STORE ARE REINVESTED INTO THE COMMUNITY!!

14.description: Hit or miss selection.  At times they have really nice discounts on hard to find shoes.  Check out lines move slow.

7.description: I came here looking for some cheap brand name workout shoes and that's exactly what I found. I bought a pair of Nike running shoes for $35-40. I did notice that a lot of the shoes here were atleast $60-109 which I think is crazy considering the shoes are older versions and you can spend that amount of money at say, Footlocker and get something better. The selection for females wearing sizes 9.5 and above suck, and there aren't too many cheaper choices for males either. My boyfriend had a hard time finding something he liked. A small gym bag still runs around $45 here.I would probably return but with Footlocker around the corner, this wouldn't be my first choice.

1.description: I am going to keep it real because I stopped here today to get my favorite treat of fries and their honey butter biscuits. The service is very slow when hoodrats arent piling into the place and they're friendly don't get me wrong, but people shouldnt have to deal with slow service in the drive thru. I also noticed a change in staff too because the last time I was there they had those young a** girls working there who looked like they're working to pay for their weekly hair  and nail appointments and false eyelash revisions. Overall, the food is actually decent when they make it fresh and not having it sitting under a heating lamp for several minutes. Still the slow service is why this place gets one star.

0.description: What? - Nobody's reviewed the Church's Chicken at 79th & the Ryan yet?Well, gee golly, I tell ya it's a heckava place. Just the friendliest of folks this side of home.And the poultry's pretty good too.

3.description: Use the copy center not bad pricing over other copy centers... Other wise they are a lil pricy...

1.description: I frequent this location for print services and office supplies. I have nothing but good things to say about them. They typically speak when you walk in and are prompt in asking if you need assistance. Sometimes it may be difficult to find help, but that is true of many places as of late. The printing/copy employees are extremely helpful and accommodating, making sure you get the best bang for your buck. They messed up my order a couple of weeks ago, but corrected it promptly and even gave me the additional poster (I wanted mounted board, not paper poster) they originally printed at no cost.

2.description: I had come to Staples to purchase a multi-purpose table to use in my basement and when I was checking out the cashier who's name was Shawnta(with a name like that reads HOODRAT) had this nasty attitude. I dropped my card and proceeded to pick it up and she said  to me "Ma'am she's talking to you"-referring to her co-worker who helped me with finding the table, but it's the tone and the way she said it that made me really look at how unprofessional African-Americans behave on the job. I am appalled that blacks have such nasty attitudes on the job and what many don't see is that they're one step away from being jobless and having someone who is serious about working in their position. I am going to do the survey and actually rate customer service as sucky because Janet who was the employee who helped me was the only one who was polite to me versus the b*tch who was checking me out. If you're a pro with shopping at Staples you will have no problem shopping here since some of the workers are not helpful anyway and you'll find what you need unless you have to flag someone down to help you and even then you wonder if they know where half the stuff is in the store.

0.description: I came to this location for a bluetooth speaker because of the large variety of displays. I was surprised that many of them are much smaller than the photos on many sites advertisements.I came in for one but because of Natalie the Manager customer service skills I purchased three which is what I really needed.This location has good customer serviceI have received not so good customer service at the Cicero location

3.description: I was in desperate need of hair attention and I took a chance and made an appointment with Toccara.  My appointment was scheduled for very early in the morning and everyone arrived at essentially the same time.  After a consultation, my previous sew-in was removed, my hair washed - no massaged actually - and conditioned and prepared for a new weave.  My in-chair time was approximately three hours - which is fabulous and I am still receiving rave reviews on my new style and color.The salon is neat and clean and the customers and stylists were warm and friendly.  I highly recommend the experience and I will return and provide additional referrals!

1.description: This place is HORRIBLE! I went here before because someone told me about them. (never again.) First when the one girl shampooed my hair she had THE WORST ATTITUDE! Then the lady who was gonna style my hair told me she was leaving to make a run so I had to wait. 2 FREAKING HOURS!!!! How unprofessional can these chicks be.. Ugh ghetto nasty trash. If I could give zero stars I would have.!

2.description: If I can rate this salon a ZERO then I would do just that. I was a client of Lauren. This has to be the most unprofessional salon I've ever been to in my life. When I came in I was not greeted by anyone in the shop, instead I was mean mugged and Lauren said "Who you here for? Lauren?" Like I didn't just get off the phone with her or she wasn't referring to herself. As I purchased an expensive silk base closure from Tocarra (the owner) she would not accept my visa debit card! Throughout the salon there are signs posted for them accepting major credit/debit cards. The neighborhood is already bad. She made me walk to the nearest gas station to use the ATM to take out $450 for my full service. So I go back to the salon. Lauren wash my hair and put me under the dryer then she goes to the beauty supply store for herself. What kind of stylist leave their client in a salon alone? After she blow dry my hair she asked another stylist (Shaynah) to braid and prep me for a sew-in. I was confused as to what was going on because Shaynah sat on Facebook for 15 minutes before she got up to start on my braids. After she finished only 3 braids. The owner called a staff meeting! In the process of getting my hair done there was a meeting called? That's was yet again UNPROFESSIONAL. That should have happened before the salon opened or after the closed. The meeting was well over an hour. I was ready to get up and walk out of the salon. Which now, I regret that I did not do it. Lauren does okay hair but she did my sew-in too tight. She pulled and was very rough with my hair. I had to take ibuprofen for the pain for about 3 days. Overall, I was at this salon for almost 4 hours for a simple sew-in that shouldn't have even taken half of that time. For $450, I did not receive a thank you or even a sample to help maintain my weave. I asked Lauren to wand curl my hair and she had the audacity to want to charge me extra money. I would NEVER recommend this salon to no one. Now I see why this salon always have open appointments. I will never go back to this place. This place falls under the stereotypical black business's..... UNPROFESSIONAL and GHETTO!

5.description: This hair salon is horrible. The stylists are rude, the whole place is dirty, and the owner didn't even do a good job on my hair. I would not recommend this hair salon to nobody.

6.description: I came from the far north side of Chicago to get my hair done at this place. The salon is very neat and modern and very clean. The only caveat is some of the beauticians have nasty ghetto attitudes, even down to the shampoo lady. I had gotten my first overlay (or bonded extensions) and didn't know I was supposed to bring a wig cap. Why did I forget that?! Then the beautician cut my hair a lot shorter than I expected, she got irritated because I was reading a hair magazine, was irritated about the hair I used, and got so irritated about me asking about using a blow dryer with the bond that she pulled (more like tugged) the extensions to 'show' they won't be coming out. Although she gave me a great look, I will not go back because the women's attitudes there were just that bad!  I still tipped them, and I was a very professional client, but too bad my stylists weren't!!

0.description: Yeah it's me again and I'm still coming here...why? Well I haven't been to a shop where everyone in their can do hair and do it very well when you come out the chair looking like a natural star I looooove getting sew ins here, as for the other reviews I never received any bad service here but my advice for any complaints of a business is to let the person who is doing your hair know she is doing something that you don't like and if that don't work let the manager know nicely. But I love my hair it's soft bouncy and natural looking people kept asking me how I grew my hair that long I said Bobbi boss remi! Deja vu always have my hair looking fly!!! Now a few lessons in salon etiquette:1. Make an appointment, remember who you spoke to when you made the appointment and show up. If you can't make the appointment or you are going to be late give the stylist the courtesy of a phone call at least a day before or 2 hrs before you know u aren't coming or goof to be late. The stylist is taking her time out to wait a provide a service for u respect the stylist.2. Tipping- tip your stylist and shampoo girl why the shampoo girl because she made your hair feel good massaging the shampoo into your scalp, taking down the braids and extensions come on show your appreciation and tip. Tip your stylist because she did a nice ass job your not cheap with other things so why be cheap with your hair?3. Come in with an idea or picture of how you want your hair, stylist are artist but not mind readers!!! Before the stylist cut make sure that's what you want if something hurts or is too tight let them know, advice with extensions if your used to a brand you like get it but if you don't know about extensions or want to try something new call the stylist before your appointment because the quality of hair is important in achieving a beautiful style if you need to know where to get good hair online message me.Other then that I had my hair done by toccara the owner and Tara they are cold in what they do check them out cause they do it all 4 real!

4.description: I only go here if I am ass out.. It's ratchet, unprofessional, they talk about all the clients when they leave.. And whenever I go I must clear my schedule cause it's gonna be all day for whatever

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

0.description: Don't support this place they crooks they don't like blacks . They don't hire from our community .please don't shop here

1.description: One of the best natural hair care salons in Chicago. Ask for Jean, Alma or Cat. This team of hair artistry are reliable, friendly, professional and fast.  I'm never in the salon more than 2 hours. Jean is my loc specialists.  I have been his client for over 3 years.  My hair is vibrant, strong and healthy.  They give the best holiday nd anniversary parties.  Yummy drinks, yummy food and sexxy fun!

0.description: I love my cousins shop, it is very relaxing whenever I go there to get my locs done! I wouldn't go any where else. If you need your locs done and in done in a peaceful environment, go to Misunderstood Natural Hair Salon! Let's go!

12.description: Service is horrible! The Associates would rather be rude and make everything a hassle for you then actually go out of their way to help you. While an associate gave us attitude and offered no solutions to fix her mistake the manager stood there, watched it happen and never said a word. Her mistake was our problem. Go to Home Depot instead!!!

7.description: Buy an appliance and they'll tell you it's three days to install.  Their contracted installers apparently call the shots and will tell you it's 1.5 weeks instead.  And the store will do nothing about it except issue you a refund when you give up.  Stay away.

19.description: I purchased Levolor wood blinds from this location. I was returning to have them cut down more to fit my kitchen window. My contractor and I entered the store at approximately 2:05PM on Friday 3/23/12.  At the customer service desk we asked for someone to cut the blinds. We were directed to Home Decor.
