My contractor sat down at the desk to wait and I walked around. At about 2:15PM I returned to the Home Decor area and he was still waiting. We asked an associate who could assist us and we were told he would call someone. At 2:25PM still no one came to cut the blind. I went back to a cashier and requested a manager.  I told him how long we had been waiting he called someone. Finally at about 2:40PM someone came to cut my blinds.  Not once did any of the associates seeing us waiting or sitting ask if we needed help. The customer service at this location is well below acceptable.

1.description: I can't stand poor customer service! Nothing burns me up more than spending my hard earned money on a service or product and the company acts like they can care less.  This review is for a problem my dear mother is going thru with lowe's currently.  She purchased a dryer on January 16, 2015.  As of today January 25th and entire 9 days later Lowe's still hasn't installed her dryer! They first gave her a delivery date of 1/17/16 but called to say the delivery truck broke down and had to reschedule. Next they come by 1/18 and deliver the dryer but claim they can't hook it up. How pathetic is that! You're going to bring my product late but then don't have the skills to install it, ARE YOU KIDDING ME! Next can you believe they couldn't set it up because the store sold her the wrong cord for the dryer. Now my mother didn't just walk in there and pick one out on random.  They actually gave her what she needed, but IT WAS THE WRONG THING! So all last week we have been waiting around for them to come. Everyday we call, the manager says oh yeah we're coming out today, and NOTHING! This went on for a week mind you!  Now if I had to miss work and wait on these jokers i would be even more pissed, but luckily I didn't.  I think my mother deserves a credit or a free dryer or something.  THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  WORST STORE, WORST COMPANY EVER.  We are going to go back to getting our appliances from Sears or Home Depot. Lowes is a joke!

2.description: Was at a Lowe's in the burbs and special ordered an oval shower curtain rod which was delivered to our door a week later. It disappointingly turned out to be an over priced flimsy product, so i took it to the store on 83rd for a return. The manager told me that i would have to go back to the store i purchased it from. Needless to say the conversation went south from there, i kept emphasizing the fact that both stores are the same store in that they are both Lowe's to which he kept replying that they were two distinctively different stores. I dug my heels in the ground and said i wasn't leaving until he at least gave me a store credit which he eventually reluctantly did. As for the rest of the store's personnel they have all been great, which is why i keep coming back. Whereas everyone i've ever encountered at the Home Depot on 87th act as if they'd rather be somewhere else.

9.description: I am in the middle road about this store. I shop here because I will never ever shop at the HD in the next parking lot over because of  their horrible customer service. But I went to purchase some carpet here and was told that the associate who cuts the carpet would not be for another 2 hours. Therefore telling me that I had to wait which was a joke and after a few choice words someone was ultimately located to cut my carpet as requested. I assumed that cross training was something that this store did not do because a customer should never have to wait for an employee to come into work to obtain service.

6.description: The customer service is really really bad there. I purchased the washer and dryer online, and get the hookup service from this local store, then there is sth wrong with the installation for the washing machine. I called for customer care and local store manager for so many times continuously for two days. There is no response or callback as promised. I felt extremely disappointed with my first purchase from LOWES. Finally, I call the LOWES customer care 1-800-445-6937 for complaint, and spoke a really nice lady fortunately, helping me out in the end.......

18.description: I cannot give them more then 3 stars because although the people there are friendly, try finding them when you need help...nearly impossible!!! I cannot believe that every associate is that busy that they aren't visible on the floor and if you do happen to catch a glimpse of a cust serv person, you literally have to run full speed to catch them. Now here is the kicker, when you catch them, they may or may not have the actually knowledge needed to help you which inevitably ends in a statement similar to "Um, I just started, let me find someone who can help you"...HUH!!!!!!

10.description: I got the help I needed immediately. That is very important to me. I had a question about square footage and the cost of the tile I was interested in, the young man took out his calculator and helped without question or concern. I wish I got his name, I'll be back to buy my supplies here for sure. My only con is price, in the tile world they are on the higher end.

13.description: Man oh man, what have I been missing?   It's a sure bet that when I walk into a Home Depot, the first cart that I grab will go CLANK CLANK CLANK as soon as I start rolling it, it never fails.  Why can't Home Depot fix those raggedy ass carts that they give us access to?   I digress...   As of late Lowes has done a number on me with their customer service and their friendly staff.  This store is quietly nestled behind Home Depot on the south side.  The store is clean and the Associates appear to work hard and are very helpful.  That's all I ask for  when I go to these Home Improvement Stores, just give me someone that can help me and then let me the hell out of there.  Lowes stole my loyalty to Home Depot, it's up to them to keep it.

17.description: If you go to Homie Depot instead of Lowe's.....you're a dummy. Here the associates actually help you because they have (gasp) product knowledge. There is absolutely no reason to spend your money with people who act like you're disturbing them or like they're doing you a favor by doing their JOB...take your money where it's appreciated.

15.description: Great customer service... Hands down better than that other " home improvment" store!!! Clean and neat at all times... People actually help and know what they speak of... And if they don't they will get someone who does without a 20 minute wait

0.description: We recently purchased several major appliances from this location: gas stove, LG washer and dryer.  We had no problems with delivery and installation with the exception of the gas stove which was missing a separate item ordered but not delivered so we just went ahead and used the existing metal tubing and got a refund from the store (by phone.)  They do seem to be short on staff at times, but everyone we have dealt with have been friendly and helpful.

5.description: I thought Lowes would be better than Home Depot, but it is filled with incompetent managers and employees who hate their jobs. I ordered an installation for my gutters and one month later still no gutters. They use only one contract installer for their installations. Of course, the installer's customer service suffers for this. There is no communication between installer and customers so you sit and wait hoping they show up. They didn't after three chances. I just asked for my refund. Many of these business on the south side treat their customers with sub par service. Start complaining and demand better. Now I will be going to a home improvement store up north where most likely I will have better service.

11.description: Slow service. No one was at the front to greet or direct me.  Then I had to wait about 20 minutes to get my lumber cut. They need to train more people on the lumber cutting tool.

8.description: Less crowded than Home Depot. Same paint colors.

3.description: The worst customer in the whole USA the Lowes at 83rd s.Holland Chicago 60620. The manager of that store need to be fired. They treat black customers like garbage.

14.description: If you're ever in need of a home appliance, ask for Nicole at the Holland Rd store in Chicago.  She is a rock star!  She exemplifies the best of the best in customer service and product knowledge. She is hands down the person to talk to if you've got a question about an appliance, customer feedback and product features.  Thank you Nicole for exceeding my expectations!

4.description: The one star is for their Customer Service department.  I went in there to pick up an online order, and I literally waited in line for 20 minutes with one person ahead of me and 3 people behind the counter!  Finally after about 15 minutes, the one that came over (Kayla) gave me a blank look and told me that somebody else would help me!  Then she walked away.If I hadn't already placed my order online and received a $15 discount, I would've walked out!

1.description: Like the original poster had mentioned this place seems like a circus with panhandlers coming in and out of the store. I came in to change cell phones after having been with TMobile for 6 years and wanted a change. I walked in and the girls working behind the counter were laughing and joking around. That to me is unacceptable and unprofessional and there is no reason for staff to greet customers like they're hanging with friends. Also what bothers me is why is it when you walk into phone stores on the south side they're dirty. I also was asked if I wanted a case for my phone and when i got a look at the prices I told her no thanks and would be looking elsewhere. I am not impressed that a guy approached me while I was waiting on my phone trying to sell me some bootleg movies. Either way I would only find it convenient for paying a bill since it's down the street from my house, but look at other Boost locations for service since they need to stop the berage of homeless and ghetto trash from coming up in the store. Hood idiots don't know that the store is a place of business not a social club.

2.description: Surprised that no one has rated this location, because service and products are bad. The owner sits in the background and seems to enjoy watching the circus of panhandlers, street vendors and unsavory people that hang in fornt of this place and even inside. Nevertheless, once you get past the circus and try to purchase a phone or pay your bill you have to deal with a poorly trained very young staff that greets you with whats up man or dude every single time. This place is very unprofessional and they invent upcharges for basic services which seems pretty shadey. If you are a tween or teen hip hop wannabe then this poor excuse of a business is for you. Shame on Sprint for allowing this mess of a store. Myself and family have upgraded!!

0.description: At least this Boost Mobile location doesn't over charge the customers. I would rather pay $43 vs having to pay $47 at the Boost Mobile locations in the Bronzeville area aka Low End.

3.description: I place orders through the Pizza Hut website sometimes days in advance.  Yet the pizza is delivered 1-2 hours past the requested delivery time.  What really upsets me is that when I call the manager tells me the order just left.  I'm less than 10 minutes away.  No apologies offered only that they are busy.   The corporate customer service takes several weeks to respond to complaints and then only after my calling back multiple times.  The pizza itself was much better when I first started ordering after moving here.  Funny, when I had a car and could pick up the pizza it was better.  They don't seem to understand the request for extra sauce.  Pizza is ho-hum.  Better off getting a frozen pizza.  P.S. No dine-in; small parking lot shared with other small stores.

1.description: Store number 026165  at 7229 s Figueroa st  .....O.M.G. !!!  the worst customer service ever .....I ordered a pizza online and went to pick it up , they gave me two pizzas and no pepperoni .....ok !! I paid for it and checked it out , took it back to the man and said I want pepperoni please , they said I ordered it like that , sorry , so I said let me talk to someone in charge here comes Daniela telling me , it'll be extra , ok I said.she says 12 more from my already paid 25 , I said I'm not paying more , she said , then u don't get a pizza, or I'll take the one u have and recook it but it'll be burnt , and I spent the next 5 minutes fighting with this chick , horrible experience with three kids waiting for food , pizza hut  please do something  , or train your employees better, one star because I still love the pizza

2.description: Horrible they gave me burnt cheese sticks I opened the box to  touch them to see if they were as hard as they look, yes they were. Okay after I touched them a few things went wrong. First,  she didn't want to give me my money back . Second she PUT THEM IN THE WARMER. So the food that I poked with my fingers Is going to be sold to another customer Eww....  Bad customer service!

5.description: I ordered from them on the day of the Super Bowl online and the stupid part was that when I had gone to pick up the pizzas I ordered they had a line of folks there waiting on orders they called in or placed online. Not only are they slow, but it seems as if they don't keep orders straight and giving customers excuses when their order isnt fully ready. They have a problem with knowing how to accurately take orders and have them ready for customers to pick up when they place the order online or over the phone. There is no reason for a customer who pre-ordered having to wait on the second half of their order because the people taking the orders couldnt have stuff made on time as promised when the order was first placed. I am surprised this location is still in buisness with the way they do things because I've eaten at Pizza Hut and got better service at other locations than this one.

6.description: They misdelivered a pizza and never corrected. I complained and never received a response from mgmt.I used to order Pizza online but never again from Pizza Hut.

7.description: Never, again, dammit! I hate to bitch but I am so turned off from this location and its surroundings.  I have not reached my boiling point with them nor will I give them the satisfaction of getting me there.

8.description: I ordered a pizza online, it was a supreme with changes. It was listed as coming with pepperoni, Italian sausage, mushrooms, green peppers, and onions. I changed the ingredients to double pepperoni, bacon pieces, onions, green peppers, and extra cheese. So I basically removed the mushrooms and sausage. When the pizza came, and hour late, it was wrong. It still had sausage. The delivery guy, who yelled at me because he called my cell phone but I didn't hear it cause I was expecting the bell which he never rang, said to call the store. I did and they put me on hold for 15 mins. Then the girl tried to re-take the order, then came back on to tell me that I had ordered wrong. She said that the supreme comes with sausage no matter what AND that I did not remove it. But was on my receipt with NO SAUSAGE. When I argued she said she would remake it but because I was wrong I would have to wait another hour at least.Not right, I have the damn receipt! They are wrong. Just admit it! And people wonder why I don't want to call the damn store! Cause people act like bastards.

0.description: I can't count how many times I've ordered a pizza online and get a call from the store 10 minutes later that says that the store is out of regular dough but I can get a thin crust pizza instead. Uhhhh no.I am 90% sure that one of the delivery men is a crackhead. Seriously. On a recent delivery, an hour past the estimated delivery time, I decided to call the store. The guy who answered said they don't know where he is and he should have been at my house by now. This old ass, gangly, dude shows up on my porch later, scratching his arm, talking about a guy getting shot, police, a huge roadblock, and running out of garlic dipping sauce before handing me a room temperature pizza....With that said, it's a large pizza for $10 and most of the time it tastes good.

4.description: An hour and 45 minutes after ordering wings and cheese sticks, I called to cancel my order (after already calling a few times to see where it was).. All the guy said was "aight" and I hung up. 15 minutes later, the driver called and said he was outside. I explained to him that I cancelled the order cuz I'm not paying for and eating cold food. He told me he had just pulled it out of the oven. What I want to know then is why it took an hour and a half to even put my food in the oven. Good thing I don't live over here cuz I would never order from here again. At least the one by my place gives credits when they mess up. Can you give zero stars?

1.description: They food is so horrible I bought to dinners today and the cabbage wasn't done. The rice was burnt and hard along with chicken being burnt cold and old. I wouldn't even feed my dog that garbage . $25.13 down the drain

9.description: This place is back up and running better than ever. .. new decor very eclectic mixed with caribbean flavor. New staff with great attitude.

23.description: I absolutely LOVE the food here; however, the service is a whole other story.  I frequently eat the catfish and mac and cheese.  The sauce is the BOMB!!!  But, back to the service.  Sucks, Sucks, Sucks!!!!!!!  They never have wings, which drives my husband crazy.  He's like how do you sell chicken and not have wings.  They are slow, slow and slow.  I called an order in the other day they said 20 minutes, got there in 30 minutes and still had to wait 15 minutes.  If you are looking for great jerk chicken or fish, this is your place, but be prepared to be pissed off by the non chalant attitudes of the people there or the slow service

5.description: I like the food but damn.. I havent eaten here in months because the phone just rings and rings

25.description: Finding myself on the south side today (an unusual occurence), I realized it was the perfect chance to try Uncle Joe's. Excellent jerk chicken! Moist, flavorful, generous portion with delicious rice & beans (although they call it rice & peas) and a slice of bread. I chose mac & cheese as my side, and it was not good at all. But it also wasn't necessary - this was a large enough lunch without it.If the closest you normally get to the south side is a Sox game, never fear - this place is on a major street and easy to find & park near. They appear to have minimal staff - one cook and one waitress. So don't expect four star service.

12.description: Terrible service and even worse food. A co worker had been on my back for years about this place "Girl you need to try them." Its my fault because I trusted her. I knew that I was dangerously in love with Maxines. "Oh girl, this place is much better than Maxines".... That was a damn lie! An old, VERY rude, impatient, old man took mines and the bf's order. I got jerked shrimp, rice and peas and a store bought beef pattie. My bf specifically asked that his jerked cat not include tails. The old man told him rudely  "too bad because fish come wit tails, what  ya wan me to do wit em?" wow. WOW.I forget how many shrimp were to come with my meal, I just remember I didn't have all the shrimp that I paid for. I guess they substituted the missing shrimp for what looked to me like a pube! Thats right! a public hair! It could've just been a regular old nappy piece of hair lol, but it was still nasty.My bf was given his jerk cat, tails included, even though fish only have 1 tail each, and here I was with "jerked" shrimp and naps. Sadly I didn't realize that I had hair in my food until I got all the way home to 43rd. I jumped on the phone and called them. The old man answered, I told him I was just there, I didnt have all my shrimp and there was a piece of hair in my food. To say he went off is an understatement. "Waaahh yah wan mi ti do?!!!!!!!!!!!!" Here was his proposition. He told me to come back, bring the food and he would remove the piece of hair. No. I'm not lying. I asked well what about the shrimp you shorted me? He told me he would give me 2 shrimp for my trouble. lol Sometimes you're willing to deal with unsavory service for great food but this place is not worth trouble at all. Don't go here if you like good jamaican.

21.description: Just the jerk chicken please!I am yet to find a better place in Chicago to get jerk chicken than Uncle Joe's, and I've been a fan  for just over three years.  While the attitude or service may be less than ideal, and because I only do carry-out, I'll suffer it to get my jerk chicken anytime. The chicken is moist and infused with charcoal smoke. The spicy jerk sauce that accompanies it make my every trip from Humbodt Park to Chatham rewarding.

16.description: Great jerk chicken but HORRIBLE customer service! These people open when they feel like it. Also, if you phone in your order it probably won't be ready when you pick it up.

17.description: Uncle Joe's makes some of the best Jamaican Jerk around...    Also unlike some other places, the place isn't scary to go into, and I don't feel bad parking my car outside.The jerk chicken is excellent.  Smokey, crispy, and moist all at the same time.  I've had jerk catfish and found that to be just as good, if not better than the chicken.  There are a lot of bones to pick through, but its well worth it.  They have curried goat, too, which is pretty good but not my favorite thing.The sauce they give you on the side is great, though it can be super spicey so have drinks on standby!You can order the chicken as a dinner or whole birds.. The whole chicken might be a better deal.  The sides are slightly lacking (you get a choice of some sort of cabbage...  or regular salad.  go with the cabbage.  and they give you tons of rice too).I've been in a few times when the places was loaded with cops eating.  Any place where the cops go out of their way to meet at must have good food, right?You can dine in at a table, eat at the counter, or take carry out.  Very strangely, they add a surcharge on for all dine in orders.  I've noticed people ordering to go then eating at the counter--what people will do to save 25 cents can be amazing!  But its a strange policy anyway...

10.description: Been here a couple of times and ordered the food for pickup. I usually just order the jerk chicken lunch. It comes with a plantain, cabbage, rice, bread and 1/4 chicken. The chicken is very good and the sauce that they give to eat with the chicken is delicious as well. I have yet to try other things on the menu, but so far, the food is pretty good. The portions are big and is decently priced.

11.description: Been here a several times over the last 6 years.  Pros: The food is great.  Some of the best jerk I have had in the city of Chicago.  The curried goat is my favorite.  But the jerk chicken, jerk red snapper, jerk shrimp, brown stew chicken, ox tails, etc. - it is all very, very good. The sides, i.e. - the steamed cabbage, rice and beans, plantains - also very, very good.  Cons:  Like many of the other reviewers have said, the customer service is horrible, especially in take out.  They are extremely and unapologetically rude, regularly run out of food, and can be extremely slow.  Dine-in has been a little better in my experience.  Tips:  Do not bother to call in an order, it WILL NOT be ready.  Also, as of 5/1/12, they are currently, temporarily closed.

26.description: Love it!!!  They have become my FAVORITE jerk chicken spots on the south side.  The chicken is always fresh and juicy, never dry like some of the other places.  Great peas and rice as well as plantains and the sauce is off the chain.  I mainly call in and just pick my food up and eat it at home, they always have it ready with little wait.  Also, if you love Jamaican OxTails...this is the place to get them.  When I am feeling extremely hungry I get the OxTail - jerk chicken combo.  Since I have moved from the area, I also like to go to the new location on 85th and Stony Island.

27.description: Uncle Joe's makes some of the best Jamaican Jerk around...    Also unlike some other places, the place isn't scary to go into, and I don't feel bad parking my car outside.The jerk chicken is excellent.  Smokey, crispy, and moist all at the same time.  I've had jerk catfish and found that to be just as good, if not better than the chicken.  There are a lot of bones to pick through, but its well worth it.  They have curried goat, too, which is pretty good but not my favorite thing.The sauce they give you on the side is great, though it can be super spicey so have drinks on standby!You can order the chicken as a dinner or whole birds.. The whole chicken might be a better deal.  The sides are slightly lacking (you get a choice of some sort of cabbage...  or regular salad.  go with the cabbage.  and they give you tons of rice too).I've been in a few times when the places was loaded with cops eating.  Any place where the cops go out of their way to meet at must have good food, right?You can dine in at a table, eat at the counter, or take carry out.  Very strangely, they add a surcharge on for all dine in orders.  I've noticed people ordering to go then eating at the counter--what people will do to save 25 cents can be amazing!  But its a strange policy anyway...

0.description: My favourite is the Oxtail and Jerk Chicken Combo with Plantain.

20.description: Out of all food, jerk chicken is at the top of my list.  Ahead of a perfectly done steak, I'd go for a brilliantly executed jerk chicken any day--and that should tell you something cause I love a good steak.Uncle Joe's is as brilliant as it gets.I come a long way to get jerk from Uncle Joe's, but its worth the trip every time. What you should know is yes, folk can have attitude in here on occassion. But something you also should understand is the people who work in here are probably subjected to some extremely ignorant folk on a daily, probably hourly basis.  When you work somewhere and deal with constant attitude, you probably quickly lose the niceness and stay on defense. I get it, so I don't lose sleep when I place my order and the girl behind the counter acts like I'm bothering her.  Just take my money, give me the correct change, and get me hooked up with my jerk and we're good.  This is one of few places for me where the product trumps the importance of the service--so much so, I'd be just fine not actually speaking to an employee in there and them not speaking to me. I'd be cool walking up in that piece and sliding a note to the cashier that says "This is an order. Please place an order of jerk in the bag..and dont forget my sauce."  It's that good.One other thing to note is that the set-up in here is a bit weird. You place your carry-out order from someone behind a bar, and everyone is sitting or standing there at the bar waiting. People basically just look at eachother for 15 minutes. While you wait, you get to witness bad service in action--but as long as they keep serving up that fire, I'm cool. Best jerk in the city.Good talk.

19.description: Some of the best jerk chicken you will find in the city. Like others have said, you do have to overlook the service, but the food is usually worth it. I have never eaten in the restaurant, only take out. And, I can't help but mention that the location on 86th and Stony tends to give you more food and can sometimes be a little bit faster. The jerk chicken, catfish, brown stew chicken and curry goat are all to die for!

2.description: We had to stand on line to be seated as if we were placing a take away order. No apologies from the FEMALE working the register. She asked where we would like to be seated to only tell us the booth is gonna be awhile before its cleaned BECAUSE SHE'S THE ONLY PERSON HERE, oh ok. I asked for a cola with my order, it NEVER came. All white meat FORGET ABOUT IT. She sets plates on the table as if nothing was wrong with our order. When we brought it to her attention she says "there's no more all white meat orders." Damn telling us these BEFORE the food was brought out to us. We DON'T eat dark meat. The oxtail gravy was sooooooo salty that a refill on the water would've been a delight. Nope, that wasn't gonna happen because she never came back during the meal. To make matters WORSE once she cleaned the other tables she placed the place mats on the seats (see pics). This is DEF my last time coming here!

18.description: Just the jerk chicken please!I am yet to find a better place in Chicago to get jerk chicken than Uncle Joe's, and I've been a fan  for just over three years.  While the attitude or service may be less than ideal, and because I only do carry-out, I'll suffer it to get my jerk chicken anytime. The chicken is moist and infused with charcoal smoke. The spicy jerk sauce that accompanies it make my every trip from Humbodt Park to Chatham rewarding.

13.description: Great Jerk Chicken and sides. The service may be bad but the food is heavenly. That's pretty much all I care about anyway.

4.description: I wanted to try something new or switch my usual spot up a bit. I road my bike here to pick up my order of the wing dinner with macaroni and cheese, Sweet potatoes, and a side of plantains. I had read many reviews that said the wings were good. The wings were very dry and it lacked taste. However , the sides were on point. The Mac and cheese was delicious and the plantains were warm and moist. I would like to try this place out again and hopefully, I can give a better rating.

24.description: Some of the best jerk chicken you will find in Chicago...that's all I have to say.

6.description: U haven't had excellent jerk chicken until you had Uncle Joe's  on 82nd cottage groove. Perfectly seasons,  taste great. You're won't be disappointed.

22.description: This is only 1 star because of the HORRRRIBLE service. Akeisha's review is 100% accurate. I got used to the crappy service that they gave, but the last time I went there was the LAST time. They treat the customers like they're the last Jamaicans on earth that can cook. The cashier girls were snapping off at each other about a short register, and then one of them got my order wrong. The kicker is that when I nicely told her that it was wrong, instead of me getting mad at her, she get's mad at me, and stomps off cursing!! I let her go back to that kitchen (probably to go spit on my food, lol), and me & my money went to the other location on 86th Stony Island.The other cashier saw what happened & was nice enough to chase behind me, but I told her they could keep it, and wanted to tell her to tell the other cashier what she could do with it too.Anyway, going here's not even worth it when the other location is 5 min. away, just as good, and the service is 100 times better.

15.description: The place has good food but they never have anything on the menu. They never have white chicken. How do you run a restaurant without food inventory? They should consider their customer's wants when completing inventory. I've walked out of this place several times because they are out of menu items. If you do not eat dark-meat this isnt the place for you.

7.description: Great food, great service, if you call in, the food is ready within 20 minutes. They have this great dish named rasta pasta, you must try it...spicy rotini in a jerk sauce with jerk chicken, onions, peppers and carrots, trust me you will try this and be back for more. Adding a pic of the jerk lobster tail, if you are a shellfish fan, this is a must try! I would not steer you wrong.

8.description: Came here with my Gf and was a bit skeptical about how the service and the food would be due to the mixed reviews.  Fortunately my worries quickly started to disappear as the aroma of food flooded my senses.  The service was great, our server was very accommodating.  The food was just WOW.  I've been to other jerk spots but they fall short of my expectations.  The food was delicious and the portions were more than I could handle.   Overall I left a very satisfied customer.

3.description: Just left here. Me and hubby had a lunch date. Food at Joes is always delicious as usual. Very flavorful and grilled to perfection. Great service, food was served from ordering to out table in less than 15 minutes. Will be returning.

14.description: Been hankerin' for some Caribbean food and for some reason, the only place that serves it in SoLo (but I'm not mentioning names), seems to think they don't have to answer their phone when I try to call in an order. Their flaky service is what sent me to Uncle Joe's in Hyde Park. The place came highly recommended and I was willing to make the trip. I think I may have inhaled the food, but from what I recall, I had the jerk wings (flavorful and crispy like I like 'em), the callilou and of course, the rice which was perfectly seasoned. I have to admit I have a thing for Ting so you absolutely must try the pink Ting. Tastes like pink grapefruit soda.Knockin' off a star for the following foolywangery:Service is sssslllllooooowwwww! I think we waited about 40 minutes for our order to go.Shame on them for not utilizing all the sidewalk space with tables and chairs for dining al fresco! They're sleeping on a business opportunity.To the robot that took our order....does it hurt you to crack a smile? It's not our fault you're stuck there on a Saturday night. Lose the stank attitude and get your customer service game up!

0.description: Tia, still the best stylist ever!

My nails came out ok, my eyebrows are uneven but my toes were don't excellent. They talk about you in their native language and the youngest women there who is not that young has an attitude out of this world, its like she doesn't want to crack a smile for anything. The older woman is nice and she is very welcoming. She's the reason why this place is getting 2 stars.

3.description: My pot roast was dry and tough, side orders mediocre. I would give the food zero stars if possible, the one star that I have is for the great wait staff, very nice.....

1.description: The service here is wonderful and friendly.  This place gets packed on Sundays, and the restaurant is cafeteria-style - you point out what you want to eat/try out, and they charge you per item at the end. They even had sweet tea, a good concoction, so I was pretty excited for that.  I particularly liked the baked chicken (the skin is quite nice) and it's juicy; the collared greens?  A must have!  The smothered porkchop and the meatloaf were just okay; so was the cornbread as it was more on the drier side and less sweet.  A tight squeeze of a parking, but if you just want some baked chicken, collared greens, and sweet tea, check this place out if you're in the area.+baked chicken+collared greens+lot available for your car

2.description: I love the food here. The customer service isn't the best but they aren't extremely rude either. I can over look that part because the candied yams and Mac&cheese are to die for. I just wish it wasn't 15$ for a plate. But I go when I have the money. :) yummm

9.description: St. Rest #2 is one of our favorite places for Saturday breakfast or Sunday after church dinner. The breakfast menu is fresh and tasty with generous portions. The dinner menu has a good variety of entrees with the fried breaded catfish being my personal favorite.

10.description: Yes! St.Rest No.2 serves good Soul Food. The servers are attentive. The meats are good,the sides are good,the cakes,and pies are good. It's one of my favorite Soul Food restaurants in Chicago. I highly recomend St.Rest. The Fried chicken is good,the BAKED,and Fried Catfish is good,their meatloaf is great,and their smothered pork chops are my favorite. I've never had a bad meal at St.Rest,and I used to pass this place all the time and pay no attention to it.

4.description: While driving through the Chatham neighborhood I craved a breakfast one afternoon. I was literally stopped in traffic facing eastbound on 87th Street. I glanced to my right and the chef of St. Rest #2 was literally waving me in. I lowered the window and said "You all serve breakfast?" Without hesitation he confirmed and guiding me into the parking lot.I ordered the build it yourself omelet with turkey sausage and green peppers. A nice size side of hashbrows and homemade biscuits. My buddy had the grits with his omelet and I manage to swipe a few samples.I never really had mind blowing grits before until I walked into St Rest #2, I almost didn't feel guilty eating them. Their turkey sausage was superb, a little crust action shield locking in the flavor until you take that first bite. Perhaps the Captain America of turkey sausage I might add.The staff was extremely friendly and the chef actually chatted with me for a few to check up on my experience. Tina our server was polite and knowledgeable I would go back again just for her to pour me coffee.There is an incredible buffet lunch spread including fried chicken, fried catfish, pork chops, veggies and pretty much everything to feed your soul.

6.description: The customer service is good but the food....not so much. Over soaked in grease , and I've witnessed a server drop a pen in the food and left it there for a good 5 minutes quite unsanitary don't ya think

12.description: Best soul food on the south side! The food is great and the service is second-to-none! I love the short ribs, and I find it hard to walk pass deserts without getting two or three for the week. The food is always fresh and I have NEVER been disappointed! Would recommend to anyone who like good home-cooking. Extremely safe and they have off-street parking.

5.description: There was a cockroach on the counter at this restaurant yesterday afternoon.....Not far from my take out food mind you. Won't be going here anymore!!!! They didn't know they served the wrong person. I'm a RN and I have reported this to the board of health.

13.description: St Rest # 2 has a modest appearance from the outside: it's a place that you may have driven past numerous times without noticing. It sits on 87th street, nestled between other stores, and across from a car wash and strip mall. However, once you give St. Rest #2 a try, you will come back again...and again! Service is good; the server helps you along with your choices. Another staff person seats you once you have paid for your meal, and then you are served shortly thereafter. The decor is of a modest diner. Simple, yet clean, and comfortable. The food is absolutely soul-food heaven! Mac' and Cheese, collard greens, cabbage, mashed potatoes and gravy, corn bread, etc. The meat selections include baked , fried or smothered chicken, fried or baked catfish, ox tails, and short ribs. I tried the smothered pork chops ( I got two , of course! ) cabbage, mashed 'taters, and grabbed some peach cobbler for dessert. Everything was delicious - I felt like I was having dinner at my grandparents. Price is very reasonable too, which is a bonus. St. Rest # 2's hours are accommodating (open until 8 or so) , and carry out is a snap - you're in and out in 5 minutes. South siders, support this local business. Heck, Chicagoans hankering for some good Southern cuisine, come check it out.  St Rest # 2 offers great food and service at great price!

11.description: Solid soul food, solid with the word. When in Tuley Park, pay a visit here for cafeteria-style chicken or fish, greens, and yammers.

8.description: um jesus take the wheel! o_o! thee worst!  greasy greasy did i say greasy!??? food layout and appearance awful!  prices for quality a katt williams joke! no way jose.... omg!  it was awful!  (but they do kindly ask you on the way out on a sign on the door if you are looking for good church home to contact them! jesus wept)

0.description: It's unfortunately, one of a very few places to have a decent sit-down breakfast in the area.  I get the liver and onions and always enjoy myself.  The waitstaff is very kind and attentive.  I'll keep going back until/unless I have a bad experience there (and I don't see that happening).

7.description: Classic soul food at a great price. I had a whole meal, but the only thing I remember are those tasty greens and cornbread!! Everything there looked and smelled delicious so you can't go wrong coming here.

12.description: Of all the Captain Hooks Fish and Chicken I have had lunch in, this one is by far my favorite. I actually watched the food channel during my lunch hour on two 46" HD flat screen TVs in the re-built lobby. I am a fan of the lemon pepper and when it goes on catfish nuggets or tilapia, you better hold on to your seat. This Captain Hooks location knows how to treat their customers right. I'm talking generous portions people! I literally had enough for dinner that night.One thing by far is a must .....their fresh squeezed lemonade. When I asked how fresh is this on the real? They showed me the box of empty lemons their employee was working on. So the answer is "DAILY"! Everyday its made fresh to order.There is no shortcuts at this location, impressive, clean and affordable!

7.description: I was dragged to the Nike Outlet nearby and after we finished shopping, this fried chicken smelled hit us as we walked out the door. We noticed Captain Hooks and stopped in. Their menu is extensive... and their prices very reasonable.We ordered the pick 3, catfish nuggets, shrimp, and buffalo wings and a banana pudding.Everything was great, especially the banana pudding, which was light and airy. However, the shrimp was a bit greasy.

3.description: Great place food is always good , never a problem with anything except long lines sometimes but they get the food out to you .

1.description: Overall the food is okay. It's just a quick fix until you find better. They are very slow when it comes to preparing your food. The cashiers are unprofessional no matter how hard they try. Sanitation could be better. Good thing I can say is, that there slushie lemonades are good

2.description: I ordered an Angus cheeseburger combo. It took over 30 minutes to complete my order and only two people were in front of us. The burger honestly had no flavor. The fries were pretty good I did like them. What irritated me the most was a lot of people who came in after us got their food before us.

9.description: I ordered the catfish and was surprised that it had bones which wasn't a bad thing. At least I knew it wasn't the standard stuff. It was piping hot and the coleslaw was enough to cool down my mouth. It looked somewhat bland and it tasted ok but I prefer mine fresh looking with vibrant colors and less mayo or miracle whip. The fries were ok too, mine was a bit mushy at times but tastes ok.

10.description: When you live as far away as I do and are still taking the wife and kids all the way into the city for a meal like this you know it's got to be GREAT!!Today we had...Traditional Chicken WingsSpicy, maybe too spicy, Chicken WingsChicken TendersMedium ShrimpJumbo ShrimpCatfish FiletsChicken Gizzards (cooked soft)French FriesGreat Homemade ColeslawI know what you're thinking, but with 10 People and some Ginger Ale it's never too much food!!Captain Hooks on Cottage Grove keeps me driving 15 Miles into the city for fried food.....YES IT'S THAT GOOD!!!Service 5*'sCleanliness 5*'sPricing & Value 5*'s

13.description: I went to pick up a phone in order. Upon walking into to the lobby, I observed a customer complaining about a missing item from his order. The cashier  immediately became defensive and gave the young man plenty of attitude. The condescending manner in which she spoke to him was almost unbearable. Ironically, the manager was right there during the ordeal. She argued with the customer about a small order of fries. Finally, she yelled at someone in the back for an order of fries and gave them to the customer as if she had just completed some altruistic endeavor. When I paid for my order, I attempted to ask if my extra sauce was in the bag. Before I could complete the question, the young lady was barking it's in the bag. Not once while I was in this establishment did I notice any of the customers being given a modicum of respect or courtesy. I never heard the phrases thank you or have a good evening. Ironically the food is not bad, but the total lack of respect and courtesy for the customer is a deal breaker for me. We, as consumers, can no longer patronize establishments that believe they have done us a favor by taking our money.  Rude rushed service must not be tolerated. I give this place my nick nack patty wack two thumbs down.

16.description: Service pretty good and the price is standard for the food they serve

17.description: This a great restaurant place. I prefer to pick up my food and they have a great variety. Aside from fish and chicken, they also have burgers and good dessert.

15.description: This place is great because it's open 24 hours daily, and you can get anything.  They serve all Chicago fast food:  shrimp, perch, Italian beef, hamburgers, hot dogs, really any sandwich, etc.  But they've also got some more off-the-wall soul food like fried frogs legs.  Another good reason to stop in is the South Side-style iced lemonades, from blueberry to watermelon (you know the stuff if you've been to any of the steak & lemonade spots around the city).  And their sweet potato pie is fantastic.  It's not made in house, but don't let that worry you--the confectionery that makes them on 95th St knows what it's doing with those spices, and packages them with a cigarette-style warning about addiction.The downside, although I'll have to give it credit for actually having seating, is that the seating area is dirty and unpleasant.  And I like brightly lit, but there's an upper bound...  Take your food to go.

0.description: The food is good! I enjoy the chicken shrimp and fish, I've had a taco before and a gyro cheeseburger, all were not disappointing. For a quick meal at 3 am they definitely do the job since its 24 hours, so if you're in the area and are hungry, stop thru. The seating area is a little bleh but I don't recommend dining in anyway. It's super secure in there, and I know it's because of the (slightly and I mean slightly) rough area. The service is meh but not too much can be expected of a 24 hour chicken shack. I'm actually going as soon as I get off; I have a hankering for some chicken and shrimp with a bottle ful of lemon pepper!

5.description: This place is interesting because of how well protected it is, makes it seem like the area is really really rough. I mean human contact is virtually impossible here. There is glass bolted along the walls blocking you from the cashiers and they use a serving wheel to spin your food to you so that you can't reach in. Even if you wanted to give your server a hand shake it is impossible.Don't let this fool you though! The food is good! I got a $5 meal including a double crisp chicken sandwich with fries and a soda. The chicken was crisp and delicious with the hot sauce. The best part was that they use a type of lemon salt/pepper combination seasoning for their fries. Only bad thing is that this place is super slow. Incredibly slow actually considering what you are ordering, I was almost late for work because I chose to eat here.

11.description: crispy wings and the mild sauce is so, so goodbuy 50

8.description: Just got some tilapia. They didn't give me ANY sauce. They didn't give me bread or coleslaw. And everybody up there has an attitude problem. Ugh

4.description: Want some fried chicken or fish in the middle of the night?  Come here. And it'll taste pretty decent too...but after you see the bill and get done eating, you'll wonder why you've spent so much money when you could easily get the same quality (if not better) and faster service at any fast food spot thats open. Then again, I'm complaining about the price of 3 AM chicken.... #firstworldproblems. Meh.

14.description: Captain Hooks has some of the best chicken in the world! I've NEVER has a bad batch and we go quite often (they called my husband '100 wings' because he ordered a pan each week for his friends after they played basketball).  I tend to stick with the chicken, fish, or shrimp; all are very delicious.  Not a big fan of their burgers, but they're not a burger joint.  Their steak sandwiches are REALLY good, and the lemonades...TO DIE FOR!The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is that the service can be somewhat lacking if it's super busy or late at night.

6.description: It is simply a quick food place with tasty offers like fried fish and chicken, gyros etc. Great post party food with something for everyone, including salad and fruit bowls for the folks who desire that. I have been going here for 5 years. I usually order wings and a salad and a fruit bowl and split it between me and 2 others. The gyros are tasty and the burgers are good too. It is well lit, plenty of free parking. I recommend you order by phone so you can just walk in and get your food, Since they cook to order, you may have to stand around and watch tv for a while if you walk in. You can eat there but most folks get stuff to go.

0.description: Freshly renovated with The Weave Shop next door. Plenty of parking right in front of the store. They carry all major brand of hair extensions. They have a monthly specials on every categories of beauty supplies. People there know their products

Stopped here for some wine before a family party on Christmas.  They have a large range of quality wines, and definitely one of the few places in the area that actually know about wine.  Thanks for being open on Christmas, you saved the day!

3.description: No! No! Do not go to this Pepe's! Grungy, grimy, sketchy and slow. No one should fear for their life for the sake of tacos. It feels like a dungeon inside, and the location does not have good energy. Beware!

1.description: I'm originally from California , and I have to say, these were the best tacos I've ever had. The food here is sooo good!!! It doesn't look inviting from the outside but man!!! I just can't stop thinking about the food I got from here!

2.description: You  it's so ridiculous that you have to buy your hot sauce for the tacos they have stop this are going some were else

5.description: Not bad... Good salsa... However overpriced food... There are other places that are much better

0.description: I bought pepe's special  on taco I have pay for hot sauce  and peppers  that bad and taco cost more then one on 95 th

4.description: Good food! Clean place!

3.description: Terrible Spot. The ONLY thing Curt has going for him is his sauce and you can get that at grocery stores in Chicago. His prices are way too high considering the poor quality, slow service and the fact he is in an area that has a large amount of competition in a one mile radius of him. He is on 82nd and Cottage Grove. Uncle John is on the next corner at 83rd and Cottege, Barbra Ann's on 76th and Cottage and Lem's on 75th across King Drive.  ALL of which are cheaper, faster, more for the money and taste better.

1.description: Decided to give it a try after many years. First off when I walked in a woman was walking out and told me don't eat here go to the place down the street. When I got  to the counter to order my food the cashier which was also the owner Curt was on the phone and had me standing there for over five minutes. When he finally got off the phone and took my order I was handing him my money and he walked off. When finally returned and took my money he asked if I wanted dessert when I declined he insisted that I get some dessert because it was nice and fresh. I then declined again. At this point I was ready to leave. Long story short when I got my food it was terrible the rib tips were practically 90% fat and there was big globs of oil in the tray. This was the worst experience I have ever had. I think i should have listen to the woman's warning.

2.description: The phone number is disconnected.  When I have driven by there it was closed.  I'm mad because they left food out of my order that was promised to me.

9.description: Curts wings are good... Service however is another story!!! Ordered six wings... Saw seven in the basket just pulled up... Sittin there... I waited teeny min while they laughed and other monkey business... Knowing all the time I was gonna write this... So I waited saying nothing just watching the time... 22 min for those same wings that I saw at first! Sucess has made them even sloppier than when they had their forst location 15  or so years ago... this is a perfect example of decent to horrible!

10.description: A small group of us drove down to Captain Curt's for lunch and we were blown-away by the service, the food and the BBQ! I am already planning another trip!  Captain Curt explained the different sauces and made recommendations on combining them to get the best tasting rips, wings and rib-tibs in Chicago!

4.description: I am really disgusted w/this establishment! I spent almost $30 for chicken wings. It took forever for them to get ready & then when I got to my destination they were all burnt and dried out! I immediately called the restaurant & was given to someone that refused to let me speak to a Mgr.. He told me to bring the receipt back in the next day (I was too far away to come back then) to get my money back. I went in the next day & Momma Curt totally avoided taking responsibility for their bad food & service. I had pictures of the food which was obvious it was burnt. She said I had to bring the food in. I advised the man I spoke w/on the phone did not tell me that. She refused to give me my money back or apologize. Her explanation was this was just a one time incident. I will never go in this restaurant again! I would advise you don't either unless you want to waste your time & money.

6.description: Let me Edit your review of Captain Curt,Theodis......the rib tips are VERY UNTASTY and I was Dis-satisfied! the rib tips are not seasoned and they don't have no distinctive taste, It just taste like pure pork with no season...yuck! :(  the chicken wings were good but they would of taste much better if they went easy on that curt sauce.....too much sauce made it un -enjoyable and messy!! To sum everything up, captain curt bbq has completely fell off and I will not be going there again, to top things off, they are a BIT Pricey!!!!!!!!Take My Advice

11.description: some of the best bbq in the city.  the sauce is a very sweet but tangy flavor, and the meat is well cooked and seasoned to perfection.  if your in the area, stop by and get the wing and rib tip combo...(verrry good).  one of my favorite spots...

5.description: Curt's has a fun decor, great sauces, and, sometimes live music.  Unfortunately, that is where the good points end.  The food is TERRIBLE.  All of it.  The links are mushy and flavorless.  The ribs and tips are fatty, charred, and poorly cut.  Then, to add insult to injury, everything is overpriced!   Save your money.  Travel of another 10 minutes and had over to Uncle John's BBQ on 69th & Calumet instead.

7.description: I was there yesterday with my husband we ordered wings and beef links. The fries were half cooked the beef link um lets say If I ate dog food it probably would be better than the soft nasty links they gave us. this was not my first time there but I have not been there in years and will never go back. For the money they charge the food should be way better than it was. I was not able to eat it my husband who will eat almost anything he pay for was unable to eat this stuff. the one star is for the sauce my husband said the sauce it still good but no good enough to cover the taste of the links.

8.description: Thought I would give them another try and to my amazement, it was worse than before.  The only thing I will go to them now for is change.

0.description: Well... 1st, the food is really good but I see now why the captain hasn't opened any other spots.  When Curt is there the service is OK at best but when he's not there the wait time sky rockets and the servers are incompetent.  There weren't a lot of people the place at all and I waited over 30 minutes for my food.  I don't expect people to move like they're being timed on a game show but it would be cool to actually act like you want me to get my food before it gets cold & soggy.  They tried to give me fries that had been sitting for at least 25 minutes but I asked for new fried since I had been waiting so long and they (half heartedly) obliged me. Again, the food is usually good buy the service is a real chap shoot (with the best service being ok ).  I like the place and would love to see more of them but the service has to get better or I will stop going.

3.description: I had gone to the Weave Shop many times and waited and waited but new to the weave industry, I thought it a great concept.  When I arrived 18 minutes late for an appointment, I was told I was cancelled after 15 minutes and could not be seen.  My pleading since I was getting on a plane for my sister's wedding, was heard upon a very cold and uncaring managers ears and NOTHING was done to help my plight.  There was no notice to me that my appointment would be canceled or this 15 minute rule, no attempt to see if another stylist could help me since this was a critical issue for me, no referral to another stylist or shop or no courtesy call to me to even mention that my appointment would be cancelled. Horrible customer service, they will never, ever see another dime from me.I was fortunate enough to walk-in to Hair Issues on 39th and Cottage Grove and was seen by a lovely stylist named Desiree.  I would recommend you ask for her.  My weave was fabulous, cheaper and much, much more customer friendly!  Go to Hair Issues

1.description: I got a sew-in done here about three years ago that was the only time things went smoothly. The last two times I've been at this location in Chatham on 87th Street & Cottage Grove. 1st of all the when I took my hair down the girl was like oh wow. Instant turn off-- like it was more hair than she expected and didn't feel like being bothered. Then the girl racked through my hair like there was a weave in it already which is a no no considering my hair is thick and natural at the roots. She then said do u have oil and conditioner in ur hair? At first I said no-- then I said yea castor oil. She said oh naww we might not be able to do ur hair let me check with ur stylist. Then she asked me if I had an appointment or if I was a walk in? I said walk in and and she walked away. Next thing I know it was two of them in my head examining how much oil and dry scalp I had... Picking in it like a darn bird picks for food LMAO!!! The other lady said yea u have too much oil in ur hair. I said yes I know I have oil in my hair that's what I use; I'm on a hair journey. She said yes but it might not blend well and I said that cool I'm just here for u to install the weave. I told her I would worry about how it looks when it comes time to blend. The lady who was supposed to braid my hair asked me how long had I been on my hair journey? I told her 3 years. She replied snidely "Oh, my hair was longer then that by then."  Then they just walked away and left me sitting there. Didn't say we can't do ur hair... Didn't say we would have to wash ur hair again in order to service u... Nothing. Absolutely nothing. Just left me sitting there like a dog being chained to a gate. I brushed my hair back up into a ponytail walked out the door and sat in my truck to write this review immediately. Maybe I can save someone else from wasting their time.

2.description: I had a sew in installed at this location. I was so dissatisfied when I left. I explained to the manager that I needed to be out before 145 and I ended up not leaving until almost 3pm. The sew in went from $50 originally to being $135 dollars when I left. I do not like the way that it is styled. I've had several people tell me that I look like Dora the Explorer (definitely not a compliment). I have had a headache for two days because of the tightness of the hair. The cut is horrible and it was un-even. I look at it in the mirror and cry. It looks like a wig and not what I wanted. I was rushed explained everything and I just want it out at this point!! For me to spend almost $300 (including hair) and to want it out after two days is disheartening. I do not ever want to go back. I wanted to look pretty and definitely do not look it or feel it.--- so update! I went back to the weave shop because I am having an allergic reaction to the synthetic hair that was braided in with my hair. It is going to cost me $30 to take it down and another $99 to put it back in plus $100 (more hair I had to buy--

9.description: I called to ask a question about a service  to determine if I was going to get it or not. I was told by the receptionist that they didn't know the answer and I'd have to speak directly to the stylist who doesn't come in until later. I called back later after she was supposed to be in and then was told that I have to come in and speak to her, she is not allowed to come to the phone. It looks like the weave shop lost my business and their lack of customer service is going to keep them in their "shop" mentality.Some people don't have the ability to drop whatever they are doing just to come in to ask one simple question that will determine if they will give their business or not. They need to keep in mind that not every one of their potential customers live around the corner and have nothing else to do but get their hair done.

10.description: Awful customer service.  Inital price quoted was changed midstream after I was well not the process. Actully, the name of the business is very misleading, $50 dollar weave is somethikng you can fo yourself.  No licenses were posted in view to the customers.  Zi ould say to all just stay away.  Just as a side net all of the stylist have bad weaves so that should be your first clue.

4.description: Let me start by saying, the customer service is definitely TO BE DESIRED! I had originally gone there on Friday (walk in day) called the young lady I was referred to telling her I was In route. I got there at 4:30 just for the receptionist at the desk to say we're not taking anymore walkins because they only had one braider. Didn't have the energy to argue as the girl I called said nothing! So, I go back Saturday morning. The receptionist (with her little ugly self) asked if I had ever been there before I said yes I was here yesterday and you guys had one braider. She replies; I wasn't here! (Where's the empathy)With all the attitude! I waited About 30 minutes then the young lady I requested braided my hair And sewed it in. The only reason I'm giving 3 stars is because the young lady did An excellent job! However, they kinda nickel and dime you and you don't feel like a valued customer! Matter of fact retrain all your receptionist! And suggest exercising empathy and it won't hurt to smile especially when you're ugly!

6.description: Never going back again.  Also the woman who was suppose to do my hair spent the time that I was getting my hair braided standing outside the shop and arguing very loudly with someone on her cell phone in the shop window so everyone could see her.  Then later on the woman who braided my hair received bad news about her family and proceeded to not cry but wail in a side room so that the whole shop could hear.  Also, they nickle and dime you so much that you go in wanting to spend on 50$ and leave spending 130$.  :(

11.description: I just got my hair done by Tiffany n the service, atmosphere, my hair n the stylist was awesome I got her at 9 I was the 8th person n I'm about to walk out at 11:45

5.description: Finally got a weave that I am proud to rock and has lasted more than two weeks!The ladies were all professional, which the exception of the receptionist...she loves her some trey songz and keeps the radio blasted when he comes on...lol, guess I can't blame her.  I forgot the stylist name who originally did my hair, she was good at the structure, but not so great at cutting or styling (I got the 98 option).  My hair was also braided too tight and I couldn't move my neck (that's not funny...lol).  So i went back three days later and Tiffany fixed the braids, cut an edgy layered bob, added a few tracks for volume and gave me great tips on how to keep my hair moisturized without adding too much product to the weave.  I am rough with my weave, I don't tie it down at night, don't really take care of it, so I go in for the washing and extension repair.  I stick with the same stylist and my hair has been up for two months now...woot woot.  Previously, the weaves barely lasted past two weeks.  I'm def a fan and ready for a new weave!My suggestion, be careful with the braiders and voice your opinion if it is too tight (you should never feel tension or have redness this leads to balding). My advice, make an appointment during the week, early morning or afternoon or be prepared to wait forever.Lastly, be aware of the "add-on" services.  You pay extra for different braiding techniques, for a net and for different styles.  I always get the 98, but had to pay extra for circle braiding, body curls and extra tracks (they only sew-in about 10 tracks, the rest is 7 extra).

7.description: I specifically made an appointment because I do not like to play a game of chance when I go for a service. My time is valuable. So My appointment was at 11am. I was also admonished that if I did not arrive by 11:15am, my appointment would be canceled. Well imagine my surprise that when I arrived at 11:05 they were no where close to serving me. They said they were short staffed and behind.  Well how about telling me that when I called. Ok. So I run a few errands to give them time. Two hours later they still were not ready. They needed at least another hour. That means I would wait three hours later than my appointment time just to get started.This is unprofessional and unacceptable. What is the purpose of a freaking appointment if the costumer has to wait 3hours to start the service. I know you get what you pay for. But hey, I was getting the $98 service!  This was a complete waste of my days and I am very upset. I will not go back.

8.description: Can you say terrible? I want to start off by saying the customer service is horrible. There is receptionist by the name of Toria who answers the phone and says something so fast you cant understand her. Before getting any words out your on hold. 5 and 10 minute holding without ever getting back to the phone. The customer service is so terrible I wouldnt step foot in the place just because of it. They need help

0.description: This place is decent I honesty did not care for my hair style the only reason I gave 3 stars is because the hair was nice that I bought from them and the style wasn't that bad. The person who braided my hair did a good job and also the lady who sewed it in/stylist did a good job with that I think her name was Ebony she was really sweet and nice. What I did not care for was the way she styled it I showed her a picture and it did not look nothing like the picture I showed her the initial cut she gave me when my hair was curly wasn't that good once she straightened my hair you could see how bad the cut was I wanted a bob really short back n long front. I didn't care for the products she used on my hair because it made my hair not blend well and the product she used on my edges was too rough and hard. After she cut it again it looked better but I had to fix it once I got home. When I got home I tried to wash the product she used on my edges out n it was really hard to get out. I would go back tho my hair looked better once I fixed it n made it curly again.

12.description: I am so glad that there is a Lowe's right around the corner from Home Depot.  I'm tired of running the service people down at Home Depot like they owe me money.  I really hate it when you finally catch one and they tell you it's not their department. Yaaay Lowe's

7.description: We bought a fixer-upper house, so we come here a lot. With a few exceptions, the staff has been knowledgeable and very willing to help. They have even suggested products that we didn't know existed, that would help us in our project better than what we thought we needed.Store is always well-stocked and has everything you can possibly think of.

3.description: You shop at this location and you are subject to catch a criminal case especially if you have a return. This store's location is high ranking in terms of sales which might be the reason why nothing has been done about the service. I literally witnessed associates talk about customers, be rude to customers and provide wrong information to guest. I waited for a department associate to come to obtain a price but it took him 8 minutes to come to the front  to find out the reason for the call. The associate told the cashier that the sticker for the price was attached. On a different occasion the Cashier attempted to ring the price for a higher amount and would not accept the online sku # but called for an associate which took forever. And no apology was offered. I did not receive a single greeting in this store. Best thing about this store is all of the eye candy.

1.description: I come here when I need something for the house I had not gone in a while because this particular location seemed to have been hiring hoodrats to work in their store. I just went back today after not going for a while and it looked like the store had cleaned house of employees who were not up to snuff. Which is a good thing because a lot of businesses are not going to keep people on staff if they're not doing their job. I came in to purchase some trash bags after Wal-Mart temporarily didn't carry the ones I usually get because they're rip resistant and good for packing about two weeks worth of trash and keeps me from making excessive trips to the alley take the garbage out. The store has been good about getting rid of a lot of riff raff since they would have a lot of people loitering in the parking lot and security has been good about cleaning that up and keeping the lot free of people hanging out there who are not there to shop at the store. Overall, service has been improving and with this trip it has come up more with cleaning up the store and hiring quality employees.

2.description: This store has poor customer services, they do not come to assist you , most of them have an attitude.

9.description: Most store employees need Training! However, Steve is the person who has the answer to any problem you may encounter! Go Steve!

18.description: If you know what's good stay away from this place! Often times they do not have what you need in stock, customer service is the worst I have seen in business history. Please don't waste your time asking for assistance because they don't know and are to stupid to know that they don't know. They will not help you with something that you are unsure of! Therefore, avoid the frustration and go elsewhere.

10.description: Oh my goodness...worse experience ever! I thought maybe they had improved since many years ago...but no.  Everyone there acts like they would rather be some place else, can't answer questions because "it's not their dept" and limited product selection.  I opted for self-check out to avoid 10 deep line....good choice until the faulty system detected "an unexpected item in bag" and I had to wait 5 mins. for an associate to clear the code.  If I come here again, I deserve all the frustration that comes with it.

13.description: I initially had a bad experience with this Home Depot that is buried in the "filtered" reviews. I contacted the corporate office, through the Home Depot website, and filed a complaint through the BBB. In less than two weeks, the issue was rectified by the Store manager Izzy, who apologized in person, and issued me a refund for my trouble. My initial contact, Patricia Oalden, lead me step by step through the process, continually updating me, until the issue was solved. I appreciate the effort on behalf of the company, and will continue to be a patron of this home depot.

16.description: As I have preferenced my other reviews of The Home Depot, I will say that I currently work for a building products company and I spend most of my time in THD at various locations throughout the city.I spend more time in this store than any other as it is the second largest volume THD in Chicago. The staff here is pretty good and very friendly. This store is ALWAYS busy, but the staff is very helpful.However, this store isn't in the greatest neighborhood on the planet. I have guys trying to sell me stolen watches and whatnot almost every day in the parking lot. I don't know if this is true, but there is a rumor at my company that there was a shooting in the parking lot last year. If this is the closest THD near you, its a good one. But if it isn't, better safe than sorry!Oh, and if your getting any flooring done, go see my boy Zuri!

17.description: I have been here a fair amount of times with mixed experiences.Last time I went, they had ONE register open with a person, and the rest were self service.  Since the one attended register was a mile long, I opted to go to the self service.  As it turns out, 50 pound bags of concrete are not the easiest thing to checkout through the automated system.  I eventually pushed the assistance button, she came over with her wireless doohicky, and scanned everything in my cart in.That was OK I guess.  The problem I had was the idiot security guard (in the fake cop outfit) who they hire to look at receipts on your way out.  I bought 3 bags of concrete, two were of the same type and the third was a different type.  On my receipt there were 2 line items for the 3 bags... one line said 2@3.00 to indicate two bags.  Not only did he not understand this, he actually started to tell me I didn't pay.  I explained it to him, but he repeated "there aren't 3 on there" several times.. Everything I said went through one ear and out the other.  After about 20 seconds or so of back and forth, I told him "you're a f'king idiot, learn how to read a receipt before you try to embarrass customers" ... I grabbed my receipt out of his hand and walked on out.  (HD has no legal right to require me to stop at the door to show my receipt as it is)... How stupid can someone be, particularly when it's their job to look at receipts?  And does he really think I'd go through the trouble of stealing a $3.00, 50 pound bag of concrete, when there are obviously more valuable things that are much smaller?  Geezeo.

15.description: Worst place on the planet... take two minutes go to Lowes

0.description: Extraordinarily busy especially the paint department (been there morning, noon, and night weekdays), definitely understaffed, and low inventory on certain items (at least a few we were interested in).  Some items are mislabeled, misplaced, or just plain missing!  We found the staff generally helpful and friendly.  We've started to go to the one on Clinton Street which is better stocked but not that much better overall.

5.description: I like home depot, I'm not sure why. This location has always been just ok to me. You have some employees that are very knowledgeable of what they are selling and other who is just there for a check and I get it. still over all I never had a bad experience here and they always seem to have what I'm looking for so I guess I cannot really complain

11.description: Awesome store, I totally avoid lowe's to come here. I didn't even know what I needed to rig up my portable a/c. The customer service gent and fellow customer has me feeling nice and cool this evening. Always get awesome service here. Garden folks are great too!

8.description: Gardening crew was very friendly. Sylvester was awesome. Make sure you find him if you have questions. Rare to see employees who care.

4.description: I absolutely hate asking for assistance and not getting it at any store. Well, expect that and more from this store. The employees have plenty of time for joking and talking among one another but no time to help the customer. The prices were honestly cheaper than the other hardware stores but I'll take my money to the store decent enough to respond for a request for assistance.

14.description: No one ever wants to help you. The staff just stands around, texting on their phones & talking while you go nuts trying to find what you're looking for.  There's obviously not a dress code because the ladies were dressed as though they were on their way to a bar (super tight jeans & tops, poppin on gum)  JUST GHETTO!!!!

6.description: The staff here is very friendly and helpful.Otherwise it is your standard Home Depot.  (It is on the larger side).

12.description: Inconsistent service.... don't pay until you are completely done....I've been into this shop about 10 times...  half the time I have good service the other half poor. ... green does a great job and takes his time.... but there are too many technichians who are just quickly trying to slap on some polish and get you out.    I normally pay before my nails are painted, but if I come back I won't be doing that again.   I get the same thing every time I get my nails done... 3 times now at this shop I've ben asked, and argued with to get what I want.. half glitter half plan polish. I don't care if you think the Polish won't show up. I don't care if you think it'll take to long to dry.. please do what I ask for, and what I pay for.. especially if it  isn't difficult...   I don't go on busy weekends, or when it's crowded so there no reason to rush.

3.description: I pulled up Yelp and found this place on a whim because I needed a quick no-chip manicure after work. Colour Nails was close by and had pretty good reviews, so I walked in at about 3:15 on a Friday afternoon. I told them I needed a soak off and a no-chip and only waited about 10 minutes before I was serviced. My nail tech, Ryan, was very nice and quick! I was in and out in about 45 minutes (including my wait time). Even better, their no-chip polish change is only $20!! I had just had a manicure, so I didn't need all the works, so this is a great price for a new no-chip color. This place is close to work and reasonably priced, so I think I'll be back.

1.description: So this was my second time visiting this shop and I must say I think I have found a nail technician. Christine is quick and good. The prices are like every other shop, you pay for base fill-in and everything else ala carte, cut down, fix nail, etc.. The shop isn't too far from home looking forward to my next visit. Nice selection of colors both no-chip and regular.

2.description: I have been a faithful customer over the past 1 year. I will not get my nails done anywhere else in Chicago. Helen is my favorite overall in my opinion she does the best nail art. Phat her hubby is amazing with acrylic. Everyone is super friendly. The salon is always packed so go at opening or late if you go on a Saturday.

9.description: First, I will start with the positive and say that it's a nice space...open and bright with newer spa chairs and bowls. Second, my technician, Ivy (I think), was very pleasant! So, the first strike was the price-$25 pedi or $35 for mani-pedi. This, of course, is not terribly out of range.
