However, I will admit that my normal two places are only $20 and $30 for those services. Second strike was poor range of color choices. As a professional and due to personal choice, I don't want overly bright, ridiculously dark, or sparkly polish. If you like these choices, this is a good place for you. However, some people like more conservative pinks, corals, etc. Fast forward to paying, the thrid strike occurred when Ivy returns with my card with an extra fee ($1) on it! Umm, excuse me, what is this charge for? I spoke with the owner, David, I was informed that "the DMV and other places charge fees for card use." Sir, the DMV also make licenses. Just because they do, doesn't mean that you can! At least post a sign and let me make an informed decision. Grant it, it was a nominal charge, however, it's the principle. Can you imagine how much extra income they generate off of that small charge because no one says anything?! Overall, although Ivy was pleasant, I will not be returning. Why pay $41 when I can get the same service for less?!

10.description: I like them! My first time here. The service is great and the staff is friendly. Got regular pedi and a no chip manicure. Green was my technician and it was his first day and did a wonderful job! He will be my go to guy for here on out! The decor is wonderful and brand new. The massaging chairs are comfortable. Wish they made them a little longer for us tall folks. Over all it was a good pretty quick day! Total cost was $55 w/ a 20% discount.

4.description: WHAT I'VE BEEN LOOKING FOR This is a very nice new shop.I got a very warm feeling when I walked in the door. But you have to stop by the place to see how much this owner put into this new nail salon. It is beautiful from the Crystal Chandler when you come in the door and the feel so good service chairs. The color changing boarder ceiling. So now the service Again love the service chairs. But I  was able to just set back and enjoy the music while Alice just made me feel special. And yes I loved the quality of her work she does a really good job.(feet, manicure, brows, and brow tint, and my eye lashes )I'm very excited about this place keep me happy and I'll keep coming back This is this owner 2nd shop. And the nail technician Jennifer has been with him for a few years now.So check them out and tell them I  sent you from yelp.

6.description: I went here. The service was very nice and prompt and my nail tech was very helpful. What I didn't like was that she rushed through the UV curing of my no-chip manicure. I got the manicure Friday morning, by Monday I noticed tears in the color, by Tuesday the tears had gotten more pronounced and the gel had begun to left. Today, wednesday, pieces of the manicure gel have fallen off of two fingers. I'm very unhappy with the manicure, but she did pay great attention to my cuticles. Don't go here if you want a worthwhile manicure. By the way, I was the first customer of the day, so there was no need for her to rush.

15.description: 1st and last time going. The manicure price in the wall says $12, but I was charged $16 ($1 fee for using c.c)Got a pedicure on Thursday,  the polish chipped on Friday off 3 toes. The manager made me feel like the bad guy by telling me I should have remembered who took care of me...how do he know if I didn't go somewhere else and just coming there to get a free polish change...and the only thing he can do is polish over my 3 chip polished toes with a random color because he couldn't "find" the one I had on (even though I told him the polish name and color number ).

0.description: As soon as I was walked in I was greeted and asked to sign in (I arrived around 10:40 AM so they had only been open for 40 minutes). I was immediately seated for a pedicure and got started. The chairs are big and comfy. The young lady doing my pedicure was great! She worked to make my feet nice and soft. My polish was smooth. I'll be back! *GOOD TIP* arrive early because this place gets packed fast!

5.description: Tina is good

13.description: They are one of the best nail salons in the city at both locations that they own they are the truth I love them Ive been coming to them for over four years now and they are really a family oriented business I love them

11.description: Newly built, so the furniture and decor is nice. They have a lot of stations. I believe 14 manicure stations and 14 chairs, one of the largest I've been to in a while. I went to ZiZi and he was very sweet, took his time with my service and made sure I was taken care of.  Only got my natural nails done, so not quite sure about full sets, but everyone else's nails looked nice too. Will return!

8.description: The best place to go for consistently good quality. They're like most salons busy on weekends and even then I'm never disappointed and that speaks volumes from me because I'm very indecisive. I have frequented both of their locations and this one is super convenient and close. They have more parking here. As far as services go, I've had manicures, pedicures, brow waxing, Brazilian waxing of which I suggest making an appointment for with Tina because she does the best job in my opinion. Overall this is my home when I need my manicures and pedicures done right.

14.description: I came in and told them that I wanted a pedicure and a no chip manicure. This was the best no chip manicure I have had in Chicago. I enjoyed the pedicure too.

7.description: Christine is EVERYTHING. I refuse to go to anyone else for my brows. Im sad im moving back to ny soon. Wth am i gonna do without her. She does it all. I've come in there many times and shes actually managing everyone and she isnt even the manager. Answering the phones and doing nails. Asking others to spread out work to avoid waiting clients and spills. She is awesome

12.description: OMG!!!! They have everything but the service sucks ASS!!! The people are rude do not want to help they text on their phones I will never go here again!

7.description: Pros: Things are on the cheaps hereGreat selection of weaves an extensionsHuge selection of other beauty products such as hair accessories, jewerly, makeupCons:EVERY wig is black, where's the love for us blondes!!There is more "security" then actual workers who can help you

3.description: Upon walking in I was greeted, the owner was training a few new employees. He was kind enough to hand me a basket while doing his walk throughs. For an Asian owned business, I have to say this is by far the best place to get your beauty needs. The  staff are knowledgable and friendly. They carry non scented garlic shampoo, hard to find in Chicago. They carry a decent array of budget make up lines as well. I will definitely be back.

1.description: I walked in today for the 1st time and was followed around by (2) men like I was going to steal something. They stood very close to me and I felt very uncomfortable. The women at the front desk were extremely nice but I will not return and I will follow a complaint with the BBB and Consumer Affairs. I feel that if you are a regular customer you are treated fairly and but as a new customer I am very disappointed.

2.description: Neighborhood is seedy but beauty house is a great place to find great hair extensions at a reasonable cost. I knew what brand of extensions I wanted and the salespeople were able to find me good "Remy" quality hair just not at Remy prices. Parking lot is small. Store is off the red line Wilson stop. Just FYI. Be mindful of the neighborhood.

9.description: I used to go here to buy hair for braiding and I was a loyal customer.  They have a variety of hair brands and types, and not to pricey on hair products.  It was my go to spot when I was in Chicago and I recommended it to everybody I knew.

18.description: I come to this store every 2 weeks or so to grab a pack of extensions and the usual hair spray or oil sheen or etc. The ladies are always very nice and quick..I'm usually in and out within minutes. Huge selection, anything and everything you would need. Every color, style, you name it. Price is great too.

10.description: Ok. So this is really, really obnoxious.  Today I called Beauty House to see if they had a very expensive product I normally buy, (Indian Remi Hair). I asked for a price on it and the girl stated "I'm sorry, we don't do prices over the phone."  Wow.  While I know it's not her fault and she was very polite---this is a real turn off, and only leads me to assume they've raised their prices and lowered their customer service.  If they had the lowest prices they would have NO PROBLEM disclosing them on the phone. Way to shoot yourself in the foot Beauty House.

13.description: Ive been coming here now for several years and need to say that the customer service is usually consistent. From the door to the cashiers the staff is welcoming,  helpful and knowledgeable. The store carry just about everything...sometimes the hair selection seems a bit reduntance/overwelmning.  However the prices are usually fair.

16.description: This place has lots of hard to find hair products in one place. When I lived in the area, I went often (I'm obsessed with my hair). Now that I don't live in the neighborhood, I pop in when I can and can always count on Beauty House to have great Black hair products at reasonable prices.

17.description: Love Love Love the fact that I now have a staple Black Beauty Supply store on the Northside. Nope Sally's doesn't do it with their shelf and 1/2 of black hair care products and I am not even going to begin to comment on the lameness around the corner from this place but they had everything I needed and I wanted and at a very reasonable prices. I can even commend them for carrying some more natural hair care lines and the lines that are mostly available online. I just found one more reason to fall in love with the North side! A+ in my book

15.description: If you are a hair product junkie, this place will be Christmas Day for you.  They have aisles and aisles of hair stuff  and YES,  for black hair.  The good part for me is that it is on the north side of the city so now I don't have to drive all the way to the south or west sides of the city to get what I want. But to be totally honest, this place is better than any beauty supply store that I have been to in either of those areas.  The other good thing is that if you can't find what you want here there is another hair place right around the corner on Broadway about 2 blocks away.

0.description: Three friends walked in,to have some good times,put on black caps & donned wigs,silly looking, hilarious,friendly staff...giggling ensued.

5.description: My mom and I have been coming here for hair for over 10 years LITERALLY. there was a woman who worked there forever who was always there and knew what I wanted all the time.  Unfortunately she left. When I call I know exactly where what im looking for is located so when the new girls answer the phone I guide them. Sometimes they'll tell me they dont have it but I know they just arent looking hard enough and when I guide them. It's there. Ms.Lee is an angel she knows exactly what I want or a better alternative.  I travel all the way up north just to get what I need

11.description: Soooo... I just called to see how much Indian Remy was and they don't give prices over the phone. Kind of odd if you ask me. Several months ago I went in to buy Saga Gold Remy. I spent $100 for two packs of 10" on Amazon I spent $100 for the same hair at 12" and 14". That being said, Beauty House is something like a SCAM. This is the reason I buy on Amazon. Serivce isn't all that great inside the store either, ladies cautions.

8.description: Absolutely love this place. The workers are knowledgeable of the products and great customer service....will definitely go back!

4.description: Large selection. The employees could work on their customer service but I suspect they don't really care much because they know people will keep coming. One employee will try to get you to use his hair services while you're shopping but he's friendly and harmless. I did finally get a smile from the other employees when I showed up at the counter to pay. Overall it's the usual experience at a beauty supply, I'd return. Though I overheard another woman complaining that the wig salesperson was rushing them.

14.description: I don't actually know anything about how good this place is but it comforts me that if I really really really need a wig, I can get one nearby.

6.description: Went in yesterday to purchase extensions for my lady.  The place is like a subtle Home Depot of hair.  But the staff was VERY helpful to my needs.  Veronica especially!! She was great!!! I totally recommend this place for all hair needs!!

1.description: I am re-writing my review because my original one was deleted. I remember this store opening about 3 years ago and since then it's been the go to store for the neighborhood. What I don't like is coming into a store that's littered with clothes and shoes because when you're catering to a specific clientele they don't have the sense to put things back in their rightful places instead they just throw on the floor. I found sealed items like perfume and other things that have been opened and partially used. I don't like using the term hoodrats, but that's what come to shop at these stores and what is a huge pet peeve of mine is cashiers carrying on extended conversations with their friends tying up the line like it's happy hour and not checking out customers who are waiting with their items they've completed their shopping on. The space where Forman Mills currently resides is the space that was once home to Dominick's before it closed down some years earlier. It may look inexpensive and cheap, but with hoodrats coming in and opening up stuff and even taking it out of the packaging and leaving it lying around. I have only gone there for stuff like socks and underwear, but anything else is a RARE purchase unless necessary. I also notice Forman Mills are cropping up in areas like the south side to cater to the hood folks who need to buy clothes for an inexpensive price. Either way this is not my go to store for much of anything except basics.

0.description: Cheap. HUGE store. Name brand clothes very large selection even for men. The clothes are "urban" so if that's your thing you're going to have a field day.

They really deserve no stars, everything is mediocre and less than average.What kind of Dunkin doughnuts don't have munchkins?? And not in the morning hours, I mean really, I could understand if it was the afternoon and they didn't have any but this is ridiculous. I was pissed off. I had my heart or more like my taste buds set on those munchkins.My sister ordered me some of those hash browns which she said I would like. So to indulge her I tried s bite of one, I didn't like them, they were soggy and soft and not crispy like hash browns should be, the seasoning was good and it had the potential to be good but they just weren't and I could tell that they were old hash browns not freshly made. Won't be coming back here. EVER!!

1.description: I went to Church's on 87th King Dr. While waiting for the girl to wait on me, myself and 2 other ladies started to scream  because we saw a mouse on top of the bread!! The employees ran to the back and didn't return!! Needless to say, we didn't order anything. .I will not be returning to that Church's again. Irs obvious that the owner doesn't care about the customers and the community.

0.description: Not bad... Almost alwatys fresh but you will wait

3.description: Absolutely most frustrating place to order by phone. Have literally been placed on hold, in the middle of giving my order (this is after the mandatory 'please hold' given the moment they pick up the phone!) so they can take other orders. Yes. Plural. How do I know this? Cuz putting me on hold consisted of sitting the receiver down, allowing me to hear everything going on! Food is good but not worth the hurdles required.

1.description: They have just okay customer service. I don't like going to a restaurant and I feel like the staff are best friends taking and laughing makes me think they aren't focusing on there jobs.Prices TOO high they have too remember places like chillies offer taco nachos for way cheaper and at a sit down restaurant . Food is pretty good they have a funky looking nacho chess that makes me not want to eat it. It's like watered down or something.

2.description: Very overpriced and just not good. I had the combo it was a drink, two tacos and fries for $6.50. The chicken taco tasted like canned chicken, it was pretty bad. They also use corn tortillas, so you know they are cheap to make. My fiancée had a combo also his was $6.50 but was two small steak tacos and a rice water, which was very watered down. The steak was pretty good. I don't think I will be back unfortunately. Also 20 minutes after eating we were both in the bathroom.

0.description: My recent visit to the southside I was not sure what I wanted for lunch. Then I notice the infamous sign in the sky. I had to grab my chicken fajita fix. I am glad I did and the plate was loaded with fresh sauteed green peppers, tomatoes and onions. Flour tortilla was my favorite, garnished with gucamole and sour cream on the side. I could not pass up the Mexican Coca Cola bottles, I had to order one. The portions were plenty and even took some home.This location has a drive thru which was something new to me. However the chicken fajitas take a bit to cook. So calling ahead is suggested if you are in a rush.

4.description: Food is good and staff is cool, its not aunthentic but it hits the spot.

1.description: Surprise...this Marshalls had lots of good deals. I stopped here just on a whim....thinking it would probably be filled with last seasons P.diddy line and a bunch of ghetto hoochie wear. (Hey I live on the southside so I can say that) There was a fair share of gold embossed t-s and g-unit cast aways but the selection of things I would want was really good....I found some books (all for under $3 a piece!!!), gourment food (pumpkin butter with port 1$, cranberry orange muffin mix $1) The foodstuff is a strange thing to buy at Marshalls but I have seen the same brands at high end stores like Fox and Obel for much more $$$$$$ so I trusted it. Also, Celine perfume I had been dying for but could not afford for $7. The package was banged up but the bottle was intact and had never been used. Score!!!Bottom line, spent $65 and had a cart-load of stuff!!!

0.description: This Marshalls seems to get merchandise slower and less premium apparel than the centrally located locations, but I've found amazing finds in various departments over the years.  Unlike the high volume stores, it is always organized and there is a good selection of clearance items if you go at the right time. Marshalls already offers deep discounts off retail prices so when products go on clearance, they're truly a steal; my favorites at this store include: Reebok running shoes for $30, CHI flat iron for $50, Fekkai hair products and Macadamia Oil hair products for $8-$10 plus even a large nonstick Calphalon pan for $20.  The hard part is holding back on picking up things you really don't need since this is one of those places where you have to dig around and easy to impulsely buy!

3.description: I frequent this establishment for manis and pedis only. The quality depends on who completes your services but if you are not happy with your technicians skills, they will gladly switch them around to accommodate you. If you want your "husk" shaved, be sure to ask for a new blade. The colors are OK but sometimes I bring my own polish because it lasts longer (OPI). The prices are comparable and the pedi chairs are to die for!!!! Sometime when I have had a stressful day, I go in just for the chairs. I have had lashes put on before for $25(could barely sleep in them because my eyes couldn't adjust) and have gotten my brows waxed for $8 (prefer to pluck them at home). If you use a credit card, there is a dollar surcharge. Hope this helps...

1.description: Salon has been there for a while, one of the few salons that I can actually see sanitize the instruments that they use for pedicure's. Haven't had a pedicure yet, will write a review once I do. I will say the first two nail tech's sitting in front to the right of the entrance are very good with gel overlays, no matter how long or how short your overlay will be perfect, powder isn't applied very thick. I am glad that I have finally found a nail tech after years of searching.

2.description: The salon is in the right space with the wrong staff. I will say I had the best foot rub by a tall built Asian man... awesome. My full set was terrible and the nails popped off the next day. I do not get tips and get OVERLAY. He didn't know what it was. My pedicure was great except literally 2 days later my left big toe became infected. Yes! The corners turned black and I had to cut that open and scrap out the gunk ( graphic I know ). It took a good 2 months before my toe showed improvement. I'll take my dinero and the drive to Ford City or the burbs if I need to.

0.description: Yeah so I am from the Burbs...right, right. The nails shops in the Burbs are pretty spacious and far in between for a good shop but none I have gone to do any free-hand designs and if they do its like 15.00 a freaking nail...WTF is that?!So we visit the southside alot cause...shit thats where he is from and all his family is there, duh. So while he ran to do his round of visits I decided I was going to get my nails done....hell its the hood and I know they got specials! So I went here Magic Nails and it was packed but luckily enough it didn't take but around 5 minutes before another booth was open. So I sat the lady was really nice who did my nails and when I asked for the same mask she wears so I won't be exposed to the shavings of my nails she gladly handed me one....maybe she smelled burbs all over me....???? The nails were done in a very short time and just as I requested them without me having to interrupt because something hurt or she narrowed the nail too much......perfect for 15.00 and 2.00 for my hand art design :)RECOMMENDED....Don't let the area fool you its true gems in the south too

1.description: This place is consistently slow and understaffed. The customer service is non existent. It upsets me  that people feel as though they can shirk proper service because of where they are. You are on the south side of Chicago. Please have some pride in who you are and where you work. We should provide world class service to each other, however most times than not it is the worst service we provide to each other. Please do better. I just watched a lady drive right past the window cause she got tired of waiting. This cannot continue.

9.description: My father gave me a special gift card "limited edition" he had for over a year. That being said he gave it to me at this location and the girl snatched it from me so fast to add the value to my app. They did joke around about him adopting her or a b day gift for her and it did go from jokes to uncomfortable joking. My father told me about he saved it just for so we went back less then 10 mins later and it was no where to be found :/ . It was upsetting to me and my dad how everything played out so I'll never be back at this location,

23.description: Consistently saves my sleepy ass when I regularly have to transverse the entire Chicagoland region at 5 a.m and the people are really sweet, evenly when it's evilly early.Conveniently located right off the Dan Ryan 87th Street exit - with a drive-thru.

12.description: Scary place to be:  Incompetent staff allow people to "sit" around in this location and not order anything.  Allow "customers" who aren't actually buying anything to have X-rated screaming matches with each other...  Staff laugh at the belligerent "customers" instead of asking them to leave and calling the police.All of this equals paying customers won't ever return.  Such a shame.  Staff needs retraining here...

21.description: Great place to network, get work done & enjoy great frappacino. I spend hours daily there a few days per week. Very friendly staff and great music... MEET ME THERE!!!!

16.description: Only Starbucks on my way to work in Roseland. It's a quick stop off 90/94 at the 87th exit. The drive-thru line can be very long at times, and I've spent 10 minutes (easily) waiting in the line. Sometimes it is quicker to just park and go inside.  The service is generally average. Not a negative experience, but not the best. They just added a long community table on the inside, which is great because they were definitely lacking tables before. Last time I went with a coworker to get some work done the wifi wasn't working.

17.description: Coffee is indeed my drug of choice. However this is a TOKEN Starbucks offering sub-par service. They couldn't fix a latte if their lives depended on it. How freaking hard is it to follow a basic recipe. Today I ordered a soy salted caramel mocha...and it tasted as if they sprinkled table salt on top. I go because of it's conveniently located a few seconds away from the expressway but I'd rather suffer until I get close enough to a reputable Starbucks.PLEASE BRING BACK THE 87th & KEDZIE LOCATION I BEG OF YOU!

10.description: Great place!! Wonderful service...always clean. You forget you're in the southside of chicago for a while.I get a lot of work done here.

5.description: The only reason I come here is because it's on my way to work/home. One time, I was going through the drive thru and had a cup from Starbucks from the day before. When I asked the girl at the window if she could take it for me (I had to make room for my new order), she looked at me like I was about to infect her with a disease and said No in the most undignified manner. It's your business. Today, I went in because the drive thru line was long. They forgot about my simple order. I wanted a tea :/ had to wait for like 10 minutes. In the end, I got a venti instead of tall, but like come on. Will be calling corporate.

11.description: Love the service, love the cleaniness and love the drinks...always fast and friendly and they serve you up with a smile and at 6 a.m. that's rare around here...lol but they do it and I'm glad they do, honestly I have nothing negative to say and that's rare...but this Starbucks is a hidden gem in the hood, but I'm so glad its here bc it gets most of my money...lol...So updated from my previous rating...no longer a 5, staff is still friendly but what ever happened to the customer is alright right...it ain't my fault ur death...seriously if you to busy talking, how can you hear me...its always one cashier who always gets my drink wrong...n I know what I said...n its official, I know its not me bc the person behind me said she got my drink wrong...hmmm guess I gotta find a new Starbucks bc this one ain't workingUpdate: ever since this negative review, I was contacted by starbucks and to my suprise they discussed my issue with this location and I was very pleased with the outcome of our talk.... now the barista knows me by name and they never get my drink wrong...this is by far my fav starbucks......I come out my way just for a latte

22.description: Today I ordered two grande Vanilla Bean Frappuchinos with easy ice, whipped cream and carmel sauce. Not only did they hook it up they didnt skimp on the carmel sauce and whipped cream. They know how to hook a customer up with some good stuff. I was very happy since they made it exactly how I liked it.

0.description: This is one of the few locations on the far Southside. Drinks are the usual, they don't really differ....but what does is the customer service. Sadly this location needs to smile at the very least. I come here to and from because of work and that's the only reason I go here. I would love for this spot to become a tad more friendly.

19.description: Consistently saves my sleepy ass when I regularly have to transverse the entire Chicagoland region at 5 a.m and the people are really sweet, evenly when it's evilly early.Conveniently located right off the Dan Ryan 87th Street exit - with a drive-thru.

2.description: Went to this starbucks around 8:57pm as I was going to the door the barista closed the door on me! Do you have any common curtesy to say "sorry were closed by drive threw is open"?! This was a young male. Went to the drive threw placed my order. First of all temp was off it was cold, second my macchiato tasted nothing like a macchiato! Im assuming they half did my order since it was an hour before they closed. The same male was at the window, he was very rude and non-chalant. I understand that its 9pm you have an hour to go at work and your tired, guess what we all do it! If your working with people you must have the personality! The Starbucks was the only one close on my way and its not in the best of neighborhoods. I will NOT be ever returning to this location!

18.description: Great place to network, get work done & enjoy great frappacino. I spend hours daily there a few days per week. Very friendly staff and great music... MEET ME THERE!!!!

4.description: Customer service is Terrible. I hate coming to places like this in the hood. I'll just leave it at that.

6.description: Does anybody even know how to smile here? Customer service is horrible & it does not take half hour for just 3 frappucinos. I also asked for the caramel ribbon crunch without being let known that there was no more crunch....in the end I just got a caramel frappucino which I ended up having to still pay more for. Better workers please! Just go to another Starbucks.

15.description: I have bad customer service experience at Starbucks I do not like the staff. I give Starbucks on 87th Dan Ryan location one Star! This one staff in the morning so rules.

7.description: Rezna is the bomb-diggity. We were in the drive-thru and after I placed my order my 14 year old son said "nice service"!  She did provide excellent service. It continued at the window. This is the reason I continue to patronize this brand. It's the culture of Excellent customer service.

8.description: This Starbucks is the only Starbucks in the area and they're the worst! The service is super slow, and I've been given the wrong order many times. Every now and then they'll get it right. I truly hope manager turns this place.

3.description: Worse Starbucks in the city. the customer service is horrible.  I requested that my butter not be thrown in bag on top of hot oatmeal container. The Barista said I didn't order the butter at drive thru. she didn't know to give me butter until she saw me because I order it all the time. However, she still throws butter on top of hot oatmeal. The attitudes are the worse and there is too much socializing at the window. Unfortunately there are not too many Starbucks  in this area. If I could give this place zero stars I would.

14.description: This is the only location from I-57 north to Dan Ryan, recently the service is HORRIBLE!!!   There has been a staff change recently on the early am shift, management remains the same. There is entirely to much socializing, horse play and walking around doing nothing behind the counter between staff and management.  On several occasions at 7:00 am I had to ask for cream and sugar, I had to wait at least two minutes to get it.  I have resorted filling up the sugar container myself and cleaning the condiment bar just to get out in a timely manner.  If you have an extra 25 minutes in your morning commute and want Starbucks at 7am traveling between I-57 (127th Street) to Downtown Chicago, avoid this location if you want to reach your destination on time.

0.description: They have the most delicious and amazing sweet potato pie and I was so excited to learn they were opening a restaurant.  They cook their food fresh made to order and their customer service is fabulous.  The fried tilapia was so hot and had the most delicious flavor.  I will definitely be back soon!!

1.description: Good, fresh and friendly service. The shrimp kow is delicious and singapore noodle is good...i add veggies which is $1 more.

2.description: The food is fresh and the best I ate in a long time the staff is friendly and they care about their customers. Would recommend to friends, family and people who love good tasting food.

0.description: Great tasting and fresh ingredients. The lunch specials are very affordable with large portions. I highly recommend.

This was not my first choice for a place to get my sons hair cut.  Nothing against the establishment, I just tried some other places that didnt work out...I was in need to get my sons hair cut on Saturday morning and did not think with the vast majorty of barbers in my area, it would be so hard to find one....with some if not Great customer service. This was truely a delima for me.  I was outside of one establishment when I called to just make sure it would be ok to walk in when I was abruptly put on hold, well the phone was sat down.  My only question was "Do you have anyone avail to cut my sons hair?" I waited for about 30 sec and hung up.  I then made my way a few steps down and decided to walk into the next establishment.  There was a barber that I knew in there that asked another barber if he could cut my sons hair...Not a problem.  He looked at me like I had asked him to do it for Free and pay ME to allow him to cut my sons hair.  After he "ugh", and contimplated, then told me "yeah I guess so". I politely said "I'LL BE BACK" and ofcourse got in my car and left. Now dont get me wrong.  I do not expect Red Carpet, but act like you want my money even if you dont Need it!  That is how I ended up at TNT. I got on my phone and looked up barber shops and TNT showed up as the next closest to me now.  I called and the gentleman on the phone said Goodmorning, I asked my 1 question {do you have anyone avail}.  I was told, "Sure, come on in we take walk ins".  I wasnt concerned about time, just wanted to know before I wasted my time or anyone elses just walking in.  They were busy but the gentleman who I spoke to on the phone acknowledged me when I walked in, asked me to have a seat and said "someone will be with you shortly".  He then told the other barbers that were working that I was waiting to let them know I needed servicing.  I was then told that I would be next by one of the barbers.  My son was in and out with a fresh new hair cut that was done exceptionally well!!! Thanks TNT for a job well done with service to top it off!

3.description: My first time going to Vicky's nails was this past Saturday.. I loved it! The staff was friendly & the service was quick as well.. just get there early because it gets crowded & the parking lot is super small.

1.description: The young lady who did my pedicure was pretty

2.description: All in all, a good, solid pedicure. I wasn't bowled over, but I wasn't disgusted, either. Nice, modern massager-chair-thingies, but I either didn't know how to work mine properly, or it was in need of repair. Either way, I was offered no assistance...The young lady who did my pedicure was pretty thorough (I have the tough heels of a barefooted marathoner), including a leg massage and moisturizing treatment. The design that I wanted to grace both big toes was executed beautifully, as well.I shall return!

5.description: I used to go to Vicky before she opened her own shop. She use to do a really good job on my brows but not my last visit she did a horrible job and filled then in with a dark pencil which was all bad since I already had on make up. She didn't clean my skin before or after my wax. My skin was stinging from her rushing on my brows it look her three minutes. Literally snatch snatch snatch alright give me my money. I told her my skin was stinging and she proceeded to curse me out expressing how she doesn't carry the proper materials for waxing eye brows. Long story short I won't ever go back there. Totally disrespectful and way too much attitude for a business owner I'll take my money else where

0.description: I received the services of a manicure and eyebrows.  Manicure I would give a 2 and eyebrows I would give a 5. Overall experience for services would be a 3. I recently moved to the Chatham area and live right around the corner from Vicky's. This past Tuesday (August 5th) was my first time at the shop. When I walked in, I wrote my name on the list and waited 10 minutes before being acknowledged and 15 minutes before being sat at a nail booth. I guess they were kinda busy. MANICURE: ($12)DO NOT go to the male manicurist with the long chin hairs. I asked for square nails and only God knows what foolishness he was filing my nails in to. I almost had a heart attack when he tried to start polishing my non-square nails. Sheesh. After having him continue to shape my nail to a point of satisfaction, I finally gave the okay to polish.  He almost forgot to add a second coat to my right hand and did double top coat on that hand too.SMH I never had such a forgetful manicurist. ALSO, he answered his phone and began talking while doing the top coats. Which would explain why he was so forgetful. I miss my manicurist in Maryland ;-( I will return to Vicky's for a manicure just not with the guy with long chin hairs. EYEBROWS: ($8) While getting my manicure, I noticed  EVERYONE who walked passed me, fresh from the eyebrow chair, had their eyebrows SNATCHED FOR THE GODS! I had planned just to get my nails done, but I wanted my eyebrows snatched too! The lady did a great job! She was a little quick when pulling off the wax strips and brushed my browns a little too hard but I think that was because she was rushing because she had so many customers (for eyebrows and nails).

4.description: I'll begin the review by saying that the strip mall where the nail shop is housed has the worst parking lot.  There are 5-6 businesses and maybe 10 parking spots.  I was supposed to visit this business before yesterday, but a couple of weeks before AND the day before I drove around the block twice and decided to give up.  Maybe that was a sign for me not to go.However, I wanted to check it out since it was new.  I FINALLY got a parking spot and decided to check it out.  I got there about 4:45 on a Friday and as expected, it was packed.  I waiting about 5 minutes before I was guided back to the pedicure chair.  I then waited for about 5 minutes for the technician started on me, which isn't a problem because I like to soak my feet for a few minutes.  The technician started my pedicure without any kind of hello or greeting, and the pedicure lasted about 15 minutes.  It was so rushed and mediocre. I understand the place is busy and there were more customers to service, but there was no care given in regards to my pedicure. She did do a good job on the French pedicure, but other than that I don't have anything positive to say about the shop.  I doubt I will be back.  For a $23 pedicure, I needed more.

0.description: These people will never do my nails ever again. I tried to work with them but my nails only looked good for 3-4 days and looked like they needed a fill after only a week. I'm a hand freak so ratty nails are NOT okay. I might let them do my pedi though but never my hands ever again.

3.description: Who goes to Chernins the day before Easter? My BFF and I that's who!!! We were headed to the beauty supply but decided to check out Chernin. I remember Chernins from when I was a little girl my uncle use to work there when it was thee place to buy shoes. I was surprised by how cute the shoes were. Cheap yes!!! Can you get a few wears out of them? yes!! Is it a bargain? HELL YES!!! I am all about buying quality but I got a cute pair of suede gray 3inch sandals for $13.00 you cant beat that! I definitely will be checking them out as the summer nears. I think I will go when they first open though because it was a ghetto madhouse in there.

1.description: This business has not moved! It is still located at the 87th street location. I just made a purchase there Feb 3 2014!

2.description: They have a great selection of inexpressive men's shoes available. Have plenty of stock in hand to accommodate varies styles and designs of shoes.

0.description: I went to a wedding today and broke my shoe.  A shoe I had fixed once already in a different place.  Cheap thrift store shoes... grrr.  After walking around a dollar store barefoot, looking for flip flops, and looking like a hobo, I tried Chernin's.  I figured they couldn't kick me out of a shoe store for not wearing shoes.  At least they knew they'd be making a sale, right?  It seemed a little bit like a madhouse in there, but luckily I'm decisive, saw something that would work and I trotted up to the cash register to plop down my $9.99 plus tax so I could stop worrying about getting a parasite or stepping on rusty metal and dead animals or something.  I could have gotten some Baby Phat flip flops for $6.99 but I already have some "Baby Girl" flip flops that I bought at the Puerto Rican fest.  Thank you Chernin's for saving my feet.

4.description: OK, I know what you're thinking, '$9.99 for SHOES?! Yuk!' but don't knock it till you've tried it.  The selection is HUGE, unfortunately, 90% consists of your standard hooker/club shoes.  However; if you're willing to put in the time, you will find a gem or 2.  I managed to score 2 pumps, one a patent red the other a pretty lilacish color. Like with any low end retail store, less is more.  Use a few pieces to add a little bit of 'pop' to your GOOD wardrobe and you will be fine.   If you're on a budget, check 'em out!

0.description: Love it, love it, love it!!!! Nice cool place to hang out without all the drama and nicely priced drinks too!

12.description: Ordered a cake on Tuesday and asked for a 3:00 pm pick for Saturday.  When I got there was told my cake had not come up yet . Received cake at 4:35.  Appearance of the cake was beautiful, but the taste was terrible. cake was hard and not very moist. I am very disappointed. I have ordered cakes from here before and they were great.  This one was terrible.   I will not  be ordering from there again!!!!

3.description: I have been a customer of this establishment for many years.I love the Sweet Potato Pie.It is with such sadness that i will never order AGAIN.I just can't deal with the nasty attitude of the counterperson(Darlene) and i recently purchased a peach cobbler that was unfit for consumption.Reaally! It was soupy,greasy and looked Nasty.I unwrapped it for a family event and was horrified.I love to patronize black businesses but this one,I will NEVER again.I only give a star because of the pie.They place as a whole needs to find out the meaning of customer service and professionalism.

1.description: Won't be back, the cupcakes were terrible and flavorless. The pound cake was not very fresh to me either. I used to rave about this place but not anymore. Will try out Brown Sugar Bakery next.

2.description: I was referred to this bakery by a friend, Darlene the lady who answered the phone was rude, and she hardly allowed me to get out what I was seeking from their bakery. If I didn't know any better I would have thought it was an inconvenience to contact a bakery regarding a birthday cake! I sent an email to their listed email address with a photo and I was telling her this when she nastily said "you gotta bring it in" I said O okay, and she responded with "when do you need the cake" I said on the 27th "We won't be open that day" I responded okay thank you, and she hung up.  It would have been polite and good customer service for her to say "I do apologize our email is currently down,  I'm sure it would be an inconvenience for you however you would have to bring a photo into the bakery and we can discuss at that time, when would you need the cake by? I then would have stated the 27th and at that time she would politely say "Unfortunately our bakery will be closed on the 27th" and then offered an alternative option in the case that the alternative option doesn't work for me you retain customers by saying "I do understand and we hope to be of better assistance for you in the future" you don't just hang up and let money walk away you try and keep it! Based off a 3min conversation I know I will not use their services, furthermore we seek to support our African American business but most times our own people act as though their doing us a favor when we are paying for the service! I just don't understand. I'll take my service up north like I've always done.

9.description: Ok, so I definitely have to tell you everything to understand my frustration! I was very shocked at the service here because my mom would drive from Richton Park to get a cake! But the customer service and bakery knowledge leaves little to be appreciated. I went here to purchase cupcakes for my daughter's birthday party and wanted an apple design on top of the cupcake. I showed pictures and everything and the lady act like I was ordering a wedding cake!  She said we would have to use fondant for the smooth look. Explained I didn't want that on the cupcakes and she said ok. She said we would have to use it for the leaves then advise me that I'll have to pay extra for them using fondant?! First thing first, how much extra could I really have to pay for 24 very small cupcake leaves, huh, $2??? Expressed we didn't have to use fondant at all. She said we did for the pictures I was showing her. I pulled the website to show her the tutorial that used only frosting and she says "that picture is fondant"!!!??? Ok lady ! I'm very crafty and could have done the simple smooth red frosting, pretzel stem with a frosting leaf (heck they have the hard frosting leaves at Michael's) but I wanted to eliminate some things on my list. Well leave it to them to add some stuff on! After about 10 minutes of back and forth, the "decorator", finally seen the light but wait.... Only to ask me can I GO BUY the pretzels for the stems and could I GO PRINT OUT the picture and stuff off that I showed them??!!!?? Wait a minute bakery that I'm sure is a legit business!!! I come to get rid of a task and you add two things on!! So I get the pretzels and tell them I didn't have time to print out the stuff for the "bakery", I wrote the website on the pretzel bag. Only to be told, "we don't have no way of looking it up but she'll hook them up, we got it now" ??? What bakery don't have access to the Internet to run their business, get emails, cake decorating ideas.... I mean I can go on! Just wrong for no reason. I will not return to this bakery and become a part time worker with no pay and Internet hot spot service. Oh yeah, the cupcakes tasted good(1star) and looked ok(1star) but nothing like the pictures :(

10.description: Customer service is really poor.  When will we learn that treating customers well will get them to be repeat customers.  Lack of customer service is why we have trouble staying in business.  The owner needs to train her help to teach them business skills. The product may taste great, but the service is horrible!

13.description: We love the caramel cakes for the holidays and peanut butter cookies just because.

16.description: This is what I imagine is the ingredient list in a caramel cupcake from A Piece of Cake:Corn syrup, sugar, stevia, high fructose corn syrup, fructose, sucrose, organic sugar, cane syrup, the insides of pixie sticks, saccharin, honey ...and some butter.Frosting is glopped on generously. Their chocolate is old school chocolate, not dark, dense and fudgy, but slightly lighter brown and saaa-weeet. The standout there was their red velvet cupcake, not the cake so much as the superior cream cheese frosting atop - Holy crap is that stuff good. After sampling three I found myself dizzy and taking note of the multiple medical offices along South Western Avenue that specialize in diabetes care.

6.description: Well, I have to say that this place is uber small and shabby.I mean like 10x11 small. Its hot, they have 1 chair in the entire place, not that they could fit many more but when looking through cake books sitting is nice for a bakery with their history. Today there were 11 people in that small space, most waiting on cakes that come from some place that the staff has to walk outside go get the cakes and bring them back in. smh.A couple people were only wanting to buy cake slices or cookies. There was 1 person upfront. THEY REALLY NEED TO GET A COUPLE MORE UPFRONT PEOPLE TO BECOME MORE EFFICIENT. No one even asked if we needed help. Eventually just left without ordering anything for my daughters birthday. This place gave off a weird vibe and their air conditioner WHICH IS DIRECTLY OVER THE ENTRANCE was leaking WATER all over us as we entered and left the facility. Makes one wonder what the kitchen looks like. WE GOTTA DO BETTER.. I'm giving 1 star because the slices and cookies looked fresh lol

15.description: I was disappointed with the service when I went to receive a quote for a client. The sales associate could not tell me flavors and tried to change my order! Ultimately, I did not go with this bakery.

0.description: I have ordered cakes from A Piece of Cake for many years. Every one has been absolutely delicious. Their caramel cakes are wonderful and I always get asked where I had it made. I live on the north side of Chicago, but find a way each time I need to celebrate an occasion that is important to me. It's all in the taste!

5.description: We have followed this bakery for 19 years, from Cottage Grove to Western, to the current location on 87th street. Our family really likes the cakes and the people have been really nice. However, we have reached the end of the road now. We have supported them even though this location is the smallest and so shabby, the cakes still taste good. This week I got up early to order a cake and they don't open until 10am - what bakery isn't open in the morning? When I went back at the end of the day, it smelled like bleach - not appealing in a food place. The order and pick up was fine, but just looking around the place, I realized I just can't support a place that doesn't care about how it looks. Or how clean it is. There are just simple things that can be done to make it look like a quality establishment. And when you look through the doorway to the back, you can see tiles missing in the floors. Makes you wonder how clean the actual kitchen and baking areas are. I wish I could bankroll an update for this place like the Food Network shows. The interesting part and the final straw is that the three layers in the cake are so uneven! The bottom layer is regular size, the middle layer is about double that, and the top layer is about half and inch. We thought it was a two layer cake at first! It tasted fine, but just doesn't look right. We'll have to drive further; however, cleanliness and professional looking cakes are important.

11.description: Update I tasted the cake!Cake itself--moist and chocolate-y. Not too bad kinda good actually.Buttercream frosting--HORRIBLE! Cheap tasting. tasted like the cheap buttercream frosting that come on the ready-made cakes from Jewel, but worse. I actually doubted that she even made the forsting herself because I make better frosting and I'm not a baker.

8.description: i am a long-time follower of a piece of cake bakery. the desserts are great and the staff is friendly and helpful.i purchase every holiday and birthday cake from them. the caramel cake is extraordinary and the mouthwatering rolls melt in your mouth. Add a little butter to the rolls and pop them in the microwave for a few seconds and you have yourself a delectable treat. they don't sell rolls year round, so i make sure i get them on every holiday. I was last at the bakery picking up a caramel cake for my nephew's birthday. it was so moist and delicious. i had a simple round caramel cake but while was there I saw the most adorable carousel baby shower cakes being picked up. the mother was ecstatic. she loved it. i saw several other cakes being picked up with such extraordinary designs and attention to detail. I will always be a fan of a piece of cake bakery.

4.description: This place sucks! They slaughtered my baby's 1st birthday cake. One of the simplest cakes you can ever make..... A Mickey Mouse cake and I'm upset

14.description: I've been meaning to do this review for some time. I've been a few times. Honestly, the cakes that I have had from here are good but the service is not the best,(hence the 1 star). Maybe they don't even deserve the one star but I still remember being in there, jonesing for some goodies and being thoroughly pissed at the wasted trip. The last time I went(about a month ago) I was disappointeed. Not in the cakes but in the service. After waiting for at least 20 minutes while three people served one lady, another lady comes in. She looks at me and asks if I have been helped. I tell her that I haven't been helped and  that I'm waiting to be helped. Well the youngest of the crew takes care of her right away like I hadn't been waiting there for damn near half an hour-WTF. I said really, You're just gonna jump in front of me and you're just gonna serve her anyway? Needless to say, I walked right out. I don't play that. I will not be back.

7.description: A bit unorganized staff, but fantastic cakes.  I've ordered two cakes for two very special occasions and they were both delicious. Everyone loved both cakes and I would definitely order from this bakery in the future.

1.description: This place is small seriously any vitamins or herbs u need for great prices.. They have to be doing well they have been open for years..

0.description: Kudus is too sweet!! Amazingly, this place has everything you could want/need in a health food shop. It's a tiny lil place but well stocked. They've even got the licorice root I used to chew in high school! NOBODY carried that since the 90s as far as I can tell. BIG plus!! And the ginger beers, excellent.

3.description: I am new to Chicago. I stopped in to buy lemon pepper fish. I ordered the wrong fish (catfish instead of perch).  The clerk developed an attitude immediately. The manager chafed the order to perch but when I arrived home the fish was old and discolored! Is this how business treat customers in Chicago. I am disgusted that I fed my family this meal.

1.description: Not bad... Parking sucks... But if nothing else is available it will due... Much better than that KFC across the street

2.description: I come here often. Great selection in the store is very neat and clean. They have great customer service. The food is cooked very well and I love the taste. I believe they do deliver but I often order inside and even have eaten inside. I definitely recommend it.

5.description: I didn't really care for the food. I got some shrimp and chicken and it was just another greasy seafood spot. Nothing more or less.  Maybe I should have gotten the Philly cheese steak.

6.description: Food was what you would expect. However as far as service the staff sometimes is less than professional. As I waited for my food I watched the woman cashier argue with one of the cooks behind the counter about making personal calls. This argument lasted at least 15 minutes. Meanwhile potential customers are leaving out of disgust. The cashier was so in her emotions that she didn't notice! She was even short with some of the customers! If I go back here it's because it's on the way and I'll get my food to go ASAP instead of dining in.

7.description: WOW- best prices, food is DELICIOUS and delivery was fast! Being Philidelphian, I tried their Philly Steak- GREAT JOB- except they couldn't bring themselves to put more than a skinny line of ketchup down the middle, lol- it's a Philly thing, Red Snapper! Send ketchup packets, if you're scrrrrd!!The Chicago dogs were tasty, the wings really came with slices of bread and a good amount of fries. The double chocolate cake was from a bakery, it was the least "wow".Open to Midnight during the week, give this place a try!

8.description: This place has just recently opened in Chatham.  We found out about it do to the menu/coupon flyers they mailed out.  From the looks of those, it looked like a fun new spot to try out.  The good impressions disappeared from there.Strike 1 - The flyers had coupons on the flaps, but they were printed in such a way, that if you cut one out, you ruined TWO other coupons on the other side.  Hmmm ...Strike 2 - When we got to the place, they had stands with the same menu/flyer on it, but someone had hand cut all the coupons off of them b4 putting them on display.  Who does that?!?!Strike 3 - We ordered a gyro meal w/ fries and a pop, used a coupon to get a free gyro with the order of a gyro, and ordered an Oreo & Cream Parfait dessert.  There were only 3 other people in the place, but it took them FOREVER to get the order up and the cash register girl was borderline rude.  When we got home the sandwiches had almost no meat and the onions and tomatoes were on there way out.  The Oreo & Cream dessert was already out.Three Strikes and you're out.  We will not be back.

0.description: Amazing! This is the best place on the bitty Southside for shrimp. I went over to Lawrence's Fisheries. Yeah...the place that has the best seafood in Chicago, since forever. No! Red Snapper makes shrimp the way they are supposed to be. The establishments best seasonings, batter, fry and serve. That is it. Not some thick encasing of batter with a moist shrimp on the inside. Thank you Red Snapper for preparing shrimp the way they are supposed to be. With the first bite I was taken back home to the coast of Georgia. We also had the chicken tenders, which were huge and for the price the quantity matches for both items. The only issue I have with Red Snapper. Is that nibble bite of coleslaw. It was not enough, but the slaw is damn good. I had delivery for this order and the delivery was pretty fast and we ordered through GrubHub. Will defo be ordering from them again.

4.description: Red is the place for fish at it best

1.description: Good food.  But terrible customer service.  After several visits where I made a point of praising food and service, I went in and ordered a double order of cheese sticks.  After charging me they informed me they had no marinara sauce.  No offer of refund.  Later the same day I took a colleague there to treat her to lunch.  After paying I realized I forgot to order a drink.  They would not let me use q credit card because of 5 dollar minimum. This was especially annoying after earlier issues.  I will not be back.  Potbelly next door has a public restroom and better service.

2.description: As a regular customer, I am insulted that after a certain hour, I can no longer do a phone order. I have stopped eating at this location and mgr Sam and Anwar you should be ashamed that you don't make exceptions for your "loyal" customers.

0.description: I never have an issue when I visit this location. Fast service and everything is fresh. The slusie machine has some good flavors and a must have when I visit. The customer service is great from the cashier to the cook. Although, we did order the gizzards and they were cooked a little to hard, but still looking forward to my next visit.

1.description: Its a good restaurant but the service is not up to par.  I called in my order and was happy to know that I  would just walk in and just pay. To my surprise, when I got there 30 minutes later my food wasn't prepared. I had to wait an additional 30 minutes to get my food. To top it off that it was incorrect. They had gotten my order wrong. I didn't realize it until I got home.  The food was good though. The area is kind of suspect though. You got to be able to hold your own.

9.description: The man who owns it is nice.   The jerk chick was very good and the cabbage is delicious! Rice and peas and macaroni were normal, but good. I had curry chicken once and the portion was a bit smaller but only okay. Pretty consistent spot. Going to try the oxtails next.

12.description: Finally a restaurant in Chicago where the taste and heat level of ALL the food on my plate meets my expectations. The owner/chef is Paulette who is a sweetheart and will take good care of you. There's a single table which is more for waiting than eating. They do accept credit cards. Dinners consisting of meat, beans & rice plus two sides typically run under $10 bucks while the seafood dishes are a little more. The portions are very generous. Metra trains run down the middle of 71st Street so pay heed to the "Yield" signs which are all over the place here.Of course the jerk chicken is the dish to get. I have a weakness for curry, so I got some of that to go also. The dinners are served on a generous bed of rice and beans and come with two sides. For one side I got steamed cabbage. Paulette works her magic even on the lowly cabbage which is seasoned to culinary nirvana.Oxtails. Curried goat. Talk about authentic! They even had escoviched fish on the menu which is akin to a ceviche. And then there's callaloo which is like spinach and I've had it only in Jamaica.Jared S. was the First to Review this place and he uses the word "spectacular" to describe it. Totally agree.So after eating food from here I have this urge to go out and have my hair braided...

21.description: Finally a restaurant in Chicago where the taste and heat level of ALL the food on my plate meets my expectations. The owner/chef is Paulette who is a sweetheart and will take good care of you. There's a single table which is more for waiting than eating. They do accept credit cards. Dinners consisting of meat, beans & rice plus two sides typically run under $10 bucks while the seafood dishes are a little more. The portions are very generous. Metra trains run down the middle of 71st Street so pay heed to the "Yield" signs which are all over the place here.Of course the jerk chicken is the dish to get. I have a weakness for curry, so I got some of that to go also. The dinners are served on a generous bed of rice and beans and come with two sides. For one side I got steamed cabbage. Paulette works her magic even on the lowly cabbage which is seasoned to culinary nirvana.Oxtails. Curried goat. Talk about authentic! They even had escoviched fish on the menu which is akin to a ceviche. And then there's callaloo which is like spinach and I've had it only in Jamaica.Jared S. was the First to Review this place and he uses the word "spectacular" to describe it. Totally agree.So after eating food from here I have this urge to go out and have my hair braided...

16.description: By far the BEST Red Beans and Rice HANDS DOWN!! My boyfrend and I went the first time and ordered the jerk chicken with red beans and rice, plantains, and cabbage and I must say that my boyfriend is a chef so he is EXTREMELY critical on food at restuarants and he LOVED every bite. Next trip we shared an order of jerk oxtails with the red beans and rice, cabbage, and plaintains ANOTHER winner. This food is simply delicious! I always thought Uncle Joe's was the go to place for jamaican, but I have def learned otherwise and the fact that I can get great jamaican food around the corner from my apt is why they def deserve 5 stars! :) Will try the jerk tilapia on my next visit.

17.description: Awful Awful Awful customer service. I ordered over the phone and I could barely hear the young lady on the other end. She said my order would be ready in 20 minutes so I waited. Arrived to pick up my order only to be met with a confused look and fumbling around. She went back into the kitchen and I waited for several minutes. I stood, waiting. She returned with a blank and un concerned look on her face - said something like "yeah this is what you ordered, it's going to be another 30 minutes. No apology. Just sheer confusion. I said no thank you and again she was unbothered and never apologized. The look on her face and tone was that of I did something wrong. Will never return.

10.description: This place is a hidden gem with all the jerk chicken spots opening up in Chicago this one takes the cake. I called as they were closing and they took my order with no problem. I had the jerk wings and the half dark dinner. The chicken was spicy but not overbearing and the sides were amazing! I had Mac and cheese and cabbage. The chicken wasn't dry like I see at most jerk chicken places. If your over east on the south side of Chicago and you got a taste for some jerk you must try this spot!

5.description: Ordered takeout and it did satisfy my craving. A bit pricy but you get good portions. Jerk chicken was moist and cooked very well. The mac cheese was impressive, which is not common. The rice and bean were a bit off because the gravy/sauce was a bit sweet. Not that terrible but  surprising.

11.description: Um, I don't know what place the other reviewers went too because this food was Nasty with a capital N!!!The jerk chicken wings were the only thing that had any saving grace to this place but the sides were just horrible!My daughter likes this place that's why I went but since she isn't a person that truly cooks or eats real food I should have known I would not like this place!!!This is another place I wouldn't go to if it was free!

22.description: Was visiting a friend who just moved to the neighborhood and was looking for a place that had take out.  By chance I came across Royal Caribbean Jerk and ordered a variety of dishes including the jerk chicken and oxtails.  I am not very familiar with Jamaican food however the food was spectacular.  On top of the amazing food the price was extremely reasonable and the the food came out very quickly.  I did not have to wait but just 10 minutes for my food to be prepared.  If you love juicy flavorful food I highly recommend Royal Caribbean Jerk!!!!

0.description: This is a hidden gem! The customer service is excellent, fast and friendly! I'm a creature of habit, I usually have jerk chicken with plantains, cabbage and rice (DELICIOUS). So I was a bit apprehensive when it was suggested that I try the lobster, but it was AMAZING! The lobster over with rice garnished with onions and peppers was seasoned perfectly! The potato salad and green salad really complimented the lobster and rice. As usual I was very pleased with the service and food!

20.description: You know a restaurant is going to be good when all of the staff speaks with a thick Jamaican accent. They are regularly out of certain items. If it was subway, I'd be upset, but these people cook everything from scratch! Be prepared for delicious food and huge portions!

19.description: Very friendly service. Small take out only place with pictures of Jamaica on the wall hung high. I ordered the curry chicken lunch special with cabbages and calilou sides. Rice and beans are included with a piece of bread.wow! Awesome food from start to finish.just like Jamaica.  And nice sized servings.I'll be back!

2.description: It was ok, it wasn't the best that I ever had but it defiantly was not the worse either. But I am sick so my taste buds are off. I will try them again in the near future and update my review.

18.description: i have to write this is all caps..this is the worst jerk chicken ever created..do not..i repeat do not go into this restaurant.this chicken tastes old the mac and cheese is old and the cheap boxes stuff.. $23 for crap food. the chicken is not grilled it's baked the sauce is just hot nothing else. i can't explain how angry i am.. no rating at all.

13.description: I love their jerk chicken dinner...man it can feed 2+ people...i definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for some good Jamaican jerk!!!

4.description: This is not the type of jerk chicken I am use to seems like it was baked in the oven and it had no heat to it and the sauce is the worst jerk sauce I have ever had in my life all in all the chicken is not nasty but not what I was expecting will definitely not be back.

6.description: I like white meat and lot of places tend to dry it out,but Not here! The jerk sauce is very spicy and has a nice texture to it, not watered down like some places.  I usually get plantain and mac and cheese for sides so I haven't tried any of the other sides yet. My food is always hot and fresh so I keep coming back. .BUT. . the service is terrible...extremely terrible.  They're rude as heck!  Extra rude...And you might want to go before it gets dark outside because the surroundings are less than desirable. Ijs.

15.description: Uh, I stopped in on a Saturday afternoon and they pretty much had no food...so... I guess I can't review a restaurant that has no food.  Who does that? The woman behind the register seemed pretty indifferent to the fact. Come to think of it, I've never seen anyone in there either. Suppose I won't be going back.

7.description: I called ahead to order a jerk chicken dinner and the guy said 15 minutes. I typically know jerk chicken spots usually take at least 30 minutes. So I took my time getting there 30 minutes later and it was not ready. I only ended up waiting maybe 5-7 minutes in the restaurant. The food was definitely worth the wait! The chicken was fresh and seasoned well. And the sides were great and plentiful that it took 3 of us to finish the one dinner! I will definitely be back! Just be prepared to wait for your food.

8.description: The jerk chicken is decent enough and that's the main attraction. The rice and everything else is basic. The staff seemed in a state of perpetual irritation or indifference. The place has a Times Square vibe of hurry up and shut up. If I'm hungry and walking by and smell the grilling, I'd probably stop in again but otherwise I wouldn't make a planned trip to the place.

3.description: Not only did the lady had much attitude behind the counter but the gentleman who was trying to take my order wouldn't stop staring me in the face long enough besides trying to ask me for my phone number to get the fucking order right after all that the chicken is okay for jerk chicken not enough seasoning but my rice is swimming literally swimming in sauce The ox tails are sweet with sugar who the hell makes oxtail sweet for Jamaican restaurant

14.description: Excellence Jerk Fish. Love the Cabbage! The Owner is about service and providing customers a good experience, he responds to inquiries you might have about food or service. I must warn you, call ahead or be prepared to wait..... Although you won't be disappointed the wait can be a bit long, otherwise would rate a five!

3.description: Uh... No!!! Not good even under new management!!! Nothing ever ready... And what they have on ready is old... If you must go here have it cooked fresh!!!

1.description: I refuse to give this establishment any stars however I'm forced to do so thanks to yelp. From the moment I arrived at the drive thru I received the worst service. The employees always have non customer service attitudes as if it's not their job to take my order. My food was reheated, NOT FRESHLY COOKED, and the drinks are always filled with ice and very little drink. It's over all a horrible fast food stop and I will never entertain them again.

2.description: Would not give a single star. Walked in on Saturday night, craving a pot pie (saw their commercial), and after waiting 10 min. to be addressed, was advised that there was a 22 minute wait for that item. I wasn't gonna wait that long, so I asked for a bowl (I know, but it's good). Was told they were out of corn... That's 0 for 2 so far. At my mother's suggestion, I then asked for their two main sides, macaroni and cheese, and mashed potatoes and gravy. They were out of both...0 for 4. At that point, it wasn't even worth it. I walked out. This place has been open forever, and never seems to be doing well. I won't be back.

0.description: Although they don't have much of a selection after 9pm (Time I get off work), the personnel at the drive through are always very nice, and friendly. They greet you with a smile, and talk to you respectfully, and with care.

3.description: They have really fell off not as good as it was back in the day I don't even eat there anymore

1.description: Unfortunately I can not comment on the food because it was so very masked by the horrendous customer service. The woman taking orders so so extremely disrespectful and rude, that when I walked in, there were already two women complaining about how she had already displayed such rude behavior. She snatched the money from the customer ahead of me and had a terrible disposition. She shoo'd a customer away with her hand when she asked if her order was done. Needless to say, I did not eat here and NEVER will!!

2.description: This was my third (ONLY) choice for Chinese food tonight. I did not want to drive back to Kedzie for ChiTung and the other place I think is halfway decent was closed! So I ended up here. It's my second time at this restaurant and I was sooo excited to return after getting what was supposed to be crab Rangoon my first time (they were fried so hard, they were inedible). I chose a special which consisted of egg foo young, an eggroll and chicken fried rice (not sure why it wasn't plain or shrimp like other restaurants...or am I). I checked my order and realized no fortune cookie.  Weird I know! I inquired and was told they don't come with the meal. The woman then motioned to the plastic bin filled with cookies on the counter which read "cookies $.10." I burst into laughter and replied, "are you serious?" Obviously annoyed, the woman threw one in my bag as if she was doing me a favor. The food: The rice was ok. The chicken in it was leftover, oversized pieces (by pieces I mean two) of chicken from what I don't what to know. The gravy on the egg foo young was an orange color. A little strange but it didn't taste too different than what I would expect. They definitely still use MSG because it was SALTY. The eggroll was sour. Not like I put sweet and sour on it; but it was going bad!! Who has ever had a spoiled eggroll?! So disappointing! Sigh....I should've known better than to try this place again.  I let my hunger pains get the best of me and now I hope that doesn't lead to food poisoning pains!

5.description: I'm in love with their food. Only Chinese place I want to eat in Chicago :) --draw back to the experience is the CASH ONLY policy :p

7.description: Tonight I was desperate. They're the only Chinese restaurant OPEN within a reasonable distance. Tofu is bland with the sauce and the fried rice is so greasy I could replace my chap stick with the rice. However, I do like the idea of serving tofu in a community where most people are like "Whats tofu?" or "Ew tofu." and the food was hot. I won't be back.

8.description: Food is good. Never have to wait long. Best in area.  Variety of dishes and they give you a lot of food in your order.

9.description: Not bad... I've had better!

0.description: This place is in the same strip mall that has the best Harold's chicken in Chicago and Docks fish.  It is anchored by the Food 4 Less grocery store. This is the Best Chinese food in the area.  Generous portions, fairly priced, fast and polite service.  The egg-foo-young patties and the triple delight are especially good.  Call ahead and they will have your order ready.  Cash Only.

4.description: I decided to do a review which I normally don't, but considering I spent 20$ on two orange chicken combos and receive the worst Chinese food I've ever experienced. I had to make a comment.

1.description: This business is linking to website that does NOT belong to them. Additionally, they are employing NON-LICENSED individuals, and have illegally obtained business license.I think the truly shameful aspect of this business, is that they use dirty, unethical, and hurtful tactics to attract business. A reflection of terribly poor character.Next step: Reporting them to TheIllinois Department of Financial & Professional Regulation (idfpr.com) to shut them down.

2.description: 1 word: HORRID.You get what you pay for. I needed a manicure quick, fast and in a hurry!I typed "nail salons" into my navigator and this place showed up around the corner from where I was. I found a parking spot and walked in with my best friend.The color selection is ... meh. Seriously.I opted for "clear"... just give me a topcoat and I'll be on my way.Before she began, I explained to her that I like my nails very short and square. I also told her that I don't like my cuticles cut; unfortunately, I had to remind her several times to NOT cut my cuticles. Just push 'em back.She pulled out her little bottle of "Sally Hansen Nail Hardener".I was outdone. I paid my ten bucks and left.

0.description: They hired new workers that barely knew any English and what they were doing. I found this to be very unacceptable, without a doubt they are likely to not be licensed.

3.description: Good prices and the pizza is great I order all the time I recommend everyone to try it

1.description: The prices are great, but I wish I could say the same about the service.  Maybe dine in is better, but I ordered over the phone twice and the second time they were so rude I canceled my order. The first time I just figured it was a Friday and maybe he was just busy and didn't realize he was actually yelling at me and being very short. The second time he wasn't just loud, he was rude and disrespectful.  I wouldn't order dog food from this place.

2.description: Tim B. Is a.spammer. he's said same thing about a couple other joints on da SS.... loser stay in hippie land and eat a pineapple and coconut liberal a.s.s. pizza

5.description: I have been around this place either walking or driving and never really thought much of it. I tried it previously years ago with a friend and I remember it not tasting bad but it was only a slice. This time I ordered a family size pizza which was only roughly $14 and it was worth it. I was surprised by how much pizza $14 could buy you especially since the higher end pizza places (Leona's..ehh) and the pizza was good. The only issue I have is that one it's on 79th and King Drive, which by itself is enough to deter certain folks and secondly, my pizza was not cut all the way through (imagine eating awesome pizza but having to rip it apart by hand...it sucked) but other than that...it was awesome.

6.description: I love this place because they make mostacholi fresh to order! For under 5 bucks you get a hearty sized meal with breadsticks. I will say that it is kinda greasy. I don't mind though, it adds to the flavor!It's just in the hood...

7.description: After spending a day in the city hunting for parking, trying to avoid pedestrians and paying parking fees we decided to search for a pizzeria off the beaten path!  Our GPS pointed us here and we googled it and thought it was a chain! Surprise - it apparently just shares the name with a chain with a cool website.  We decided to go for it and ordered a family size deep dish for about $23 bucks. My sister ordered a slice of deep dish cheese with a soda for about $3 bucks. Both pieces that I sampled were simply delicious!! I prefer St. Louis style thin crust but the cheese was awesome and lots of it. Now, they don't take plastic and it took 40 minutes for the pizza but it was well worth the wait and we had no trouble finding off street parking. There are no tables and chairs so this is truly take out. It was a great adventure!

0.description: I have never eaten here before but I Siri called it instead of my local pizzeria in Colorado.
