The guy that answered asked me, "do you know where we are located?"My reply, "ya sure."  His response, "then hop in a helicopter and come on over."Next time I'm in Chicago I'm stopping by!  This has obviously happened before, thanks Old Chicago.

4.description: please think twice before ordering here!!!Starting with the first thing, I tried to order online through my yelp app, it said I could not place an order at this time, so I called.  The person who answered the phone was in such a hurry that he really couldn't get my order straight or my phone number.  He kept interrupting me while I was trying to order... Fast forward even when I had to call back to see when was the pizza going to arrive he rushed me off the phone, stating the pizza would be another 15 minutes, I ordered at 6:15, it did not come until 8:00. When the pizza came it was gross! Hot, but gross! Had no flavor at all and I ordered soggy buffalo wings... Oops my bad, soggy inferno wings that came with yellow ranch. I gave the review a two instead of a one, because my kids said the pepperoni was good. I am overall outdone, this was my first and last time ordering there.  Maybe, I caught them on a busy Sunday evening, or maybe it just wasn't for me.

3.description: They have a very large selection, but I won't be going back. The staff is ridiculously unprofessional and the owner walked past me 5 times without saying a word. I was never asked if I needed help & he never sent anyone over. In another section of the store, the employees watched me wait at the counter for someone & just watched. I stood there so long I thought they were customers too! I stopped a security guard & asked him to call someone for me, only to find out it was the same group of girls watching me. Then, someone else needed help in another section, of course the guard called again & this lazy heifer got mad saying that he was acting like someone else who irritated her & she didn't want to hear him on the walkie all day! This was all in front of me! This was my second & last visit.

1.description: Horrible customer service! One of the owners basically told me I didn't know how to count when I challenged that her employee told me I would get a discount for a used product on top of a sale. The employee verified she said it but hid behind her lack of English to say she didn't understand what I meant. How do you sale a used product for market price?! When the owner made the comment to me, I promptly let her know how many degrees I had, told her I spoke English very well, and started doing the math for the discount out loud. She was so pissed, she walked away in the middle of me talking! I agree that they have everything and after talking to the other stores in the area, it seems as if they are (in Walmart fashion) creating exclusivity contracts with certain vendors. HOWEVER, I know the value of my dollar and I REFUSE to shop anywhere that takes my money for granted. Although this store is only a few minutes from me, I have not returned since that happened in October. I would rather go out of my way and pay more if need be!

2.description: I'm pretty surprised at the reviews. I only went there once some months back. I bought a "leather looking" skirt and some usual hair products (oil sheen, thermal protector). I had a young lady helping me in the clothing section and when I went to the counter to purchase, the cashier and employees were friendly and talking to me. In fact I'm going back today after work to get some hair stuff. :) See you all soon. I'll be in a long eggplant colored coat if you see me lol

5.description: Large selection of products, average to high pricing. Cashier seemed noticeably cold as if she did not want to help us with our purchase. I am not surprised to read that others have had not so great customer service from this place.

6.description: I was going to write this long detailed expose but why risk carpal tunnel dealing with the wanksters.  They are big on supply and low on customer service.  You will definitely have to tell somebody off, most likely a  manager, unfortunately good service starts at the top by example so don't expect anything spectacular.  Managers are rude especially the lady in the back with the shorter hair.  With all the beauty supplies in chicago you can make this your last stop.  Their prices arent anything to write home about either.

7.description: Do not go to this place!  I went there on yesterday  just to get my credit  so that I could purchase some items to my dismay I was told that the restroom was not for the public. So that where everything started  I was told by security and a manager  ( who would  not give me her name) told me that I could not use the restroom then another security  officer  can and  asked  me what was the problem I informed  him that  there was not a problem but that I needed  to use the restroom he gave the same  spill and he asked the manager  if I was going  to be served she said no the security told me to leave I said no I told him that I came to get my credit and get some items  the the manager keep saying  NO I told her that she was doing a disservice and that I was going  to the BBB and ADA about  what had accrued with me and only then she told the security  that I could  shop and then told the employee why she was not waiting  on me. So then I was waited on by a lovely young lady. I purchased  my items  and will never return again.

8.description: Wide variety of items however terrrriblllleeee customer service... I've came here a few times to give it another chance you know, thinking perhaps I caught some ppl on a bad day. No! From the cashiers on to the mangers/owners - just terrible. One manager was cursing out the cashier while she was cashing me out... She was so embarrassed. I will say the greeter (male, African American) is always nice and the young ladies working in the wig section. Other than that, awful.

9.description: Extremely bad service.  Unfortunately, it was from the manager.  A friend and I went into the store today to try and find certain beauty product.  We began looking around and then my friend needed to find the restroom.  One of the salespeople escorted her to the back and then we continued shopping.  As we were talking to the salesperson, the manager came up to her and began chastising her loudly, telling her that she needed his permission before anyone could use the bathroom. Really?!!! Do you not see she is helping us?  Do you not see that we are about to spend at least $100-200 in your store??? Nope, he didn't care.  Upon leaving, we gave him a piece of our mind and left... I can't speak for my friend but I will find another beauty supply.  Tell a friend!

0.description: I am so glad I decided to ignore the low rating and bad reviews for this place because my experience was faaaaar from bad.To begin, the store is located on the south side of Chicago, the second to last stop on the redline (87th) to be exact. Due to the fact that I live on the north side, I made sure to call the store first and find out if they carried a certain brand I was looking for. THIS is where great customer service came in, I called and asked the person who answered the phone to confirm they carried a specific brand, after the woman confirmed I then asked for a specific product within the brand. The woman then took the time to walk down to the aisle the brand was located and inspect the shelves until she found the product I was looking for. Woohoo! The fact that I received such helpful customer service over the phone definitely confirmed that a trip to the store may be worth it regardless of the distance. Once I arrived to the strip mall where the store was located (tons of parking by the way), I was greeted by the Mother of all beauty supply stores. Sistar Beauty is in a building that was once a Best Buy store, that should give you an idea on how massive the inside is. I'm talking wall to wall wigs & hair weave galore! Tons of false eyelashes, makeup, beauty products, hair tools, jewelry, shoes and even clothing! I seriously felt like a kid in a candy store. While walking around the store I was approached by several of the employees who were polite and asked if I needed any help. Thumbs up in my book!As for the pricing, everything that I purchased was inexpensive --they were little things like hair gel, shower caps and deep conditioners. If you're buying hair or hair tools expect to spend a much bigger amount. I will say that the person checking me out clearly was one of the owners of the store and did come off a bit cold but whatever, the employees were lovely which made up for it. Overall my experience was pleasant and I will be back.Happy shopping!

4.description: Poor customer service. High pricing. No public restroom in such a huge store. I think that whoever the owner is May be a business newbie or something. I don't recommend this place

3.description: Great service... Odd location... But Can't give or more than a 3 it's a chain

1.description: Solid sandwich place with a variety of choices for all eaters. I had the Mediterranean sandwich with your choice of fixings (ie: tomatoes, lettuce, mayo, mustard, vinegarette, etc) on a wheat bread. I liked the toasted bread. The flavor of the sandwich was okay. Didn't get a chance to try the shakes or the cookies since I heard that they were good. Location was in a newer shopping center. Plenty of parking in front of the restaurant.

2.description: One of the best Potbelly's my girlfriend has even been to - and she's been to a lot.  Mmmhmm.  Sandwiches are spot on, salads are fresh and tasty, plus their milkshakes are delicious.  This neighborhood needs more diverse (and most importantly delicious) fast food like it.

0.description: Great customer service! The manager was very interactive with her customers and the sandwich are always great!

1.description: How do you not have spinach? This is not the first time a Subway I have patronized didn't have spinach. I think they are being cheap actually. If you claim to be health conscious, you KNOW spinach is more nutritional than iceberg or romaine lettuce blends.I didn't even order my salad. It was a wasted trip.

2.description: I went to Subway on yesterday and ordered a tuna sub.  When I got home, they had given me someone else's food, turkey with gobs of mayonnaise and lettuce.  The customer service is non-existent, because there is no regard for their customers.  It seems they are making money but don't want to be there. A suggestion:  Check to see if the sandwich belongs to the person before they wrap it up and ask for your money.

3.description: I LOVE it I've been coming here for over ten years and the service and food have stayed consistent.

1.description: I came here tonight to order a carmel sundae and I was standing there for a good 10 minutes while the workers were going about things as if nobody was standing there waiting to order their food. What was even more ridiculous was how they're not efficient in the least bit to getting customers  orders right when a lady standing next to me checked her order and noticed there was an item missing and took the manager 5 minutes to get the sandwich made and into the customer's hand so they can leave. I was still standing there and the manager kept looking at me and went to the drive thru window and two other workers saw me standing there waiting to take my order and neither one came over to take my order. I walked out because there was no reason for me to be waiting over 10 minutes just for someone to come and take my order.. This is kind of why I don't bother with McDonalds on the south side of Chicago because they can't seem to do anything from keeping the restaurants clean to efficiency in terms of keeping the lines moving so everyone gets their orders in a timely manner and made the way they want it. Don't bother going here.

2.description: Took my daughter and her friend there this evening. A dark skinned heavy set girl with long red weave came in  went in the back and came back with my daughter's order. She crumpled up the bag of food and literally slung it on the counter. When we made it home, the chicken sandwich was crumpled up just like the bag with a piece of hair on the lettuce. Apparently she didn't want to come to work so she shouldn't have came. Me and the other commuters patronize that McDonalds for coffee frequently in the morning because its very close to the red line train station. We will not be returning and I will certainly tell the ladies just what happened in the a.m... Disrespecting a patron and their food is not tolerated....

5.description: Food is always burnt or looks like it fell on the floor.

6.description: Wow, this is the worst McDonald's that I have seen in a while. it is hard to blame McDonald's, because the main reason that it is so bad is the way the parking lot is set up. There is absolutely no room in the parking lot. I stopped by to grab a bite to eat and the deliver truck had to block the entire drive through line. When I finally got my breakfast beagle it looked and tasted like it was cook yesterday and was sitting under the light for hours. I will not return.

7.description: Gave them a second chance... They blew it... Ordered a #2 breakfast... Sausage mcmuffin meal... Short on time this am... Well I get home... No egg no hash brown that I ordered extra the one I had was cold! So I call them... Told no problem they will replace product! Minutes away I return they got to look up order even thou I am no in person talkin to the same person that did same on the phone... Then they ask me for the samdwich back!!! Tell them I left it... They didn't tell me to bring it back on the phone! So this is what they do... I Get AN EGG IN A BOX AND A HASH BROWN!!! Three managers behind the counter and this is the best they can do ?!?! I called the corperate office behind that... People if you stop here if you order is messed up call!!! We should demand better service in our neighborhoods

0.description: Very good for a McDonald. I drove through the "Mickie Dee's" in the early afternoon. The first window cashier was nice and said have a nice day. The second window lady was just as cordial. She handed us our medium sized icecream cones (they used to be really high when I was younger. I would wonder how they got them that high, a foot and a half tall) and said genuinely have a good day. I recommend this McDonalds

4.description: I agree with the rest of the reviews. This is one of the worst McDonald's that I've ever been in. I ordered a wild berry smoothie, only to end up with a strawberry banana one. When I went back to the counter to tell them about this, I got much attitude because of THEIR mistake. Never mind, I don't want it. Give me my money back. Too many McDonald's around the city to be bothered with this crap.

0.description: They took over 2 hours to deliver my food. When the food finally arrived it was cold. I had an Italian beef and a jerk taco. The jerk taco was ok, a little too spicy, but ok. The Italian beef was dry and flavorless. The meat seemed like it was old. I ordered a sierra mist as my pop and instead received a ginger ale. I will never order from this place again.

28.description: Went to Haire's when I found out my favorite place was closed.  NOW THIS IS MY FAVORITE PLACE!!     The shrimp is amazing.  Not the greasy  stuff you get from the other neighborhood places.

1.description: You have to love living on the Southside when you find gems like this. Just the way I like shrimp. Light batter. Good seasonings and a descent size. For the price you get a good amount of shrimp. I wish the bomb bag was a boiled bag of shrimp like they do at the Boiling Crab locations. My fault for assuming, but overall will be stopping by again for my next shrimp craving. The little lady working in the back is a charm also. So sweet and professional.

9.description: Very good fried shrimp. Doesn't have all that breading like most shrimp places. And it's really good when they actually have the little side of spaghetti. I been here a couple of times and they were out of spaghetti, that's why i took a star off.     They only sell three things. Shrimp Dinners that come with a side of spaghetti OR fries and a side of coleslaw, a shrimp bag (lrg or small) and can pop.  So u know the shrimp gotta be good if basically thats all they sell.

29.description: I went here solely on the two reviews. That is all I had to go on. Long story short Haire's Gulf Shrimp is good. I order a small with fries. The shrimp are light and flavored well. This place does have a following as I saw people picking up their phone orders. Haire is a very friendly guy who takes pride in his food. Make no mistake, it's ALL about the shrimp and nothing else. Which is okay with me. This is a small place across the street from Simon High School. If you want fresh and seasoned fried shrimp this is a place to get some. Sometimes small places don't take credit cards but they do here. Thanks for that cause I never ever have cash.

23.description: (9/14/2012) Oh wow!!!! This was my first time having shrimp from here, can I say they were.awesome! We ordered the "bag of shrimp" to go for $11, you get a lot for your $$. I appreciate that you can keep it simple and not be forced to buy a dinner. The shrimp were lightly battered and seasoned throughout. The tails were removed so you were getting all shrimp. They were a very decent size ( not popcorn shrimp at all) and came w/ sauce and crackers. I was very pleased and will return in the future. Hope they continue w/ excellent quality and service.

5.description: These are the best fried shrimp in the Chicagoland area. They only sale shrimp, fries & spaghetti. Even the spaghetti is delicious. I recommend this shrimp house to shrimp lovers everywhere. May not be the best looking place but coming from a caboose it's a giant step up.

31.description: I have been keeping this spot on my Top Secret List for over a year now.  Guilt has overcome me so now I guess I,ll spill the beans. This is Crack for shrimp lovers. The only item on the menu is shrimp.He uses his mothers Louisiana Recipe and maintains consistancy  every batch. The result is a crispy, buttery, lightly spiced shrimp that is positivly addicting. The prices are just as good as the shrimp at $7.00 for a small order and $10.00 for large.

12.description: Ok I went back to Haire's Gulf Shrimp tonight and this time I purchased 2 large shrimp dinners. Yes! Yes! Yes! You so get your monies worth. I really enjoy the shrimp dinner from this place. This place takes pride in cooking their food. And the employees are courteous.  Will be going back again.

21.description: I must admit that this place is small but they do serve the best shrimp! I ordered the "bag of shrimp" and it was $12 and my friend ordered the small dinner. We only waited for about 5-7min and our food was ready. I literally recieved a bag full of shrimp with crackers, cocktail sauce and hot sauce. Im 122lbs and I ate every single shrimp in that bag! The shrimp is perfectly battered and was not overwhelming. The size of the shrimp was suprisingly big. My friends order included fries which was also a good portion to eat.I will definately keep coming back here!

16.description: I absolutely love their shrimp and fries!!!  Now the spaghetti, leaves a lot  to be desired.  BUT THAT SHRIMP!!!! Delish!

17.description: Great shrimp. Don't look for anything else. Bag of shrimp large or small and shrimp dinner. Dinner inc Cole slaw, spaghetti, and fries.

10.description: Pretty good! I never knew they existed. Cheap & tasty shrimp. I had the Large bomb bag. 18 shrimp for $13 bucks.  I'll definitely be back!

11.description: The shrimp here is very tasty.  None of that thick breading.  I have gone back several times and they have been consistently good.  The down side for some is the appearance of the establishment.  It's on the south-side of Chicago, in an urban area. So, I'm not sure what people expect.  The service wasn't bad (no rudeness), but it wasn't outstanding either (straight to the point, no friendliness).  It serves the purpose for good tasting shrimp on the go!

26.description: This is some good shrimp. Its not overly battered with small shrimp, totally opposite. This was my first fix, my bf got the scoop on this place from a friend and his dad. It goes perfectly with the cocktail sauce. I got the large bag for $12 bucks...WOW! Lightly battered,  butterflied, nicely seasoned, and clean. Not greasy at all. I was a little disappointed when my cocktail sauce ran low on my last one, i know next time to ask for 2...and an (extra) small order. Yes, its that good, a large is a nice size bag for one person, but i shared...however, not next time, lol. This is now my new shrimp place.

27.description: Delicious I just wish they had fish also a more extensive menu but all in all the shrimp are delicious really good i will go back again and again

0.description: I'm from Boston but whenever I come to town I make it a point to stop here when I can. I like the coleslaw, but it is kinda sweet.  The portions are great and everything is made fresh and to order. Yum!

20.description: Seriously the best fried shrimp I have ever had. Lightly coated, not too much seasoning. Almost perfect. $8 for a small bag and $11 for big bag but it's a lot! You will be full before you hit the bottom of that bag. I'm overdue for a visit!

19.description: (9/14/2012) Oh wow!!!! This was my first time having shrimp from here, can I say they were.awesome! We ordered the "bag of shrimp" to go for $11, you get a lot for your $$. I appreciate that you can keep it simple and not be forced to buy a dinner. The shrimp were lightly battered and seasoned throughout. The tails were removed so you were getting all shrimp. They were a very decent size ( not popcorn shrimp at all) and came w/ sauce and crackers. I was very pleased and will return in the future. Hope they continue w/ excellent quality and service.

2.description: The shrimp is great! Been a few times and and no disappointments. Fresh and hot each time. Call order in and its ready upon arrival.

18.description: I must admit that this place is small but they do serve the best shrimp! I ordered the "bag of shrimp" and it was $12 and my friend ordered the small dinner. We only waited for about 5-7min and our food was ready. I literally recieved a bag full of shrimp with crackers, cocktail sauce and hot sauce. Im 122lbs and I ate every single shrimp in that bag! The shrimp is perfectly battered and was not overwhelming. The size of the shrimp was suprisingly big. My friends order included fries which was also a good portion to eat.I will definately keep coming back here!

13.description: BEST fried shrimp on the SOUTHSIDE of Chicago! Tasty and lightly battered, reasonably price and fast courteous service! The sides are not great but the shrimp are what gives them the five star rating for me!

4.description: Great shrimp, always fresh and ready when I pick up.

24.description: Yes! Yes! Yes! I recommended this place for anyone who loves fried shrimp. First of all, it's actually shrimp! Not just batter. My shrimp were served hot,delicious , and not too greasy.  They cook them fresh to order so I had to wait a short time for them to get ready and it was well worth it. The prices are reasonable as well.

6.description: Best shrimp place I've been to outside of South America. Shrimp are breaded but not too much juicy and tender. I only go with a co worker and have never entered the place but I will continue eating here and that says a lot considering I live on the far north west side.

22.description: Best shrimp on the South side of Chicago!

15.description: F'n great shrimp. It's so good, they don't serve nothin else 'cept spaghetti and cole slaw.  No fish, no chicken, no gyros. Just exceedingly good shrimp, and for that reason, they make me happy. And unlike so many other shrimp joint, here you get all shrimp and no tail. At first that might be discombobulating because tails have served as shrimp handles for so long. But you won't miss them a bit.

7.description: shrimp are delicious as well as the spaghetti, might be a little wait but food is cooked to order so you know it's fresh and hasn't been sitting around.

8.description: After reading the reviews, I couldn't wait to try this place. The shrimp weren't bad but they weren't great. The establishment was less than desirable and I wished I had stayed in the car and not entered because I believe that played on my psyche. I'm sorry but I didn't love this place. I really wanted to.

30.description: i just came back from haire's gulf shrimp. it was a spur of the moment decision, but i'd passed by a few times recently and finally decided i had to have it. like, today.this would not be my first time eating the shrimp. in the past, my boyfriend has surprised me with greasy paper bags on the passenger seat, filled to the brim with the best shrimp i'd ever eaten in my life. (ever. ever-EVER.)plain and simple: slightly greasy, buttery, flaky, PERfectly seasoned (seasoned so well, to quote my daddy, it "tastes so good, make you wanna slap ya mama!"), big, juicy, succulent, RIGHT shrimp. "better than love, we made Delicious" kind of shrimp.no lie.and haire's is in the hood. i didn't even want to go in with my scary self. but boyfriend was not participating in this mission today, so he sent me in.there was a sign on the wall that said: "Report shootings and any other illegal activity."not much going on on the block though. (a stray cat meowed at me on my way out. scat cat, you can't have nunna this good stuff!)and not much going on in the menu. you get 4 options, and 4 options only. and i ain't mad about it. a large ($10) or small ($7) bag of shrimp OR a large ($12?) or small ($8) shrimp dinner (that's the Deliciousness, along with spaghetti, slaw, et cetera whateve don't nothing really matta but the shrimp i tell ya).i prefer the large bag.all i want is the shrimp.all i need is the shrimp.thank god for the shrimp.they are big. they are beautiful. and they will make people fight for one. or a piece of one. and now they are all gone. go get you some.

3.description: I tried them at the African Festival of Arts on Sunday. They were generous to give me a sample. After that I was in love! Hours later, I order the $10 bag bomb shrimp...and it was da bomb! Even though they are on the South Side, I'd travel far for good shrimp!

14.description: Keep it short and sweet the shrimp were great just enough breaking, fresh, short wait, and tasty. Go check them out its worth it ..

3.description: The cashier was very polite and friendly. The service was great and fast.The managers can be unprofessional at times.

1.description: Let me start by saying how horrible this place is they dont have any thing that you ask for i asked for ketchup no ketchup i asked for bbq for my chicken nuggets nope only ranch i asked for a lemonade nope only soda and they dont even have napkins they gave me brown paper tools which seem to be the ones that are in the bathroom. This is the last finally time i will go to any bk if i would of known i would have gone across the street at the gas station for a lemonade and a bag of chips and there customer service from gas stations are always friendlier.

2.description: I came in for breakfast and service was a little better from the last visit, but still needs major improvement. The breakfast sandwiches I ordered were not that great the ones from Dunkin Donuts are way better and bigger too. It's like they're skimping on the egg and cheese.Still the service was so so, and I try not to go to places on the south side that's staffed with hoodrats because I am not interested in being serviced by someone with funky ghetto names like Shaquita and LaTasha. I'll stick to my select locations that I know service is decent.

0.description: Say you walk in here around 9:30ish AM., the time varies a bit but at this time is when all the local newsies come in to count their change.  Morning rush is over and most of the tables BK has for their customers are over run with newspaper sellers counting change.  Ask a manager to move someone, you're lucky if anyone comes out to move'em.  This BK is typically busy.  At times you can find people sitting outside on a curb to avoid unnecessary confrontation inside.  Newsies can be mean.  Don't get it.  Good for people watching, I've never seen that much coin counting happening by so many at one time.  It's a daily occurrence.

4.description: Not bad... Ask for "off the broiler food"... Better than the mcdonalds across the street!!!

1.description: omg the nastiest jerk i;ve ever tasted in my life!!! i couldnt even finish it or the rice n beans... horribly nasty!!!i dont know if its named don as of now.. but whoever owns it as of july 17th, 2014 needs to close it doors! its unimagineable how nasty that food was!!!

2.description: Clean, friendly and affordable south side Jamaican jerk joint.A school event brought us to the neighborhood early on a Saturday morning. As the day wore on we asked a local where the best BBQ place was. He directed us to Don's. Not BBQ of course but mighty satisfying all the same.We didn't meet Don, but a kind woman who could dish out and take my annoying style of humor took our order. As we waited for our food to come out we enjoyed small talk with her and later a mom who came in with her two kids.Jerk catfish: Delicious. Not a filet but the bones were easy to remove.Jerk chicken: Same, chew the meat off the bones, yum.Curry chicken: slightly different spices, similar meat prep, awesomeBrown stew chicken: ditto, yum.[They had run out of goat. Boo.]Rice and beans were a little dry but she gave us plenty of extra jerk sauce which woke it up.You get cabbage or green salad, we tried both, I'd say go with the cabbage. Salad was ok though.Plantain on the side was great and just the right amount.A slice of dense white bread comes with. Edible, but you're really just supposed to use it as your napkin.I forgot to get a beef pattie. Kicking myself now.A note on the neighborhood. The only thing whiter than me was the starched collar of the gentleman selling The Final Call out on 79th and Stony. But I parked my station wagon around the side and didn't get hassled so I'd say visit with confidence and you will be rewarded with a tasty meal and some memorable scenes. Such as the cool ethnic heritage mural a block east, and a scary no-tell motel just to the west.We're coming back for that goat! And I want to try the oxtails and beans too.That's all I got, check it out peeps.

0.description: This spot is a definitely go to.  I have had many things on the menusalt fish and cailoo, salt fish and cabbage, jerk chicken, shrimp and catfish, the oxtails....  it is all tasty as hell.   Did i mention this is my favorite jamacian place to go to?  And that I pass up two better known spots to get here? Don't play.   Some jerk, a bottle of ting and if i'm gonna be really greedy a beef pattie ( they also have veggie and chicken)This place ain't high flauntin' and its in the middle of the stone cold hood, but that don't stop me from getting my grub on.  The place is well kept, there's a flat screen for dine-in and the owner's wife--( i think)  dreads and glasses is friendly and pleasant.

1.description: I visited the "Chatham" location first time (11/15/15). I ordered a quart of "Chicago Mix" as a gift & a small "Chicago Mix" for Me. The popcorn is fresh & delicious.The service was prompt & courteous.

9.description: I traveled home and made it to this location to get popcorn.  It was great!  The customer service was really good.  I want to commend this team for making my experience a positive one.  I recommend Garrett to all of my friends in LA that are traveling to the Chicago area.  None of them have been disappointed.

23.description: WOW!!!!! About time a Garretts Opened on the SOUTH SIDE!!! Fast service, friendly workers with a smile. Also A parking lot . I have to go now and get my cheese and caramel mix. WoW!!! My hands are so cheesey now. Time to lick them clean. Yumm Yumm.

12.description: Every visit, very short line and little to no wait. Fast and friendly service.You never have to worry about lines around the corner at this location. With a drive thru, parking, and short lines you will be in and out.

21.description: On a busy holiday weekend trip to Chicago, I couldn't understand why lines for every Garrett Popcorn Shop overflowed out the door and onto the streets....now I do.At the request of my cousin, I was asked to bring back just one thing from Chicago for him-- Garrett Popcorn. I ordered two large bags, one Chicago Mix, the other a almond/cashew/pecan Caramel Crisp mix. My commitment to ensure the adequate transport of this popcorn back to Atlanta included bringing it on a separate carry-on (yes, just the two bags of popcorn) and being pulled over and inspected by TSA. Let me tell you, it was soooo worth it! I didn't enjoy the caramel glazed as much as the Chicago Mix, but I would absolutely be ecstatic to have one again! Or both! Or either!

16.description: I was pleasantly surprised at how fast the line moved. I hesitated coming here because I had visions of super slow service, staff that were serving popcorn with a nasty attitude and shortage of product.However that was not the case, fast service, very pleasant staff, a security guard (hey, it's the South Siddee), and efficient process which moves patrons in and out of the store quickly.  The cashier even said "thank you and please return again"....whoa! I hope this level of service continues :)

17.description: What can you say about the world's best popcorn.  I've traveled all over the world and have yet found anything better.  When I visit Chicago I stop there and when I get home sick I place an order online.

10.description: It's  been a long time since i had this popcorn...reason being its in the city or downtown and i live in the suburbs...i usually frequent paparazzi popcorn in hazelcrest to get my "chicago mix" fix...however i stopped in Garrett's yesterday and the line was long but moved rather quickly...ordered the chicago mix which they changed to Garrett's mix ....let me say this when its freshly popped it's very good but after a couple hours or next day not so much...taste very stale and had my teeth aching...i dont know why this was the case but I'll  like to keep my teeth a while longer and not lose them to eating popcorn...

5.description: I have worked in downtown Chicago most of my life, so I've been to my fair share of Garrett's. However, the location in Chatham is my favorite by far.Most downtown locations get thousands of visitors a day, so they focus on volume. The Chatham location focuses on customer service. They greet you as soon as you walk in the door. Even if the place is packed, they get you in and out as quickly as possible. And, they pop the popcorn on site, so the popcorn is always fresh.I can honestly say I've never had a bad experience here. I always leave knowing that I will be back to this location. Try this one out for that cheesy caramel goodness. You won't regret it.

11.description: On a busy holiday weekend trip to Chicago, I couldn't understand why lines for every Garrett Popcorn Shop overflowed out the door and onto the streets....now I do.At the request of my cousin, I was asked to bring back just one thing from Chicago for him-- Garrett Popcorn. I ordered two large bags, one Chicago Mix, the other a almond/cashew/pecan Caramel Crisp mix. My commitment to ensure the adequate transport of this popcorn back to Atlanta included bringing it on a separate carry-on (yes, just the two bags of popcorn) and being pulled over and inspected by TSA. Let me tell you, it was soooo worth it! I didn't enjoy the caramel glazed as much as the Chicago Mix, but I would absolutely be ecstatic to have one again! Or both! Or either!

22.description: I've enjoyed Garrett Cheese and Caramel (it's called The Chicago Mix) my entire life! I grew up in Chicago and it was always a treat when my family went downtown for the soul purpose indulging  in a large bag! I was delighted to find out that after 45 years of being solely on the northside of Chi, the family owned biz opened a popcorn shop on the south side! South siders are a big part of the success of his Chicago treasure. NOW....why do we love it??? CHEESE and CARAMEL MIX please! It's called a Chicago Mix. You actually eat the cheese and caramel together, it's all mixed together in a small, medium or large bag. Sounds weird I know (and it's weird ONLY to those that didn't grow up eating this delectable magic mix), but it really is the most delicious play on flavors in your mouth. It melts in ur mouth from the first bite, I promise. One warning: ADDICTIVE!!!! Make sure you have lots of napkins and a bottle of water is always handy. Bottle of water is to quench the thirst that will come from the strong, rich, delicious flavor explosion you'll experience from this mix.I'm headed back to Florida (home now) and my husbands requirement is to land with a big bag of GARRETT chitown mix in my hand!!!

0.description: We were visiting from Durango,CO and our friends said we had to try a local snack staple, Garrett's Popcorn Mix...cheese popcorn and caramel popcorn mixed together, a savory and sweet combo that becomes a bursting flavor party in your mouth! It is addictive!! The gals working behind the counter were fun and made it a great experience giving us samples of the nutty caramel flavors, loved the pecan caramel. My husband is usually not a popcorn snack fan but he ended up eating more than me, it was that addictive. This store is a local experience and definitely a keeper!!

20.description: I was pleasantly surprised at how fast the line moved. I hesitated coming here because I had visions of super slow service, staff that were serving popcorn with a nasty attitude and shortage of product.However that was not the case, fast service, very pleasant staff, a security guard (hey, it's the South Siddee), and efficient process which moves patrons in and out of the store quickly.  The cashier even said "thank you and please return again"....whoa! I hope this level of service continues :)

19.description: I've enjoyed Garrett Cheese and Caramel (it's called The Chicago Mix) my entire life! I grew up in Chicago and it was always a treat when my family went downtown for the soul purpose indulging  in a large bag! I was delighted to find out that after 45 years of being solely on the northside of Chi, the family owned biz opened a popcorn shop on the south side! South siders are a big part of the success of his Chicago treasure. NOW....why do we love it??? CHEESE and CARAMEL MIX please! It's called a Chicago Mix. You actually eat the cheese and caramel together, it's all mixed together in a small, medium or large bag. Sounds weird I know (and it's weird ONLY to those that didn't grow up eating this delectable magic mix), but it really is the most delicious play on flavors in your mouth. It melts in ur mouth from the first bite, I promise. One warning: ADDICTIVE!!!! Make sure you have lots of napkins and a bottle of water is always handy. Bottle of water is to quench the thirst that will come from the strong, rich, delicious flavor explosion you'll experience from this mix.I'm headed back to Florida (home now) and my husbands requirement is to land with a big bag of GARRETT chitown mix in my hand!!!

2.description: You know this popcorn has to be good if you go pick up some prior to visiting your momma when you come to town. If my schedule doesn't support it, I remind my fam of how much they love me and insist that they send me Garrett's popcorn. This popcorn is pretty popular and you can expect a line out the door some days. It's very much worth the wait. The parking lot is about average and getting out the lot can be a challenge due to inconsiderate drivers who won't let you merge as you exit the lot.They offer a military discount and can ship almost anywhere. I've got friends in San Diego ordering online after I introduced them to this goodness. You have a few choices; cheese, caramel, mixed and even options such as pecan and cashew caramel popcorn. They have traditional plain popped but if you gonna wait in line you better get what you want. My suggestion is to make a sampler out of the smaller sizes if you want to try more than one item. If you've been here before, you know the drill; when it's your turn you better sound off and don't be holding up the line.Customer service has been good here and I appreciate the staff for keeping a cool head when some customers are being difficult. Cash and credit accepted for your purchases.

18.description: This location is AMAZING!!! All of the employees here are super sweet and very friendly!!! The popcorn is very fresh. The Chicago mix (cheese & caramel corn) is my favorite! Today I also tried the pecan caramel corn, and it's soooo good! Every flavor I've tried is delicious. If I'm on the south side of Chicago, I'll definitely be visiting this location!!!!! Overall, I have no complaints and I'm very pleased with the experience I had here.

13.description: Best popcorn in the world and the Chicago mix is the best thing to come out of Chicago since Barack Obama.

4.description: This store is the same as all the others.  Chicago mix for us.  My wife picks out the cheese corn and my daughters the caramel.  I love them both.  Garrett's first opened at 10 West Madison Street in Chicago in 1949 and has many locations throughout Chicago.  If you are not from this this neighborhood definitely choose a downtown location to shop.  While I was waiting in line a group of guys got arrested right in front.  If you do choose to do a little urban exploring to satisfy your sweet tooth and leave your cozy suburban home to visit the historical Chatham neighborhood be sure to use a little extra caution here.

6.description: Picking up a Chicago classic, with one order in a Blackhawks tin. Go Hawks! #onegoal The staff was really nice and patient with us, especially with our large order. We ordered 4 separate orders; 3 with the Garrett mix: a jumbo bag, a gallon Blackhawks tin, and a quart blue tin and a large order of the mixed nut variey (almond, pecan, and one other which I forget atm). They were careful in double checking that they were accurate with our order and double checked. They were also honest with us in the discrepancy between amount bought with the quart ("You're paying for the tin because it's about half the amount popcorn-wise), which I appreciated. There was ample parking in the back, which is much better than any of the other locations. Easily a go-to if you want Garretts and you're in the south side.

15.description: Being a native of Chicago I've literally grown up on Garrett's popcorn (cheese and caramel mix aka The Chicago Mix for life).  Now that I now longer live there I don't get my fix nearly as often as I would like.  You can order online which I do sometimes but there's nothing like walking into a Garrett's and having the ambrosial smell of popcorn smack me in the face.  When I do go to Chicago to visit with friends and family I don't always have a chance to get downtown (usually go to the Randolph St. location) to get my cheese and caramel delight since all my peeps are in the burbs.  As if my prayers had been answered, the 87th Street location opened which is much easier for me to get to.  Before actually visiting I heard rumors that the service and taste of the popcorn was not up to par with downtown shops.  WRONG!  The service was great and the popcorn was even better.  I will definitely be going back to this location on my next visit to the Chi.

7.description: I'm giving 1star based on customer service. I tried to find out if they are open Xmas eve.  It's not on website so I called customer service.  What a JOKE!  I basically got an "I don't know" so I pushed further asking "How do I find out?" and I could hear her frustration because she didn't have an answer. She finally (supposedly) checked with supervisor who sent an email (really?) and they didn't have response.  No offer to get info & contact me.  I looked up local # and it is voice-recorded with only regular hours listed. If you want to speak to someone-it gives the customer service number.  They (corporate/mgmt) obviously don't care to treat customers with any respect.

8.description: Paid $160 for a can of popcorn only to have them give me popcorn from bottom. Got home and my popcorn was stale. Sadly thatz probably why good things usually ain't in the hood. Go to any of the downtown areas if you want your money's worth.

3.description: If you like popcorn, you will LOVE Garrett Popcorn Shop. It's all fantastic - the Garrett Mix (aka Chicago Mix) - is superb, and any of the Caramel Crisp nutty mixes will melt in your mouth.This location was closest and what appeared to be the easiest to get to on my most recent weekend trip down to Chicagoland. I just now read Edward W's review that states if you are not from the area visit a Shop in one of the more touristy neighborhoods. I cannot agree more. While this location was a straight shot east on 87th Street, we went through some questionable spots...... I visited this location on an early Sunday afternoon and the line was out the door. There was a police officer on duty letting people in as others left. They were really jamming in there; hip hop and rap music was blaring over the speakers. Which was fine, it was just different than the 2 other Garrett locations I've been to. Customer service was meh. I did feel bad for the employees, they seemed rather robotic. Popcorn = 10 stars!!!!!!!!! I cannot recommend enough!Customer service = 2 starsLocation (for a traveler on a weekend adventure) = 2.5 stars

14.description: I have been craving this popcorn all summer and finally made it in on Wednesday,  24 Sep 14! I was excited because an illness kept me away. I had popcorn earlier this year from this location and shipped a tin to a friend in LA and the popcorn was great! On the above date I tasted the samples  and the popcorn was good; unfortunately,  when I left and frantically opened the bag the popcorn was horrible!  I am happy to not have to drive downtown and stress about parking,  but the 1.99 bag of popcorn I had at the gas station tasted better;  I am beyond disappointed!  I have never tossed cheese popcorn because it is my favorite: I guess there is a first time for everything!  The caramel pecan popcorn had a burned taste and it was left unfinished! I will just park and visit my favorite location on Jackson and State! Maybe I can share this bag with the squirrels.. on second thought they might not be able to finish it!!On a lighter note the staff with the exception of the cashier was very pleasant and sweet!

58.description: Ummm....Well, I went in on a referral from a good source (I thought).  He did remind me we only discussed the Curry Chicken which of course I forgot about.  Here it goes...I was so hungry.  I went to a nearby boutique to browse as I waited for a friend to join me for dinner.  When she finally got there, she wanted to see what I got and of course, she then wanted to "browse" before dining.  When we finally got in the restaurant,  I ordered first because remember, I was starving.  The dinners are already set meaning you could not deviate from the side dishes but I didn't care, I was hungry.  But my friend did.  She questioned if all the dinner options were this way and they said yes, you can only have rice & peas, cabagge and the special bread along with your entree choice.  Plus NO plaintain came with it.  She was bothered by this and decided against ordering.  The young girl behind the counter was not happy with this and made a couple of choice faces as my friend walked away.  I decided it wouldn't be right to stay so I asked if it was too late to cancel the order (It is NEVER too late) and the young girl behind the counter asked the cook and he said yes it was.  I got the food (because I was hungry) and proceeded to leave when I remembered I was suppose to order something for another friend but I didn't get a chance. Thank God I didn't. I did not turn back because I didn't want them to mess with the next order because my friend did not make one.  I decided to share my meal with the other friend.  We ate (because we were both hungry) overcooked rice, cabbage,and deprived jerk chicken.  I was highly disappointed and so was the other hungry person.  I will probably not patronize this place again.  My friend had a right to complain.  Oh and I did get a banging dress at the boutique across the street thanks to the Banana Leaf.  Thanks!

56.description: Aww yeah!  THE BANANA LEAF!  I've had the Brown Stew Chicken meal, the cajun(?) Tilapia meal, and both were tasty.They have a great jerk chicken meal, because compared to some other jerk spots in this area I've tried, Banana Leaf's chicken is super moist, not dry.Parking is not great, but hey, it's the city.  If you're in the area, definitely check this one out.

29.description: Excellent food. Great owner in Rick I love this place. I have gone there many times. It is the best Caribbean food in Chicago

42.description: I've been doing some construction work in the area and I could smell the food from this place from over two blocks away. I would've tried them earlier but I was unaware that they took credit cards, because for some reason most Jamaican restaurants don't, but they do.I went around 1pm and there really wasn't anyone in there. I ordered the jerk catfish and it was ready within 10 minutes. So I was happy I didn't have to wait forever and a day for my food. In my opinion the food was very good and well seasoned. I even liked the veggies which I never eat. The only downside is that I didn't get any plantains and the beans and rice were burnt as in they scraped it out the bottom of the pot.I shall return.

23.description: Ok. So I went here and figured that im a natural fan of Jerk but they have some greatly prepared Jerk chicken. See, why I recommend this place is because you get a variety  of selections with one dinner is which I search high and low for in a restaurant so it automatically gets approval. The dinners are very affordable. Suits as one of the best when it brings up all aspects. I love to eat but don't eat beef or pork so I specialize in Chicken, Turkey & Fish. When I ordered living on 79th & Oglesby, I visited this place with friends & the dinner was right on time. I eat to live and live to eat Good.Don't get it twisted.Street-preneur.

47.description: The wings are too die for! They are not too hot like most of the jerk chicken places around here. The girl who works there is polite and both of my visits have been short and pleasant. I'll write once I try more entrees.

8.description: Ok. So I went here and figured that im a natural fan of Jerk but they have some greatly prepared Jerk chicken. See, why I recommend this place is because you get a variety  of selections with one dinner is which I search high and low for in a restaurant so it automatically gets approval. The dinners are very affordable. Suits as one of the best when it brings up all aspects. I love to eat but don't eat beef or pork so I specialize in Chicken, Turkey & Fish. When I ordered living on 79th & Oglesby, I visited this place with friends & the dinner was right on time. I eat to live and live to eat Good.Don't get it twisted.Street-preneur.

31.description: The customer service was great. Yet, the food was awful. I will not be coming here for a meal again. I was craving Jamaican food and got something totally different. SMH On a positive side, their portion size can feed two people so you get more bang for your buck.

34.description: I'm a fan of great food and customer service. I have only been here once but had a great experience. The customer service was on point and felt more like "Cheers," a place where everybody knows your name.  I had the jerk chicken, which was absolutely tender, seasoned well, and plentiful. I also had the cabbage, which was also very good.. Once I'm down with this Raw Food Detox, I will be back..LOL! The only think I do recommend is that you call in your order. Since they make everything fresh, it takes a while to get your food but it's worth the wait.

16.description: The only reason this review is getting three stars is because the food is actually good. However, the wait and customer service is about a one star. For example, one evening we ordered a jerk catfish/chicken combo dinner. They didn't have ANY sides with the exception of string beans. They did have plantains and refused to substitute despite their inconvenience of not having anything prepared. This same evening we waited over 40 minutes for our food. We even noticed another customer that called her order in waited just as long as we did. All things considered the food is good, I just can't say whether or not it's worth the risk of waiting almost an hour for.

13.description: Local neighborhood Jerk spot offering tasty food. However, they are rather inconsistent to reach.

11.description: Where to start, the food is good, it really is- but VERY SALTY! The salt has never failed to be in excess at this restaurant, its all throughout the side dishes and in the curry, jerk and stewed dishes.  You can't eat here more than once in a 2 week period unless you don't care about hypertension.  On to the good: The food as i stated is good and they give you good portions. Most of the staff is really friendly but there is one young dark skin woman there that really shouldn't be on the phones or have contact with customers; she mumbles on the phone and always sounds like she would rather be any other place but there. Sometimes the music is too loud and you are asked to repeat your orders. Don't even think about coming here with a debit/ credit card, the sign says the machine is down but since i've been going to this place it's never worked.The jerk chicken is excellent, the curry is either hit or miss and the stewed dishes are just ok. The string beans, cabbage and rice and peas are all good, just very salty. The mac n cheese needs work.

39.description: If you want a fried breaded thing, then this is the hood for it. And a side of gross hot sauce that is mostly salt? Easy to find around here also. So when I came in here, I set my expectations low. But man it was so good. The mac and cheese is a new favorite of mine. Add this place to the short list of places in this hood you can get a delish somewhat healthy meal. The chicken is done in the jerk style, so its not fried. And you get enough for 3 people, and cabbage and beans. They have Jamaican sodas here. Love.

37.description: Still one of my favorite places to eat! Keep up the good work!

0.description: People are definitely sleep on this place. The jerk chicken salad is phenomenal!! They give a generous amount of chicken on top and the chicken is seasoned to perfection!! I would call in the order, otherwise be ready for a bit of a wait.

38.description: I am a return visitor for the Jerk  chicken and tilapia salad on a regular. I did NOT care for the jerk soup, lamb chops and jerk wings. If you would like a excellent salad stop in.

51.description: I lived up the street from this place and I have been eating here since they opened up. I love the large portions and seasoned food. Only place I have found with tender ox tails...Cabbage...OH MY...I just absolutely love this place...I now live up north and travel to 79th just for a GREAT meal...I will actually be catering a party from this this weekend..

27.description: I enjoyed the chicken. I have ordered 2x by calling ahead. I ordered the quarter jerk chicken only and it's less than $6, very filling. I'll be back.

54.description: I consider myself a jerk chicken expert having been to Jamaica quite a few times.  This place has the best jerk chicken in Chicago!  It's tasty and juicy.  And they are fast...you don't have to wait forever for your order and deal with nasty staff attitudes like a certain other jerk chicken place on the South Side.

48.description: this is the place to go for some real jamaican food. i strongly recommend you try the chicken ,string beans ,mac & cheese but a hidden jewel is the shrimp and crap dip  it is to die for.    love everything  that rick serves, the best jamaican food around !

44.description: Good place to get some decent jerk. Hot sauce was great. Mac n cheese was good-it's the real stuff, just like the homemade kind, but too salty for me. Rice and beans have never dissapointed, and I could've passed on the cabbage --I'm used to the red peppers and carrots and SEASONING in there. You get a good amt of food with great, great service, so you can't beat that. Also they do catering. I've had them for 2 events, and they're professional, reasonably priced, and on time. Everyone loved  the chicken and Mac and cheese. Great business.

24.description: I ordered 2 white jerk dinners. 2 jerk dinners half white with string beans and peas with rice and cabbage with a slice of bread and a can of pop. The meat was very plentiful and tender a little too burnt on the outside for my taste. The peas and rice was nasty and the gravy tasted burnt. The cabbage was over cooked. I heard rave reviews about the banana leaf and I was disappointed with the peas and rice and the cabbage. Customer service was good and the wait was a little too long.

7.description: It was alright. Sometimes i think living in Miami and traveling to Jamaica makes it harder for me to appreciate Jamaican food in other places.

49.description: This is THEE go-to spot for jerk chicken. I have been to numerous jerk restaurants in Chicago, and when I tell you this is the best......this is the best! The jerk chicken is seasoned to perfection and always juicy. I Love the dark meat and wings, the breast is good too, but dark meat has more of that crispy skin. Oh, and please do not leave out of this place without trying their Mac & Cheese. Their Mac & Cheese is to die for! I introduced this place to some of my friends and family and they refuse to go anywhere else. Also, this place has only been open for a few years and they have gotten a lot of recognition. They were in the Taste of Chicago Festival last year and will be returning this year. I would suggest checking them out . Hope this review helps!!

40.description: Amazing carrabean food. i've tried stew chicken, oax tale & jerk chicken. Cabbage is great, rise is nice & moist. and they do give you spices on the side, for us "yankees" :)neighborhood gem. Do call when ordering take out (i've uploaded the pic of the menu), it does take 10-15 min.

53.description: Suggested BL again for a baby shower, Man the mac and cheese was a superior hit! You can't buy really good mac and cheese at too many places, so people were loading up and coming back for more on the mac alone! The jerk chicken was tender and hot as usual. As long as the customer Service maintains at great and the food just keeps getting better...keep it coming Rick, we need great eating spots on the southside, you are def one of the top contenders.

30.description: The food was good, I order the Jerk Chicken (white) with Mac&Cheese and Greens, but the customer service needs some work.

46.description: I highly recommend this place.  Everything was good starting from the time I entered the restaurant until I finished my food.  I called ahead of time and place my order and the young lady called me back to let me know that my jerk catfish would take a little longer and wouldn't be ready until a certain time and when I arrived at given time, my order was ready as promised.  She was polite and very pleasant and my food was just hot and delicious.  Love it!!!

1.description: I normally  go to Uncle Joe's but heard such wonderful things about this place I gave it a shot.. All I can say is, salt.  I ordered jerk chicken and it was very salty and the string beans and cabbage that came with it were very salty. I don't think I will be going back but they seem to do very well so there are a lot of people that like salty food.

55.description: This place is the best, I am in love, the macaroni & cheese taste like my granny is back there cooking. I definitely recommend this place anytime jerk is mentioned. I am a Banana Leaf spokesperson...LOL!!!

9.description: I am in love with this place. The salads are off the chain. You won't be disappointed!!!

26.description: It was alright. Sometimes i think living in Miami and traveling to Jamaica makes it harder for me to appreciate Jamaican food in other places.

25.description: The first thing I would like to say is the food is GREAT!!!! but the downside is if you call your order in and they will tell you 20mins . Do not believe it the real time it takes to get your called in order is 1 hour!!!! ;( once you arrive to the restaurant to pick up your order that should be ready in 20mins be ready to wait the other 40 mins in the restaurant!!! The lady works there at the front desk is nice I even asked If they deliver to business she said yes!!So I tell my co-workers all about this great food .. I call to place an order they said they don't have a DELIVERY MAN!!!!  So they get three stars from me!

12.description: I can eat here daily . My specialty is the wings, the white chicken dinner ,the jerk chicken salad,their shrimp, jerk chicken salad with shrimp! (Oh me, Oh My) and last but not least the plantains (reheat a little bit in some butter- Yes) But I have heard all their other items are good as well. Sometimes they a little heavy on the salt with the vegetables!Try it and I believe you will be satisfied !

21.description: Banana Leaf never disappoints!! The jerk fish Rice, cabbage, and macaroni is to die for!! Calling on your order is the best way to order because wait times inside could be between 20-40min on Friday or Saturday nights..Definitely worth the wait

17.description: Tried going Sunday afternoon and they were closed. No sign or anything. Make sure you call ahead because the hours are wrong!

10.description: I come here for the jerk chicken salad!! I work across the street from Uncle Joes yet I still travel 15mins away to get my salad for lunch. Not only is their small salad larger than Uncle Joes student salad (which cost a little more) but they give you so much more meat and they use real GREEN lettuce as opposed to Uncle Joes yellow/green iceberg lettuce!!! The ladies that work the counter are always polite

5.description: I noticed that girl that works we're gloves all the time that means she is touching money and people's food.... Smh that's not good and when I asked about it her answer was not good at all

3.description: The jerk chicken salad is what made me fall in love with this place and the non-chalant, could careless attitude women who work the registers and take the orders made me hate it. Everytime me or my fiance have gone to this restaurant  (a total of 5 times), 3 different women, with funky a** attitudes have taken our order. No "please"  "thank yous", nothing, but they sure know how to take our money. It came to the point where we made our own jerk chicken salads so wouldn't have to deal with this establishments terrible customer service. What resturants need to understand, is their customer service HAS TO BE as good, if not better than their food. P.s. I'm only putting a star because I have to!

35.description: man, I hate to give such a low review, but this is the average of the three times that I've gone. man! So disappointed because the food was sooooooooooo salty! Did I say SALTY?!!! man! I almost had an aneurism when I bit into the chicken the last time I went.SO - the backdrop. After a 35 mile bikeride, a friend recommended this place as having some of the best mac and cheese in the city. Being a mac and cheese, and jerk chicken fan, I said "must try this place." Since i was also starving post my bike ride, I decided to hop in the car and head straight there. I orderd the 1/4 chicken dark, a large mac n cheese, the cabbage and green beans.When I got home, I broke out the food and it was deeelicious! The mac n cheese was definitely very good, the jerk was also very good and tender, and the cabbage and string beans were well cooked. I was a fan!However, I've gone back 2 times since then and MY GOODNESS! The salt content in the food was out of control!! The first time, I thought it was a fluke..maybe an off day. The second time, I realized my first experience must have been the fluke. It seems like over salting is the norm. The last time I ordered from there, I literally rinsed off every piece of chicken, piece by piece, and then had them soak in water. Still too salty even after that. Ended up throwing most away.I had to do the same with my vegetables (soaked, re-soaked, and soaked again) - and then heated back up in microwave. Still over salty.And then the biggest disappointed ever - the mac and cheese! Texture was still great.. flavor would liokely have been great too if it weren't for the fact that it, too, was soooooooo salty! I ended up rinsing (gross, I know) my mac n cheese, as well, in hopes that I could save it. Nope :(  Ate around it some, but ultimately threw it out as well because much too salty.My siste r- who loves salt and has a much higher tolerance than me - even said it was way too salty. Her words: "man! If I think it's too salty, you know that's a problem."So hopefully, they figure out what's going on with the salt before all their customers die from strokes.But since i don't want to be one of them, I'm going to stay away for now.ah well...

19.description: The food is not consistent.  It is constantly burnt. When it is that burnt it takes away from the taste and it is dangerous.  Just as they like to collect money, I like to get good quality food for my money.  I notice the cooks take their jobs more seriously when the owner is present.  There is too much competition to get comfortable.  When small businesses close, people lose jobs the community suffers.  Still customers matter. So I'll shop around.

28.description: The mac and cheese and yams were good.  I'm glad to know that I'm not the only one who felt the food was a bit salty.  The jerk chicken and fried chicken were definitely too salty.  Come on, Banana Leaf, you know we need to watch our blood pressure.

45.description: I came here after reading reviews and looking for a nearby place for takeout. It took multiple attempts to find their website with a menu, but I eventually found it. I ordered jerk chicken wings and she said the wait time was only 5 minutes. I got there about 20 minutes later and my food was still hot. I didn't have to wait very long to pay. The food was delicious. I will return. On 79th street they have the pay to park boxes but I parked on Euclid where there was free parking and many open spots

33.description: I went to this place because a friend of mine posted a pic of her Jerk Chicken Salad on FB and it looked delicious.  So I called in an order for my husband and I.  The Jerk salad for me and a white Jerk dinner for him.  The service was actually pleasant.As she stated  (friend on FB) and as it looked my salad was DELICIOUS.  However, my husband's food was not.  As another reviewer stated, the sides were EXTREMELY salty.  I love cabbage and could not eat it.  A couple pieces of chicken was burned (not jerked).They really should put less salt, if a person desires more they can add it.  But you can't take it out when you over do it.  It destroys the meal.

43.description: The jerk Salad is amazing, the blackened tilapia is good but it's a bit too salty . Pricing is mediocre . All in all it's a pretty good spot. Ps: plantain isn't included in meals

2.description: I absolutely love everything I have had here!! Tilapia, cabbage, Mac and cheese, rice, jerk veggies and more!! I live in Boston but EVERY TIME I am in Chicago I make it a point to visit Banana Leaf. You should too!

18.description: My absolute favorite spot on the southside to get jerk chicken. They would be my favorite jerk restaurant bit they d ok nt have brown stew often which is a bummer.  I love the 5wing dinner with the string beans. I also like the fact that you get a free drink with the meal. If you are looking for amazing jerk on the southside this is a place to try.

41.description: At this tme, it was terrible.  Chicken was too much salty. It  was not chicken but SALT !!!  Maybe chicken was soaked in salt water long long time before cooking.  I really disappointed and  threw out a  haf chicken meals.Owner MUST KNOW  3 things.1. Customers want fresh chicken.  2. Too much salty chicken can not be consumed. 3. Chicken not salted is no problem because we can eat it with our own salt.Let  customers enjoy yout food with their own standard of consuming salt.

52.description: Great food! Im a health enthusiast and have them prepare all my meals for the week! I get a tray of jerk chicken and specially prepared blackened tilapia to last me through the week!

50.description: great prices fresh food love the jerk salad since going here i don't go anywhere else Norman is crazy with his review but he eats at the red pagoda so ....... that says it all. good food great prices

4.description: As good as it gets outside Jamaica...ignore the petty comments.  Taste is true Jamaican, grilled jerk chicken (not baked)...desserts are xcellent also.  Always a stop when I'm home visiting Chicago.  (Favorite Pizza place: 'Italian Fiesta')

6.description: Why are they so much haters never thought such a group of people can hate on each other for petty stuff...!? You go their for the food if it's good or bad what should shape your mind not if they don't kiss your ass.?! Everyone in my mind is entitled to have a bad day .. Tin woman moment . Relax. No wonder public servants get a lot of beefs here.. Be happy you have nice food business in your neighborhood a lot of us is just stuck eating just boring Mexican in ours ! Bottom line great food consistent decent service for a takeout style joint . Consider what price point non 5 star Reaurant likes of Shaws, alinea, maestros ect.. Don't expect to be butt pissing and yes they do say please and thank you. Decent food for price and what it is fast food busy take out type place . No soup for u

22.description: I can eat here daily . My specialty is the wings, the white chicken dinner ,the jerk chicken salad,their shrimp, jerk chicken salad with shrimp! (Oh me, Oh My) and last but not least the plantains (reheat a little bit in some butter- Yes) But I have heard all their other items are good as well. Sometimes they a little heavy on the salt with the vegetables!Try it and I believe you will be satisfied !

15.description: I have tried several Jamaican Restaurants in Chicagoland area & around the country, But I have never come across many that would measure to the quality & freshness of the food, great customer service  as well as quantity even fir the reasonable prices. Banana Leaf is the spot, & I will recommend it to individuals, large groups & even catering. Rick just knows how to keep the customer happy & has always gone above & beyond the call of service. Please consider trying it & I promise if you really know about what you are looking for in the jerk business, you will never be disappointed.

57.description: Healthy portions, but have a way to go for that authentic caribbean flavor.

20.description: Tanya is sooooo sweet they forgot my jerk sauce in one order (I've ordered so many times) they were so polite to offer me something complimentary for even having to make the trip back up there. I love this place not only are The salads sooooo delicious, they give you so much meat but the customer service is off the chain. Unfortunately places on the south side usually do not make u feel welcomed they don't greet u NOTHING but this place did and I think that's a great start.

36.description: Great jerk salad, its a must try. However, when I ordered their chicken is was sooo salty. Therefore I only get the amazing salad oh, and that good mac n cheese

14.description: I've gone twice and plan on going again. MAKE SURE YOU CALL AHEAD or you'll be siting for 30 minutes. The food is great a lil too salty for me, but still good. Great portion sizes and lunch specials.

0.description: This location is typically clean, well organized and the employees are helpful.  I did have to complain about rotten fruit one time, however they rectified the problem immediately.  Love the return policy.

3.description: The prices on most items have gone down due to the new Walmart Super Center 4 blocks away. Meats are always overpriced, good selection of liquor if you need a fast grab for a party.  Self check-out lanes makes getting in and out quickly a breeze..

1.description: The worst grocery store and very expensive.  I feel that because it's on the south side of Chicago they do not maintain it like other Jewel grocery store brands. Items in the meat/seafood department are always missing. Their shelves are dirty and disorganized. I only use it now as a convenience store. Mariano's does a far better job  with the same price point. See pictures.

2.description: I hate, hate, hate this store. Lines are long, the self-service counters are never open, the staff has attitudes, the parking lot is filthy and the produce is rotten. I live very near by but drive downtown for much better selections and excellent customer service.  Too bad but I will never, ever shop here.

5.description: I have been a long time patron of Jewel-Osco and like one reviewer had said the prices are at an all time high. Not to mention the crappy customer service because I complained about the excessive talking the  cashiers were doing. The manager looked at me as if I was bothering her when her job is to make sure the cashiers are doing their job. Cashiers can make errors when they get distracted when they get too chatty with each other. In the case at this Jewel-Osco they seem to hire a lot of hoodrats mainly like one reviewer said inexperienced teenagers. There's also the issue with them opening up additional lanes in a timely fashion when it gets pretty busy especially at the first of the month when the hoodrats get their food stamps.This location used to be good but has gone down hill with the kind of people they hire to work there.

6.description: I was rudely told that the store did not Internet coupons by both a manager and cashier.  The so called manager stated "Jewel stores  in the African American  community do not take Internet coupons". After I wrote corporate and told them that I was taking my business to Walmart and about the comment the general manager of the store called me apologizing. Then she insulted my  intelligence by calling me back 3 minutes later and stating "corporate" stated that  one coupon in question was invalid. She didn't know the policy and that is why the employees state they do not take Internet coupons. Jewel is losing a long time customer over this.

7.description: Been shopping here for more twenty years. Jewel has raised their prices to a ridiculous level. Meats are second- hand. Fruits and vegetables are a little better in quality. Service is terrible. Too many inexperienced teenagers working there.Jewel's is I. Competition with the two other food chains in the area and it's pathetic that they do not have a decent sale on food items. Ans that game that they have to earn points toward purchasing appliances is a joke.

8.description: Not the best grocery store, nor is it ever my first choice. I only go because it is down the street for those time I need to grab something quickly that I am missing.

0.description: Looks like a resurgence of good business and crowds... Other grocery stores in the area are falling off... Glad to see

4.description: Place is empty now. Maybe because their service has become poor.

3.description: I am surprised that other people had a horrible experience. I ordered a wig online, of course and got it in 3 business days. I did however, order priority mail. I haven't tried on my wig yet, but I'm sure it will be good.

1.description: I placed an order on 2/1 and in the order summary it said that the quantity was 2 when I had paid for 3 items. So of course I wanted to make sure that what I paid for was actually in stock so I called, phone just rang and no voicemail option. I emailed too, no response. I should not have so much trouble contacting a business about my order. I live in the area and spend a lot on hair products so was glad to find somewhere nearby for quick shipping ... BUT I WILL NEVER ORDER HERE AGAIN. AND I WILL BE CONTACTING PAYPAL FOR A REFUND now since I have also written on their FB page trying to get assistance, and they had time to erase my message but no time to actually assist a paying customer.  Do not order here, they suck. They spend all of their time marketing to YT wig reviewers but do not provide ANY customer service to paying customers. My orders from all other similar companies always ship out the next morning unless an item is out of stock and they contact you to make you aware -- do not waste your time ladies!EDITED TO ADD: After continuing to post on their page asking for help they FINALLY sent me a message saying that my order states that I ordered 3 items and saying that it takes 24-72 hours or ship. No acknowledgement of their crappy customer service or apology, how unprofessional. I will be going back to my trusty Samsbeauty, Wigtypes and even Ebonyline since they value paying customers, resolve issues professionally and accept responsibility, some of them also offer cheaper shipping options as well so it's a win win.

2.description: I ordered a wig from this company. They did NOT state that the wig was out of stock when I ordered online. Instead they took my money. Then emailed me to see if I wanted another color.       AGAIN. Most companies will let you know if an item is out of stock BEFORE they charge you.They claimed to process my refund in 5 days. I have not received the refund. I have been emailing the on a constant basis and they keep promising a refund. I STILL have not gotten it.This incident is very unfortunate because they have other items that I would have liked to order. But I cannot take this chance again.

0.description: I was a little concerned after reading all these reviews, but it was to late I had already ordered the wig. Fortunately I didn't have any problems. I did have to email them once because I didn't receive my shipment confirmation email for a day or 2. They emailed me right back and once I received the email confirmation I received the wig 2 days later. I haven't tried on the wig but from the looks of it I shouldn't have any problems with the wig either.

I wasn't sure whether or not to give them 3 or 4 stars because I will admit they can be hit or miss with the customer service but on a good day, the girls are friendly and VERY knowledgeable, they always have great suggestions whenever you have a certain look in mind but don't know how to achieve it, or a specific hair problem that you need a quick-fix for. There is a really great selection every day on wigs, hair, dye, etc. The even have shirts, shoes, hats, earrings, pots and pans, strollers and soda. It's big and spacious so you're not always bumping into someone in the middle of the aisles and it's usually pretty clean. Don't take a big bag in with you though, or else you'll have to check it at the door. All in all a great hair care spot.
