Honestly I can't even find this place... I walked all around that block back and forth... Id really like to try it out though. Maybe they don't exist anymore?

1.description: I found Honey K's on Style Seat and decided to check it out.  The main attraction was the $25 Blow and Go for new clients.  I figured even if I didn't like my hair or the shop, I didn't invest too much money it in.  I made a 10:45 appointment, and went in with low expectations.I have natural hair that I like to wear straight so I usually go to the Egyptian owned "assembly line" places where different people wash, blow dry and style you.  Outside of 3 times, I had not been to an African American shop in 9 years.  I hate to say that our people are oftentimes slow and late and have a totally disregard for their clients time and that is why I went to this shop with low expectations.  Well, Teka (the stylist and owner) at Honey K's exceeded my expectations.  She started me on time and I was out in just about an hour.  (the estimated time, per Style Seat, was 1 hour, 15 minutes)  My hair was straight at the roots like I like it and styled nicely.  The shop itself is very basic, no frills, but that is fine with me.  I don't need all the TV's and décor as long as the service is up to par.After the first visit it is $40 for a shampoo and style, and that includes a deep conditioning or a hot oil treatment.  I feel the prices are very reasonable and service great.  I have already made another appointment to go back.

2.description: Always offering good deals and specials to new and existing clients.

0.description: All of the stylist at this salon are proficient at hair care and styling. I've been going to Chiquita forever and unequivocally recommend her for all of your hair care needs.

3.description: I love this place not only are the prices good the staff is friendly and they are consistent  every time I go in there. I like this place it is a much better experience than shopping across the street at Jewel. Staff at Jewel act like you are doing them a favor by shopping there I guess they forgot we pay their salary. As of late I have noticed that Jewel has lowered their prices somewhat in competition with their competition isn't  competition great especially for the consumer? Keep on doing what you do food 4 less I appreciate you much and I know I'm not alone

1.description: It's funny how these hood idiots who work there don't seem to take their jobs seriously because if they really did they would have kept the bathrooms clean and maintained after walking in there and out of four stalls one was actually cleaner than the others. Maybe a letter to corporate will make them realize customers expect to shop in a clean store with personable staff and not staff restocking shelves when the store is still open that is for the overnight staff to do when the store is closed for the day. They need to get it together up in there seriously.

2.description: Stopped here while in route home. I needed food for my long drive. I'm sure I will be back again, and will start making this a normal stop when driving home.

5.description: This is the best grocery option in the immediate area (with the exception of Aldi). They have a pretty good selection of items and even had coconuts a month ago when I needed them. I moved from the northside (26 year resident) to the area three years ago and I was excited when the store opened (first exposed to the store in Evanston). I have only had one customer service issue as a frequent customer (at least once a week). Employees, including security, clerks, and managers have been very pleasant. I have heard similar stories from my neighbors. Perhaps positive given equals positive received.  This store is also much better than the Jewel across the street and has better sales.

6.description: I have not had a bad experience yet! The food and liquor is cheap but the food is fresh! Service is OK!!! Cashiers are ringing you up they are not trying to make small talk that's for sure. The lines have always been long no matter if I go early in the morning or late in the evening. I guess they are just super popular. The best thing about this is...I saved so much compared to shopping at Jewel or Dominick's.

7.description: I was at this location earlier today. I've been here before to pick up some potato chips three months back, but my oh my, when it comes to comparing something in a super-ghetto to something with the same name in a not-so-ghetto, the Food 4 Less that I use to go to on 70th & Ashland in West Englewood neighborhood beats this place into a pulp, soundly, in many ways than one.The customer service was okay, but doesn't beat the service I receive at the location on 70th & Ashland.The layout is just so not cool to me. It's confusing as hell and signage is surely lacking here.There's not many good items here. To tell you the truth, but according to my opinion, this F4L is actually smaller than the one on 70th & Ashland. Hmph, bust it!Want to know what else I don't like about this place? THE FREAKING FLOOR! Oh my gosh who decided to use the floor of this Food4Less to fight World War 3? There are sooo many cracks and black spots of only God knows what on the floor throughout the damn store! The location on 70th & Ashland doesn't have any part of its floors looking like they've been through hell and back three times in a row! What's up with this location? How long has it been here? Not very long, and its floors make it look like it's already 25 years old.I'm sticking to the F4L on 70th & Ashland, even though I live on the west side now, and have to check out the one on Cicero and North.Blow this joint! Let my love affair for the one on 70th & Ashland be a sign of no, not brand loyalty, but store location loyalty!  :D

8.description: Hmmm I haven't had the same experiences as the others... Except for the missing safty seal on the milk carton I took home... and there are quite a few items that they just dont carry.. I was a chef before a soldier... so i still have to go to the other stores for somethings but i save alot of money

9.description: Like the store, but had bad experinece with a co-manager when I went to get refund for overcharge.  He was unknowledgeable about how to work register at Service Desk, etc.  Had to call for help 3 times.  Then sort of insulted me as transaction was over.  Also the cashiers seem to put in wrong codes to overcharge you for items on sale.  This is happening more often recently, last several months.  I think it is on purpose.

0.description: This is my go to location...Part of it is I don't have a car and this one is close but they do have some good deals....I mean the name shouldn't be food 4 less since the food is just as expensive as Jewels in regards to the meats if not more when it comes to fish.I try to go early to see what I can kind find on clearance...and that helps with my food bill tremendously.  I also volunteer and cook for a great organization so I am here a lot picking up things to make for the ladies of the group I serve and I do stay in my budget when I shop the clearance and sale items for the group.I do not understand the whole check your bag thing...I laughed at the guy and said you want me to check my empty bag filled with bags...he looked at me with a straight face and said yes...smh so I have to buy my food then walk up to the security guard and get my bags so that I can bag my groceries...sorry only in the hood!!!  Let's be honest if someone really wants to steal they will rather you take their bags or not...but again that is just my opinion. I am glad that they take my tax exempt form and the cashiers always seem to have a smile and a few have engaged in conversation where we begin to talk about what I do as a volunteer...I have to say that is one of the reasons I keep coming back...the staff is great!I couldn't get into the app thing because to be honest it seems like there is an app for everything these days...what happen to just having a sale without me going into the store trying to find a signal so I can add the item to my cart to get the sale that is due to me if I go through all the agony of waiting for the app to load...I have to say that I'm glad there are many stores that have stopped this practice and just place items on sale without the customer having to play a game of save the dollar when you see something on our app...lolI also have to say this and I give this butcher like big kudos because I was trying to find a pork roast that was in my budget and could feed the ladies in my group...he let me know what was the best and how much I would need and then suggested something else if I truly wanted to make sure they had a hardy meal.  I picked up a couple of pork roast for my family and got the chicken thighs, green bean, red potatoes plus a few other things for my group but I like that he took an interest and that is another reason this staff makes me a loyal customer.Thank you for smiling, thank you for being helpful and thank you even when I seem a little frazzled that you help me still make a great meal for a great group of ladies.I can't speak for other's experiences only mine and although I don't like the bag check...I like the staff...and because of that I will be back!!!Enjoy!!!

4.description: I stopped here to pick up an item that was on sale and I was appalled when security told me I had to check my bag.  I have never heard of having to check your bag in a grocery store.   It just amazes me that stores that are corporate owned can have such different sets of rules especially when it comes to the minority communities.   I shop all over and have never been subjected to anything like this.  I will be writing the corporate office and I will npt be shopping there anymore.

3.description: I'm a regular here. I always get the Orange Chicken or Sweet and Sour Chicken. Each meal runs around 6-7 dollars. The quantities are huge enough for three people. Unless you eat like me then for dinner than breakfast. They don't take credit (still don't know why). I recommend you get crab rangoon with your order because they put four in the meal unlike the egg roll which is only one. Plus its next to the family dollar, so you can get a drink from there. Some have a thick accent which can be difficult if your order taker is a fast talker, but as long as your patient you will be okay. But once you get used to it you can order easily.

1.description: I forgot to write this review as I have in eaten there about a week ago. I ordered a variety of food for me and my collegues and it just wasn't right. First of all the delivery driver asked for tip. Second. My total was suppose to be $31 bucks. When driver came it was $38. No problem. But the food just didn't taste right or maybe it wasn't fresh. I'm not going to go into detail because I don't have time. But didn't meet my standards at all.

2.description: I go to this place pretty often because they have really good food because the regular place I had gone to for years had gotten a new owner and the quality of the food had declined. This restaurant chain is also an award winning franchise. My only reason for the three stars is the fact that they only accept cash payments and no credit or debit cards. They do need to get in touch with technology as to how things are paid for since not everyone carries a lot of cash on them. It's easier for them to use a debit or credit card to pay for things instead of having to hunt down an ATM. They would be better off if they accepted credit cards as a form of payment. Im also not impressed with the excessive panhandling that seems to be the norm around the neighborhood and having customers getting harassed by homeless people and general idiots begging for change. Overall the food is very delicious and be sure to ask for NO MSG because many people have food allergies and that stuff can really mess up your sinuses if you're not careful and have an allergy to certain seasonings. The restaurant can be a little cleaner and maybe invest in a bug zapper to handle all the flies that congregate inside the restaurant. I know it gets warm during the summer but something has to give with the flies being all over the place. It's better to do a call in and pick  up and not really eating there to save yourself from being harassed by bums and hoodies.

0.description: Delivery was great, Orange chicken was nasty and the customer service is horrible, I would never go here again

1.description: It looks a little iffy from the outside, but the inside has everything you could need and the employees were super nice! Great prices, too. Their earring section was also surprisingly big and super fun. Would recommend!

0.description: A great store for its genre. Good selection of black beauty products. They have Freetress crochet hair which is in incredibly hard to find. Employees on the floor were pleasant and helpful. Store layout was a little tight and confusing. Proprietor was refreshingly unsuspicious though. Convenient location with free parking and they took credit/debit cards! Hallelujah!

3.description: Loved it. Comfortable and a great place to escape to grab a few drinks without the crazy crowd.

1.description: The place is clean. Great environment Great food and great fun. I had a good time last night The Empire Finale viewing party

2.description: This is a Bar/Lounge with the comfort level and diversity that is welcoming to all! The atmosphere in this place is really nice and provides for a very cozy environment. Everyone greets you with hello and a smile. There is a great selection of cocktails and cold beer. The musical selections are always mature and pleasing to the customers. This is a place that you and your friends, family and co-workers will love to visit time and time again! When you are in the mood for cocktails, then you all definitely have to check this place out!

0.description: I love this place!  It is my hideaway from the city hustle and bustle! There is always a welcoming cheer when you come through the door and a glass of something tasty being stirred or shaken just for you! The DJ Mellow Sounds keeps the place live with his diverse mix of music from every genre. Meet me there or beat me there, one thing is for sure, you will feel welcome and leave with anticipation to return. Tamika Raye

1.description: I went to the Dunkin Donuts to get some hot chocolate and they still make crappy hot chocolate so as far as going there again the answer will be no. They don't know when to check to make sure there's plenty of mix in the machine to make it just so it comes out good. I had to put three packets of splenda in the drink to get it to taste somewhat right and it doesnt really taste so great when it's almost watered down.

0.description: My job requires me to go all around the Chicago Area & I always stop to get a coffee at DD no matter where I'm at. Yesterday I stopped at this location & order a coffee. That coffee might of been the best coffee I've tasted from DD. Fresh. They were under staff, I believe. So I had to wait a bit but other then that the staff was very friendly. Can't wait to go back there to get a coffee when I'm in that area.
Richie is so wonderful and courteous.   She does great eyebrows and the pedicure s will make you feel so relaxed and pampered.  I highly recommend her.

3.description: This is the hood target with hood employees. Not my favorite target to go to but I will stop by when I'm in a hurry. Lately it never has what I need and I don't understand why. At the register I had two cashiers tell me that they didn't know how to do a gift receipt. Why are you a cashier if you cannot complete simple tasks??? But a store is only as good as there employees. Anyway, not my favorite target but I will stop by from time to time. Maybe during one of my visits they will improve

1.description: Probably my least favorite Target store of all the ones I frequent.  I recently tried to come here because they a certain product that the other target didn't have.  After having the target in mckinley park verify, that it was ONLY available at this one in the computer, I decide to go up there.  OK, so why when I get there, do they look in the computer, verify that it's in stock, then shrug their shoulders and say that they have no idea where it is.  I mean how should I know???  Maybe I could check in the back.  Not that they offered to do so.  I didn't make a big deal, but I'll likely keep using the other Target stores such as in mckinley park, west loop, or bedford park.

2.description: Clean  Organized  Well Stocked   Friendly employees NO!I'm not fond of this target but when I'm in a hurry I'll stop here.  The store itself is great. But the employees need work.  I don't know what it is, but its this one lady "Jennifer B." practically every time I shop here she is working the express line.  She has the most, Stank, Nasty attitude ever.  On my last trip, the guy in front of me asked to see how much each of his items were because he thought he was charged the incorrect advertised amount, which is understandable.  He only had 3 items. She huffed, puffed, mumbled and gave him the most evil look.  I was offended for him. Um, lady do you want your job or not, because plenty of people out here would love to be working right about now.  So disgusting, I don't understand these people. If you don't like you job then QUIT!!! Otherwise get it together.

9.description: Clean, neat, organized. Staff is friendly. I love the grocery section.

10.description: Always awesome!!!!

4.description: They are usually really helpful in here and everyone is nice pleasant at and I don't mind coming here for various things. I also love there at cartwheel it helps me save money too and that's a win win

6.description: Every time I'm here people are shooting in the strip mall. Parking can be annoying but once inside you forget about being in the "hood" until some body walks pass you in hooker heels and boy shorts. Cosmetics section is vast, electronics is okay and the clothing section can be a GEM because most African Americans do not know high end designer brands well. When the limited collections come out you can find them in full stock here. To my fashionistas willing to drive here, come casual and be ready to snatch up the designer for Target brands. This location is okay but I will drive to Evergreen/Oak lawn to the two story location on 95th so the baby can shun me from taking the escalator and make me go up the stairs.

11.description: I love my neighborhood Target! They are making improvements after only being open for a few years by adding a full-size produce market. Yea!

5.description: the service in electric is very very bad. First I want them help me check how many in the stock, there people tell me three number, and the range is from 4-60. Even that, not one number is what the system tell me how many they have. And when I want to buy 3ds, wii u or other game player, they Deliberate ask me buy lots of games. Really extremely bad service experience!!!!!

7.description: So this being an older Target its not that bad.  What bothered me was I was eating in the Cafe mind you there is no Starbucks at this location nor they serve breakfast.  But back to da point I walked into the cafe at about 10am nobody in sight.  One of the check lane mangers I asked her if somebody was in the back of the Cafe. She told me hold on I will help you.  I'm like SMH... sure enough she walks  behind the counter and asks me what I want.  She did wash her hands at least.  But why don't they have somebody in the Cafe.  I only been to this location twice so far its a really old store I wish it had Starbucks.

8.description: Love this location. It's clean, organized, spacious parking lot, strangely not busy on a sunday afternoon? Friendly, helpful folks? Believe it. This Target is like .. awesome. Plus I scored some Missoni hair clips. Makes the roosevelt and even worse... the elston location look like big dumpsters.

0.description: Place was very clean on the inside and outside in parking lot as well. Staff was very helpful. While searching for a cell phone car mount, we came upon one that looked like it would fit my mobile phone but...it didn't! Ask one of the gentlemen at the electronics department counter if they had any other mounts available? He said that the one we held in hand was the only one, but then expressed that there might be more in the automotive department. Even though this Target has a small automotive department; sure enough...they had 4 more mount styles available...and at great prices! Thanks Target and especially that gentlemen that guided us to the item we were in search of!

1.description: First of all, the manager/owner LEE has the worst attitude I have ever seen. She is an Asian lady with a black girl attitude. She really think she is though( I mean doing business on 79th she probably feels the need to be)but every single time I see this lady she would shade me (a customer). I have witnessed two verbal altercations with her and other customers.. . One day I was getting my nails done and somebody busted her Windows out ..  There was a time were she did my lashes. I told her I only get mink/extreme 3D lashes that usually cost $150-250. She said she can do that for a better price. She charge me $80 to do my lashes like the cheap cluster lashes($20). I was highly upset because my eyelids were swollen and full of pain. I knew before i left this lady. She jus got over. I came back to the shop to get them removed and she took SCISSOR TO MY EYELASHES! The experience was getting worst.  I should of taken this lady to court. Nevertheless, I hope this never happens to another customer there.Ideally, this is not a place for any girl, lady, or women to get their nails done.  I only went to that nail salon because my long time stylist is next door. The area is dangerous, the customer service doesn't exist at this salon, and the owner is a Bitch! It's not worth it ..

0.description: I get great service every time I go. Lee has been my manicurist for years and every time I leave um satisfied with my nails or feet. It's a family ran business and they are so nice. Lee is sweet and funny and will hook u up.

I was in the middle of looking for a new cell phone because Sprint is a rip off because I was told if I had an individual plan it would be close to $200 a month and for that much I could pay for two TMobile bills. I did some research and TMobile had a great plan for individuals which gave unlimited talk, pics, text, and web for $39.99 a month and even better NO contract because I wasnt about to sign a 2 year contract to be locked into something. I got a month to month agreement so if I am not happy with the service I can go to someone else and not have to pay a $200 termination fee. I got great service I was taken care of very well by Jeremy and one of the things I liked was that the staff all had normal names nothing ghetto and weird which is how it should be. What would make you want to go in someplace and someone greets you with the names "Shaquita" or "LaQuita" makes you think you're dealing with a hoodrat. Jeremy was very professional and took the time to explain each of the phones I was looking at. Jeremy showed me one of two phones he had and I took to the second one he showed me which was an android phone with Microsoft on it so I can use the applications on the go including Facebook.  He explained the terms of the agreement and answered any questions I had. I got better service there than when I've gone to a few places to get things. Now my sister is ready to kick US Cellular to the curb since she's getting tired of their service and saw I got good service at TMobile with a cheaper plan. If you're on the south side stop over to this location because it's got a great, friendly, professional and a well organized staff. The last place I've gone to for a cell phone the staff was standing around chit chatting instead of taking 5 minutes to greet a customer that comes in. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a good phone and cheaper plans if they're not getting them from the current carriers one is with. I would also take into consideration that you won't be sorry you went with TMobile if you're with a carrier who's plans are not meeting your budget and needs.

This store is awesome. I was hooked the first time I came last Saturday. The clothes there are mostly to wear to the club, but anyone can find what they want eventually. I bought this cute white short-sleeved blouse that I am going to wear with some capris. The male worker there was very nice. He helped bring down some tops that was hard to reach, and gave great assistance when it was needed. No one there did not hound us, like some of these urban stores are know to do. The only thing was the racks were too close together, leaving too little space in the aisles to move through. It was sort of congested, and I constantly had to keep saying to people, "Excuse me, please." That was annoying, but overall I would definitely go back again.

3.description: Great chicken saladEverything is so tasty...even wines are good.Little bit salty but tasty.These are what I tried. Awesome. Can't wait to go back again.Aww. I go earlier before six pm to avoid crowd.

1.description: Took forever to get my food because they ran out of shredded chicken but I will say when I got the food, it was amazing. I don't know if it was just a bad time but I would recommend.

2.description: I usually love sizzlin skillet. But my experience today was terrible. I called in a order for cajun shrimp and chicken alfredo. The guy told me 10 mins. I get there in 20 mins. Then the guy tells me, it will be another 5mins. Now 30 minutes later cuz I was signing up for some internet, I ask about my food. They tell me that they have no cajun spices and the guy just left to go across the street to target to get some Cajun spice. It gets worse.  I complain, and they tell me . Well. You haven't paid for it yet....... NEVER AGAIN.

9.description: The food is OK!! Nothing special about this place beyond the fact that everything on the menu isn't deep fried!! Like most restaurants on the south side. If your use to quality food then you understand my opinion. When they were at the old location the quality of the food was 3 1/2 now it's 2 on a good day..

10.description: Very Good food! I'm here to say that the food here is one of the best on the south side. I usually have the blackened or grilled chicken and shrimp salad, and have been eating it since the old location. It did seem to be prepared better at the other place (79th St Lawrence) but even with the changes it surpasses some of the salads I've had at pricier places downtown. Quality food and really laid back cool staff.

4.description: Really good.The first time I had the 'fondue' pasta - way too much cheese; kinda got sickening after a while. But......the jambalaya is delicious and spicy, the seafood seems to be fresh and well cooked......Recently I tried the grilled salmon plate ($15) - OMG, DELICIOUS. The creamed spinach was so good, and so were the garlic red potatoes. Those sides were so good that I don't really care what protein I pick with it next time.....although the salmon was well seasoned and not overcooked.I hope they return on groupon - but ill be back either way.

6.description: Awesome customer service. They convinced me to try a taste portion of the garlic chicken pasta and it was so good I changed my order. The chicken could be seasoned better, but other than that it was great.

12.description: I've been wanting to try this place for a long time, so I got a groupon to go here. I bought 2 different dishes. The first was the 1/2 chicken and rice pilaf. So when I think 1/2 chicken, I'm thinking ummm... 1/2 a chicken. Not a chopped up chicken breast in nursing home sized pieces *insert eyeroll*. Anyway, it was well seasoned and so was the rice pilaf and steamed broccoli. Then I tried the grilled chicken fettuccine. It was made with the same bite sized chicken. This time, there was absolutely, no salt, no seasoning, no nothing. Looking at it, you can tell this is real alfredo sauce. But then again, it had that weird aftertaste that comes from those bottled alfredo sauces in the grocery store. Now after I seasoned it myself, it was decent. But the whole point of take-out is not having to do stuff, so minus 2 stars for that and for chopping up my chicken toddler-style. Not cool.

5.description: My wrap was amazing and the food was hot and my fish was fresh.  Awesome customer Service

11.description: The best thing that I can say about this place is they offer a menu of options that are not all fried foods. they are black owned which is great BUT.....some of the menu items are described as upscale entre's but they are simplicity in a bowl. The "chicken alfredo" was not bad but it tasted like something my little sister could have made. I tried the buffalo wrap, it was not bad at all. A buffalo wrap is not complicated at all so  figured they couldnt screw that up. Then I got brave and tried the Chicken Teryaki. EPIC FAIL!! Frozen packaged chicken with store bought sauce on top of rice and barely cooked veggies. To top it all off they forgot my extra mushrooms. No mushrooms at all. When I called to complain they said the "chef" would fix it again for me tomorrow. Tomorrow? And I personally wouldn't label him a chef. You have to go to school for that and as basic as that meal was I'm quite sure he was a cook and not a "chef." Wont be going back There again.

8.description: I don't know why there are no reviews for this place. It's really good. It's kinda hidden on the street. You'll pass right by it.I heard about this place a few years ago and didn't really trust the opinion of there person who told me about it. Recently someone else said how good it was and I have to try the southwest chicken wrap first.  I was able to see a menu and order from grub hub. My wrap was delish! I can't wait to go back to try other menu items.

0.description: I enjoyed an amazing meal from here a couple of summers ago. You can find healthy delicious options and not break the bank. Good alternative to some of the greasy spoons in the area.

7.description: I know I'm late but I just found out about this place a month ago. I thought it was refreshing to find a restaurant that was more than burgers and fries. I have been there 3 times. The customer service is horrible. Twice when I went I walked to window to place order and young lady comes to window with a ticket pad. Never did I receive a "hi what can i get for you" nor " welcome to sizzling skillet". I believe she would rather tend to her social media accounts which was what I seemed to be interrupting her from on her phone. The food was obviously good since I've been there 3 times. I'm big on customer service so I probably won't go back due to the lack there of.  I also didn't like the fact that the shells are still on the shrimp in the Alfredo along with anything else you order with shrimp. This is obviously a black owned business and I try hard to support them. I refuse to support any business when the customer service is not up to par.

56.description: This is Harolds Chicken Shack #55 and it is my favorite Harold's. I always order the 4 piece wing dinner with salt, pepper and mild sauce. ALWAYS get mild sauce, just trust me. Oh yea and this one delivers.

29.description: This use to be my Harold's to go to rain, sleet or shine but their prices have gone through the roof!!!I walked in and walked out when I saw how much their wing dinner was...I still like this place, I still think they are the best but their prices made me seek another spot to get my Harold's from!!!

42.description: the best Chicago chicken wings you can get. its always insane crowded in there but they push out the chicken quickly no looong waits like at other harolds when they have 2 customers in there in you still wait 20 mins for a damn 6. piece ..along with crackheads sleeping everywhere so you gotta stand up ( 75th street.),.....clearly best harolds to go too, the one in hyde park is also good too

23.description: This used to be one of my favorite Harold's, but that was over 10 years ago. I just went the other day and the chicken was hard and over cooked. That was after I waited around for my food to be bagged up even though it was already done and sitting in the fryer basket for what seemed like forever. Hit or miss I guess, but I won't be returning there anytime soon.

47.description: Growing up in Georgia - one grows to feel that fried chicken is an essential part of a complete diet. Of course, that diet does have consequences down the road, but we all make choices - it's just a matter of whether we feel the costs outweigh the benefits. In the case of Harold's, I would say its worth losing a few months of your life to enjoy some of their ridiculously good chicken in the present. I really think the key is in frying to order - this really makes a big difference. This Harold's itself was a nice environment and is easily accessible for those on the go. They even have a picture of Bernie Mac (RIP) with someone who I assume is the owner. I went with the 1/2 chicken dinner with hot sauce (which isn't all that hot). The mild sauce has a more bbq type taste and I like getting both because there's inevitably way more chicken than sauce with the standard order for my liking. However, I really think Harold's is the kind of meal where if you go its got to be your only meal for the day. Also, this stuff is entirely too unhealthy to be eating for more than say once a month (unless you're exercising and consuming copious amounts of vegetables  on top) because your body knows you're killing it softly with this stuff. Then again, we all make choices - its just a matter of if they make us happy-  and Harold's definitely makes me happy.

8.description: This IS THE BEST Harold's in the city by far. My family and I have been coming here for years. This is a minority-owned business and they often showcase other minority-owned businesses like Oooh Wee! Sweet Tea!

31.description: This is a fried chicken shack.  It is not a nice, sit down, waiter-to-your-table kinda place.  It is small, greasy, always crowed, super slow, and usually leaves a lot to be desired from the customer service point of view.  I would have given 5 stars it the service was better.It is also the best Harold's Chicken location in Chicago and the best fried chicken is Chicago!  I eat here all the time.  I come with cash, know what I want, and I am prepared to wait awhile to get it.  The food is always piping hot, smelling good, and tasting great.  They have real mild sauce!  I always get my food covered in a mixture of mild and hot sauces, extra on the fries.  I am getting hungry just typing this.  The wings, livers & gizzards, white and dark dinners, the cakes and puddings ... I have had it all and it is all good.  Do not bother to call in your order, they will not drop your food until you get there.  Just be prepared to wait, but it will be worth it.

34.description: The charge of 99cents to use a debit card threw me. The merchants fees will offset with all of the volume this place gets. I'm with Wale, harolds is overrated. I dont like to be nickeled and dimed.

16.description: Okay first let me say that I wanted to support this business because it's black owned. However, I felt there was truly nothing special about this chicken when eaten plain with nothing on it, that's what truly defines how good someone's chicken is. I've had chicken in many places. I bought a 12 piece chicken wing meal with one waffle. And just for the naysayers, I went to the one on 87th St. which is supposed to be the best location. If you want to see how good chicken truly is with nothing on it, next time you visit Atlanta Georgia go to Gladys Knight's chicken and waffles. Not to mention, this place is overpriced for greasy chicken. I honestly would have enjoyed chicken from KFC more than this place.

13.description: If this is still the same quality it was a few years back then this might be the best Harolds on the SouthSide.  Everytime I come back home I order the 6pc w/ Mild Sauce and salt and pepper.  The only problem that I could recall about this location is the actual wait.  87th is always packed and its at least a 15-20 min wait unless you are just order a side of fries w/ Mild sauce (FYE......).  In all, this is a pretty good Harolds in comparison to the one's around the area.  PS.....Watch out for them goons though! LOL

11.description: Horrible service. .... I called in an order in December. .. it took 20 minutes longer than the guaranteed time..... when I complained they stated I should use the website.  ....... 3 months later. I used the website. . Website charges my card, gives me a time of 30 minutes.. I show up 40 minutes later they had no record of my transaction. . I gave my confirmation number. I showed the screen shot of my order and that the money had been deducted from my bank account they said they had no record. ... I asked for the manager.. they said they would have to call the boss..    20 minutes later after the boss 2 as called I still hadn't received a refund or my food... they decided to then cook my order..... 2 hours for a supposedly 30 minute meal

39.description: Number 55 offers bad fries and the chicken there seems comparable to the other Harold's Chicken Shacks that I've visited.  I don't get the hype.  Perhaps people like it because it seems a bit less daunting than some of the other South Side Harold's locations, what being located in an antiseptic Chatham strip mall and all.

37.description: Hey, I love Harold's...I mean my brother in law used to call me Harold, I ate there so much...that being said, this Harold's on 87th used to be the best but now, eh....not so much....the wings have gotten littler (yes littler) , the chicken seems dry probably because they scared to put some sauce on the chicken like I asked.... I don't know. To me the one on 75th and King Drive is MUCH better. Sorry 87th, yall fell off. No one seems to notice yet though so I'll keep going to 75th where the lines are shorter, the wait is quicker, you can call in your order and they actually drop your chicken so you don't have to wait another 10-15 minutes before you get your order, and hey the cashier is actually friendly....go figure.

0.description: The food is delicious... The wait is kinda long but if you want it fresh, thats the price you pay! ;-) the service has improved a great deal  lately! Much better attitudes in the place!

38.description: Out of all of the Harold's Chicken establishment, this one is the best. The one thing that I like about this branch, is that you can see the cooks preparing the food and it is clean.

51.description: Okay, okay so I fraternize with a few Chi-town transplants that go on and on about this Harold's chicken. Being born and raised in Cali, I was like who cares? Deep fried only goes to the thighs! But my friend insisted on taking me to Harold's chicken after picking me up at the airport we went straight to Harold's! Harold's fries that chicken down so crispy yet juicy and tender. Then they throw that secret sauce on there!!!! OOOOOOO-weeeeee!!!I might move to the Chi for Harold's. Keep in mind though all Harold's are not created equal. Go to this one on 87th!mmmmmmmm...finger lickin good! Whups...wrong chick joint. ;-)

27.description: Hey this location 87th & the Dan Ryan is the BEST in the city so far...

32.description: Now people make a mistake when they rate this place. It's a hole in the wall fast food joint. So the service is not top notch nor does it look elegant. But best believe if you get some fried chicken with mild sauce (and they have the REAL mild sauce) you will forget the rest.

54.description: Possibly the best fried chicken i had outside of home. THis particular location is probably the best one.Would love to open up one of these here in DC/Baltimore, i feel it could make real $$.

48.description: Slow service... But a near perfect product!

44.description: Great chicken all of the time. If you get some that you think is not right then you don't know chicken. The only issue is that they do not truly accept credit cards. They have an ATM set-up that charges you 99 cents to use it that you can take out up to $5 over the purchase price. You can only use debit cards for this. In this day an age that many people don't carry cash this is a hassle. The cakes vary in quality depending on who supplies them during that month. Prices on the menu board do not necessarily agree with the prices that are charged so look at your receipt. If not for the credit card issue and the price issue I would give this 4 stars.

24.description: Love it, love it, love it!  The one thing I can honestly say about Harold's Chicken is that the chicken is consistently good!  It's always hot and mouth watering!  The service may suck and you may have a long wait time but, your food will taste great!

7.description: I love this place - just takes a minute to get your chicken. Wish they had more sides ! I receive great customer service there ! Fan for life!

49.description: Oh God. There was a level of uggh that makes me never want to return to this Dan Ryan branch of the Harold's Chicken franchise off 87th Street. The service was awful. The atmosphere inside was regretful. Two people before me ordered and then walked out and couldn't answer the pick up call. The next person ordered and threw on some headphones and couldn't hear his number called. Please get me outta here. Yeah, that's how i felt. That's until I tasted a batch of this fried deliciousness. Simply incredible for what it was.There was this quality that was fresh. Even the bread with the chicken had a freshness that was...well...refreshing for a Harold's franchise. I'll definitely go back to this location - and send somebody in to get my bag of yummy.One odd drawback that subtracts a star from Harold's is there payment system. They don't take credit cards. What they have is this weird ATM machine in which you have to withdraw an even amount of money to pay for your food & then have them give you change. Then, there is a 99 cent fee for the service. I thought the service was giving me some deliciousness. In fact, minus two stars. Fix that shit pronto.

40.description: The food is usually good but the service sucks. The one thing that really bothers me about this Harolds is they don't take debit cards.  This place is always busy and I can't understand why they charge you to use a ATM machine. Don't bother calling an order in, I think you wait even longer for your order.

53.description: I've been to a LOT of different Harold Chicken's in my day and this one is my fav.  The chicken is seasoned right and they give you a good amount of food for your money.  I have been coming to this Harold's since it first opened which was in the early 90s and frequented often when I lived in Chatham but now that I'm in the 'burbs I don't get there as often...I'm forced to succomb to Harold's near Country Club Hills, which has NOTHING on this Harold's and they are OVERPRICED!

46.description: Best Chicken Shack in the PLANETT. I never had chicken soo good. It is all in the sauce - I ordered mine with everything. You have to try it! It is the best I ever had. Well worth the hype. I'm in NYC right dreaming about it :)Harold's Chicken, we need one in NYC.

1.description: They were good and the prices are great. I got 2 chicken tenders w/fries and mild sauce for just over $3 after tax. The chicken and fries are cooked to order and come out piping hot !!! No, you don't understand.It's too hot for you to go in there STARVING. You simply cannot bite into their chicken when you first get it without risking 3rd & 4th degree burns on your tastebuds and lips. Trust me, I learned the hard way.  I've had better. But, the chicken seemed to be real chicken and had a great breading on it. The mild sauce has a hint of sweet with it and tastes really good. They drench it over the chicken and fries, giving the fries a special sweet potato taste. It's a great spot for after clubbing hunger pains. I wouldn't eat there often, but I would definitely return. Oh and there's a DVD pusher hanging out too. The bug at the door was undetermined as to whether it was a roach or waterbug but hey, what's the difference at this stage in life. I should wipe off a star for that but because he was at the door and there has been so much rain, I will assume it was a waterbug, brought in from outside. Overall, pretty cheap and tasty. I'd try a few other places first tho, if that option was there. No pics. Just memories from my tummy.

55.description: I think this is the one that I went too, but I wasn't driving and was with friends so I'm not quite sure....Never the less, I got a 4 piece wing dinner with salt and pepper and the mild sauce on the side. Believe it or not, as much time as I've spent in the city I had never had Harold's...this was my first time ever. I was impressed! For me, fried chicken is fried chicken- and that still hasn't changed much...but Harold's is some of the best fried chicken I've tasted that didn't come from my grandmother's kitchen! I would love to go back and get more. Die hard Harold's fans thought it was odd that I got my sauce on the side, but I don't like sauce on my food cause to me it makes it soggy if I don't eat it fast enough...Consider me a Harold's fan! Wooohooo!!!!

9.description: Do not order your food online, they will not have your food ready when you get there. I asked was my order ready, they told me no we will start it now. I had to wait 20 minutes for my order. Why have a online service for take out when your not going to start the order until I get there. Don't waste your time ordering online.  It's a joke.

26.description: NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!  I decide to go there for my husband and had to ask my self why did I waste my time.  Some of the people are friendly, well one of the people working there is friendly.  They do not pay attention to the orders coming up and mess them up.  They then get an attitude with you when you just ask for your order and you have to wait an hour and a half just for a wing dinner.  The place was over crowded and others are upset because they are waiting for so long.  To top it all off the food is not that good either.  They need to revamp of something.

25.description: Don't bother.  These people have no clue about customer service.  I walked in when it was not busy, and was ignored.  I turned in walked out.  Go to the firehouse next door. You'll get good service and better food.

12.description: One of the best Harold's Chicken in the city. I've been coming here for years and it's one of my favorites.

21.description: The chicken here is always well seasoned, but they don't give you enough sauce which makes me sad. The place is ALWAYS packed, so be prepared to wait if you didn't call your food in. The employees aren't that friendly, but whatever...just give me my chicken...

17.description: I had a craving for Harold's Chicken again and I was in the area, so I went there. I ordered a 2 wing snack pack since I'm on a diet. Once again, I waited and waited and waited. After the supervisor realized I waited almost 40 minutes for 2 wings and some fries, she gave me 6 wings and extra fries even though I didn't ask or complain. They still have the best chicken. Their customer service has also improved. I will be coming  here again when I'm in the area.

10.description: Just had the worst tasting chicken breast and catfish I have ever eaten. I am totally shocked at the taste of this food. Harold's should be ashamed to serve food that taste this bad. The chicken was totally bland and dried out. The catfish taste as if it had been fried twice. Very disappointed.  Mild sauce does not hide bad taste!

5.description: It was a good experience overall. Honestly I think the wings are overrated, or perhaps breaded wings just aren't my thing :-/ if you do get to visit I'd suggest the ice/sweet tea!

3.description: I'm 31 years old and I've been going to this Harold's since I started driving, about 15 years old. The best Harold's in Chicago, to me! The only one I'll ever go to!! (Hyde Park was pretty good too!)

35.description: This is the spicy Chicago fried chicken.    Accept no substitutes.   If you can't take it, go back to Bennigans you wimp.

19.description: The sign said 16 piece for 18 bucks. I asked for the 16 piece and the cashier said "No, 18." The sign was digital so how hard is it to update? Rude! Chicken 1-5=5. Mild Sauce 1-5=5. Service 1-5=1.

28.description: Chicken is chicken and Harold's is one of the best at cooking up some bird!

45.description: Man o Man. Ok I am from Chicago but moved to L.A. 5 yrs ago and when I tell you I have been petitioning for this Restaurant to appear here in Cali..I mean I am campaigning like Obama.  The menu is cut and dry...ITS A CHICKEN SHACK. But the special part about it is the mysterious 8th wonder of the world us Chicagoans call "Mild Sauce"...NO one else knows what it is but ask anyone at Harold's and they will tell ya its what you need to be putting on ya Chicken and or fries. My "usual" is the 6 wing , SALT AND PEPPER AND MILD SAUCE!!! GO HAROLDS!!!

33.description: In my opinion, this is one of the best harolds chicken places in Chicago. By far this is the only one I eat from. Th chicken is always crispy and greasy...what more could you ask for. If you never had em, please try em

43.description: I do not appreciate the fact that I phoned in an order in advance so that I would not have to wait, and upon arriving at the specified time, the order still was not ready.The sassy worker said they don't start cooking it till you arrive.  Then what is the point in phoing ahead ?The one on 83rd and Ashland is much better tasting AND they will have your order ready for you if you call in ahead.

2.description: This will probably be my last visit to this Harold's location.  Lately,  I feel like it is hard to find good fried chicken. Most places are hit or miss and this time this one missed.  I went to the location early today around 11:30 am right before the lunch rush.  I should have known something wasn't right when I saw that there were a few baskets of chicken wings just sitting there.  Placed  my order only to find out after I got home that my worst fear was real that the chicken was old and apparently they just dipped it in some hot grease and was selling it.  Just disgusting be careful If you thought going early meant that you were going to get the fresh chicken of the day apparently not so much.

18.description: In my opinion, this is one of the best harolds chicken places in Chicago. By far this is the only one I eat from. Th chicken is always crispy and greasy...what more could you ask for. If you never had em, please try em

41.description: After much pondering, we came and were surprised to see the restaurant being in a strip mall right off 87th exit. We ordered a 8 piece bucket, and a piece of caramel cake.Caramel cake - VERY GOOD, dense but not dry, with good frosting. SUPER sweet!We then waited 25 minutes to get our food, because the staff forgot our order. However, the lady behind the counter made sure that she gave us free fries. chicken - very juicy, but not seasoned at all. I think that's why they gave us a lot of vinegar based hot sauce.I have to say that this is good juicy fried chicken! Will come back if we don't get another flat tire in the parking lot.

52.description: I am from the south so i am serious about fried chicken. dead serious. it has to win me over with it's juicy meat and crunchy skin, and be right out the grease piping hot and with a well seasoned taste that isn't flat. this my friend, is that chicken. it's really good and well cooked.  I read online about the various harold chicken shacks across the city and one really good article said that this was the best one. So i went and tried it out on a Sat. the chicken is well seasoned and i dont even think it took me 5 min to swallow it down...it was soo good. I haven't been in a while because it's a bit of a drive for me, but I'm def going back.

50.description: Ok so this is a review for them from their taste booth. Service extremley friendly. I was hesitant to eat their hushpuppies but they were delicious with that delicious mild sauce an the chicken was yum in the tum. If they weren't far from me I would visit more often.

4.description: I was in Chicago for the weekend celebrating my best friend's birthday. After the club one night all of our bellies were rumbling. I could literally hear mine saying "FEED ME BRITANY!" I was wondering what could possibly be open at this hour because back home after the club your options are usually Chinese food or McDonalds if you aren't downtown. She said Harolds Chicken Shack and I smiled from ear to ear because it sounded like the kind of place that I would like. I had spotted them around town in the day time and I was already curious, so now it was time to feed my curiosity.Upon entering the first thing I notice was the smell. I wanted to do a happy dance but the restaurant was not empty in the wee hours of the morning so I continued to act normal. People were sitting down and eating what looked like some delicious fried chicken. The place was small but there was ample seating and the staff was friendly. I ordered the 4 piece chicken wings and waffles which was 7.99. I thought that was a reasonable price until I SAW THE PORTION SIZE. 4 chicken wings really means 8 wings because they don't cut the wings in half like back home. It also came with a side of fries, a waffle, bread and the creamiest coleslaw. If I lived in Chicago I would be obese. The food is just too cheap and too delicious. I was in love and it was a great first taste of Chicago. p.s. I love honey garlic wings which they didn't have BUT they had ketchup wings which I've never heard of so obviously I had to try it. I had a mild/ketchup mix sooo good! Harold's please come to Canada and don't raise your prices. I would be your biggest fan.

6.description: Harold's Been on my list for couple years. Happening to be in town & had to try this famous chicken.  The chicken was not  great or bad either. It was ok, hot & crispy. But it was missing something regarding seasoning. Perch & Catfish combo was completely over cooked. A little on the salty side. If u don't know how to fry chicken, u may love this place.

22.description: If I could give a zero I would! Now i never patronize any other Harold's, but now I need to find a new location to buy from. I don't care how good the chicken taste if the customer service is terrible! I just called there trying to place an order. Don't speak to them with mannerism because most of them isn't used to that! They seem accustom to dealing with ghetto people. The lady sound frustrated taking my order and I state to her that she doesn't need an attitude. She responds (with hostility/attitude), "Ma'am I don't have an attitude, we just busy!" Then I told her, Shoot, I'm hungry! Then she hung up on me. Now for one the price of their food has done nothing but increased! Every other order is good. What I don't understand is how black businesses- especially this one, feel they can treat the same customers that keep them in business like crap! I work too hard for my money to give it to a place with crappy customer service that's obvious too busy to correct it! Thanks for saving me about $16 on chicken drowned in sauce! You all can keep your feather filled chicken along with your nasty attitudes!

15.description: This use to be my Harold's to go to rain, sleet or shine but their prices have gone through the roof!!!I walked in and walked out when I saw how much their wing dinner was...I still like this place, I still think they are the best but their prices made me seek another spot to get my Harold's from!!!

20.description: Harold is my hero. This is a great spot for chicken wings. Being from California I wasn't sure about the whole mild sauce thing over the chicken. Super delish...we loved the chicken. Good flavor and good crunch and good juiciness. This is a Chi town must anytime I'm there. My advice, go to Harold's Chicken Shack.

36.description: Driving home on a Sunday, I drove past a Harolds..the one on 87th and decided to see what this place was all about. Talking to my wife moments earlier who had stopped off to get my daughter some McNuggets at another place I won't mention, the thought of real chicken didn't sound that bad. So into Harolds I went.All I have to say is "yuck". First, how they don't get shut down by the health department is a wonder but I felt unhealthy the second I walked in. What a grease pit. I should have walked but thought there had to be something to this place since there is so many of them. Nope. Ordered the 4 piece wings with mild sauce. For whatever meat was on those wings, which I'm still debating if there was any, was  greasy and flavorless. I was like eating dirty grease. And the "mild sauce".....that was simply ketchup. Even the fries were terrible. I felt nauseous the whole trip home and immediately had to shower when I did get home to get that smell off. I was thankful however for the two pieces of bread put in the bottom of the tray....without, I would have had that grease all over my car. I guess the biggest disappointment was that it was kinda expensive too.Anyway, I love junk food once in a blue moon but Harold, hate to be harsh but this place is simply just not good.

14.description: Don't eat it often but when I get a taste for it, here is where I go. Today, though, they bombed out. The chicken was spoiled. I may never eat chicken again.

1.description: Besides the fact that an employee was murdered in this store a few years back, this is a great location. Not only do they offer a wide variety of clothes for us women with a little more meat on our bones, they always have items on clearance!This location is near a bunch of other stores too which is convenient if you need to purchase other items. Namely, Lane Bryant is a couple of doors down which is a bit more pricey than Ashley Stewart but offer better quality bras!

2.description: Yep. I've got that junk in my trunk.  That's where all those Yelps end up at.  Shut the hell up, you know you like it...For those of you in the same big boat, Ashley Stewart is a welcome breadth of fresh air - cute clothing with lots of great cuts and styles, all made to grace the more zaftig forms with lots of ease and cuteness.  Like all plus-size stores, the styles range from club to work to casual and everything in between.  I find their color palate to be far more complimentary to humans than Lane Bryant or Torrid, with far more solids and nice patterns to be found here instead of crazy shit with polka dots, chains and a picture of Tinkerbell all over it.  There are certainly some questionable ho get-ups, but hey, some people are looking for that too.  Wouldn't it suck if you wanted to dress like a tramp and couldn't find your size and had to instead wear something matronly with a fucking bow on the neckline?Also right now the chain has a promotion selling some of my favorite Erykah Badu, Jill Scott and other CDs and half of the proceeds go to women's and children's causes locally - very nice.  Jill Scott even helped to design a bra for the company.There is also a Lane Bryant two doors over, so you can comparison shop (prices and staff are both WAY better here).  But do be warned about this particular location.  The term "Death trap" doesn't really even come close to doing this particular parking lot justice.  In fact the entire intersection and surrounding mile of traffic in every direction has it's own unique traffic rules - employ guerrilla driving techniques and don't get trapped in the horrible one-way, one lane lot right next to the store.  The staff is helpful enough, but can be distant, or even just really busy, because it sometimes gets pretty swamped in here. Excellent!  So now that I'm cuter, about that next review.....

0.description: Ashley Stewart and Forest Park Illinois is the best the staff is awesome and very helpful when you walk in the door they always greet you with hello if they don't have your size they will call around for you let's continue to support Ashley Stewart and Forest Park Illinois

1.description: I really enjoyed the Jerk chicken and cabbage! The greens were good But too salty and the mac n cheese tasted like kraft delux from the box...over all because the chicken was really juicy and had the proper level of Heat is why i gave 4 stars! Would try again

9.description: Best jerk chicken! Chicken is moist and tender. The skin is smoky and flavorful. The owner is often there. She uses seasonings from the old country. Cabbage is crisp, yet tender.  It is lightly seasoned and mixed with bell peppers. The sweet plaintains are fried just right. The candied yams are cinnamon flavored. The jerk catfish is also delicious-it is topped with grilled onions. They have Ting-grapefruit flavored soda and ginger beer.

23.description: a tough pick between Uncle Joe's and Tropical Island Jerk.This branch of the Tropical Island Jerk chicken is the "nicer" one. ie, no bullet proof glass, no bullet proof revolving serving door. there are actually a coupla tables and the sides on the steaming table are easily visible. go for the yams + cabbage. spicy cabbage finished off with yams as dessert are possibly the 2 most perfect (and most popular) compliments to smoky jerk chicken.With the addition of the butt-kicking sides, TI's is comparable to Uncle Joe's. Uncle Joe's sauce has more kick, but TI's chicken is more moist and plump (both dark meat of course). Uncle's Joe's has more burnt ends on the chicken but i believe TI's skin as more flavor. Really tough call between the two smoke chicken houses. TI + UJ's puts Jamaican Jerk (on Howard?) to shame.

12.description: The jerk chicken is the best feature of this restaurant, that is probably why chicken is included in the name. I think this place has one of the best jerk chicken and catfish in the area. Other dishes I have tried but not a fan of, the chicken is the only reason why I go there. Most Jamaican restaurants I have been to are slow and have a 'your food will be ready when ready' no hurry attitude, this place is the same. You have to have plenty of patience going in the restaurant. Other ethnic restaurants seem to understand what is needed to maintain good or improve the customer experience but not this place.

21.description: I am AMAZED.I can not believe this place has not been reviewed yet, seriously.There is no other restaurant in the entire city that I will purposefully and regularly drive so far out of my way for.I love jerk in most any form.  However, I would elope with the Jerk chicken from Tropic Island.  Unreal.  I love that unidentifiable and satisfying feeling you get from good juicy greens, sweet potatoes, and rice and beans.I really can't type fast enough to express my love for this place.Black bean salsa, out of this world.  Ting soda, satisfying, refreshing, goes great with vodka.  Also good at putting out that smoldering fire in your mouth and belly after finishing the black bean salsa. Don't be freaked out by the less-than-inviting exterior of the restaurant.  I'm a northside white-boy with a severe penchant for down-home cookin'  and I go to this place regularly at all hours and its not a problem.  Not to mention how nice the guys are that run the place.  They are from the caribbean and are totally cool, even though one of them looks like he could be a body guard for DMX.Go and enjoy.

16.description: I grew up on the spot, but lately they have been a bit stingy on their chicken and sides..I mean if I pay $10 for a Jerk Chicken Dinner give me more than 2 pieces of Yams!! They have def. been downsizing, and although I preferred them over Uncle Joe's, due to them offering rice and beans with an additional 2 sides, at least Uncle Joe's gives me enough of my sides!

17.description: When a friend and I went here about a month ago, they were about to move to a new location. The jerk chicken here is very flavorful and well spiced, but not spicy. I also got yams and garlic potatoes, which were both super tasty. The chicken is served with rice and beans and a hard dough bread, which is A+ (see my review for West Indies Bakery). It was a little hot in there. I couldn't be that hot all day, but luckily they are moving to a new space, so hopefully it will be a bit cooler there.

10.description: No damn star!!! Just left there 4 lunch! Food has no taste & they have grandma fixing plates!!! They didn't have any singles & we waited over 30 minutes just to get lunch!!! I won't be going back! They have a sign saying we cut our staff I don't c why it's always crowed. From here on out I'll b on look out for another good jerk!

5.description: I'm a pescatarian. I came to this restaurant to get dinner, I ordered a curry shrimp dinner which included Mac and cheese, red beans and rice and greens. $16.93. I didn't mind the 30 minute wait cause I knew it was made to order. When I received the to go plate I opened my dinner to see that there was only 10 pieces of shrimp on this bed of red beans and rice, a small amount of greens and MacNCheese. I inquired about the amount she told me that this is the amount that is suppose to be given. I didn't argue cause I'm hungry. Got home sat down and ate it the macaroni was slimey and overcooked and instead of curry I got jerk shrimp. And insult to injury is I threw up everything. They were nice enough to reimburse me with no problem hence the 1star. I'll never go back.

11.description: I just discovered this place. The owner is actually Jamaican unlike the prior at uncle Joe's do that a huge plus. They had veggie patties and they were decent, a little over cooked but good. My mom said her jerk chicken was of the glass. She is a pretty good cook and said the yams were almost good as her yams. And they had ting which I was excited about.

22.description: Next time you're in the hood, stop by for some of the best jerk chicken you will ever try. These guys are Jamaican and know their stuff. The dipping sauce for the chicken is out of this world. All sides are good--greens, macaroni & cheese, rice, etc. This ain't free range chicken! But it tastes so good that I don't think about it.They only take cash. I have always gotten it to go and would probably loose my appetite if I ate in.  *insert jab to Northsiders for being scared to come down to the South Side*

0.description: Very good good I highly recommend this place the chicken and fish are excellent the sides are average but they do the trick

20.description: This place is absolutely delicious.  I live on 79th and Kostner so I was able to just shoot down 79th st to get here but it is right off 94 so most people can be there in no time.  It is not really a sit down and eat place, almost everyone takes it to go so don't be turned off by the neighborhood.  Believe me it is worth the trip, I can not stop thinking about the Jerk lunch ($7.50) which came with a huge portion of red beans and rice, plenty of chicken and your choice of two other sides.  I ordered food for my whole family and brought it over to my parents, so I was able to try quite a few sides. The rundown, don't order the mac-n-cheese it is basically Kraft, definately get the candied yams and collared greens and if you like plantains get an order of those as well.  Now for the star of the show, the chicken, be sure to ask for extra sauce.  As you bite into the chicken you immediately get the sweetness of the jerk sauce and upon swallowing that sweetness turns into addicting spice as your mouth is enveloped with fire, delicious can't stop eating fire.  Overall, this place is addicting and I can not wait to go back and will very soon.

19.description: I am AMAZED.I can not believe this place has not been reviewed yet, seriously.There is no other restaurant in the entire city that I will purposefully and regularly drive so far out of my way for.I love jerk in most any form.  However, I would elope with the Jerk chicken from Tropic Island.  Unreal.  I love that unidentifiable and satisfying feeling you get from good juicy greens, sweet potatoes, and rice and beans.I really can't type fast enough to express my love for this place.Black bean salsa, out of this world.  Ting soda, satisfying, refreshing, goes great with vodka.  Also good at putting out that smoldering fire in your mouth and belly after finishing the black bean salsa. Don't be freaked out by the less-than-inviting exterior of the restaurant.  I'm a northside white-boy with a severe penchant for down-home cookin'  and I go to this place regularly at all hours and its not a problem.  Not to mention how nice the guys are that run the place.  They are from the caribbean and are totally cool, even though one of them looks like he could be a body guard for DMX.Go and enjoy.

2.description: I tried them for the first time today and I wasn't impressed. The rice wasn't all the way cooked still hard. The oxtails didn't have a good flavor and the plantain were soggy. The only thing good was the cabbage. Uncle Joes is still better. I may go back and try the chicken.

18.description: Next time you're in the hood, stop by for some of the best jerk chicken you will ever try. These guys are Jamaican and know their stuff. The dipping sauce for the chicken is out of this world. All sides are good--greens, macaroni & cheese, rice, etc. This ain't free range chicken! But it tastes so good that I don't think about it.They only take cash. I have always gotten it to go and would probably loose my appetite if I ate in.  *insert jab to Northsiders for being scared to come down to the South Side*

13.description: Seriously, this is the best Jerk Chicken that I have ever had in my entire life. The food  is always on point and the service is good. They now have an area to sit down if you like and you can  bring friends and family.They are helpful if you are a first-timer, as well.No place has been as perfect as Tropic Island Jerk Chicken.They have been in business to long to get it wrong. It's RIGHT every time!

4.description: I wish i could  give  NO stars... cabbage  mushy, rice and peas had no flavor- probably  sat too in that make shift cafeteria  style  warming  table/ bullet  proof glass. And not to mention i paid for  6 wings but traveled 10 miles  back home and had 1/2 white meat instead. Yeah I  won't be  back!!!!

6.description: I drive in from the city to eat the jerk chicken, curried goat, and oxtail. I can't think of a better place in Chicago to get it. I've been to Uncle Joe's in Hyde Park, and feel this is a step above.  I love this place, even though it looks like a dump. Their sides are great too. Love the yams, the mac and cheese, and the steamed cabbage. My mouth waters just thinking about it.

15.description: This place is the best! I love the greens and the chicken is just priceless.

7.description: Delicious! Loved the Cabbage and Sweet Potatoes! The Jerk wings were good too! I have to try the Mac and Cheese and Jerk Catfish next! Be sure to get gravy on your Rice and Beans, I didn't want any but my friend suggested it and I'm glad she did. It was a great combo! I wasn't expecting for the food to taste so good but they fooled me. The service wasn't bad either! I wish she threw a little more cabbage on my plate lol, but overall it was a good experience! I'll be back!

8.description: First time here today as a walk in. Service was phenomenal, food was exquisite and wait time wasn't unbearable, and great prices!  Goodbye uncle joe's, jerk city and everyone else.

3.description: The food here is not bad.  The customer service is ok.

14.description: I don't know who is reviewing this place if they are a real customer and not a person that owns or works here, but if you know me or don't I will give you the run down. Ok so I was craving some jerk chicken and I looked on here and here is Tropic Island Chicken with a lot of stars, I also seen that they have delivery so I called and a male with a Jamaican accent picked up "E-lo Tropic Chicken" I then mentioned to him over the phone I wanted to make an order for delivery he respond with "oh no no no he no work here no mo, he got tired of doing delivery" then he abruptly hung up on me without seeing if I wanted to order or not. But no my fellow yelpers I was persistent so I got my boyfriend to wake up and take that drive to 79th just so I can taste the food and get a dinner for my mother. I get there and the place looked clean, the food was set up in like a steam table without a cover (but I guess steam tables don't come like that). they had a nive array of items but they looked sort of dried out or limp looking the chicken was in the back. I ordered 3 white chicken dinners at $34 each came with 2 sides, red beans and rice, and bread. we rushed home to see what we would get... and to our disappointment this is what we found:Jerk Chicken- had no jerk at all!, tasted like some ok BBQ chicken I could have made at home, the chicken was dry there was barely any chicken skin to have that jerk flavor I was looking for, the chicken looked good but didn't make the mark clearly wasn't worth my money or commute out there.Mac and Cheese: My boyfriend liked but I didn't tasted like butter and kraft mac and cheese hell deluxe tastes better than this mac they haveSteam cabbage- I love cabbage with all my heart but it has to be seasoned well with onion, and other seasonings and can't be too hard, this cabbage was tasteless and too hard like it was poorly under cooked I wanted cabbage not coleslaw like cabbage leaves damn it!!!red beans and rice- hard and not fluffy, dry, they poured gravy on it that didn't taste to good eitherYams- were ok not syrupy tasted like cinnamon was on there it was alrightBread- Yes I judge the bread because with jerk hicken I like my bread to be like a pound cake in taste and how thick and dense it should be, this bread was like a regular white bread slice!Overall all of our dinners were bogish, subpar,mediocre messes and I wasted my Honey's money on this find another place to get jerk chicken and not here! I meanwhile is going to try Uncle Joe's on 47th

3.description: For less than $10 you can get a meal that can feed you and your girlfriends/ guy friends. It's delicious, fresh, and when you're finishing eating you feel full until the next day.

1.description: I love this place.  The food is always great and they give you more food than you pay for. .. which is a plus. Their food is a mouth- watering deLicacy that seems to have come from another dimension

2.description: Eh, for a steam tray cafeteria food set-up, this place is alright.  Nothing more, nothing less.I tried something that they called "spicy chicken" which was interesting for a place like this.  Featuring dried hot peppers like one often sees in Szechewan cuisine, it also had some cilantro, giving it a Mexican twist.  It was pleasant, and I would get it again were I to return for another visit.The restaurant space is clean and inoffensive.

0.description: Yummy fast food restuarant. My coworker took me here for lunch one day... so much food for $5. I have never seen so much food in one box. The shrimp fried rice is great. Way better than Panda Express. Support this mom-and pop store.Especially with all you can drink soda... this is a deal.Eat the big deal and get CRAB Ragoons... best ones I have tested. They should expand more and more of this restuarant into malls and stuff.

4.description: they pack the food on as if they were feeding an army! this is, honestly, enough food to feed my mother, my father and myself. we usually get the noodle n rice split, with beef and brocolli (yummy), black pepper chicken and orange chicken. it is very fufilling and the egg foo young is pretty good too. it'll cost you about 6 bucks tho.

1.description: it's an okay place...melow it out and dance of some carbs in your mind man...you gotta check this place out

0.description: Good fried shrimp dinnerEverything is so tasty...even wines are good.Little bit salty but tasty.These are what I tried. Awesome. Can't wait to go back again.Aww. I go earlier before six pm to avoid crowd.Everything is so tasty...even wines are good.Little bit salty but tasty.These are what I tried. Awesome. Can't wait to go back again.Aww. I go earlier before six pm to avoid crowd.

attributes.Music: DJ, Live, Juke Box, Music Videos, Background, Karaoke
